4428089/4377760/4435171.title: A Collection of Prayers
4428089/4377760/4435171.text:
When sneezing May God protect us all from sicknessWhen lighting the fireMay we all see the light of heaven.When the clock strikes The old people bless themselves in macking the sign of the crossWhen the cuckoo is seen firstMay we all be alive this time next year.When starting workMay we see the work of our soul.
(continues on next page)

4428089/4377782/4435209.title: A Collection of Prayers
4428089/4377782/4435209.text:
90A Collection of Prayers.After Holy CommunionO my Lord and my Savour I give there thanks far comming into my Soul. I thanks you for all the graces and blessings thou hast bestowed upon me give; me the grace to be a good mother and to bring up my children in the fear and love of God.O my Lord and Savour give me all the graces. I stand most in meed of, particulararly the grace of a happy death and a favourable judgment.O my Lord and my Savour, support me in my Last hour, in the strong arms of the blessed Sacrament. Let the holy oil seal and heal me, Let Thine own Body be my food and Thy Blood be my Sprinkling.Let swett Mary breathe on me, that in them all I may die as I desire ot live in Thy faith and in

4428091/4377400/4435345.title: Paidir
4428091/4377400/4435345.text: Crostas na thanghal sa leaba luighfim partaibh na theanga go dtaghadh in theamchaill nó ghrádhta a Mhuire Mháthair mór trochaireacht in am gádthar mó thorth dochtúir laighse, ann nuadh sláinte agus a Mhuire breágh beannachta go Flathas na nGrasta, táirse chéim deinsé, in aimsir lithe na gréinr m'anam idh láimh agus saor a ifreann mé d'on t-Athair agus d'on Mach, bheirim a bhfuil beó, chuirim a gcumairí gach taobh dom. deir mé agus im dhiaidh. Cuirim comaraí moramh agus an rí gleomhar agus Micheal a ainghle teacht ins na seátóra. An dhá rí aspral atá ceanghalta d'on tríonadha a bheith a gárdhal m'anam go cathair na gleóra. Solas na soilse agus radharch na trionóide agus grásta na féinne im' agaidh na h-ógora.

4428091/4377401/4435406.title: Paidir
4428091/4377401/4435406.text: Ná thiogaig an Tighearna an-bháis na gearr bháis dúinn, ná bás in aon peacad de's na seacht peacaí marbhugadh ach bás Naomhta ar stad na nGrást Bás nár geall le sná raosún go mba an lán déanach a thabharaimíd linn o'n aoghal seo. Cuirp Napmhta an Toghearna ar lár m'anam go raghamíd gcuiliúdir na Naomh agus na n-angle isteach go dtí riocht na Flathas. Amen.

4428091/4377430/4435453.title: Paidir
4428091/4377430/4435453.text: A Dhia na ngrást, thug tú an long de Noé chun é saoradh ar an tuile agus thug tú an Eaglais dhomhsa chun mé saoradh ar Ifrinn. A Dhia, tabhair conghnamh dom chun mo paideacha a rádh chun an peaca do sheachaint agus chun bheith dílis don Eaglais agus a thoil do dhéanamh anois agus go bráth.

4427833/4348571/4435540.title: Prayers
4427833/4348571/4435540.text: Prayers 2/4When going on a journeyJesus Mary and Joseph we prayBe ever with us on our wayJesus Mary and Joseph we prayBe ever with us night and dayWhen you go into bed at night fold your arms in the form of a cross and say "I must die, I do not know when nor where nor how but if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever. O my Jesus have mercy on meThere was a preyer I saw written out and carried about during the Black and Tan regime. I have no opportunity now of getting it. The belief was that by saying it you could pass unseen through the enemy forces It referred to Judas betraying Our Lord.When starting work: O most crucified Jesus have mercy us our souls and our bodies we restrain to thee Whose five bleeding wounds were nailed to a tree Most Crucified Jesus have mercy on meOn going to sleep: - On four corners of my bed, four Angels are spread - Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on And if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take: And an evil come to me my Angel Guardian waken meOn going to bed: - Jesus king of the Jews preserve me from a sudden and unprovided death.

4428091/4377440/4435722.title: Paidir
4428091/4377440/4435722.text: PaidirA dhia na ngrás ,nár mhaith dhuith an  t-aoibneasabairt d'ár gcuid athair agus b'ár gcuid máthair, agus nár bhoct do  cútaigeadar leath i n'a dhiaid sin é.Mhill an pheaca iAd dúnad na flaitis ortha agus ní béad aon fághail ar iad do oscailt go deóneireach tú do cuir do mhac féin cúighainn,molad go deó leis tabhair congnamh dom a thigearna chun an peaca do sheataint, agus un go dtabharfainn bhidoeacas  duit ó m'croidhe orainn cun geataí na bflaitheas do oscailt duinn go léir arís.Micheal De Lunioera Gleann Garbh Lios Mór

4428091/4377461/4435732.title: Paidir
4428091/4377461/4435732.text: A Dia ní raibh dada ag neo ach ainmidhthe le bronnadh orth , ach tugh  tú do mach féin dúinn -ne é ofráil suas Cughath le linn an Afrainn.Bheirimh bhuidheachas leath i dtaobh ár thúghais dúinn  agus tabhair conghnamh dom, cumh grádh don Afrainn Naomhtha fháidh a mháirfeadh.

4428091/4377472/4435738.title: Paidir
4428091/4377472/4435738.text: A Dhia na nGrás, nár mhaith dhuit an t-aoibhneas sin go léir do thabhairt d'ár gcuid Athair agus d'ár gcuid máthair agus nár  bocht do cúthaigeadar leat ina dhiaidh sin é. Mill an peaca iad dúnaid na Flaithis ortha agus ní bheadh aon fágáil ar iad do oscailt go deó, meireach tú do chuir do Mhas féin cughainn, moladh go deó leis. Tabhair congnamh dom a Thighearna chun an peaca do seachaint agus cun go dtabharfainn buideachas leat ó m'chroidhe cionn gur cuireas do aon Mhac ag triall orainn chun geataí na Flaithis do oscailt dúinn go léir arís.

4428091/4377483/4435744.title: Paidir
4428091/4377483/4435744.text: Ná thioghaig an Tighearna an-bháis ná gearr bháis dúinn, ná bás in aon peacadh dos na seacht peachaí marbhuighadh, ach bás Naomhtha ar stad na nGrást. Bás mar gheall le nár raosún go mo b'é an lán déanach a thabharaimíd linn ó'n saoghal so. Cuirp Naomhta an Tighearna agus géile beannuithe an t-Slánathóir ar lár m'anam go raghamíd i gcuiluidír na Naomh agus na n-Angle isteach go dtí ríocht na Flathas. Amen.

4428091/4377510/4435765.title: Folklore
4428091/4377510/4435765.text:
Lord. Bless this bed I am going to lie on, bless this sleep I am going to lie on sweet Mary, My mother, be thou at my head. Blessed John the apostle, be thou at my feet and the dear angel of God, be at my side. May Christ's messenger, with the holy isles. be in time at my death to put the seal on my soul, in the name of Chirst, cruicified.



A Íosa Críost, tháinig tú ar an saoghal sa go beo, bocht, dealbh, ar mhaithe liomsa, agus ní raibh de árus agat acht stabla fuar, folamh, cé gur Tú Dia agus gur crithaigh Tú an domhain go léir. Tá cion agus báid mo craoidhe agam leat: a Íosa.



My saviour sweet who send us all good things, thou hast brought us rain, We do not accept such gifts. But Jesus we ask of thee fine weather again.

4428091/4377511/4435767.title: Paidir
4428091/4377511/4435767.text: A Thighearna Dia uile chumhachtach, a cruthaig neamh agus talamh trí fáis agus bás ar Slanathóir Íosa Críost. tabhair dúinn gach grásta a chunár n'anamneacha do shábháil sa saoghal so agus Flathas Dé do shide sa saoghal atá le teacht.

4427834/4348645/4436041.title: Old Houses
4427834/4348645/4436041.text:
(continued from previous page)
and it was a seat in the day and a bed at night. There was no glass in the windows but they used to put sheep skins in the windows instead. If people had no turf they would bring in the cow and she would keep the house warm with her breath. Sometimes they built mud cabins when they had no money to build a right one. When the soldiers were going arount[d] they built mud cabins. Michael Armstrong, Skiddernagh, Manulla, (50) James Armstrong



As I went up the holy land I met the Blessed Virgin May coming with twelve mass books in her hands. Twelve priests singing twelve bells

4427871/4352479/4436902.title: Paidir - Sa Leaba
4427871/4352479/4436902.text: Sa leabaidh Luighim ar an leabaidh seo.Mar a luighfead insan uaigh,Deinim m'fhaoistín leat, Íosa , go cruaidh Tré gníomhartha mo cholna.Tré smaointe mo chroidhe .Tré amharc mo shúileTré labhairt me bhéil,Tré siubhal mo chos,Tré gach nídh adubhairt.Is nach raibh fíor .Tré gach ní gheallas.Is nár choimhlíonas.Gach nídh rinneas i g-coinne Do dhlíghe.Nó do thola naomhtha.Iarraim maitheamhnas ort, a Rí na glóire!Amén

4427871/4352480/4436903.title: Paidir - Ag Coigilt na Tine
4427871/4352480/4436903.text:
Coiglighim an teine seo,mar a choigligheas Críost cach,bríghid 'na bun,S'Muire 'na lár.Seacht n-aingil fichead.As Flaitheas na grás,Ag cumhdach an tighe seo,'S na daoine go lá.



Ólaimíd an deoch seo mar d'óladh na páirtigh .Lán de grásta agus a'seilt go trom.Gan troid gan clampar gan ughdar náire.Nó fios amáireach go mbeidhmíd ann.Iarraimíd  conghnamh ar Mhuire Mháthair.Mar is í ár gcúl báire ms gach am.Ach seo i sláinte a bhfuil sa láthair.Agus Mac na ngrásta go raibh  a'cuidiú linn.

4427871/4352570/4437074.title: Prayers
4427871/4352570/4437074.text:
Rising in the morning.The light of day to night succeeds;We therefore meekly pray,Oh! God, in all our words and deeds,keep us from harm this day.Making a fire.God of this blessed light,Near me shining.On the wide way of the hearth,I go unrepining.Going into a chapel.I am very, very, sorry,To have given Thee such pain.Do forgive, and bless, and help me,That I may not sin again.



I will raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul. Oh! may I rise on the last day to life everlasting.

4427873/4352631/4437291.title: Seanphaidir
4427873/4352631/4437291.text: Sean-Phaidir."Paidirín Páirteach in Gáirdín Phárais í mboll na mnáib bí 'riamh gan loith. An té mach naomhtha tá gach ar na grásta ná leig fáin na mbainnaibh boit. Is maith a sagart mac dé, is maith a bhaisc a rinne sé. Bhaisht sé Naomh ón báiste agus bhaist Naomh ón báiste é. Is deas é do Phaidir beannaighthe mháthair. Ce déarfad do Phaidir trí huaire aon mhaidin Luan tógfadh sé naonbhar naoi nuaire stcúig agus a anam féin bheith 'sna bhflaitheas."

4427873/4352632/4437292.title: Seanphaidir
4427873/4352632/4437292.text: Sean Phaidir."Sipeír a Sagart mé a cuireadh ar a saoghal, mé chrú le Dé dílis go chuadon mo chré nach leiginn aon anam ar seochrán ná stré. Éalóidh ar lasadh agus imtheochaidh ar sluagh do muid na bodhar agus ní chloisfuimúid thú. Sínear ar nóisín más fluich fuar an lá gan tada ar a nuachtar ach sgaoiltáigín úr agus snaomh ar a bárr"

4427873/4352850/4437506.title: A Prayer
4427873/4352850/4437506.text: Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless this bed, that I lay on. As I lay on my right hand side, I pray to God to be my guide, Four blessed corners on this bed, four blessed angels on them spread, and if I die before I wake I pray to God, my soul to tale, and if any evil comes to me "O Sweet Jesus awaken me".

4427836/4349474/4437594.title: Collection of Prayers
4427836/4349474/4437594.text:
The prayers that I learned in school and at home are Our Father, Hail Mary, the Apostles Creed, the Confiteor Grace before meals, grace after meals. The Angelus, Acts of faith, Hope and Charity, Act of Contrition, Hail Holy Queen. I learned the Inigo and the Memorare from a book. I learned the Morning Offering at home. The words of the Lord's prayer are. Our Father who art in heaven hallowed be Thy name Thy kingdom come Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread; and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us, and lead us not into temptation but deliver us from evil. Amen.This is a prayer my mother taught me. O Angel of God my guardian dear to whom God's love commits me here even this night be at my side to light and guard to rule and guide.On four corners of my bed four Angels are spread. Mathew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed I lie on if I die before I wake it's God I will give my soul to take and if an evil come to me my guardian angel waken me.
(continues on next page)

4428101/4378201/4443864.title: Paidir

Iar dul a chodladh dhuit:Deas lámh Dé fé'm cheann,Cros na n-aingeall os mo chionn,Dia ⁊ Muire ⁊ Mícheál liom.Tar, a Mhicil, agus glac mo lámh,Déan mo shíothcháin le Mac Dé;Má tá aon deamhan-sprid ar mo thíCuir Mac dílis Dé idir mé 'gus í,Fé ghuidhe na dtrí aingillidheAingillidhe órdha, ó's siad is sine,An tAthair, an Mac, ⁊ an Sprid NaomhthaIm' shabháil ⁊ im' ghárdáil,Ins gach aon áit a gheobhaidh mé.2. 4428102/4378396/4444009.text: Ag dul a codladh dhuit abair :Luighim ar an leabaidh mar luighim san uaighDeanaim m'fhaoisidín leat, a Íosa, go cruaidhTrí gníomhartha mo choirp. trí smaointe mo chroidheTrí amharc mo shúl, tré labhairt mo bhéilTrí siubhal mo chosTrí gach nidh adubhairt agus ná raibh fíorTrí gach nidh gheallas agus nár cóimhlíontasGach nidh do rinneas i gcoinne do dlighe nó do thoile naomhthaIarraim maitheamnas ort, a Rí na GlóireAg eirighe dhuit ar maidin abair :Eirighim suas le Dia, go n-éirighidh Dia liomLámha Dé im' thimpeallAg suidhe agus ag luighe agus ag eirighe dhom. 4428104/4378296/4445075.title: Old Prayers
4428104/4378296/4445075.text: Old Prayers'God bless the work' is a saying people often use when passing in a field of workers.  In return for charity people said 'May God increase your store'.  Visitors to a house always said 'God save all here'.When going to bed this prayer was recited:-There are four corners to my bed.  There are four angels at my head.Saints Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lay onIf I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeIf I wake before I dieTo God I give my soul to keepHeart of Jesus! I adore TheeHeart of Mary! I implore TheeHeart of Joseph pure and justIn these three hearts I place my trustMr. M.Beecher, Main St., Tallow, Co. Waterford.Katherine Beecher, Main St., Tallow, Co. Waterford.

4428104/4378305/4445099.title: Old Prayers
4428104/4378305/4445099.text: OLD PRAYERSO my God, I adore you, your sovereign majesty,I thank you for all the gifts you have given me,Especially for keeping me safe during the past nightI entreat your blessing on all my thoughts words and actionsGive me the grace to know you to love you and to keep your commandsAnd to do all that I can to promote your honour and gloryThrough the sufferings and death of my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.Mr. J.J. Walsh, West St., Tallow, Co. Waterford (age 84 years)Patricia Beecher, West St., Tallow, Co. Waterford.

4428104/4378307/4445107.title: Old Prayers
4428104/4378307/4445107.text: As I lie down on my bed to sleepI give my soul to God, to keep.If there is any evil to come to me,The Blessed Virgin Mary will save me.Little Baby Jesus in your crib so coldI give your warm heart as the shedherds did of old.

4428104/4378308/4445117.title: Old Prayers
4428104/4378308/4445117.text: I lay my body down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me,My soul and my body I give up to Thee,Thy five bleeding wounds, that were nailed to a treeO, merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.As I lie down to sleep,Jesus, lie down with me,Jesus' right hand under my head,Jesus' bross over me,God for my father,The Blessed Virvin, for my mother,Heaven for my bed,And I renounce the devil.

4428104/4378310/4445129.title: Old Prayer
4428104/4378310/4445129.text: This prayer was said before starting on a journey:Show me thy way,And teach me thy path,And direct my steps according tothy works.Make perfect my walk,That my steps may be moved,And that no injustice may rule over me.

4428104/4378337/4445196.title: One of the Old Prayers
4428104/4378337/4445196.text: Some years ago, there lived in Tallow, two very old men. One was very tall, and the other was very small. One night, as the two were going to bed, the smallest asked of his comrade, to say a prayer for him. So he said, he had only one prayer, but at his request, he would say it for him. When he got into bed, he said the prayer for him, and this is what he said- "Now I lay me down to sleep, The grey backs all around me creep, And if one should bite me 'fore I wake, I hope to gosh his jaws will break."

4427880/4354074/4445206.title: A Prayer
4427880/4354074/4445206.text:
As I lie down om my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,God within, and God without,God all round about His house,Four corners on my bedFour angles stilly spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie onAnd if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.

Old PrayersTo be said before going to bed at night.O my Queen and my Mother, bless me with they pure and holy hands that I may have a good nights rest. That I may be shielded from all vain, evil and distracting thoughts. That I may get the grace to wake be time in the morning to rise promptly and do the work that thy beloved Son has given to the care of my feeble hands.2/I lie either on my right or left sideI pray to God to be my guideSweet Jesus within me,Sweet Jesus about meThe twelve apostles all around meFour corners on my bedFour angels overheadSaint Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless this bed that I lie onIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take If any evil come over meI pray Lord Jesus to deliver me3/ Jesus and Mary be ever (within) with me in the way as my good guard at all times and in every place lest I wander in by paths lest my senses or my heart be seduced by the many illusions.
(continues on next page)

When the people are getting up in the morning they say "thank God for bringing me safe over the night". When kindling the fire they say "O, my God, kindle in me the fire of thy love" When lighting the lamp they say "May the light of Heaven shine on every poor soul". When going to bed at night they say "I lie down to rest on the bosom of my saviour's breast, Jesus name be the last word

On awaking in the morning the old people say "O my God I thank thee for giving me the grace to see another day Grant that I may rise on the last day with an
(continues on next page)

4427907/4356800/4450844.title: Prayers
4427907/4356800/4450844.text:
The night is falling mother dear and the long day is o'er. And before the picture, I kneel down once more. To thank thee that has broght me safe through the day and ask Thee to night to keep evil away. How many times have I fallen today mother dear. How many graces neglected. Since last I knelt here. O wont you with pity my own mother mild ask Jesus to pardon the sins of the child. I am going to rest, for the day's work is done. Its hours and its minutes have passed one by one and the god who will judge us has counted them all. He has numbered each grace and has counted each fall. In his book they are written against the last day. O wont you ask Jesus.
(continues on next page)

Luighmíd le Dia is go luighidh Dia linn.Dhá láimh Dé linn, páirse ó Dia linn,Dia is Colm Cille linn agus a bhratlinn, Micheál agus a sgiath linn, Dia mór athair uile-chumhachtach agus an Maigdean (M) beannuighthe go raibh in ár ibimh dheasa linn ag luighe agus ag éirghe dúinn.

4427905/4356871/4450858.title: Aisling - Seanphaidir
4427905/4356871/4450858.text: "An suan ort a mháthair?" Ní h-eadh a mhich acht aisling". Céard é d'aisling a mháthair? "Béidh tusa go do crochadh, go do cheásadh, go do stúirsáil, go do spúináil, ceangailte go phosta cloce. Ab t-slinn nimhe a' dul do croidhe naomhtha. Do chuid (frior) fola fíor uaisle fú'c ar an tamamh" "As maith d-aisling " a mháthair. As fíor d-aosling a mháthair  do gach (duine) aoinne a deireas d'aisling gach tráth nach baoghal do ifreann agus nach bhfuil flaitheas le fhágail aige.

4427917/4357606/4453172.title: Prayer
4427917/4357606/4453172.text:
To thee O Sacred Heart of Jesus; to thee I devote and offer up my life, thoughts, words, actions, pains, and sufferings. May the least part of my being be no longer employed; save only in loving, serving, honouring and glorifying thee, Wherefore O Sacred Heart of Jesus be thou the sold object of my life, the pledge of my salvation and my secure refuge at the hour of my death. Be thou O most bountiful Heart my justification at the throne of God and scree me from his anger which have so justly merited. In thee I place all my confidence and convinced as I am of my own weakness, I rely entirely on thy bounty. Annihilate in me all that is displeasing and offensive to thy pure eye. Imprint thyself like a divine seal on my heart, that I may even remember my obligation to be never separated from thee. May my name also I
(continues on next page)

4427917/4357607/4453175.title: Prayer
4427917/4357607/4453175.text:
(continued from previous page)
beseech thee by thy tender bounty be written in the book of life and may I ever be a victim consecrated to thy glory ever burning in the flames of they pure love and entirely, penetrated with it for eternity.  In this I place all my happiness, this is all my desire to live and die in no other condition than that of thy devoted servant. Amen



O God who justifiest the wicked that repent and desirest not the death of a sinner, we humbly beseech thy majesty to defend thy servants with thy heavenly grace who trust in thy mercy and to preserve them by thy continual protection that they preserve in thy service and by no temptations.
(continues on next page)

There is a road leading from our village to Culclare, which is called Grallach. The old people say there are lights seen on this road on different occasions. There is a field on the left hand side of this road called trinse dubh. It was given this name because there is a drain at the lower end where
(continues on next page)

4427917/4357335/4453270.title: Paidir
4427917/4357335/4453270.text: Paidrín páirteach , an maidrín mairteach moladh an ráh bhí Dia gan loch , Aon Mich Mhuire agus aon ní grásta ná féach fan anam mbocht. Maith na sagairt Mac Dé maith an báisteach rinne sé , bhaist sé an nigheach agus baisteadh a nigheadh é , bhí go maith fur tháinich cáigh . Cuir sé suas ar roilligigh áirde trí úair eile cruaiche bheith in éirigheas mo paidir trí úair maidin Dé lúain a bheith slán sábháilte.PAIDIRIn ainm an goineadh , in ainm a rugadh  in ainm na tri réich suas go flaitheas Ó Mathair. Cé sin tá tú  a rádh?   A Mic Dí is féidir is paidir a rinne mé ó dhimthigh tú .Maith an paidhir é a mháthair. An té a deireas an paidir trí úaire dul a chodhladh dó gheibheann a b-anam na slán ach purgataí , sábáilte agus manam slán .

4427917/4357341/4453422.title: Ancient Tales
4427917/4357341/4453422.text: There is a fort at the end of our village. One night as a man called Tom, and his wife were passing this fort on their way home from town they heard strange music, and as they looked in towards the fort they saw fairies playing inside in it. They got very much afraid, and hurried home as fast as they could. They were only just inside and had the bolt on the door when they heard strange sounds outside. They shook holy water all round the house, and sometime afterwards the sounds ceased. After that people of the neighbourhood were afraid to pass by that after midnight.Old PrayersO True Lamb of God who takes away the sins of the world by thy mercy which is infinite preserve me form sin and evil. I carry about me the Holy Agnes Dei in thy name as a preservative

I offer myself up to thee as an entire oblation during this day in memory of that sacrifice you offered on the cross for my sake. Accept O my God the oblation I make, and may it be aggreeable to thee in the odour of sweetness Amen.

4427919/4358118/4453850.title: Old Prayers
4427919/4358118/4453850.text:
Long ago people said different kinds of old prayers. These prayers were always said in Irish.When a person sneezes, was going to bed the rosary was said in Irish. When the rosary was finished everyone in the house said little Irish prayers of their own such as "Mile Buidheachas do Dhia agus an Mhaighdean Bheannuighte".When they were getting up in the morning they said the "Our Father" the "Hail Mary" the "Morning Offering" but they were all said in Irish. My grandmother who is eighty years of age cannot say any prayers they said in the morning but the ones I have just mentioned. When starting work early in the morning they said "A Dhia Mhoir na Glóire tabhar cabhair dom" and other little prayers in Irish such as " A Chroidhe Naomhtha Íosa cuir faoi do churam mé". A man taking the loy or spade when sinking it for the first time in the morning said "Beannacht De le hAnnaibh na marbh.Peope said a little prayer when anyone out of the house was
(continues on next page)

4427926/4358167/4454580.title: Old Prayers
4427926/4358167/4454580.text: There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels over them spread,Mattew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lay on. God bless us all till evening fall, And help is in our wantings, Send health and not the wealth, Which never has been fated. This work we start in the name of the Sacred Heart. And by his will we do it, And at the last it is the name as the start,In the name of his Sacred Heart. As I went up the holy landI met the Blessed VirginTwelve mass books in her handsTwelve bells ringing twelve priests singing Open the gates of heaven shore the gates of Hell.And let the poor souls into heaven.

4427930/4358791/4454970.title: Seanphaidreacha
4427930/4358791/4454970.text: When a person got a toothache a Sacred-Heart picture was placed on the affected part and the following prayer was said:-"Dia i do croidheDia i do inntinn,Go bhfágaidh do an píanI bhfad i do dhiaidh.""Muchta, Muchta,Tabhar leat na leicneac"This was sung when a person suffered from mumps. An asse's collar was put round the sufferer's neck. Then he was led out to the pig-sty and brought round it three times, the above words being said each time. The pigs were supposed to take the mumps off the collar which was left hanging in the sty for a night.

4427829/4347968/4455070.title: Paidreacha
4427829/4347968/4455070.text: Tá ab oaudur seo ag na sean deoine, "is goire cabhair De ná an doras."Seo ceann eile. Nuair atá storm ag teacht deir siad, "A Dhia tabair aire dhom" Agus seo cean eile. "Glóir do Dia" nuair a cloiseann siad nuadeacht mait.Seo ceann eile "Buidesteas Mór le Ríogh na glóire" nuair a éirigheann leo obair mhait a déanamhNuair a bíonn duine marbh deir siad "Beannacht Dé le na anam."

4428068/4375319/4455236.title: Collection of Prayers (Learned at Home)
4428068/4375319/4455236.text:
Oh, Jesus, I know I must die, I do not know when or how or where, but if I die in the state of mortal sin I am lost for ever. Oh, Jesus, have mercy on me. [To be said when lying down after going to bed]Oh, Mary, my Mother and my Hope I rake refuge under thy mantle.  There will I live and die. Deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing. Oh, Jesus bless my father and my mother, my sisters, and my brothers, and all those whom I ought to pray for, as Thy Kind Heart knows how to bless them, Amen. [To be said when lying down after going into bed]
(continues on next page)

4428068/4375321/4455237.title: Collection of Prayers
4428068/4375321/4455237.text:
I lay my body down to sleep, I pray to God my soul to keep.  If I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.  Four corners on my bed, Four angels on them spread.  Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, God bless this bed I lie upon.  [To be said when you go into bed.]As I went up the Blessed land, I met the Blessed Virgin.  She had seven books in her hand, Seven candles lighting, Seven priests singing a song, and seven doors shining.  [To be said when you go into bed.]
(continues on next page)

4428068/4375322/4455238.title: Collection of Prayers
4428068/4375322/4455238.text:
(continued from previous page)
No. 4, 5, obtained from:-Mrs. B. JudgeCarrentrilaBacks, Co. Mayo.



As I lay on my right hand side, Blessed Saviour be my guide. When evil comes to me, Blessed Lady waken me. There are four corners on my bed. These four angels over spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. God bless this bed that I lay on. Mary with the leaf and Mary with the flower. Come to meet me at my dying hour. All the sins that I forgot. Oh sweet Jesus blot them off. [To be said when you go into bed.]
(continues on next page)

4428068/4375326/4455239.title: Collection of Prayers
4428068/4375326/4455239.text:
(continued from previous page)
[/]



Oh Mary, my mother, and my Hope, I take refuge under thy mantle.  There will I live and die.  Deliver me from sin, and grant me thy Holy Blessing.  O Jesus, bless my father, and my mother, my brothers, and my sisters, and all for whom I ought to pray as Thy Kind Heart knows how to bless them, Amen.  [When lying down in bed]God bless this house, and keep each door.  May Angels watch 'till night is o'er.  [To be said when going to bed.]

4428068/4375327/4455241.title: Collection of Prayers
4428068/4375327/4455241.text: On Good Friday our Saviour died.  The Jews came and and pierced him from Heart to Hand Upon His Flesh the blood did flow.  His tender Mother was staning by, with heavy heart, and dreadful dress.

4428068/4375328/4455242.title: Collection of Prayers
4428068/4375328/4455242.text: Oh, hail, holy Mary, our hope and our Joy.  Look down blessed Queen on a poor Irish boy, who wanders away from his own beloved home.  Oh, Mary be with me where ever I roam.  Be with me, oh Mary, forsake me not Mary, but guide me and guard me where ever I go.

4427829/4348014/4455251.title: Paidreacha
4427829/4348014/4455251.text: Nuair a thuiteann dhuine isteach i bpoll nó ar an dtalam deireann sé radh beag, "A Dia déan beannacht orm".  Nuair a  bíonn trioblóid ar dhuine deireann sé, "A Iosa, Mhuire, agus Sheosaim cuidigh liom."Nuair a caitheann tú amach uisge saleachtha deireann tú, "Chugat cugat uisce salach agus fág an bealach."  Nuair a bíonn duine tinn agus abhrann duine eile leis, "Cén chaoi bhfuil tú" deireann and duine eile "Tá mé go maith buidheachas le Dia." Nuair a cailltear daoine bíonn na daoine eile ag rádh, "Beannacht Dé le n-a anam."Nuair a bhíonn an Domhnach ag teacht bíonn na daoine ag radh,  "Rachaid mé ag an Aifreann amárach buidheachas le Dia."  Nuair a bhíonn daoine 'gá cur ins an uaigh deireann daoine a bhíonn ag féacaint, "Is a Dia narbh ' fhuar é an uaigh sin."

4428068/4374792/4455831.title: A Prayer
4428068/4374792/4455831.text:
Oh Adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ I dying on the sacred tree, save me oh holy Cross of Christ.  See me safe through all dangers.  Oh holy Cross of Christ warn off from me all things that are evil.  Oh holy Cross of Christ warn off from me all weapons of danger.  Oh holy Cross of Christ warn off from me all dangerous deaths and give me life everlasting Amen.In honour of our Lord Jesus Christ, and in honour of His glorious resurrection and God-like ascention to which he wished to bring me the right way to heaven.  True as Jesus died to save sinners, true as Jesus was born on Christmas day, true as He ascended into heaven, the honour of Jesus
(continues on next page)

4428166/4383151/4456390.title: Local Prayers
4428166/4383151/4456390.text:
in every District of Ireland we find little prayers taught to the children at home by their parents or grand-parents.  These have come down to us from our ancestors and are very valuable.  In some parts of Ireland these prayers are in Irish.I say this prayer going to bed at night."Here I lay me down to sleep.I give my soul to God to keepWhether I wake now or neverI  give my soul to God forever.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels round it steadSt Matt, St Mark, St Luke, St JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.If any one comes to disturb me
(continues on next page)

4428166/4383154/4456391.title: Local Prayers
4428166/4383154/4456391.text:
Every district in Ireland has its own little prayers taught to the children at home by their parents or grandparents before they come to school some of those prayers are in Irish and have come down from our ancestors and are very valuable.Now I will tell a couple of prayers which I was taught before I came to school.  (Heare) Here is a little prayer which can be said morning and night."Take my body Jesus,Eyes and ears and tongue,Never let them Jesus,Help to do thee wrong".Here is another prayer which can be said morning and night for a happy death."O Merciful Jesus have mercy on meMy heart and my soul I resign unto theeFive bleeding wounds thou sufferedCrucified Jesus have mercy on me".
(continues on next page)

4428216/4386699/4456816.title: Prayers
4428216/4386699/4456816.text:
This little prayer which I learned from my mother is to be said when you are getting into bed at night.O Sacred Heart of Jesus send me safe over the night.O Sacred Heart of Jesus protect sinners, save the dying, and let free the holy souls in purgatory.O Sacred Heart of Jesus, I offer thee all the masses, celebrated to day, for sinners who are in their agony, and who are to die this day, may the Precious blood of Jesus have mercy on them.Three short prayers are said before rising in the morning.Infant Jesus, pure, and simple, hear my prayers, and grant my petition.Gentle Jesus, meek, and mild, look down on me a little child, make me humble as thou art, and with your love inflame my heart.O Sacred Heart of Jesus, have mercy on me.



Its in the priest, and its not in the people, its in the church, and its not in the steeple, its in the rock, and its not in the stone? = The letter R.

4428216/4386717/4456835.title: Prayers
4428216/4386717/4456835.text:
I learned many nice short prayers from my mother when I was young.When I am going to bed I say there are four corners on my bed, there are four Angles now in spread, Mathew Mark Luck John god bless this bed that I lay on.When I go to bed I say.Oh merciful Jesus hung in a tree, my soul and my body I give unto thee,O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.Another prayer I also say when I waken in the morningO Angel of God my guardian dear to whom God's love commits me hear ever the day be at my side to light and and guard to rule and guide.O Sacred Heart of Jesus have mercy on me.



How deep is the sea? To deep.Two black men and one white man were going down O'Connell St, and if the two black men ate the one white man what was the number of the car? Two eight one.When was beef the highest? When the cow leaped over the moon.What has four legs and only one foot? A bed.

4428216/4386767/4456884.title: Prayers
4428216/4386767/4456884.text: There are alot of prayers here still that were used by the old people of long ago.Some of them are said when people are in tempation (sic)."Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, help me"."Spare us, Good Lord, spare thy people whom thou hast redeemed with thy most precious blood, and be not angry with us for ever".When getting up the old people say:"I rise from this bed for the love of Thee,Who didst die on the Cross for the love of me".If you fall into sin say:"Lord in the blood that simmers doth flow.Wash me and I shall be whiter than snow".

4427931/4358478/4457747.text:
When Jesus went into the garden to pray,He sweated drops of sweat and blood,Thinking of his bitter passion and deathOn the cross O Lord grant me sleep and rest.



God bless Good Friday, Good Friday day,The day Our Saviour was crucifiedA Crown of thorns put on his head, And nails put in his hands, and Mary, Mother, standing by, crying out,Crying out. The one that shall sayThis prayer three times a day,Three times a night, shall neverEnter the pains of hell.

4427931/4358480/4457773.text:
There are four corners on my bed, There are four angels on them spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, God bless this bed that I lay on. If I die before morning, my bed may be in HeavenAn Angel at my head and Angel at my feet,An angel in the middle to keep all danger out. Six stars again eleven may carry us all up into Heaven.

Paidríní If I lay on my bed as I lay in my grave,I beg of my Jesus my soul to save.Lord be the bunch, Mary be the flowerThat they both may be round me,At my dying hour.



As I went up the Blessed Land.I met the Blessed Virgin MaryTwelve Mass Books in her handTwelve bells ringing.Twelve Priests singingOpen the gates of HeavenShut the gates of HellAnd let the poor suffering souls into Heaven.Mrs Vesey.Barrick St.Charlestown.

4427931/4358483/4457781.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358483/4457781.text: PaidríníO! Merciful Father, wherever I be,My heart and my Soul, I give unto thee,Five bleeding wounds nailed to a tree,O! Merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.Francis KilroyBellaghy.Charlestown.O Holy Angel of God, to whose care I am committed,By the supreme clemency, defend govern, and keep me,From all harm and danger this Blessed dayBut more especially, at the hour of my death.Francis KilroyBellaghy

4427931/4358484/4457782.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358484/4457782.text:
O Virgin Mother, ever meek in my behalf to Jesus speak,That from my Soul, all sin effaced,I may like Thee, be mild and chaste.



O! Mary Immaculate, Star of the Sea,Mary Immaculate, pray for me,Now and at the hour of my death Amen.

4427931/4358484/4457785.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358484/4457785.text:
O Virgin Mother, ever meek in my behalf to Jesus speak,That from my Soul, all sin effaced,I may like Thee, be mild and chaste.



O! Mary Immaculate, Star of the Sea,Mary Immaculate, pray for me,Now and at the hour of my death Amen.

4427931/4358485/4457786.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358485/4457786.text:
Many souls are departing from.Their prison house of clay,In thy precious blood O' JesusWash their sinful stains away.While around them evil spiritsTheir unholy trade are playingAgonizing heart of Jesus,Have mercy on the dying.



Dear Lord I ask that this short dayBe spent for Thee and Thine,O! Jesus grant that every hourMay please thy Heart Divine,Let not my foolish love of praiseRob work or prayer from TheeJesus from pride from self, from sinMay this whole day be free.

In the name of Our Lord Jesus ChristI lay myself down to rest,Bless me O Lord, defend and Govern me,And after a short and miserablePilgrimage, bring me to everlasting happiness Amen.



When getting up min the morning.All for thee,O Lord my Jesus.All for thee.

4427931/4358489/4457805.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358489/4457805.text: When you begin to do your work say:-All for thee' O My Jesus.When you are inclined to anger:-"Mother Mary hold my tongue."When you enter a house say:-G."God bless you".  "God bless the work"God save all here."  God bless all here

4427931/4358490/4457808.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358490/4457808.text: There are four corners on my bed,Four Holy Angels on them spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.God bless this bed that I lay on.And if I die before I wake, the Blessed Virgin my Soul to take.If any danger happens me,Lord Jesus take care of me.Heart of Jesus I adore Thee.Heart of Joseph pure and just.In these three Hearts I place my trust.

4427931/4358491/4457810.title: Paidríní
4427931/4358491/4457810.text: Twas on Good Friday, Our Saviour , he was crucified,A Crown of thorns was put on His head.The Jews with long spear, hit him from the heart to the hand, Thy Blessed Blood began to flow,Thy Blessed Mother standing by,Anyone, who says this prayer. Three times a night, three times a day. Will never enter the gates of hell,Or die in mortal sin.Lord be the branch. Mary be the flower,Jesus and Mary help me at my dying hour.

4428147/4381874/4457921.title: Local Ruins
4428147/4381874/4457921.text:
(continued from previous page)
school district. It is a castle which is situated on the banks of the river Suir. A family named Powers owned it and they had another in Dunhill. John Power was the owner of the castle in Kilmeaden. When Cromwell came over in the year sixteen hundred and forty nine he made a raid on Kilmeaden castle and hanged the owner Mr John Power on a tree out side his own door. A few says after he went to Dunhill and the owner guarded the castle all the day but he was offered a glass of buttermilk and the man called back Cromwell and told him to take the castle. My People do not know whether there is a dungeon in the castle in Kilmeaden or not.

4428147/4381876/4457925.title: Old Prayers
4428147/4381876/4457925.text:
(continued from previous page)
the old people had and are not in print.  The old people had these payers for different purposes. Some of them said them when they were fishing and some when going on a journey and some when they were going to bed. I know one of the prayers that the old people used say when they were going to bed. It is "As I tie on my bed to sleep I pray to God my soul to keep. There are four corners on my bed four angels over spread St Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John God bless the bed that I lie on to night and for ever more amen. I did not heat anything about St Patricks Cross, St Bridget's Cross was made of rushes some say.

(continued from previous page)
[-]



On St. Patrick's Day it was customary to take a burnt coal from the fire, cool it in water and then draw the sign of the cross on the arm with the burnt coal.This was supposed to save a person from illness or serious losses during the year.On St. Brigid's Night, sugáns of straw were made and kept carefully in the house.When the young calves were born, one of these sugans were made by the man
(continues on next page)

4428144/4381529/4458482.title: Traditional Prayers to Be Said on Going to Bed
4428144/4381529/4458482.text: As Ilie down on my right sideI pray to God my soul to guideIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeIf any evil spirit come to meOh! blessed Lady waken meJesus the Branch and Mary the FlowerJesus and Mary be with me at my dying hour. Amen.
4428144/4381529/4458482.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, An tSráidbhaile

4428144/4381530/4458484.title: Another Prayer on Going to Sleep
4428144/4381530/4458484.text: (1)As I lie down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf I should die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take(2)There are four corners in my bedThere are four Angels overspreadMathew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on(3)Oh! Jesus the BranchOh Mary the flowerOh Jesus be with me at every hourOh Jesus Mary and Joseph I giveYou my heart and my soul.

4428144/4381531/4458485.title: Traditional Prayers - Prayer Said on Rising
4428144/4381531/4458485.text: As I arise from this bed of sleep to adore my GodSo may I rise on the last day through the salvation of my soulTo life everlasting. Amen.O Lord my God, O Lord my God,Possess my soul, possess my soulForever and ever. Amen. Amen.O Mother of Mercy, I beseech you to pray always to your divine Son that he may keep me all the days of my life from falling into mortal sin.

4428144/4381532/4458486.title: Traditional Prayers
4428144/4381532/4458486.text: (d) It was on Mount Calvary Our Saviour died.It was on Mount Calvary He was crucified.A crown of thorns on His head.His blessed blood began to flow.His blessed Mother standing bywith a heavy heard and a mournful sighAs I looked up as I looked down.I saw the blessed Mother coming down.The Child Jesus in her arms.A prayer book in her hand.Twelve bells ringingTwelve priests singing,Twelve candles lightingOpen the gates of HeavenShut the gates of HellAnd let the poor sinners enter heaven

4428144/4381533/4458487.text: (e) Another prayer on going to bed.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadMathew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lie onGod bless it in.God bless it out.God bless all around about this houseAnd if I die before I sleepI pray to God my soul to keep.And if I die before I wakeI give my soul t o God to take.

4428129/4380597/4460175.title: Paidreacha
4428129/4380597/4460175.text:
Paidir adeirtear ag gabháilt thar Roilghe :"Dia's Muire dhíbh a fhíréin Chríost athá ag feitheamh annsan leis an Aiséirighe Ghlórmhair. An Té a fhulaing bás ar chrann na Croise ar bhúr san go dtugaidh Sé suaimhneas fíorraidhe dhíbh. Amen"Paidir a deirtear le linn dul a codhladh :"A Íosa dhílis a athair an t-suainDíbir na smaointe seo ma Uaighthe uaimIm shuidhe dom, im luighe dhom, im chodhladh go suainBí im' thimcheall, bí im' chomhlacht, bí im' fhaire gach uain"Cuirtear an fonn "An Druimfionn Donn Dílis" le sin.Paidir a deir lucht déirce nuair a gheibheann siad rud éigin :"Má thá fuigheall faoistim, dearmhad Aifreann nú breitheamtas aithrighe gan comhlíonadh ort go maithodh Dia dhuit iad".Paidir : A bhainrioghain bheannuighthe is a Mháthair Dílis Dé, comhnuigh liom ar maidin is ar meadhon lae. Nuair a sgarfaidh m'anam lem' cholann fuar gan áird - bhíos ar m'aimhleas is seasaigh liom ar uair chruaidh mo bháis.Paidir a deirtear díreach roimh tuitim dod' chodladh agus díreach t'réis dúiseachta duith :
(continues on next page)

4428130/4380631/4460199.title: Paidreacha
4428130/4380631/4460199.text: Cabhair atá mé ag iarradh Ort0sa a Dhia tré droch-smuinte mo chroidhe, tré neart is náire fíor, tré dealbh is gach cómh líonas. Cuirim cuimhne Dé ó cionn mo cuimhne féin an trí naomh dá chlois an t-Athair, an Mac agus an Sprid Naomh. Amen,Ná muchadh Dia solus na bhFlaitheas ar ár n-anam má 'sé toil Dé. Amen.Íosa a Righ, Muire is Uan, díbeart mo smaointe mailighthe uaim. Ciaca im shuidhe nó im chodhladh bí timcheall, bí in éinfeacht liom, bí goire dom gach uair. Amen.A dhá Righ id aingeal, d'aingealaí órdha Sigh is beannuighthe i gcathair ne Glóire. cuir do shábháil mo anam orm gach aon nóimint. Amen.

4428130/4380634/4460201.title: Paidir
4428130/4380634/4460201.text: O a Íosa ar maidin sgreadaim is glaodaim ort, ar Aon Mic Beannuighthe a ceannaig go daor sinn. Cuirim-se mo anam fé braithe do sgeal so agus saor ón bpeacadh sinn i gcaiteamh an lae so.Beannaigim duit-se a Dheuglán Naomhtha, a iarraidh do cabhair do tháinigh mé ar son Dé ort. Beannuigim duit-se is beannuigim fhéin duit.

4460751/4377161/4461543.title: Prayers
4460751/4377161/4461543.text:
When the old people were going to rest they said these prayers :-1. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified, I lay me down to rest. Bless, O Lord, defend and govern me. And after this short and miserable pilgrim age here, bring me to everlasting happiness with You in Heaven. Amen.2. Take my body, Jesus,Eyes and ears and tongue.Never let them, Jesus,Help to do Thee wrong.Take my heart and fill itFull of love for TheeAll I have I give Thee,Give Thyself to me.
(continues on next page)

4460751/4377164/4461545.title: Prayers
4460751/4377164/4461545.text:
This prayer was said after meals :-O my Lord! it was You who gave me this bread. I know that it would be a sin to waste it.There are many who are better than I am and are hungry.This prayer was said on going to rest :-O! my Lord, I love youO! my Lord, I must dieAnd if I die in mortal sinI will be lost forever.This prayer was said on awakening :-"My dear Jesus, I know you could have taken away my life this nightAnd I thank Thee for allowing me to live for a little longer
(continues on next page)

4460751/4377166/4461571.title: Prayers
4460751/4377166/4461571.text:
This prayer was said before Holy Communion :-O my Jesus! why should you come to a miserable old creature like me, whose soul is full of sins. But Jesus, I love you in spite of all my badness. I wish that my soul were as pure as the lily or as that of your dear Mother Mary, my Queen and my Mother.This prayer was said on awakening in the morning :-Jesus, Mary and the holy Saint Jude, the WiseGuard me and guide my hands and feet and lips and
(continues on next page)

4460751/4377169/4461573.title: Prayers
4460751/4377169/4461573.text:
This prayer was said after Holy Communion :1. O my God, I love You, for Your own sake. You are infinitely good and if I ask for something you will give it to me.2. When people were getting out of bed they said "Creidhimh in Dia, go bhfuil Tusa annso im láthair.3. "A Íosa an tAthair, a Íosaph, bheirim suas dhíobh mo chroidhe agus m'anam.4. When they were working in the fields they said "In ainm Dé an obair seo".5. " A Mhuire cuir srian lem theangaidh"6. In the day they said this prayer :
(continues on next page)

4460751/4377173/4461577.title: Prayers
4460751/4377173/4461577.text:
This prayer was said when getting up in the morning.1. O my Jesus! I do not want to offend You today. My Lord! I can't go to work without Your help. I can't help committing sins if You do not help me. Give me grace not to offend You.This prayer was said on awakening2. O my God! I offer You all my joys and sufferings and anything that I have to suffer I will try and bear it for you. Bless me Jesus and help me to work for you today
(continues on next page)

4460751/4377176/4461581.title: Prayers
4460751/4377176/4461581.text:
When going to Holy Communion :-Ó, a Thighearna, I strike my breast with shame on account of the load of sins I have hidden in my heart unknown to anyone but You. With Your Precious Blood wash my poor soul clean from those sins.When going to rest :-My God! when Satan comes to torment me, give me grace to drive him away far from me.2. Now I lay down on my right side to sleep
(continues on next page)

4428065/4374388/4461742.title: Short Prayers Said Locally
4428065/4374388/4461742.text:
The people of this locality have very nice prayers that are not written in  books.   Suppose a man was working in a field,  and another man was passing by he would say "God bless the work".   This is another prayer the people of this locality say.   When a person comes visiting to a house he would say "God save all here" and when he would be going home, the people of the house would say "Good night and safe home".   Another prayer is:-   When a man stops work in the evening he says "The Lord have mercy on the dead".   When he says that prays I suppose he means the Lord have mercy on the people that were working there cutting turf before him.    The old people long ago used to say when the lamp used to be lit "The light of heaven we may have when we leave this world".   If an animal would die or a person, and when he would be going to bury it, he would say "The harm of the year
(continues on next page)

4428277/4391252/4462514.title: Old Prayers
4428277/4391252/4462514.text:
When going to bed say:-"As I lie down in this bed to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,Bless the bed that I lie on,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over head,One to watch and one to pray,And two to bear my soul away,Waken now, waken never,I give my soul to God forever,God within, God without,God be round this house about,If any evil happens me,Blessed Virgin Mary and my Guardian Angel come and waken me".The following prayer can be said anytime while writing the letters I. N. R. I. on the forehead:-"Jesus, of Nazareth, King of the Jews, grant me and
(continues on next page)

4428277/4391262/4462515.title: Old Prayers

Mother, dear, are you sleeping,No! dear child I'm dreaming,Dreaming that our Saviour,Has been scourged, and nailed to the cross.With His precious blood spilled before us,Anyone who says this prayer,Three times night and morning,For Jesus sake shall never take,The fever ache, falling illness, hung or drowned be.Or die out of his bed.When I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,God the plant, God the flower,God give me a happy hour,Mary stands at my bedstalk,

A Prayer for a Happy Death to Our LadyMy own sweet Immaculate MotherWhen death's dreary shadows draw nighWilt thou come from thy throne in the HeavensAnd teach me thyself how to die.IIWilt thou come by St. Joseph attendedLet me hear the sweet tones of thy voiceSaying now that my exile is endedThe time is at hand to rejoice.IIITake me back to the heart of my masterTo the land overflowing with blissWhere my joys shall be deep and unendingTo repair all my sorrows in this.A Prayer after Communion.O,God of charity without limit, and of mercy without measure, it was Thy love

4428278/4391053/4462653.title: Local Prayers
4428278/4391053/4462653.text:
It was on Good Friday in the afternoon	When the Jews cam in with their sharp spears To pearce[sic] the heart of our SaviourDear,His blessed mother being standingbyHer sighs and cries would terrify,any one who says this prayerThree times by day, three times by nightShall never die in mortal sin and the pains of hell shallnever prevail.Amen.

Amen. O'Sacred heart of JesusI place my trust in theeI hope that when I leave this worldmy soul to thee will flee.IIO Jesus meet me with a smileand don't send me awayBut say come here I love you child For ever and for aye.IIIThat I may always live with you

Beirt bhan ag tosnughadh ar aighneas :-Mhuise, a Mháirín bearrtha -"Bhuel, anois, a Bríghidín gan bearradh, teaspáin dúinn do lomra"



Is chughat-sa thánga a thobair naomhaIs chúghat-sa thánga a gcarrán mo phianta.



Gairid do seasca bliain ann bhí an Rialtas ag tabhairt amach prátaí síl ar cháirde. Bhí ar gach duine bocht a chuaidh fé na ndéin urraitheas do thabhairt go ndíolfadh sé asta de réir mar bhí beartaithe. Ní raibh an Béarla ag an mhnaoi bocht so ach go dona. Nuair d'fiafraigh an cléireach di "Who is your security"? dúirt sí gur Mrs. Standing (Stainton). "Where is Mrs. Staunton"? arsa an cléireach. "Well, he be grounding i mbád a chalaid" arsa an bean bhocht.(Thit so amach in Eochaill agus bádhadh Staunton agus go leor eile ag dul thar an gcaladh dóibh agus sin é bhí an bhean so ag iarraidh do innsint).

4428117/4379834/4463656.title: Paidir an Luain
4428117/4379834/4463656.text:
Beannuighim díbh a lucht na mbratNá cuirighidh suim in bhúr gcás'S mairigh a bheadh ar an leabaGan capaid ar uiar a bháisDuine gan céill ná géill dob pheacaidheDein faoridín ionnta agus beidh tú id leanbh arís.Chuaidh Muire 's a mac amach go moch ins an láLeathadar an brat, tháinigh Simon, fear beannaithe an Róimh'S breá is beannaithe agus sí Brat na trí brinnse óirBrat a rugadh Críost fé agus ar baisteadh éAn té dhéanfadh na focail seoTrí h-uaire gach aon mhaidean LuanCífeadh sé mac Dé trí h-uaire roimh a bhásAgus ní rghaidh anam go h-Aifreann go bráth.



Imeacht na ngrásta le h-anam ann na marbhMáthair is mo mháthair mo driothár is mo driofúirGo dtugadh Dia suaineas siorraidhe na bhFlaitheasDos na h-anamainn go léir agus fuscailt ó phianta prugadóireachta.

Paidreacha Gairide1  Urnaigh  roimhe dul a codlad."Dia 'mó choimhead, Dia 'mó shabhail An Mhaighdean Mhuire gó rabh ag déanamh áite damh.Na trí Aingle ortha (ordhar) is aoirde  agus is uaisle ins na flaithis.  Go rabh ag coimhead m'anam agus mo chuirp i gceithre coirneal mo leaptha, a aingle  na bflaitheas gcró siadaill. Má fhághaim bás roimh mhaidin i bflaith{/} Dé go rabh mo leabaidh".2 Paidir ag dul a luighe duit"Sínim ar an leabaidh seo mar sínim ins an uaigh, faoiside chruaidh a ghním leat a Dhia,  asboloid tá mé ag iarraidh ort ar dhroch raidhte mó bhéil,  Air ár peacaidh mó cholann, De bhrigh gur mé bhí lochtach  dubhairt agus nach dtearna[?] Gheall agus nár choimhligh
(continues on next page)

4427952/4360607/4464308.title: Prayers
4427952/4360607/4464308.text:
PrayersLast night I had a talk with Mrs Gallagher of Curryane Swinford. She is sixty three years of age. She told me a few prayers which she heard from Mother. The prayer that used to be said after the rosary is as follows:-Most merciful Jesus have mercy on me.My soul and my body I resign too thee.Those five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree.Most merciful Jesus have mercy on me.The prayer that used to be said for the dying is as follows: - "Most merciful Jesus lover of should, I pray to thee by the agony of thy most sacred heart and by the sorrow of they Immaculate mother to cleanse in thy blood the sinners of the whole world who are now in their agony and are to die thus night amen. Agonising heart of Jesus have mercy on the dying."Mrs Gallagher also told me a song which she heard from her mother. Micky Mulloy of
(continues on next page)

4427952/4360630/4464515.title: Prayers
4427952/4360630/4464515.text:
I was again talking with Mrs Egan an old woman of Kilbride 79 years of age about the prayers the people used to say long ago. She told me that she got this information form her mother. She told me the prayer the people used to say when they used to get up in the morning. They used to make the sign of the cross in Irish and say this prayer “the blessing of God Almighty upon us and on our home! And then they used to make the sign of the cross again in Irish. She told me also that when they used to be starting work the prayer they used to say was - “God Almighty help me through this work and bless be from everybody’s eyes heart and mind amen.
(continues on next page)

4428064/4374302/4464547.title: Prayers
4428064/4374302/4464547.text:
When a person in to a house he says “God save all here. When he is leaving the people of the house say “May God send you safe home. When they are looking at a mark on a person they say “God bless the mark. When people are looking at an animal they say “good luck to hm.” say If a person dies they say. May the Lord have mercy on him If the hear one sneezing they say “God bless us. If we hear of a person being sick we say He’ll be allright  with the help of God. If we hear of a bad news about anyone
(continues on next page)

4428330/4395867/4465019.title: Seanphaidreacha Gaeilge
4428330/4395867/4465019.text:
Sean Phaidreacha Gaedhilge a fuair mé ó Nellie Bheag – bean Mhíc Chonaill. Leac chonaill Árdaraithe I. A Dhia, bheirim m’anam duit.‘S níl mé na dhiaidh ort go braiaéD’fhág mé na fhiadhnaise ar an Mhaighdean MhuireGur fhág mé m’anam ar do dheis láimhCeithre Cóirneil ar mo leabaidhAingle Dé go rabh ‘s na scabaill Ma gheibhim bás – anois no go maidinI bhflaitheis Dé go rabh mo leabaidhTar éis dul isteach sa leabaidh san oidhchea deirtear an urnaigh sin shuas.II. Órtha fhiabhraisNuair a chonnaic Íosa an chroichThainie Air basbaidh agus creathaD’fhiafraigh na h-lúdasaí DóAn fiabhras creatha.Dubhairí  Sé NachFiabhras a bhí airNó fiabhras creatha,agusAn té deirfeadh an órtha sin Tirí h-uaire an uile láNach dtiocfadh airFiabhras nó fiabhras creatha.
(continues on next page)

4428330/4395868/4465023.title: Seanphaidreacha Gaeilge
4428330/4395868/4465023.text:
(continued from previous page)
IIIÓrtha an Déididh:Peadar ‘s é na luigheAr chloich mharamair.Thainic Íosa os a chionn“Peadair goidé sin atá ort?”“Íosa, m’ fh I bhflaitheis Dé go rabh mo leabaidhTar éis dul isteach sa leabaidh san oidhtheÓrtha fhiabhraisNuair a chonnaic Íosa an chroich iacail atá tinn”“Éirigh Pheadair, agus béidh tú slán”.Ní bhéidh an órtha agus an deideachI n-aon bhéal amháin.



Fuair Séamus Mac Aoidh, Paisde ins an 4adh Rang an da Phaidir seo a leanas ó na mhathair mhóir - Máire Níc Aodh, Leac Chonaill, Árdaratha. Tá sí fa thuairim 83 bliadhna de aois.“Bean Frank Shéamuis” a bheirtear oirthí san chomhursanache seo.I. Pronaim m’anam Ort a DhiaNí a iarraidh ort arais atá méFágaim m’ fhiadhnaise ar an Mhaighdean MhuireGur fhág mé m’anam ar do dhéis láimhFa na ceithre cóirneil atá ar mo leabaidhAingle Dé go rabh ann sgabthaMa gheibhim bás roimhe mhaidinI bflaiteis Dé go rabh mo leabaidh.IIÓrtha na sgaball.Gcluin sibh mise, a lucht na sgaballNa deánaigidh failligh in mur geás
(continues on next page)

4428330/4395895/4465093.title: Seanphaidir don Mhaighdean Mhuire
4428330/4395895/4465093.text: Sean Phaidir Don Mhaighdean Mhuire.Failte romhat a Mhuire MhóirA Mhaighden Mhuire ar n-eacair chóirA mhathair Íosa, réalt na maraDíon na mbocht ‘s ar n-anam charaIs tú thug arais an blath do thuitEabha is mór na grásta dhuitRug tú an tUan a shaoraigh sinnAnois ‘s ar uair ar n-éag linnTabhuigh dhúinne síothchan dé.Sgaoil na glais a cheanglas méGreim de’n bhocht - de’n dall a shúlA mhathair mhuirneach Ríogh na ndúl A mhathair na subhailceadh agus airc san reachtA mhathair na h-eagna a’s na h-úmhluigeachtSaor sinne fríd chéim do MhicAr olc ar dhubh ‘s ar éiric.Réalt na maidne agus Árd RíoghainSeachainn sinn ar bhun na bpianGo moltar fa do choimirce gan mhaoidheamhAn t-athair, an mac, a’s an spiorad Naoimh - Amen.Tógadh an phaidir seo as leabhar Seamus Mhic Grianra, gasur ins an 7adh Rang. Fuair Séamus i ó na atair mór - Domhnaill Mac Grianra, atá na chomhnuidh ar bhaile an Bheárnais, Tearamonn, Co. Dhun na nGall.

4428330/4395896/4465097.title: Seanphaidir
4428330/4395896/4465097.text: A Thighearna is mé an Créatur lag faoi ualach thromDa mhéad mo pheacaigh 's aithreach liom.Aidmhighim creideamh Dé go síorLe gradh mo chroidh 's le dochas fíorÓ chois na croiche, glaoidhim suasFríd Íosa ar dTighearna, claoin anuas,Le maitheamhnas agus párdún in mo peacaigh - Amen.Tógadh an t-sean phaidir seo as coip leabhar Chrochuir Mhic Grianra. Paisde ins an 6adh Rang. Fuair Seamus an Paidir ó na athair mór - Domhnall Mac Grianra - atá na chomhnuidh ag Béarnas, Tearamonn, Co. Dhún na nGall. Tá Domhnall fa thuairim 75 bliadhna de aois.

4427962/4361258/4465948.title: Cumadóireacht - Paidreacha
4427962/4361258/4465948.text:
Cumadoireacht Paidreacha(1) Nuair a bhíonn tú ag oscaile an dorais ar maidin abair. Go mbíodh geata na flaitis ar oscailt rómham.(2) Nuair a bhíonn tú ag coigilt na ceine ins an oidche abair go gcoigiltear agus go múchtar teine Phurgadóra romham.(3) Nuair a bhionn tú ag dul isteach sa roilig abair go ndésnaidh des cróchaire ar anamnacaibh na marbh. (4) Nuair a bhéadh tú ag dul isteach sa séipéal abair ba mhaith liom bheith lán de ghrása ag teacht amach dom.(5) Nuair a bhéadh duine ag dul ón a thigh peín go tír nó áit eile abair bíodh am maith agat nó beannact leath.(6) Nuair a bhíodh duine ag cur páinne ar bhanbhaibh no ar mhucaibh abróchadh go gcuiridh an fháinne seo stop ar
(continues on next page)

4427968/4362150/4466021.title: Paidir
4427968/4362150/4466021.text:
Paidir gheal, gheal, cár codail tú aréirFaoi chosaí mhic DéCár chodail tú anochtFaoi chosaí na mbochtCá chodail tú oidhche amárach Faoi chosaí  PhádhraicCéard é sin agat id do dheas láimhNaoi ndeoirí de choisreacháin DomhnaighCuir Muire liom ó dhoras go doras go bhfághfainn an dá dhoras déag ar neamhDún doirse ifreannAmén.



As I went up the blesed hill. I met  the Blessed Virgin Mary. She had twelve mass-books in her hand, twelve bells ringing, twelve priests singing. Open the gates of heaven and close the gates of hell and let all poor souls in. Anyone who says this prayer three times by night, three times by day will never enter the flames of hell.

4427968/4362150/4466022.title: Paidir

4427968/4362161/4466026.title: Paidreacha
4427968/4362161/4466026.text:
Paidrín, Páirteach, áirdín páiris, moladh na mná bhí riamh de'n guidhim a tú bhí rian na ngrásta, go réidhtigh tú an Cháisg [seo] thar an ainm bocht. Is maith is agam i mac Dé, is maith a baistean nDia sé.baiste ó'n mbaist agus baist ó'n mbaist Dé, Tháinig achrainn ar a chruaidh againn ar úr ár máis. Is maith é do phaidir a mháthair le rádh, ní éinne d'éarfadh an phaidir seo trí uaire an luan nach dóicheadh naoi n-ainmneacha naoi n- uaire as purgadóir, agus ainm péin arís go bráth.



Sé do bheatha rian Domhnaigh. Sé do bheatha mic na h-óige. Iosa mic Mhuire déan trócaire orainn, in mhaighdean bheannuighthe fóill orainn.



Ó mhaighdean glóire mhór san mhaitheas, is tú mo stór, mo lón is mo chuisle, glin le n-ór, tóg mé feasta. Nígh mo láimh is mar lé pheacaibh, is ar úr ár máis bí ag rádh do phaidir.Ó Íosta Críosta, thar bréan le sacraiméin, lín mo chroidhe le do ghrásta féin.

4427968/4362172/4466030.title: Paidreacha
4427968/4362172/4466030.text:
There are four corners in my bed. There are four angels on them spread. Michael, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bead that I lie on, and if I die before I awake I give to God my soul soul to take. But if I die in mortal sin I know I am lost forever.



On Good Friday the Jews came in with a big long spear in his hand, and speared our Savior to the heart. From heart to hand his blood would flow, his loving Mother standing by, with a heavy sigh and an awful moan. Whoever shall repeat these words three times at night, and three times at noon, shall never die in mortal sin, and the pains of purgatory shall never be injured to him.On good Friday Jesus died. The Jews that pierced his heart and side. His blessed Mother standing by with a mournful heart and a dismal cry. Anyone that says this prayer, three times by
(continues on next page)

( Ag coiglilt na teineadh )Coigluighim an teine seoMar orduigheann cáchBrighid in a mbunAgus Muire in a bhárrAinglí Dé atá i bhFlaitheas na grástaClúdaigh an tigh seo agus a bhfuill ann go lá(II)Ceithre coirnéal ar mo leabaidhCeithre h-aingeal uirthe scarthaDa bhfuighinn-se bás roimh maidinI bhFlaitheas Dé go raibh mo leabaidh(III)( Ag dul isteach i leabaidh )Síneam-sa síos ins an leabaidhMar sineadh Mac Dé ins an uaigh (?)

4427982/4363580/4467103.title: Paidreacha - Seacht Suáilce na Maighdine
4427982/4363580/4467103.text:
PaidreachaSeacht Suailce na MaighdineAn chéad sólás:-A fuair an Maighdean bheannuighthe nuair a fuair sí an sólás a bhain an t-aon mhac beannuighthe, nuair a fuair sí an power gur thuirlinn sé faoi broinn a mháthar.Ó, a thighearna nárbh aoibhinn an sólás é agus beannacht Dé in ár dtimcheall, gur beannacht Dé g[o] bhfágha gach duine ar an t-saoghal seo a ndeachaid n[ó] a rachaidh ar orde Muire Naomhtha. Molaimíd tú a Íosa 'gus molaimíd go bráth thú agus molaimíd bainrioghan na glóire. An glóire siorraidhe go bhfagha gach duine beag agus mór dá n-airigheann na seacht sólás seoAn dara sólás:-A fuair an maighdean bheannuighthe nuair a fuair sí an sólás a bhain an taon mhac beannuighthe go bhfuair sí an power nó gur thuirling sé ó bruinn a mháthar.Ó, a thighearna srl.An tríomhadh sólás:-A fuair an maighdean bheannuighthe
(continues on next page)

4427985/4364881/4467106.title: Seanphaidreacha
4427985/4364881/4467106.text: 1.Síntear ar leabaidh mé.Mar sintear me san uaigh.Casaid cruaidh dhéanaim leat a Mhic Dé.Faoi mo dhroch ghniomhairtí.Faoi mo dhroch smaointí.Faoi mo chaoi féinAgus caoi mo mhór chaoi féin      Amén.2.     Paidir GealPaidir geal is paidir Mhic Dé.Is deas an phaidir é sin.Cé'r codail tú aréir.Codail mé i leabaidh Mhic Dé.Cé codhlachaidh tú anocht.Codhlachaidh mé i leabaidh na mbocht.Cé codhlachaidh tú an oidhche ambáireach.Codhlachaidh mé i nGairdín Pharthas.Dá lamh Dé linn.An t-athair atá ar Síleann.Na trí buighleann.Dia agus Colmcille linn.Corp Críosta ós mo chionn.Mac Dé idir mé agus an t-olc.

4427982/4363583/4467107.title: Paidir
4427982/4363583/4467107.text:
Paidir(1) Luighimíd le Dia agus go luighe Dia linn,Dá láimh Dé linn,Pearsa Dé linn,Dia na dtrí Muire linn,Dia agus Colmcille linn,Brat Bríghde in ár gcionn,Sgiath Mícheáil bhán in ár gcionnDia idir sinn agus chuile olc,Dia idir sinn agus náire ár gaolta,Dia idir sinn agus gaoth an cnoc.



(2)  Luighim le Dia agus go luighe Dia liom,Pearsa Dhia liomDhá láimh Dé liom,Na trí Muire liom,Dia agus Colmcille liom,Nac daingean an dún so a bhfuilimíd,Idir na sluaigte ag dul tharainn,Idir Muire agus a MacIdir Bríghid agus a brat,Idir Mícheál agus a sgiath,Idir Dia agus a lámh dheas,Claidheamh Críosta in mo láimh dheas
(continues on next page)

4427982/4363585/4467114.title: Paidir
4427982/4363585/4467114.text:
PaidirGcluin sibh mise lucht na sgabhall,Na déan faillighe insan gcás,Is mairg bhíos gan a caraidIs é ar leabaidh an bháisNá ith feoil Ceadaoin is na éagaibh do thinneas,Umlaidh síos don cléireach agus don cuig feilteacha MuireDéan do comaoin le Mac Dé agus béidh tú ag féasta na leinbh,Déirigh Muire agus an Mac amach láCasadh Símon dóbhtha le na soilse óir,Níl aoine a déarfas mo phaidir naoi nuaire c'aon Luan nach dtabhfaidh naoi n-anamneacha as teinte Purgadóra agus a anam féin go bFlaitheas Dé ar uair ár mbáis.Fuair Anna Ní Thachair sin ón a máthair mór Bean Uí Tachair, atá in a comnuidhe i gCreggane Baile Cruaich agus atá in a aois (86)



Glóir Dia Naomhta, Glóir don Athair, Glóir don Mac, Glóir don Spioraid Naomh,Ceithre coirnéal ar mo leaba,Ceitre aingle urri sgarthaMá fhághaim-se bás go maidinGurb é Flaitheas Dé mo leaba.

4427982/4363587/4467117.title: Paidir don Scaball
4427982/4363587/4467117.text:
Paidir don SgaballOfráilim suas an paidir seo in onóir don Mhaighdean glórmhar agus dá haon Mac le hanam dearbratheacha spioradalta agus deirbsiuracha Muire a bhfuil ó luighe na gréine go h-éirge gréine, a bhfuil faoi Brat na Maigdine, a bhfuil rún croidhe in a hintinn a chur ortha a bhfuil, a raibh a mbeidh le Dia ár bpeacaigh a maitheamh dom féin agus dóbhtha-san. Go mbeidh sinn roinn-páirteach i glórmhar agus aoibhneas na maigdine agus a mbéidh siad faoi eadarguidhe beannuighthe ár n-anamna agus ar uair ar mbáis.AménFuair Ann Ní Giontaigh sin ón a athair Mícheál O Giontaigh



Aisling MuireAn codladh sin ort a Mháthair, ní headh acht aisling cruaidh cráidhteCéard is brígh do do aisling,Go raibh tú ceangailte le roipín cruaidh cnaibhe go carraig clocha,Go raibh Do chuid Feola da spíonadh, da stróicthe ó na cnámhaDo chuid Fola uaisle reathuigh le fanaidhO is maith i d'aisling a Mhathair. Níl fear na mna a déarfas sin as gach tráigh ní baoghal do Ifreann agus tá Flaitheas Dé le fághail

4427982/4363588/4467123.title: Paidir
4427982/4363588/4467123.text:
PaidirPaidir iseal a rinn Críosta i gcionn a miosaAr Sliabh Bachall ar mhullaigh Caiseal,Go mbeannuightear duit a Mathair Dé,Go mbeannuightear duit a Céile an Spioraid Naomh,Go mbeannuightear duit a A Teampull na Tionóide,Go mba dún daingean an dún seo a bhfuilmuid annGo mba sluagh dall an sluagh atá in ár ndiaidhLeanbh Iosa i gCocall Criosta,Críosta agus A Cocall sgaruigh go fíor in ár dtimceall.Amén(le rád – ag dul amudha ar fhairrge no ar sliabh)



PaidirTógadh suas ar gualnibh árda .Buaileadh anuas ar leacraibh na sráide,Tógadh suas ar Crann na Páise,Cuireadh sleagh nimhe tríd na taobh dheasCuireadh na táirgni tríd A cosa agus A lámhaÉisc a Mhathair! agus na gol go cráidte, Go bhfágha tú congnamh ar síol Eabha agus AdhaAon duine a ghoileas aon deoir faoi mo PáiseIs geal a loisdín i bPálás na nGrásta.Fuaireas na trí paidir sin ó Bean Ui Ceamharcaigh (72)Cnoc a Caisleain,Baile Cruaidh

4427982/4363589/4467259.title: Paidir ag Coigilt na Tine
4427982/4363589/4467259.text:
Coiglimíd an teine seo mar coigligheann Críost chác, Muire in a bun agus Bríghid in a barr, Cumdach an tighe seo agus a bhfuil ann go brát,Ar an dá aingeal deag atá i bhflaitheas na nGrást



Sínim insan leaba seo mar síneadh Mac Dé insan uaigh,Faoisdin cruaidh a dheanaim leat a Dhia,Faoi droch smaointe mo chroidheFaoi droch ráidhte mo béil,Faoi gac nidh a gheallamuid agus nach ndéanmuid a coimhlíonadh.



Míle fáilte romhat a Chuirp ár dTighearnaA tháinig ó óigh dhiadha go glan,Fuaidh go crann na Páise,Is saoradh síol Éabha ó coir,Ós peacach bocht mé nach fiu mé glacadhSlánaigh mé le linn d'feiscine.(Le rádh ag an Elevation of the Host)

4427982/4363590/4467267.title: Paidir
4427982/4363590/4467267.text:
PaidirCasán na ngrás go siubhalmuid,Glór na n-aingeal go gcluinimuid,Flaitheas Dé go bhfeicimud.



In ainm an Athar atá ar NeamhAn Mhic a d'fulaing an phianAn Spioraid Naomh ár neartúAn Mhaigdean Beannuighte ár dtriall,Anois agus ar uair ár mbáis. Amén



In ainm an Athar, an Mhic agus an Spioraid Naomh an triur nár sárochadh ariamh.



'Breith Muire agus a Mac ar m'aisling'(le rádh taréis brionglóid)



To be said on seeing a Raven(1)  Fiach dubh ar an eitilt aimhréidh gur air do cheann fein do chealgadh(2)  Iasg is uisge i do bhéal agus gurbh é do cheann fein do chealgadh[T]ugadh an méid sin síos o Seumas Mac Ceamharcaigh (75)Cnoc a CaisleánBaile Cruaidh.

4427982/4363591/4467291.title: Paidir Nuair a Bhlaonns an Coileach
4427982/4363591/4467291.text:
Paidir nuair a blaodhanns an CoileachDeagh-sgéal ó Dia chugainnAn té a thug an glór sin duitGo dtugaidh Sé glór na bFlaithis dár n-anam.Amén



Ofráil na MaidneUmhluighim agus impidhim mé féin duit a Mic Dhílis Dé agus a Mhaighdean glórmar cumachtach beannuighthe.Tugaim moladh mór agus buidheachas duit ar son mé féin agus mo chomhluadar a thabhairt slán ó bhás na hoidhche. Ó thug Tú slán ó bhás na hoidhche sinn go dtugaidh Tú slán ó bás an lae muid. Slán ó chuile urcóid agus o chuile anachain, o chuile tinneas agus ó chuile tromas, ó gárla gránda, ó aicíd agus anachain na bliadna.Go gcoinnighidh Tú ar dheagh-stáid agus stáid na grásta muid agus nár thugaidh Tú nídh ar bith insan saoghal seo dúinn a bhainfeas glór Rioghacht na bFlaithis d'ár n-anamneacaibh bochta an lá fhágfas muid an saogal seo.Go dtugaidh Tú suaimhneas siorraidhe do na hanamneacha bochta atá ar slighe na marbh. AmenFuair Mell Níc Suibhne na paidir sin ón a máthair mhór Bean Mhic an Bhaird (72) Leitir Fraigh, Co na Gaillimhe

4427982/4363591/4467293.title: Paidir Nuair a Bhlaonns an Coileach

AmenFuair Mell Níc Suibhne na paidir sin ón a máthair mhór Bean Mhic an Bhaird (72) Leitir Fraigh, Co na Gaillimhe

4427982/4363592/4467298.title: Ofráil an Phaidrín
4427982/4363592/4467298.text:
Ofráil a PaidrínTosuighmuid agus tionsglaidhmuid na cuig deicneabhair seo go léir mar orduigheas Dia dúinn agus an Eaglais Caiticlighe dúinn i gcuimhneamh bháis agus na Páise d'fulang Tú a Slánuightheoir Iosa Críost ar ár son-se agus son na cine daona go h-iomlán. I gcuimhneamh na seacht solás agus seacht dólás a bhí ort a Mhaighdean Glormhar. I dam acht ar d'aon Mac agus i gcrann na Croise dá ceasadh. A Thighearna marúil go dtabharfadh tú maitheamhnas agus párdun dúinn in iomlán ár bpeacadh agus go ndéanfaidh tú trócaire agus grásta orrainn ar uair ár mbás.Bás Críostaidhe go dtugaidh Tú dúinn a Slánughteoir. Bas olla agus aitrighe más é sin do Thoil Féin a Dhia dhílis agus a Mhuire-ban-Tigearna.Fuair Róise Ní Thacair sin ón a mathair mór Bean Ui Tachair (86) Creggán, Baile Cruaidh.



Go sábhailidh Dia sinn feín is an méid is ceisg orrainn isug agus amuic.To(To be said on hearing a hen crow or a cock out of the ordinary time)

4427982/4363592/4467299.title: Ofráil an Phaidrín
4427982/4363592/4467299.text:
Ofráil a PaidrínTosuighmuid agus tionsglaidhmuid na cuig deicneabhair seo go léir mar orduigheas Dia dúinn agus an Eaglais Caiticlighe dúinn i gcuimhneamh bháis agus na Páise d'fulang Tú a Slánuightheoir Iosa Críost ar ár son-se agus son na cine daona go h-iomlán. Bas olla agus aitrighe más é sin do Thoil Féin a Dhia dhílis agus a Mhuire-ban-Tigearna.Fuair Róise Ní Thacair sin ón a mathair mór Bean Ui Tachair (86) Creggán, Baile Cruaidh.



Go sábhailidh Dia sinn feín is an méid is ceisg orrainn isug agus amuic.To(To be said on hearing a hen crow or a cock out of the ordinary time)

4427982/4363593/4467305.title: Paidir roimh an Phaidrín
4427982/4363593/4467305.text: Paidir roimh an PaidrínLeigimíd sinn féin i bhfiadhnaise Dé uile cumachta agus déanamíd gníomh-iarraidh. Iarraidhmuid agus onóirimuid Thú a Dia. Creidim a Dhia go bhfuill tú annseo i láthair go bhfuil fhios againn go bhfuil Tú ag eisteacht linn, go bhfuil fhios agat chuile smaointe.Aibhdighmuid go bhfuil Tú ár Cruthuighteoir agus ar dTíghearna ar neamh agus ar talamh. Isligh sinn féin go h-iomlán faoi do smacht.Bheirimíd míle buidheachas duit a Thighearna faoi gach thiodhlaichte agus grásta a thug Tú dúinn ó tháinic muid ar an saoghal seo agus go speisialta sinn a thabhairt slán ón lá indiú agus ilé? mar a thug Tú slán an lá seo sinn a Thighearna tá muid ag iarraidh ort sinn a tabhairt slán an oidhche seo agus tá muid ag iarraidh ort cíoracuideacha agus galruigheacha a chur tarrainn gan diogh gan dioghbhail agus ár dtreoiriú ar cosán giorracht na grásta agus an t-sláinte a thabhairt dúinn agus ár dtreoiriú mar treoirigh an t-Aingeal Raifhéal Tobias Naomhtha.Fuair Mell  Níc Suibne an paidir sin ó Mícheál Mac Ceamharcaigh (82) Tallacha, Baile Cruaidh.

4427982/4363594/4467312.title: Paidir le Rá ag Tórramh
4427982/4363594/4467312.text:
Paidir le rádh ag TorramhOcht lán deag do roillic PádhraicDe brat BhrigdeDe oileán na naomh,De tuamba Críosta,De gairdín ParrthasDe beannacht dílis Dé le d'anam agus anam de seacht sinnsear ar gach taobh beo agus marbh.Nár ba liachtaighe grainne gainimhe ar an traigh nó Ribeacha féir ag fásNo gur beannacht dílis Dé le d'anam agus lén ár n-anamneacha féin an lá deireannach, agus le hanamneacha mairbh Purgadóra go h-iomlán.Méadú ar a nglóire, laghdú ar a bpiantaAgus go luaithe isteach insan Glóire SiorraidheAménFuair Ann Ní Gíontaigh sin ón a athair Mícheál O Gíontaigh, (79) Duma Frighil, Baile Cruaich



Iosa Muire agus Iosep in airicis m'anam



A Shlánuightheoir an Domhain dearc anuas orrainn le do shúile trócaire.

4427982/4363595/4467324.title: Paidir - Ar Son Duine ag Fáil Bháis
4427982/4363595/4467324.text:
Paidir (ar son duine ag fághail bháis)Paidrín Pairteach in gairdín Parrthas,Ag mac na mná a bhí ariamh gan locht,O, a Aon Mhic Dé na grástaGo dtugaidh tú arús don anam bocht



PaidirCuirim m'anam ar Rí na Glóire,Cuirfidh Sin a mhathair go gcuir mé m'anam ar deas láimh do Mhic. A Mhuire ar gac port na leig mo anam thart. Is mór mo dúil do bhfolach. Mar gheall ar do Mhac guidhim ort. An Rí atá shuas na leig uait mé ar uair mo bháis



Taréis béile feola deirtear"Go méaduig Dia feol beo agus iasg marbh agat".Bean Ui Chonmhuchain as Croc a Caisleain a thug sin go Mell Níc Suibhne.

4427978/4363071/4467517.title: A Mermaid
4427978/4363071/4467517.text:
(continued from previous page)
and her son told her the right stack. Afterwards she and her three children went down to Enniscrone. She made three stones of the children and was never seen or heard of again herself



Four corners on my bed, four angels at its stead. Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lay on. As I lay down on this bed to sleep I give my soul to God to keep. This is another prayer God bless Friday and Good
(continues on next page)

4427998/4366126/4467728.title: Seanphaidreacha - Ag Dul isteach sa Séipéal
4427998/4366126/4467728.text:
Go mbeannuighidh Dia dhuit a chrois a chrainn direach glas a ceasadh Iosa Críosta as. Iarraim iompuigh ort a rí agus tú i do shíneadh ar an gcrois. Beagan peacadh a bheith ar m'anamh nuair a bhéas sé a sgaramhaint leis an gcolann.



Octlan Dé umba Criosta, Roilig Phadhraig, Brat Brigde, Gairdin Phárrthas, Naomh na n-Aingeal Go Bheannactai Dílis Dé ar anamh na marbh go hiomlán.
