4493769/4418467/4534543.text: "God bless Friday, and Good Friday too, the day Our Saviour was crucified.The Jews came by, with spears so sharp, and they pierced Our Saviour through the heart.  His mother standing by, with sorrowful heart, and tearful eye."He who says this prayer five times a day, and five times a (day) night, shall not die of dread or fright.  Or the gates of hell shall not enter in

4493712/4413435/4534810.title: A Collection of Prayers
4493712/4413435/4534810.text:
Prayers which should be said when you are in bed.Oh, Lord bless this bed that I am going to lie on, and bless the sleep that I am going to take. Sweet Mary my mother be thou at my head, blessed John the Apostle be thou at my feet and the dear Angel of God at my side. May Christ  messenger with the Holy-oil be in time at my death to put the seal on my soul in the name of Christ Crucified.Print I.N.R.I. on your forehead and while printing say:-Jesus of Nazareth king of the Jews preserve (me) from a sudden or unprovided death, Amen.Form your arms in the sign of the Cross, and sayI fold my arms in the sign of the Cross and I say to myself I must die. I do
(continues on next page)

4493758/4417350/4535242.title: Famine Times
4493758/4417350/4535242.text:
(continued from previous page)
were no potatoes here. There are a hole lot of houses down because the people had to leave them.There is an old house in Sleadrin and they were people lived in it and they left it at the time of the famine and they went to Scholen. These people is dead now.There is an old house in Corven and there was people liven in it the time of the famine and they died with hunger because they had nothing to eat. Some of these people died with flew and the fever and other diseases.



In olden times when the people would be going to the town they would say. If god spares us wee will go to the town and we will trust in god that we will get home again safe and when they would get home from the town they said thank god for sending us home safe. Long ago before the people went to bed they said God bless us for the night
(continues on next page)

4493773/4418980/4535721.title: Old Irish Prayers
4493773/4418980/4535721.text: (1) Here I lay me down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep and if I die before I wake I pray that God my soul may take. If evil spirits come to see me great God relieve me. There are four corners in my bed, there's four angels around my spread, Saint Matthew, Saint Mark, Saint Luke, Saint John. God bless me on this bed that I lie on. God wash me sprinkle with his two eyes, that I may be  cleaner and  whiter than snow.(2)   God bless Friday and good Friday the day our saviour was crucified. Up comes the Jew with a long spear in his hand. Our  Saviour's heart he ran it through, His blessed Mother standing by with a heavy heart and a weeping eye.Those who should say these prayers five times by night, five times by day, never shall die with dread or fear.Taken down from my grandfatherBarney McEleney. Age 86Chapel Street, Carndonagh

4493773/4418981/4535722.title: Old Irish Prayers
4493773/4418981/4535722.text: (3)   God the branch, God the flower. God be with me at my last hour.As I lay down this night to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, If any evil touches me, Oh Blessed Lady wake.------------------------------------------------------4.God bless the bed, God bless the flower, And God bless me, In my last hour. To be said three times in bed at night.------------------------------------------------------5.Four Great Angels around my bed, Two at the foot and two at the head, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, Guard the bed that I lie on. To be said in bed at night.------------------------------------------------------6. Dear Angel keep me near thee, Beneath thy snow-white wing, And guard me form the evil ones, And teach me holy things. To be said night and morning.------------------------------------------------------7.Ere I lie down to sleep, I give my soul to God to take, And If I die before I wake, I pray that God my soul will keep. To be said in bed at night.

Efficacious PrayerCease, the Sacred Heart of Jesus is with me,Open to me thy Sacred Heart, O Jesus,Show me Its charms, and write me with It for ever.May every breath and pulsation of my heart.Cease no daring my sleep;Be to thee a testimony of all my love,And say unto Thee unceasingly - Yes Lord I love Thee."Accept the little good I do; Grant me grace to repair my evil.That I may praise Thee in time, and Bless Thee for all Eternity, Hail Mary

4493774/4419154/4536212.title: Weather-Lore
4493774/4419154/4536212.text:
(continued from previous page)
weather. When the sea is calm it is a sign of good weather. If hills look near bad weather is approaching. Snails crawling about foretell rain, and swarms of midges in fine weather also indicate the coming of rain.



The following prayers are said when going to bed. God the father bless me, jesus christ defend me and keep me in the virtue of the holy ghost. Enlighten and sanctify me this night and forever amen. Into thy hands O Lord I commend my spirit Lord Jesus receive my soul. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I lay myself down to rest. Bless me O Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness.
(continues on next page)

4493785/4420217/4537529.text:
Jesus at my head,Mary at my feetHoly Saint JosephWatch over me while I sleep.The five bleeding woundsWere nailed to a cross.Mercyful Jesus, have mercy on me.Mercyful Jesus, have pity on me.My soul and my body I resign unto you.Mother are you sleeping.No son dear I am dreaming.What are you dreaming?I am dreaming that you are nailed to a cross.And a spear driving through your right side,True for you motherThose that say this prayer three times going to sound sleep will never go to hell.As I lie down this night to sleep.I give my soul to God to keep.And if I die before I awake.I trust in God my soul shall take

4493786/4420313/4537932.title: A Prayer
4493786/4420313/4537932.text:
A Prayer.When the old people saw the new moon they said,"God sees the new moonThe new moon sees me,Good bless the new moonAnd God bless me,"



BreadThe kind of bread the old people made in our district was oatmeal bread, boxty-bread and potato-bread. Some of the bread was made from oats grown locally. The people in our district used querns which consisted of two flat stones with a hole in the lower one. The grain was put into the hole and ground by the other stone.The bread people used was boxty-bread, potato-bread and oatmeal-bread. Boxty-bread was made from potatoes, flour, milk, soda
(continues on next page)

Most merciful Jesus have mercy on me.As I lay down my right side Jesus sleeps on Mary's knee.If any danger dust comes near me,My sweet Jesus waken me.  Hail pure white Lilly ever bright and peaceful Trinity.  Brilliant rose of heavenly

4493804/4422347/4538304.title: Urnaí na Maidine
4493804/4422347/4538304.text:
Cuireas mé féin i bhfiadhnaise Dé indiu ag deánamh gníomh adhraidh. Adhraim is onoirim thú islighim mé féin go h-iomlán faoi do ' smaoid' is cresdim gur tú mo  Chru thuightheóir agus mo Ard Thighearna agus deánamh ar feadh an lae a chuirfeas fearg ort le smuaineadh, le briathar ,le gníomh no le faillighe.  A Naoimh Mhuire ar Ar dtaoibh linn indiu a aingil dí bhí ár gcabair agus ár gcoimhead, sorllsigh  linn, cabhruigh agus curdigh linn anois agus go speisialta ar uair ár mbáis.   A Pháitrúin Naomhtha , Pádraig guidh ar ár son.A Íosa , deán trócaire orainn . A Thighear na deán trócaire orainn. A mhic Dé tabhair toirthe ar ár n-árus i na laethe. Díbir ar shiubhal uainn na droch spioraidí agus ghach uile  cinéal peacaidh mar ndúil go ndeánaidh na naoimh  aingil a n-áite cómhnuighteacha i n-ár gcroidhthibh cuir do bheannach orainn go cinnte agus cuirfimid muid  féin in do ríoghachta is in do foirne.Nóta ar an taobh eile.
(continues on next page)

4493796/4421463/4540259.title: Paidreacha
4493796/4421463/4540259.text: Mary Doherty,Cloughfin,Clonmany.I got this from:-Joseph DohertyCloughfinCoimrigh Dia is Muire, Colm Cille, Padhraig agus Muire agus Éoghan Bhaistidhe. Fa deidin(?) i luighe is ag éirge dúinn.(They used to say this when going to bed and rising)There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels on my spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lay on.(They used to say this when going to bed)I adore thee O most precious cross which has been adored with the tender delicate and venerable hands and feet. O Our dear Lord Jesus Christ imbued with His most Precious Blood. I adore Thee O most Precious Cross for the love of my Lord and God, Jesus Christ.(Long ago the people used to say this prayer on Friday and they would release one soul out of purgatory and if they would say it on Good Friday they would release thirty-three souls)

4493796/4421464/4540260.title: Prayers
4493796/4421464/4540260.text: Holy Mary pure and whiteHeaven it is my heart's delight. Holy Mary pray for me that I may be in heaven with thee.Jesus be my SaviourMary be my guide. May the blessing of Holy Trinity assist me every hour.Jesus, Mary, and Joseph enlighten us, help us, save usAmen.God bless Friday and Good Friday and the Friday Our Saviour was crucified on. The wicked Jew was standing by. He pierced Him from the heart unto the hand. Who ever says this prayer three times by day, and by night neither death or judgement need they fear.

4493796/4421466/4540262.title: A Prayer to be Said When Going on a Journey
4493796/4421466/4540262.text: Show me O Lord Thy waysTeach me Thy pathsDirect my steps according to Thy wordThat no unjustice may ever rule over meThat my steps may not be moved.Enlighten me O Lord with Thy holy lightSustain me by Thy graceAnd suffer me not to fall into sinThrough Jesus Christ Our Lord Amen.

I appeal to thee O St. John Boyce   when I am  in need of special graces both spiritually and temporally and you that had so much

Druidim mo shuil agus léighim a fuair sí tháramh.Cruaiste Dá go bhféichidh mé.Tór Dé go ghnídhidh mé.  Geállann Críost go fhóllann mé. Flíathas Dé sochar mé.

4541317/4422123/4541426.title: Prayer for the Agnus Dei
4541317/4422123/4541426.text: O Lord Jesus Christ the true Lamb that takes away the sins of the world.  By Thy mercy which is infinite pardon iniquities.  By Thy sacred passion preserve me this day from all sin and danger I carry about with me this holy Agnes in honour of the persevicial against my own weakness, as practice humility which Thou hast taught us.  I offer myself as an entire obligation in memory of that sacrifice of love which was offered for me on the cross, in satisfaction for my sins.  Accept O My God this obligation I make and may it be agreeable to Thee in the odour of sweetness.  AmenCollected by Celia Mc Laughlin KnockbrackFrom Winifred Fulton Liscomfort

4428384/4402804/4551072.text:

(Eolas faoin bhfaisnéiseoir agus faoin mbailitheoir)



Ceithre coirnéal ar mo leabaidh ceithre haingle go rabh annsin Dia go rabh astoigh Dia's Muire go rabh fá dtaobh de'n leabaidh, Dia ma thig dadaidh orm Maighdéan na Muire muscail mé cúdaigh mé cuidigh liom anois a's ar uair a mbáis. Amen.Síntear mé sa leabaidh seo mar shíntigh mé sa n-uaigh Maighdean na Muire go rabh ag mó cheann Eoin Baisde go rabh ag mo bhonn, teachtaire dílis a n-ionad Críosta tar chugam sa agus cur an ola Chríosta ar m-anam dílis a D'fhulaing Críost ar an chrann.Luighim ar mó láimh dheas codluighim ar mó láimh chlí diúltaighim de'n an-spiorad agus gabham ón sa spiorad naomh.A Dhia caithfidh mé bás fhághail níl fhios agam ca h-uair ca h-áit na caidén dóigh ma fhágham sa bás i stad peacadh marbhtha tá mé caillte go deo. Íosa déan trocaire orainn.



Tomhais orm tomhais ort caidé an dealg a chur brígh sa bhrat.   (Salainn)Chuaidh beirt clann Craobhaidhe amach na cnuic maidín cheó an méid a fuar siad chaith siad uatha é, a's an meid nach bhfuair siad bhí sé leo.   (Dealg)Ma chuidigheann crub "elephant" leath acra cáide chuidigheas
(continues on next page)

4428384/4402815/4551084.title: Paidir
4428384/4402815/4551084.text:
Luighim ar mo láimh dheis, codhluighim ar mo láimh chlí, diúltaigheam do'n ainspiorad agus comhnuigheam leis an Spiorad Naomh. A Mhaighdean Mhuire bhí ag mó cheann a Eóin Baiste bhí ag mo bhonn. Teachtaire Dé in ionad Críost bhí agam go gcuirfidh ola Chríost ar m'anam dílis a d'fhulaing Iosa ar an chrann. Ceithre coirneáil ar mo leabaidh, ceithre h aingle go raibh annsin, Dia go raibh amuigh, Dia go raibh astoigh, Dia is Críost go raibh fá dtaobh d'en teach. Mó thigeann gáth orm is mé mo codladh, Dhia muscail mé, Dhia cuidigh liom anois agus ar uair mó bhais Amén. A Mhuire na ngrás, a mathair Mhic Dé go gcuiridh tú ar do leas mé, go Sabhlochaidh tú mé ar gach uile olc. go sábhlochaidh tú mé idir anam is corp. Go sábhlochaidh tú mé ar muir a's ar tír go sábhlochaidh tú mé ar leic na bpian, gárda na naingeal a's mo cheann Dia róim agus Dia liom.Bhí mé ag siúl ar thalamh beannuigh, is casadh damh an Mhaighdean Bheannuigh. Bhí seacht gcóróinn Mhuire léithe ina láimh. seacht gcoinnle lasta ar gach taobh. seacht sagairt a leigheamh. seacht gclog a bualadh. Geaftaí na bFlaithis a foscladh agus dorsacha Aifrinn a dhruid.



Toit sa choillidh agus gan teine ar bith ann.   (Ceo.)Tá sé amuigh agus tá sé astoigh agus tá sé eadar an taer agus an talamh.   (Fuinneóg.)Barraile ar an t-sráid agus a dhá cheann druidte.   (Uibh)
(continues on next page)

4428385/4402820/4551089.title: Urnaíocha
4428385/4402820/4551089.text:
Fáilte dhuitse Mhuire Mór. A Mhaighdean shiorruidhe, ar neacair Phóill. Is tú Mathar Iosa, is tú réat na maidhne, is tú sciath ná mbocht, is tú anam charaid. Nuair a thug tú an bliath arais a shaothruigh sinn, agus shabhuigh dúinne riothca Dé. Sgaoil na glois a chenglas mé. Greim d'on bhochtar daladh shuil. Mhathair Mhuirneach, Dhia na n-umhal, scathan na subhailce le h-uilcin rath, na h-eagla, agus na h-umhalaidheacht. Go Móltar faoí dó h-imirce. An Tathair, an Mac, agus an Spiorad Naomh. Seanurnaigh 24-1-38Gluinn tú mise lucht na scabal, na leigigidh faillidh ann mhur gcás. Is mairg a bíos gan caraid, is mé mó luighe ar leabaidh an bháis. Dhuine bhoicht gan chéill nach dean bréag leis na muiribh, umhal dó ná cléiridh, agus do na cuig féilte muire. Dean dó fhaoiside le Mac Dé, agus beidh tú ar féasta ag na muiribh. Bhí Muire, agus a Mac, ar shiubhal amuigh
(continues on next page)

4428385/4402565/4551101.title: Urnaí
4428385/4402565/4551101.text: UrnaighCrios Mhuire mo Chrios. Crios na gceithre gCros.Crios ar a rugadh Iosa, a Íosa mhín-mhilis deán trocaire orm.Éirigh a mháthair agus tabhair tártháil ar an mhnaoíÉirigh féin a mhic as tú is feárrBaist leanbh agus fág an mhnaoí slánNíl a'n nduine i ndeirfidh an urnaigh seo uair ach a'n lá nach bhfeicfidh an Mhaighdeán Mhuire naoí lá roimh a bhás. "Urnaigh"Triúr a thainig isteach - Peadar, Muire agus Íosa. Anna máthair Muire agus Muire máthair Íosa.Iad sin uilig go rabh idir muid agus Fiabhras gus Aicideachca na leabtha.Thainig Iosa go bun na Croiche indiaidh ar chur sé agus ar threabhaidh sé.D'fhiafruigh na h-Iúdaí dó, bhfuil fiabhras ort nó creachtha.Dubhairt sé - Níl fiabhras orm no creachtha acht an té a chloinn mo chuid focal.A congbuigeas (choinneos?) a gcuimhne iad no a sgríobhas.Fiabhras creachtha no aicideacha na leabtha ní bhéidh ortha anois no go bráthach tré saoghal na saoghal, Amen.

4428385/4402565/4551102.title: Urnaí
4428385/4402565/4551102.text: UrnaighCrios Mhuire mo Chrios. Crios na gceithre gCros.Crios ar a rugadh Iosa, a Íosa mhín-mhilis deán trocaire orm.Éirigh a mháthair agus tabhair tártháil ar an mhnaoíÉirigh féin a mhic as tú is feárrBaist leanbh agus fág an mhnaoí slánNíl a'n nduine i ndeirfidh an urnaigh seo uair ach a'n lá nach bhfeicfidh an Mhaighdeán Mhuire naoí lá roimh a bhás. "Urnaigh"Triúr a thainig isteach - Peadar, Muire agus Íosa. Anna máthair Muire agus Muire máthair Íosa.Iad sin uilig go rabh idir muid agus Fiabhras gus Aicideachca na leabtha.Thainig Iosa go bun na Croiche indiaidh ar chur sé agus ar threabhaidh sé.D'fhiafruigh na h-Iúdaí dó, bhfuil fiabhras ort nó creachtha.Dubhairt sé - Níl fiabhras orm no creachtha acht an té a chloinn mo chuid focal.A congbuigeas (choinneos?) a gcuimhne iad no a sgríobhas.Fiabhras creachtha no aicideacha na leabtha ní bhéidh ortha anois no go bráthach tré saoghal na saoghal, Amen.

4428385/4402566/4551104.title: Urnaí
4428385/4402566/4551104.text: UrnaighCeithre cóirneál ar mo leabaidh - ceithre h-aingil go rabh istigh, ceithre h-aingil go rabh amuigh. Aingeal go rabh taobh thiar damh. Aingeal go rabh taobh amuigh damh - Aingeal go rabh ag mo ceann. Aingeal go rabh ag mo chosa agus aingeal go rabh fríd an teach seo go maidin. A mhaighdeán mhuire mo thig a dháth orm go musglaidh tú mé.

4428386/4402611/4551111.title: Paidreacha
4428386/4402611/4551111.text:
Urnaighe le rádh indiaidh dhul i luigheSínim mé fhéin 'san leabaidh seo mar shíntear mé 'san uaigh.Faoisde chruaidh, chraibheach ghnídhim leatsa a aon mhic dé.Eoghain baiste na n-easbal bhí ag mo bhonn,Muire na Naomh bhí ag mo cheann.A theachtaire dhílis Dé tar chugam in am,Go gcuiridh tú ola Chríost ar m-anam dílis,A cheannuigh Íosa go daor ar an chrann.Ceithre coirnéil ar mo leabaidh,Ceithre h-aingle go raibh annsin.Dia go raibh amuigh,Dia go raibh istigh,Dia agus Muire thart fa mo theach go maidín.A Mhaighdean Mhuire cuidigh liom,A aingeal Mhuire cumhdaigh me.



A Dhia liom. Is tú grian na
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402611/4551112.title: Paidreacha
4428386/4402611/4551112.text:
Urnaighe le rádh indiaidh dhul i luigheSínim mé fhéin 'san leabaidh seo mar shíntear mé 'san uaigh.Faoisde chruaidh, chraibheach ghnídhim leatsa a aon mhic dé.Eoghain baiste na n-easbal bhí ag mo bhonn,Muire na Naomh bhí ag mo cheann.A theachtaire dhílis Dé tar chugam in am,Go gcuiridh tú ola Chríost ar m-anam dílis,A cheannuigh Íosa go daor ar an chrann.Ceithre coirnéil ar mo leabaidh,Ceithre h-aingle go raibh annsin.Dia go raibh amuigh,Dia go raibh istigh,Dia agus Muire thart fa mo theach go maidín.A Mhaighdean Mhuire cuidigh liom,A aingeal Mhuire cumhdaigh me.



A Dhia liom. Is tú grian na
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402612/4551113.title: Urnaí ar Fheiscint na Gréine
4428386/4402612/4551113.text:
(continued from previous page)
h-ainmna i is geal liom do shoilseacht. Grádhuim thú a sholuisshíorraidhe, tabhair damh radharc ort.



Beannuighim dhíbh a fhirínní,Críost ata ann seoag feiteamh le h-eisrighe ghlórmhair,An t-e dfulaing páis ar bhur son.Go dtugaidh sé suaimhneasSíorraidhe díbh.
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402613/4551114.title: Urnaí fá choinne Rá sa Reilig
4428386/4402613/4551114.text:
Nuair fhoscluigheas fuinneógaí an lae fosgluighim'se fuinneógaí m-anama. Suas na cathrach neamha agus gach eile comhair. Éist le guth m-urnaighe, mo Rí agus mo Dhia. Guidhim agat agus éist le'm ghuth ar maidín Íosa Mhic Mhuire d'fulaing do pháis ar chrann na croicthe uair roimhe an bháis dearcas orainn agus réidhtigh ár gcás. Tabhar dúinne na flaithis uair roimhe an bháis.Luighim ar an leabaidh seo ma shíntear mé san uaigh ag dul i mbás chodlata damh Mhic Dé ngidhim'se faoiside chruaidh mo leabtha leatsa. Ó olcas mo chroidhe agus ocraidhe mo chodlate. A Dhia is mé atá lochtach ngidhim mo gheallam na ndeanamh mo comhnuidhe. Máthair Íosa bí ag mo bhonn. Eoin baisteadh bí ag mo chrann. Teachtaire Dé dílis tar chugam i n-am go gcuiridh tú ola Chríosta ar mo anam cheannuigh Íosa ar an chrann.Máthar na Gile agus baínríoghan na glóire is leatsa ngidhim mo chasaide ar maidín is trathnóna le mo chur ar mo leas
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402622/4551154.title: Urnaí an Scabaill
4428386/4402622/4551154.text:
Bhí Muire agus a mac ag siubhal amuigh sa lá Casadh uirrí an pearsa beannuighthe mar bhí Símon as an RóimhShín sí do sa deis láimh sgaball beannuighthe na mbransaí óirNíl aon dhuine a chaitheas mo aibid beannuighthe mar is cóirNach mbéidh séala agam ar anam ins an ghlóirSimonMáighdean clúiteach mhúinte, maiseIs tú mo stór, mo lóin is mo thuigseTusa an réalta soluis bheas romhaim ar an bealaighle mo treorú' ar an eolas san áit a dtéigh an tóir ar an pheacachMáthair na gile agus bainríoghan na glóireIs leat a ghnidhim mo chasoide maidín as tráthnóna le mo chur ar mo leas agus mo threorú' ar an eolas go poball na h-aithrighe an áit a síltear na deora líon mo lámh as smál mo pheacaidhTabhair m-anam 'na flaitheas seo aillse chuir Muire ormNí pheacach mé lith no [?] guidhe [?] Muire agus go rabh Muire agam ar uair mo bhásMhuire mhór, máthair an ríogh deanam mo dhícheall le do MhacGluaisigh orm níos gile no an ghrian agus ma tá cha bhíonn plan i bhfan ann
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402624/4551158.title: (no title)
4428386/4402624/4551158.text:
Geal Peadair, geal Pheadair, cár chodlaidh tú aréir?Chodlaidh mé ar neamh mar ar chodlaidh mac dé.Ca gcodlochta tú anocht?Fa chara chríosta.Caidé sin romhat?Tá, na h-aingle.Caidé sin 'do dhiaidh?Tá, na h-Easpail.Caidé sin ar do láimh dheis?Uisce coisriochta.Coimirce a chur muire liom le mo dhéanamh eolais go teach pháiris.Adhruighim an dabhach sin thall bhfuil an choinneal lasta ann a lár Muire agus a mac ann. Bríghid agus a brat ann. Micheál agus a sciath ann, Dhá láimh dé da m'anam.



Luighim ar mo láimh dheis.Codhlaim ar mo láimh chlí.Luighim le Dia agus luighfidh Dia liom.Luighim leis an mhaighdean Mhuire agus luighfidh an Mhaighdean Mhuire liom.Dúiltim ro'n an-spiorad agus glacaim leis an Spiorad Naomh.
(continues on next page)

4428386/4402626/4551160.title: Urnaí le Rá ag an Aifreann
4428386/4402626/4551160.text:
Seo an crann beag duilleabhrach glas ar céasadh mo shlánuightheóir air a dhoirt a chuid fola ar ár son,I n-dúl go saothrochainn m'anam ó leic na bpian,Gach anam a tháinig romham ariamh, agus a thiocfas mo dhiaidh.



Beannaigh mé Íosa agus na leig damh bheith go mí riaghalta. Tabhar grádh damh ma táim go maith. Níl uaim ach an grádh sin.Umhluighim do phobail Dé go n-umhluigheann Pobal Dé damh. Umhluighim ar mo ghlúin. Comhnuide in mo chridhe. Go n-umhluigh Rí Flaitis Dé agus an dá eascal déág damh ionnas go sabhluigh Dia m'anam ar leacacha pian.Brídhid Ní ChomhghaillFuaras ó Bríghid Bean Uí Colla (70 Bliain D'aois), Mín an Iolair, Doire beag, Gaoth Dobhair

4428386/4402630/4551467.title: Comaoin Spioradálta
4428386/4402630/4551467.text:
(continued from previous page)
fuíntach i ngeallamhain chríost in do sheirbhis naomhtha go deireadh ár shaoghail. Creideamh láidir, dochas daingean teas ghrádh an spioraid naomh. Greása an spioraid Naomh go gcomhnuigh tú liom. A Íosa a dhóirt do cuid fola mar luachach ina na scálaí ar son ár gcuid peacaidh bí trócaireach dúinn.



Indiaidh an phaidrín deirfidhe - trí paidreacha, trí Abhe Máire agus Cré le h-impighe na maighdne muire, nuair a chonnaic sí a h-aon mhac ar chrann na croiche fríd a h-impighe, fríd a h-aon mhac muirneach na trí amharc trocaireach sin a thug siad ar a chéile, leis na trí amharc throcaireach thabhairt orainn in uair ár mbáis agus ár gcruaidh cás.trí paidreacha, nó trí abhe máire agus cré i gcuimhne na trí pearsa ro naomhtha mar atá an t-athair, an mac, agus an spiorad naomh lá maith an bhreitheamhnais, an lá sin an [?] an talaimh agus dheánfar púd[? de'n pheacach, lá na feirge agus na [?], mar n-iúl a Dhia go bfuighmid scath agus dídean agus folach faoi sciathán do throcaire.
(continues on next page)

4428000/4366408/4552367.title: Paidir ar son Dé
4428000/4366408/4552367.text:
Aingeal gheal gheal cé chodal tú aréir? Faoí Ghrasta Mhic Dé. Cé geodhló thú anocht?Faoí chosaibh na mbocht. Cé gcodhló tú san oidhche ambhárach? i nGáirdín Phádhraic. Cé sin rómhac? Dhá fhichead Aingeal. Cé sin do dhiaidh?



Aingeal gheal gheal cé chodal tú aréir? Faoí Ghrasta Mhic Dé. Cé geodhló thú anocht?Faoí chosaibh na mbocht. Cé gcodhló tú san oidhche ambhárach? i nGáirdín Phádhraic. Cé sin rómhac? Dhá fhichead Aingeal. Cé sin do dhiaidh?

4428386/4402764/4552450.title: Urnaí le Rá ag dul Isteach go Teach Pobail

4566066/4563918/4570532.title: Paidreacha
4566066/4563918/4570532.text: Luigh Peadhar ag srut lán tháinig Iosa Criost as a cinn (River Jordan)  Ceard sin ort a Peadhar? O.A. tighearna Diá tá piann in mo fhiacáil agus mo cheann. Éirigh suas a Pheadar agus bheith tú slán ní tusa amháin ach áinne aoinne dhá bhfuil an iorra aige. Ní caith an iorra agus an pian sa ceann amháin.Sin Páidir i gcóir Pián san fhiáclá.Páidir nuáir a bhionn siad ag caigly an tart- Coigilimid an teine seo mar coiglt Criost, thac.Na h-aingle dar ndhuiseact mar ndúisiad ar n-amháid. Teach beannuighthe an teach seo,  teac nach tuigh a theor nar fháigidh marbh a teac seo agus gach a fháigid béo.Coigílimid an téine seo agus mbhun ná cranáighFháis Mhure sa bún agus brighidh sa bárr. Ná cáithre  fice aigléala sordhagh agus gcatháir na grasta agus mbun na thigh seo an oidhce go dtí an láMicéal agus a brat. Brighid agus a sgeal. Dhá bámh dhealach thart ar an anam o anoct go dtí blian o onoct.

4566066/4563940/4570608.title: Paidreacha
4566066/4563940/4570608.text:
Paidirín pairte í ngairdín páiris molar na mná tá riamh gan bocht. Is a aon Fjais [?] dia na grásda go dtugí tú arrais do m'anam boct.A Rí geal na cruinne nach sinne an truaigh mhuaire mar a gcuimhigh muid ár beatha Críost. Níl ántne ná sgala o indu go dtí amaras is nac bebag é an spáce ar an tsaogail seo.Aingeal aoibhinn aingeal dé Cabruig trom ar fead a laé bhe lé m'ais lé siread olú is ná leig don deamail mé cur imú.Airtí gol í creadaimh cruaid go dtidca agam mar thánaig an aingeal lé sonas í glus na mná. Trí ráidthe a caith sé  faoí na bron gur thurling sé mac dé gur thug sé an tuisge an fhear. Is maith an sagart mac Dé is maith an baicte rion se do baiste
(continues on next page)

4566066/4563942/4570609.title: Old Prayers
4566066/4563942/4570609.text: Go mbeanuigh dia gus Muire agus padraig isteach annseo go maidneGo mbeanuigh día 'gus Muire 'gus padraig duitCá codlag tí aréir fé cois an mhic deCá codlag tí anocht? Fé cosa na mboctCé sim in do diaidh romact tá na nAingealCé sim in do diaidh ta manaspalCé sin ar taobh laim deas agath ta bróinDo uisge Domnuid. Cuir i bfuie dom a dia na bfotas, O ac pairis duit a pairis glais má fagainn sé bas anoct nó amárac i bfalaitis. Sé go raib mo leabaid da laim fadú geal dia liom Miceál agus a sgath lion bna trí parac cudac m;anam sí O a tigiarna prionad mo corp agus mo anam ort agus ní iarraid ort a gcoice-Ionad sé sin ort a maigdian beanuighte Glormaire gur cuir mise mo anam ar deis laimh de. Ar deis laimh de go mbé mo anam Amen.

4566066/4563943/4570610.title: Prayers
4566066/4563943/4570610.text: Dóigh -Labhras aspal Naomh Miceál Árd Aingeal, leigheas é seo. Nuair a clostear eling na marb in do da cluas deireann na sean daoine "Go mbá bfad uainn an  anacain.

4566066/4563944/4570611.title: Prayers
4566066/4563944/4570611.text: When old people hear a ringing noise in their ear they think it is a dead bell and they say- 'Go mba  bfad uainn an anacain , beannacht De le h-anam na marbh"When they see a star running they say it is a soul going into heaven and say they say they say-"M'anam mo Dhía is do Mhuire, "  three times.

4566078/4565204/4571801.title: Paidreacha
4566078/4565204/4571801.text:
Bhíodh paidreacha le haghaidh gach ócáide ag na seandaoine. Taréis dúiseacht dóibh deiridís “Mar a thug tú slán ó’n oíche sinn, go tugaidh tú slán ó’n lá muid.” Nuair a bhíodh siad ag cougile na deineadh deiridís. “Coiglim-se an duine seo; mar coigligheas Críost an các, Dríghid ‘na bun. Muire ‘na bárr, comhdaigh a’ tir agus daoine go lá.” Ag dul thar roilig dóibh deiridís “Beannacht Dé le anamacha na marbh.”Roimh dhul a chódladh do na leanbhaí deiridís – ‘Ceithre pósta fé mo leabaidh ceithre aingil ag dul air ina scéal má fháigmuid bás as seo go maidin. Tar i bhflaitheas Dé a bhéas ár n-aigne. Nuair a bhíodh duine a’ baint a chur éadaigh Dé roim dhul a chodladh deir sé-“Mo thighearna Íosa a nochrughadh se na chuid éadaigh d’fhonn tú a sguírsáil ó na
(continues on next page)

4566079/4565327/4572169.title: Paidreacha - Paidir na Leaba
4566079/4565327/4572169.text:
Moladh go deó leat a Mhic DéThugais saor ó'n oidhche méA Mhuire Mháthair iarr ar do mhacGo mbéidh bealach mo leasa gan bach.



I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred Hands, With sorrow deep and true.May every move of my hands to-daybe a million acts of love for You.I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred FeetWith sorrow deep and true.May every step walk to-day Be a million acts of love for You. I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred Head With sorrow deep and true.May every thought of mine to-day
(continues on next page)

4566079/4565327/4572170.title: Paidreacha - Paidir na Leaba
4566079/4565327/4572170.text:
Moladh go deó leat a Mhic DéThugais saor ó'n oidhche méA Mhuire Mháthair iarr ar do mhacGo mbéidh bealach mo leasa gan bach.



I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred Hands, With sorrow deep and true.May every move of my hands to-daybe a million acts of love for You.I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred FeetWith sorrow deep and true.May every step walk to-day Be a million acts of love for You. I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred Head With sorrow deep and true.May every thought of mine to-day
(continues on next page)

4566079/4565328/4572173.title: Paidreacha - Seanphaidir
4566079/4565328/4572173.text:
(continued from previous page)
Be a million acts of love for You.I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred HeartWith sorrow deep and true.May every beat of my heart to-dayBe a million acts of love for you.

4566079/4565328/4572174.title: Paidreacha - Seanphaidir
4566079/4565328/4572174.text:
(continued from previous page)
Be a million acts of love for You.I kiss the wounds of Thy Sacred HeartWith sorrow deep and true.May every beat of my heart to-dayBe a million acts of love for you.

4566069/4564219/4572741.title: Paidreacha
4566069/4564219/4572741.text:
I rith an lae deireann na daoine Ó a Íosa déan trócaire orainn.Nuair a dhuisigheann duine ar maidin deireann sé mho Dia tugann mé chroidhe agus mo anam dhuit.Nuair a bíos siad ag eirghe deireann siad éirighmíd as an leabaidh in onóir do Íosa a fuair bás ar an gCrois in onóir dúinn.Nuair a theigheanns duine isteach sa séipéal deireann sé Ó a Íosa tá fhíos agam go bhfuil tú ins an T-Sacraiméid Naomhta.Mo bhannríoghan Mo mháthar déan trócaire orm.Nuair a bhíos na daoine ag dul in a gcodlad deireann siad Dia na trócaire feac orm le truagh.Nuair a coiglightear
(continues on next page)

4566069/4564221/4572742.title: Old Irish Prayers Said When Going on a Journey
4566069/4564221/4572742.text:
May the sweet name of JesusBe lovingly 'scribed,On my heart inside.O Mother of Jesus,May I be with Him,And Jesus with me.May a binding of love,That nothing can sever,Be between us for everAmen. In the name of the Father for successAnd of the Son who suffered pain,May Mary and her Son be with me on my way,O Mary meet at the shore Let not my soul go by thee,Great is my fear of thy Son,In Communion of Saints may we be,Listening to the voices of the angels.
(continues on next page)

4566069/4564222/4572745.title: Old Irish Prayers Said When Going on a Journey
4566069/4564222/4572745.text:
(continued from previous page)
And praising the Son of God would without end.



Ionntaomíd le Día agus go n-ionntuigh Día linn, cuirimíd sinn féin i bhfiadhneise Día, déanamíd gniomh-bhruadh, creidim i nDía go bhfuil tú annseo láithear, go bhfuil tú ag féachaint, orm, go bhfuil tú ag éisteacht liom, go bhfuil fios agat ar mo smaoimibh, íarrithim agus onóram thú, amhduighimh go bhfuil tú in mo chroiodhthóir, agus m'atair tighearna, agus islíthim féin go h-iomlán faoi do smacht.
(continues on next page)

4566069/4564225/4572748.title: Paidir nuair a Dhúisím ar Maidin
4566069/4564225/4572748.text:
Paidir nuair a dhuisighim ar maidin.Míle buidheachas do Dhia thug slán ón oidhche mé go dtugtaí tú slán ón lae mé,Paidir tar éis ár mbéilibhMile moladh mór agus buidheachas agus altú leat a Rí gheal na grástaAr son son na bheatha sin a thabhairt dúinn go dtugtaí tú an bheatha shíorruidhe d'ár n-anam agus Amen.Paidir tar éis bheith ag caitheamh tobaicSeacht lón reilc pádhruig túmba çhíosta brat brídhge go beannacht dílis dé le h-anam na marbh.Na léachtaí gainimh ar an tráigh na ribe féir ag fás, go beannacht dílis Dé le h-anam na marbh,Paidir ag coiglint an teine.Coigíighim an teine seó



Mile moladh mór agus buidheachas agus altú leat a Rí gheal na GrástaAr son son na bheatha sin a thabhairt dúinn go dtugtaí tú an bheatha shíorruidhe d'ár n-anam agus Amen.



Seacht lón reilc pádhruig túmba Chíosta brat brídhge go beannacht dílis dé le h-anam na marbh.Na léachtaí gainimh ar an tráigh na ribe féir ag fás, go beannacht dílis Dé le h-anam na marbh.



Coiglíghim an teine seó
(continues on next page)

4566069/4564225/4573020.title: Paidir nuair a Dhúisím ar Maidin
4566069/4564225/4573020.text:
Paidir nuair a dhuisighim ar maidin.Míle buidheachas do Dhia thug slán ón oidhche mé go dtugtaí tú slán ón lae mé,Paidir tar éis ár mbéilibhMile moladh mór agus buidheachas agus altú leat a Rí gheal na grástaAr son son na bheatha sin a thabhairt dúinn go dtugtaí tú an bheatha shíorruidhe d'ár n-anam agus Amen.Paidir tar éis bheith ag caitheamh tobaicSeacht lón reilc pádhruig túmba çhíosta brat brídhge go beannacht dílis dé le h-anam na marbh.Na léachtaí gainimh ar an tráigh na ribe féir ag fás, go beannacht dílis Dé le h-anam na marbh,Paidir ag coiglint an teine.Coigíighim an teine seó



Mile moladh mór agus buidheachas agus altú leat a Rí gheal na GrástaAr son son na bheatha sin a thabhairt dúinn go dtugtaí tú an bheatha shíorruidhe d'ár n-anam agus Amen.



Seacht lón reilc pádhruig túmba Chíosta brat brídhge go beannacht dílis dé le h-anam na marbh.Na léachtaí gainimh ar an tráigh na ribe féir ag fás, go beannacht dílis Dé le h-anam na marbh.



Coiglíghim an teine seó
(continues on next page)

4566069/4564225/4573021.text:

(continues on next page)

4566069/4564225/4573022.text:
Paidir nuair a dhuisighim ar maidin.Míle buidheachas do Dhia thug slán ón oidhche mé go dtugtaí tú slán ón lae mé,Paidir tar éis ár mbéilibhMile moladh mór agus buidheachas agus altú leat a Rí gheal na grástaAr son son na bheatha sin a thabhairt dúinn go dtugtaí tú an bheatha shíorruidhe d'ár n-anam agus Amen.Paidir tar éis bheith ag caitheamh tobaicSeacht lón reilc pádhruig túmba çhíosta brat brídhge go beannacht dílis dé le h-anam na marbh.Na léachtaí gainimh ar an tráigh na ribe féir ag fás, go beannacht dílis Dé le h-anam na marbh,Paidir ag coiglint an teine.Coigíighim an teine seó

4566069/4564226/4573023.title: Paidir ag Coigilt na Tine
4566069/4564226/4573023.text:
(continued from previous page)
cách bríghid ar a bhunn agus Máiréad ar a bharr, ceithre n-aingeal agus Rí Na Grás agus fanaidh an teine seó go dtí lá amháin.



Paidir roimh dul a choladhCeirthe coirnéail ar mo leabaidh ceirthe n'aingealaibh orraibh sgarntha má fhághaim-sé bás shul mátigh (?) maidin i bhflaithis De go raibh m-anam.

4562129/4562098/4573029.title: Paidir
4562129/4562098/4573029.text: Seacht lán roilc Pádraic, túmba Chríosta, brat Bríghide de bheannachtaíÍosa Críosta le h-anam na marbh i bPurgadóir, go speisialta le h-anam ár mhuintir fhéin.Beannacht na Naomh, beannacht na n-easpol agus beannacht na Maighdine Gile Glórmhar agus Naomh Seosamh le na n-anam.

4562129/4562100/4573032.title: Paidir Eile
4562129/4562100/4573032.text: Nuair a bhíodh daoine ag ól le céile i dteach ósta fadó deireadh siad an paidir seo leanas;“Ólamuid deoch mar d’ólfadh Pádhraic, lán de ghrásta agus cainnt le fonn. Gan troid, gan braon, gan uaghdar náire ná fios amáireach go raibh muid ann. Cuireamuid ár n-iompaí ar Mhuire Mháthair. Sí ár gcúl báire i ngach am. Seo sláinte a bhfuil sa láthair agus staid na ngrásta go raibh muid ann.

4569049/4566714/4573249.title: Local Prayers
4569049/4566714/4573249.text:
God bless Good Friday. Friday day the day that Our Saviour was nailed to the Cross. Bush of four thorns nailed to his head and hands and His Blessed Mother standing by.With a heavy heart and a dismal cry.Anyone who says this prayer three times by night and three times by day shall never  enter to the gates of hell.As Peter sat upon a marble stone Our Blessed Lord came to him alone.What oils you Peter or what makes you so pale.O Lord and Saviour I have a toothache.This prayer is said in the morning or if you awaken at night.Sprinkle me O Lord Jesus with this and clense me with this that I may be made whiter than snow.
(continues on next page)

4566083/4565610/4573267.title: Seanphaidreacha
4566083/4565610/4573267.text: Tá go leor sean-phaidreacha ag na daoine thart annseo. Nuair a dhéanas duine sreabhfair ba cheart di dhuine a rádh. "Dia agus Muire agus do shláinte leat"Nuair a casta socraid ar dhuine ba cheart don dhuine a rádh "Beannacht Dé le n-a anam agus trí coiscéime do shiubhal indiaidh na comhrá. Tá sean-phaidir ag cuid de na daoinibh le rádh nuair a bhíos duine tinn agus muna rachadh duine amugha ins an bpaidir d'éireóchadh an duine tinn as agus dá dtéigheadh sé amugha ins an bpaidir do caillfidhe an duine. Tá sean-phaidir ag na daoine le rádh nuair a bhíos siad ag coigilt na teine. "Coigileann mise an teine seo mar choigil Críost cáidh, Muire in-a bun agus Brighid i n-a barr go gcoiglfidh mise an teine seo go teacht an lae"Nuair a bhíos  duine ag dul ar thuras deireann muinntir an tighe leis go dtugaidh Dia slán abhaile thú".

4566083/4565611/4573271.title: Seanphaidreacha
4566083/4565611/4573271.text: Seo paidir a dheireas na daoine tar éis a bheith ag catheamh tobaic - "Seacht lán roilic Padraig, Túmba Críosta agus brat brighde de bheannachtaibh dílis Dé le hanamnaibh na marbh". Tá loghadh mór le gnóthaint ag aon duine a dheireas í. Seo paidir eile a dheireas chuid de na daoinibh ag coigilt na teine- Coigleann muid an teine seo mar choigleas Críost Muire 'na bun, Brighid 'na bárrDhá aingeal is fiche ag cumhdach an tighe seo mo theach is mo theine go lá".Seo paidir eile:-luigeann muid le Dia, go luighidh Dia linÁr gcroidhe le Dia croidhe Dé lin.Seo ceann eile:-Ceithre posta ar mo leabaidhceithre haingle ortha sgarthaMá fhagaim-se bás as seo go maidini bhFlaitheas Dé go raibh m'anam'A Íosa, déan tróchaire orm.

4566083/4565612/4573290.title: Seanphaidreacha
4566083/4565612/4573290.text:
Bhíodh paidreacha ag na sean-daoine nuair a bhíodh siad ag dul i n-áiteachaibh."Bheannuigh mé dhuit a lucht na sgaball ná déan fáillighe  ar bith i n-a gcás.Nach mairg a bhíos gan caraid 'na luighe ar leabaidh an bháis.A dhuine bhoicht gan céill ná h-éagcaoin gan do thinneasGlac comaoineach ó Mhac Dé, béidh tú feasta indo leanbh (?)D'éirigh Muire suas trí h-uaire roimh an lá. Tharraing sí sin aice sgaball na mbrainnrí óir tháinig sin aice neach beannuighthe ón RóimhCrois Bhrighde mo crois, crois na gceithre gcroisDuine ar bith deireas mo phaidrín-sa trí huaire chuile láTiocfaidh Muire Máthair ar chuairt aige trí h-uaire roimh a bhás.An peacach bochGo bhfóiridh Dia ar an bpeacach bocht atá go síoraidhe ag straidNuair a éirigheas sé ar maidin ní ar a ghlúinaibh a théigheas sé.Ní theigheann sé coidhche chuig  an Aifreann ná ag éisteacht briathra Dé
(continues on next page)

4566083/4565614/4573293.title: Seanphaidreacha
4566083/4565614/4573293.text: Bheannuigh mé isteach ins an leabaidh seo i n-ainm Mhic Dé, diúltaidhe na n-olc.Bheirim mé féin suas do'n triúr is fearr an t-Athair, An Mac, agus an Spiorad Naomh.Tá ceithre haingle dom fhaire.Má fhaghaim-se bás as seo go maidini bhFlaitheas Dé go raibh m'anam.Ó, a Íos, déan trócaire orm.Gheobhaidh mé bás - níl a fhios agam cé'n am, cé'n áit, cé'n uair ná cé'n chaoi.Má fhaghaim-se bás i bpeacadh marbhthach tá mé caillte go deo. A Íosa déan trócaire orm.Teachtaire ó Dhia againnCuairt a aingil ós ár gcionnDia bheannuighthe ar ár gcolainnDia romhainn agus Dia linnI ngáirdín Parrthas bhí an paidrín páirteach ag moladh na mná a bhí riamh gan locht is  a h-aon mhic. A mhuire is a Rí na nGrásta is go dtugaidh Dia cáirde do'n anam bocht. Croiste agus cáirde agus grásta ó dhia againn tabhair gach lá is é tá muid ag iarraidh sacraiméid na h-Aithridhe is go neartuighidh Dia sinn is guidhimíd ár n-anamna ort a Mhuire Bhan Tighearna

4566083/4565615/4573295.title: Seanphaidreacha
4566083/4565615/4573295.text:
Nuair a thagas duine isteach i dteach deireann sé "Go mbeannuighe Dia agus Muire agus Naoimh na h-Éireann isteach san teach seo".Nuair a fheiceas na daoine an féar bainte deireann siad "Go mbéaraidh Dia beo sinn ar an am seo arís".Nuai a cailltear duine deirtear gur ceart "go ndéanaidh Dia tróchaire ar a anam" a rádh.Nuair a bhíos duine ag imtheact ó theach duine eile deireann muinntir an tighe leis "go dtugaidh Dia slán abhaile thú".Nuair a bheadh duine ag obair agus duine eile ag dul an bealach deirfeadh sé leis "go mbeanuighidh Dia thú is do chuid oibre"Nuair a bheadh duine ag dul thar dhuine nach mbeadh ag labhairt leis  bheadh sé ag rádh "Coirreagan Dé idir mé féin agus mo namhaid" Nuair a thuiteann duine ar an dtalamh déanann siad comhartha na Croise ar an áit agus ní éireóchaidh aon dochar do'n duine.Nuair a bhíodh na sean-daoine ag dul ar an aonach fadó bhíodh siad ag rádh "Go gcumhduigh Dia sinn agus go gcuiridh Sé luach ár gcuid cneastachta chugainn"Nuair a bhíodh siad ag cur na bhfataí bhíodh siad ag rádh "Go ráthaidh Dia ár gcuid dúinn".
(continues on next page)

4569051/4566960/4574006.title: Seanphaidir
4569051/4566960/4574006.text: A maidin glóreamhail, móreamhail, aisgeamhail, is tú mo stór, mo lón agus mo taiscirt. Is tú an réal solus rómhain gach rodh, agus ar chnuich na neor go mba tú mo caraidh.

4566073/4564629/4574391.title: A Collection of Prayers
4566073/4564629/4574391.text:
Jesus the branch and Mary the flowerJesus and Mary be with me in my dying hour.All for thee O my Lord,O my Jeus all for thee. O my good and sweet and gentle jesus,All for thee.Prayer when going to bed.As I lay down on my right hand side,O pray to God to be my guide,If anything happens me,O Blessed Lady waken me,Four corners upon my bed,Four angels upon them spread,
(continues on next page)

4569065/4568253/4575151.title: An Phaidrín
4569065/4568253/4575151.text:
An Phaidirín i)	Comhartha na Croise. In ainm an Athair agus a Mhic agus a Spioraid Naomh Amén. ii)	An confitéor anseo: Creidmuid a Dhia go bhfuil tú anseo i lathair, go bhfuil tú ag féachaint orainn go bhfuil tú ag éisteacht linn, go bhfuil fhíos agat ar an uile smuintú adhraimud agus onóraimud thú admhuighmuid gur tú ar gcruthuightheóir ‘s ar n-árdthighearma agus i slighimid sinn féin go h-iomlán faoi do smacht. iii)	Cuirimid sinn fein i bhfiadnaise dé bheirimid moladh mór agus buidheachas duit faoi gach tiodlacadh agus grásta dá dtug tú dhuinn ó oidhche ar mbeirthe go dtí seo cláthair agus go speisíalta ar dtabhairt slán ó chodladh na hoiche aréir. Ofráilimid duit a thighearna ag gcorp ar n-ainm. Ar gcoidhte ar n-intinn agus ar n-uile smaointú a n-oileann do ghlór is d’onórachaí féin agus tá siul again le congna an Aoin Mhic Iosa Críosta gan aon nidh a déanamh ar an saoghal seo a chuireas fearg ort arís go bráth.iv)	Ó áthigearna mar nach b’fuil fhios again dul ag codladh dunn a n-eireodh muist aríst go bráth. Tabhair dhúinn ó ghrásta a sinn féin do mhion-scrudu.
(continues on next page)

4569065/4568256/4575155.title: Paidreacha eile
4569065/4568256/4575155.text: 1)  Ag Coigilt na Teine dhuit abair:-Coiglim an tein seo mar choigligheas Críost an PháisBrighid 'na bun is Muire 'na bárrNa Seacht n-Aingle is aoirde i bhFlatheas na ngrásCúmhdach ar mbeithidigh is daoine slán.2)  Ag Muchadh an t-Soluis dhuit - lampa nó coinneall etc.Abair:-Ná muchtar Solas na Flaithis iónann go deó"3)  Nuair a bhíos bean ag déanamh aráin deireann sí:-Rath Dé agus ball PhadraigAr a nglacann's mé is ar a bhfeiceanns méAn rath a chuir Dia ar na Cúig AráinAgus ar an dá éiscGo gcuiridh Sé ar an mbeatha seo é.4)Ceithre Choirneál  ar mo leabaidhCeithre aingle beannuighthe orra scarthaMá fhághaim bás sul má dtí maidinI bFlaithis Dé go raibh mo leaba.

4569069/4568750/4583594.title: Seanphaidreacha Gaelacha
4569069/4568750/4583594.text:
Bhí go leór paidreacha ag na daoine 'san tsean-aimsir lé h-aghaidh dul a chodladh nó éirighe, agu lasadh an lampa, ag coigilt na teine, ag dul isteach 'san tséipéal, lé h-aghaidh gach galra a bheadh ar dhuine agus paidreacha h-aghaidh gach lá sa mbliadhain. Seo ceann a deiridís í Mí na Bealtaine.A Mhaighean ghlórmhar, mhórdhach, maiseach, is tú mo stor, mo lón, is mo thaisge, is tú an réalteólais romham's gach bealach, go gleann na ndeór ná leig m'anam.Seo ceann a deiridís ag dul a chodladh dhaobhtha.A' h-aon Mhac Mhuire agus a Rí na nGrást, tá mé ag cur impidhe ort gan fán a leigint ar m'anam bocht.Nuair a bhíodh bean an tighe ag lasadh an
(continues on next page)

4569046/4566575/4583611.title: Local Prayers
4569046/4566575/4583611.text: Local prayers.O'. then to Jesus you my mother turn,By the most tender names comfort those souls,The poor holy souls that burn in unquenchable flames.As I lie down in my right hand side,I pray to God to be my guide.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angel over spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,I hope they bless the bed that I lay on.O'. good angel do me defendand bring me to a happy end.

4583281/4576243/4583884.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583281/4576243/4583884.text:
91A collection of prayers.The old people had many beautiful prayers that were never written in books.  My grandmother once told me that she said a short prayer every morning when she awoke.  This was the prayer - "Oh Lord, lead me the right road this day."When she was getting up out of bed she said another one which was, "Jesus Christ, help me to rise glorious from the dead on the last day."When the people were starting work long ago they all said - "Oh my God, I offer to thee all my work.Another small prayer was said at the beginning of a journey.  It was like this - "Oh God bring me safely to my journey's end."When the old people lit the first fire in the morning they said "Oh Mary, Queen of the Missions, help to kindle the fire of faith in pagan lands."The last thing they said at night was - '"thanks be to God for all his gifts this day."In this district there was an old woman who could say a great long prayer in Irish.  She called it  "Mathair Padhraig Naomtha" and no one knew it but herself.  When
(continues on next page)

4569067/4568563/4584651.title: Paidreacha
4569067/4568563/4584651.text:
Pat Mannion, Kilcreevanty, gave me the following old prayers. The people in olden t imes used to say this aspiration when  making the fire. They need to leave the tongs in the fire grate across and them say:"May God and the Saints fire serve this place until I arise next day le Cúnamh Dé"When they used to awake next day, they used to pray:"Seo lá eile le Cúnamh Dé,Agus go Feicidh mé míle mórmar é".When they used to quench the lamp at night they used to say:"Nár Múchaidh Dia solus na bhFlaithis orainn"
(continues on next page)

4569063/4568197/4584690.title: A Prayer to Be Said when the Clock Strikes the Hours
4569063/4568197/4584690.text: O most sweet Jesus I commend to thy divine Heart all that I have done in the hour that is gone to be cleansed and purified and offered to God the father for the eternal praise and what so - ever I shall do in the hour that is beginning I resolve for the glory of God and the salvation of a mankind in union with thy passion Amen.

4569063/4568199/4584694.title: Prayers
4569063/4568199/4584694.text: (1) \infant Jesus meek and milk look on me thy little child.Pity mine and pity me suffer me to come to Thee.(2) Heart of Mary I adore thee,Heart of Jesus I implore thee,Heart of Joseph pure and just,In those three hearts I put my trust,O' merciful Jesus have pity on me,My soul my body resigned to thee,Five bleeding wounds nailed to a tree.O' merciful Jesus have pity on meO' body of Christ be my salvationO body of Christ be my sanctificationBlood of Christ fill my veinsWater of Christ wash out my stainsPassion of Christ may comfort meO Good Jesus listen to me

4583271/4575375/4585976.title: Paidir
4583271/4575375/4585976.text:
As eirigh Críosta as eirigh feárr da gcola úd ríamh ó léighte na leabhar as leagtha mo chreann. Críosta athar na socar tar éis a crocal le crann, Dia h-Aoine creidim comineah h-Aoine creidimh na gill go dtáinig mac na h-óige béann ó a Muire bhí romhan ar a bport. Ná leig manam thart is na leig manam teine na béann. Suíd a tháinig na deamhan ar na ribthe níneuchaí agus le bárr pinte ar na firithibh. go dtáinig  anduine dall agus crall osgail a dallad agus lé gcrús mic dia ar talamh druim na talmhan  marbú na fhiadnuise é. Breálín geal agus ná cuir fo- h-Aoine agus le gol go clárr. So uirín (?) na gréine gofú comineac as eirigh  treocaire.



The Name of my village is Ballyroe and it is in the parish of Kilconly. There are twenty one houses in my village now but long ago there were twenty three houses in it. All the houses were thatched except two long ago, and are all thatched now too except four. The most common place names a leguane. It was
(continues on next page)

4583285/4576544/4586525.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583285/4576544/4586525.text:
Some of the prayers which I learned at home and not at school are as follows,1. There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless me on the bed that I lay on.2. If a person were going on a journey, the people of the house would say, "God speed you and send you safe over your journey".3. When getting up in the morning we say "Thanks be to God who brought you safe over the night".4. When lighting a
(continues on next page)

4583307/4578251/4586766.title: An Old Prayer to Our Lady
4583307/4578251/4586766.text: Oh Mary of Graces,And Mother of God,May I walk in the paths,That the righteous have trod!And mayest thou save me,From evil's control,and mayest thou save me,In body and soul.And mayest thou save me,By land and by sea,And mayest thou save me,From tortures to be.May the guard of the angels,Above me abide;May God be before me,And God at my side!Moira Burke,Convent School,VI Std.My uncle Paddy Burke, Beagh, learned this prayer from an old school teacher when he was a little boy at school over forty years ago.
4583307/4578251/4586766.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Gort Inse Guaire

4583302/4577791/4586827.title: Seanphaidir don Mhaighdean Mhuire
4583302/4577791/4586827.text: A Mhaighdin Glórmhar mhórmhar mhaiseach!Is tú mo réult eolais romham ins gach bealach,  agus i ngleann na ndeór, agus thú ár gcaraidhÓ m dúinn treoir tá an toír ar an bpeacach.Caith braon de do ghrásta orainn le grádh do Athair.Nighe ár lámh dúinn, níor smal gach peacaidh agus ar uair ár mbáis go raibh  muid ag rádh an paidir.Ó a Mhic, a sgaranns an lá leis an oidhche a d'fhulaing an Pháis ar an gcrann Dia hAoine!Ní cloiseann muid glaoidh choilleach ar uair a mheadhon-oidhche le tromsán codalta ag peacaidh an t-saoghal seo.Béidh an fhairrge do thala 'na cnoic ag geimnigh, na clocha glasa cuir drucht alluis 'gus fola da n-eadan le faitchíos stoirm an lae udan.Tiocfaidh sí féin agus a cuid aingle  i n-einfheacht lei ag treorughadh ár n-anam go feithe na glóire agus saoraim ( iarr) ?  ar Muire gur fíor an Glór sin.Ámén

4583302/4577792/4586828.title: Paidir Eile
4583302/4577792/4586828.text:
1/ I ngairdin Phaíris tá na Phaidrín Pairteach ag moladh na MátharBhí raimh gan lochtAom Mhic Íosa agus a Rí na nGrásta go dtugaidh Tú grásta d'ár n-anam bocht!Trosgadh agus cairde agus Grásta Ó Dhia againn!Do chabhair gach lá againn agus táimíd dá h-iarraidhSacraimeid na h-aithrighe go near tuighidh Dia linn agus cuimrigh ár n-anam ar Mhuire Bhan TighearnaÁmén.II/ An Cúigheadh lá Fichead de Márt tháinig aingeal as an Flaithis le teactaireacht ag Muire Mháthair mar bhí sí gan fheacadh le sgeala ó Togh na nGrás, agus ó Árd Righ na bhFlaiutheas go mbéidh sí 'ma Mháthair ag Iosa dá mur nídh é ba mhaith leithi.D'umhlaigh sí síos ar a dá ghluim bhreág gheala agus dubairt sí go mbeadh sí sásta le nidh ar bith ó'n AthairNí túisge thuirling Mac Dé fhaoi 'na
(continues on next page)

4583302/4577818/4586864.title: Old Prayers
4583302/4577818/4586864.text:
Old PrayersNight:I lay me down my night hand side I pray to god my soul to guide and  if i die before i wake i pray to good my soul to takeMorning:Oh! My God my only good! the other of my being and my last End! Clothe my soul with a nuptial robe of charity And grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before thy judgment seat in heavenChildren's prayers when lying down in bed for the night:- There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels on their spread,Matthew,Mark Luke,John God bless me! and this bed that i lie on.As I was going up holy Erin, I met the blessed Virgin- Seven Gospels in her handseven bells ringing Sevens Priests singing shut the gates of hell and open the gates of heaven and let the poor souls in for ever and for ever Amen!
(continues on next page)

4566060/4563575/4586869.title: Paidreacha
4566060/4563575/4586869.text:
1)  A Dhia na nGrástaÓra Easbol  agus Athair na nGrásta nach mór na dúairí dubha iad seo ag teacht o'n mbás againn. An ghrían ag dul síar agus an feár gan t-sabháil agus mé ag cuimhne m'anam ort, a Rí na nGrásta.Tiocfaidh Micheál Árd Aingeal i meadhon na n-anma agus cuirfidh sé isteach ins an sgála. Seasaidh an t-anam bocht suas ins an scála. Beidh sé ag cur alluis agus fola sios o'n scála le faitchíos droch-freagra a thigheacht o'n tÁrd Rí.Teighigidh an Aifreann go fearamhail Dia Domhnaigh. Ná suidhigidh agus ná seasigidh ag cúl-cainnt ar do chomharsain agus tagaidh abhaile ar an nós céadna. Tá na Flathais thríd dhá lasad le breagha cheóil, spoirt agus taithneamh. Tá sé sgríobhtha i
(continues on next page)
4566060/4563575/4586869.school_info: School: Scoil Bhríge Naofa i gCor an Dola (An Cheathrú Bheag)

4583314/4578844/4587347.title: A Prayer
4583314/4578844/4587347.text: (When going to bed)There are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels overhead.  St. Matthew, St. Mark, St. James, St John.  God bless me in this bed I lie on.(When in bed)I have a little prayer I told it to Mary, Mary told it to Jesus, Jesus told it to God, God said it was good, Jesus be the Branch, Mary be the Flower, God bless me in this bed and my last dying hour.

4583314/4578845/4587348.title: A Prayer
4583314/4578845/4587348.text: (In the morning)Jesus Mary and Joseph have mercy and compassion on me and bring me safe over this blessed day. Amen(At night)St Matthew, St. Mark, St Luke and St John bless this bed that I lie on and bring me safe over this blessed night. Amen

4583314/4578846/4587352.title: Prayers
4583314/4578846/4587352.text: O sweetest Jesus, Thou art my protection and my strength in time of strife.  Thou are my joy in time of prosperity.  O Vouchsafe relief to me in this difficulty. AmenO Jesus, Only Son of the Father, O Lamb, who didst shed Thy hearts blood to redeem us.  Shelter me, guard me, keep me for every, whether lying or sitting, or standing, or sleeping.  Amen

4583314/4578847/4587356.title: A Prayer
4583314/4578847/4587356.text: Twas on good and on Good Friday too in the afternoon when they came with a spear in their hands struck our Saviour across the heart.  His blessed blood began to flow, his blessed mother being standing by with a hard heart and dismal sigh and those who say this prayer three times by day, three times by night neither sin nor danger, nor the flames of hell will they ever have, shall they ever enter into.

4583329/4580185/4587584.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583329/4580185/4587584.text:
A Collection of Prayers12 - 12 - '38These are some prayers that my mother taught me."As I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on,There are four corners on my bed,Four angels there are spread,If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.This prayer is to be said when going to bed at night."Infant Jesus meek and mild,Look on me a little child,Pity mine and pity me,And suffer me to come to thee".This prayer is to be said
(continues on next page)

A réalt na maidhne a's a árd-ghrianSabhail sinn ar leich na bpíanMoltar faoí do chimirce gan mhaoidheamhAn tathair , an Mac 's an Spiorad Naomh



Urnaighe an Sgabail'Gluin sibh mise lucht na sgabalNá deanaighíd faillighe in bhu gcásnach truagh sin fear gan caraid'S é 'na luighe ar leabaidh 'n bháis.A dhuine bhoicht gan chéill, ná dean breág le Muire, Ná h-ith feoil Cheadaoine a's ná héigean do thinneasUmhlaigh dó'n chléir a's do na cúig féilte Muire,Glac cumaoineach Mhic Dé a's béidh tú ar féasta ag na haingleBhí Muire agus a Mac a' siubhal amuigh sa lá,Casadh ortha pearsa beannuighthe mar Siámon as an Róimh,Thairg sí dó as a deis láimh sgabal breágh na mbrainsí óir.Níl duine iomcrochas m-aibíd bheannuighthe mar is coír,nach mbéidh séala agam  ar a anam ins an glóirA Chruthuightheóir na  bhflaithis agus athair na glóire,Is leat a gnidhim mo eashaoid maidin a's trathnóna,'Mo chur ar mo leas agus me chasadh ar an  eolas
(continues on next page)

4583317/4579102/4588090.title: Prayers
4583317/4579102/4588090.text:
Prayers that I learned at home th December.This prayer should be said every night and morning.On Good Friday our Saviour was crucifiedWith a crown of thorns placed on His headThe Jews came round Him with a sharp spear.And pierced our Saviour through the heart and through the hand.His precious blood began to flow His Blessed Mother bein standing byWith a heavy heart and dismal sighAnyone that says this prayer three times by day and three times by night shall never suffer the pains of Purgatory and shall never enter the gates of hell nor never nay amenWhen we lighing the lamp or cande we usually say "The light of heaven to all the poor souls"  When you would see the moon you would say
(continues on next page)

4583326/4580000/4588257.title: Prayers
4583326/4580000/4588257.text:
The prayer when the clock strikes is;-Jesus this hour I give to thee,For all the pasts pardon me,Knowing that I must soon depart.Then hide me in thy Sacred Heart. The prayer when going to sleep is:-As I lie on this bed to sleep,I give my soul to Christ to keep,If I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take. This prayer was supposed to have been made by an old Connemara woman :-My loving Lord! A thousand welcomes! Oh, son of Mary, I love you indeed I do. Who am I at all that you should come next or near me? Oh! God of heaven, make a little corner for me in your heart, and never while there is life in me let me lose my place there, and after death let me hide there. Amen.Have pity on me Oh Blessed Mother! Talk to my God for me! Tell him I'm a poor ignorant creature, full of sin and misery, but that I love you, His dear mother; that I am a poor servant and for your sweet make to help and pity me. Amen. The following prayer is said as the door is closed every night:-We close this door! We hide from sightLord of life and love and light
(continues on next page)

4583326/4580002/4588260.title: Saint Ríchill
4583326/4580002/4588260.text:
Saint Rícill is the Patron Saint of this parish. She is supposed to be the sister in religion of St Patrick. It is said that she founded a monastery in Kilrickle. That is the reason why it is called Cill Rícill. It is also said that she is buried in Kilrickle



It was on good Friday our Lord was crucifiedHis precious blood began to flow his mother standing by with a dull heart and a dismal cry.Who ever say this prayer three times a day and three times a night shall never enter into the gates of hell.

4583327/4580089/4591358.title: (no title)
4583327/4580089/4591358.text:
(continued from previous page)
And pull down the green flag representing our shoreWe poured boiling water on those orange men downTo remember the day they saw sweet Ballygowan

4583327/4580094/4591371.title: Local Prayers
4583327/4580094/4591371.text: It was on Good Friday the afternoon,The Jews came in with spears so sharp,To pierce Our Blessed Saviours tender heart,The blood gushed out from heart to hand,By Him our Blessed Mother Mary did stand,She said those who repeat this prayer,Three times by day, three times by night,Shall never died in mortal sin,The gates of hell shall never be opened,To let them in.

4583327/4580095/4591373.title: Local Prayers
4583327/4580095/4591373.text: O angel of God to whose holy care I am committed by thy supreme clemency iluminate, defend and govern me this day and for ever more.Amen

4583327/4580095/4591374.title: Local Prayers
4583327/4580095/4591374.text: O angel of God to whose holy care I am committed by thy supreme clemency iluminate, defend and govern me this day and for ever more.Amen

4583327/4580096/4591377.title: (no title)
4583327/4580096/4591377.text:
When people are driving the cows they say "Sho" or "How". When calling the calves they say suck suck. The cows are tied with a chain to the manger. The chain is put round the cows neck and is then fastened to the manger. When people are calling hens they say chuck, chuck, when calling geese they say badthy, badthy, badthy. When the are calling the cat they say puish-urish and for the dog they whistle or call him by his name.



God bless Good Friday, Friday is the day. The day He carried His crown. With sharp thorns on his head which apears through his hands through his heart through his Blessed Mother looking on. With a heavy heart and a dismal cry anyone who says this prayer
(continues on next page)

4583311/4578581/4591647.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583311/4578581/4591647.text: This prayer is said going into Church :- Out-side the Church I lave my sins, and into the Church I enther in.This one is said going to bed at night: -There are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels on them spread.  Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.  God bless that bed that I lie on.Those two are said at prayers: - Lord be the branch and Lady.  Great God may be with me at my dying hour.I have a little prayer and I told it to Mary.  Mary told it to God.  God said it was good.  Jesus be the branch and Mary be the flower.  jesus, Mary, and Joseph assist me now in my dying hour.There is no special time for saying this prayer, but it is usually said when going to bed and getting up in the morning: -O! holy cross our noblest.  In those woods there's none like thee.  No tree, no flower, no shady bower, can produce so sweet a flower as thee.To be said getting up: -I rise from this bed for the love of Thee.  who dids't die on the cross for the love of me

4583311/4578594/4591660.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583311/4578594/4591660.text: Long ago the old people used to have a lot of prayers.The old people say this one when entering a chapel."Outside the church I leave my sin and into the church I inter in""God bless us all both great and small and convert those that hate us, and give us "mate" that we could ate, along with those small "pyates", was the prayer said before eating the dinner during the famine.When rising from bed people say :- " Now I rise from this bed of sleep to adore and labour for the salvation of my soul.   May I arise on the Last Day glorious and immortal."I adore thee Holy Cross which has been adorned by the tender and delicate hands of our Lord Jesus Christ and abuse his precious blood.I adore thee Holy Cross for the love of my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ

4583311/4578616/4592413.title: A Collection of Prayers
4583311/4578616/4592413.text:
Long ago the old people used to have a lot of prayers. Some  when entering into church or to school.This one used to be said when starting to school.It is my duty to go to school.There I must learn to read and write,There I must learn more about God and my religion.I must try to learn these and other things when I am young.This is one said when going to bed,I lay my body down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep.And if I die before I wake I prayto God my soul to take.This prayer is still said by old people,when raking the fire.Coiglighim an teine seo mar coiglighis Críost Chách.Brighidh in a bun agus Máire in a lár.An dha aspal déag tá i gchatair na nGrás.Chumdhac an tighe seo is ar ndaoine go brádhach.This is said when going to bed.O my God I know I must dieI do not know when, or where, nor how.But if I die in mortal sin Ill be lost for
(continues on next page)

4591080/4588580/4593164.title: Paidir san Oíche
4591080/4588580/4593164.text: Tabhair cuairt a Dhia ar an teach seo agus díbir uaidh cailg a 'deabail. Go gcomhnuighidh na h-aingle beannuighteh ár gcúmhdach tré Íosa Críost ár dTighearna . AmenArticle an Chreidimh Chruaidh a thagann chúghain ar uair ár mbáis mar tháinig aingeal an t-séain le sonas i gcluais na mná. Chaith sí trí ráithe mór fada gá iomchur agus greim níor bhlais a béal acht ag sileadh trom deór go rugadh e Mac Dé. Thug sé an t-uisge tríd a mhéar. Bhaist sé Eóin Baiste agus baist Eóin Baiste é. Scaoil na sriantachaibh i dráth na ban leath cumach é Mac Nuadhach, trí rí le dul i ngrán. Gach páirt a marbhughadh i gcré níl aon duine i n-a chruinn Article an Chreidimh Cruaidh agus é a radh uair sa ló d'feicfidh an Maighdean Glórmhar trí uaire roimh an bás.

4591080/4588621/4593269.title: Prayers
4591080/4588621/4593269.text: These  are a few of the prayers the old people long ago had.'Sa gáirdín PharásTá an páidrín páirteachAg moladh na mná bhí ariamh gan lochtÍosa, Muire agus Athair na GrástaNá leig fán ar m'anam bocht.Nach maith an sagart É Mac DéNach maith an baisteadh rinne SéNuair a bháist Sé Seán beannuighthe Is báist Seán beannuighthe ÉNuair a shil Cathughadh chun láithreachCrochughadh agus céasadh É.Níl aon duine déarfas an paidir cruaidh seo Naoi n-uaire naoi n-oidhche LuainNach sabháilfidh naoi n-anma agus a anam bocht féin.This is another prayer:Abróchaimís na seacht páidreacha seo:Seacht gcéad, Lán deug, Roilig Phádraig tuama Críost. Ráth Brighid Oileáin na Naoimh. Tempoill na Róimh beannuighthe le na h-anam a ndeaca uainn ariamh ar treo na marbh. Go gartha beannacht le na h-anamnachaibh agus le na n-anam bocht féin an lá deirneach. Old people say this prayer after smoking tobacco

4591086/4589304/4593505.title: Paidreacha
4591086/4589304/4593505.text:
Long ago the people had prayers. If they heard anything wonderful they would bless themselves and say go dtarruighidh dia sinn. If a man was going to a fair they used to say go gcuridh dia an tad ort. If the people heard of any accident they would say dia idir sinn agus an anachan because they would be afraid that themselves would meet with any accident. They also have prayers to say when they would be raking the fire. If the old people saw a star falling they would say M'anam do dia is Muire three times and they said a person would be sure to go to heaven when they said that prayer. If a person sneezed they would say God bless us. The people do not believe in those prayers not and very seldom they say them.



Rudai fe leith a mbíann meas arra.The people used to have crosses in the house long ago. They used to have crosses made of straw with an image of some on the cross and they kept them in a safe place until
(continues on next page)

4591086/4589312/4593538.title: Paidreacha
4591086/4589312/4593538.text:
98PaidreachaThe people long ago used to have a lot of prayers.  The people did not learn these prayers out of a book.  Long ago when the people used to see a star falling they used to say mainm do dhia agus do Mhuire three times.  When they used to see the new moon at first they used to bless themselves.  When they used to be reaching the fire they used to say Coiglimid an teine seo mar coigleas Criosta cach.  Muire ar bharr and tighe and Brighid i na lar and da aingeal deag ata i gcathair an ngras.  Ag cumhdach and tighe seo agus na daoine slan.  When the people used to be in danger they used to say Dia idir sinn agus an anachain.  When a person used to escape a danger they used to say go dtarruighidh [?] Dia sinn.  When they would see a person working they would say God bless the
(continues on next page)

sibar na deora.Líon mo chroide le grádh damh athair,Nigh mo láimh ó small an peacaidhA aon Mic Muire. na sgar uaim anoisNa ar uair mo bháis Amen.A Mhaighdean Glormar.Ó fir máise, is tú mo stor, moleoman, mo thaiscidhe.Is tú atrach dilis ag dul romhamIns na casain.

Dul a luighe ar mo leabaidh damhDul i mbáis codhalta damhTá ceithre chornáil ar mo leabaidhIs ceithre aingle ortha sgabthaA Dhia bí amuigh a Dhia bí istighDia is Críost bí fán teachIs mo thig dadaidh orm in mo chdhladhMaighdean Muire musgail mé.----------------------------------------------Paidir.Failte romhat a Mhuire Mhóir. A mháthair Iosa. Realt na Maidne, Tú sgith na measg. Is Tú anam corra. Thóg a bhlát a tuit le hádh na mór agus grásta duitgur thog tú an t-uan, a shaothruigh sinn anois agus an uair a leag muid ann. Tabhair dúinn siadhchan dé is sgaoil na glais a cheangluighis mé. Tabhair greim don bhocht, is don dall a shúl a (Mhaighdean) Mháthair Múirneach Rí na Iudach? Cathar na suailc, realt gan [reach]?

Toil Dé go ndéanamuidDlíghe De go leanamuidAr ár eanntal féin go smactamuidSraoin le nar dteanga go gcuirimidAr tígeact Dé go meirimidGac contabhairt  peacaid go nacamuidAn pháis Chríost go smaoinimidArraidh tráthamhail go ndeanamuidI Moladh agus i n-ónóir DeGo ndeanamuid anoirAgus ar feadh an Tighearnacht AménBridie DillonI got this prayer from my mother Mrs Bridget Dillon Airyhill, Kylebrack, Loughrea.She is fifty years of age

4602698/4596134/4606246.text:

Article an Chreidimh Chruaidh a tháinig chugainn ar chúirt ar uair ár mbáis. Mar tháinig an Taingeal le sonas i gluais na mná. Tamhairní Íosa faoi na braoinn is d'úmhlaigh sí síos de bhánnríoghan uasal an asail bhinn. Tháinig an dá ríogh tháinig na trí ríog faoi throm thuirse ag sileadh deor. Níor itheadar greim is níor bhlaiseadar de aon nia, nó go dtháinnig Mac Dé agus tharraing an tuisge tríd an bhféar. Is maith an sagart É, is maith an baiste a rinne Sé. Bhaist Sé Eoin, agus bhaist Eoin É ag tógál na sraonnteacha dá gceann Mac Ríogh ar Neamh dá gcuir le crann. Tógál báidh díobh is dá gcuir san gcré. An té déarfas Article an Chreadimh Cruaidh trí huaire ins gach lá béidh an Mhaighdean Muire ag comhrádh leis trí lá sul a bhfuigfidh sé bás.
(continues on next page)

4602698/4596161/4606293.title: Ag Luí ar an Leaba
4602698/4596161/4606293.text:
Luighim ar an leaba seo mar luigheas Mach Dé ar an gcroich. Brat Mhuire na sgaball tharm,Ó a Maigdean Ghlórmhar, bhunmhar, mhaiseas, Is tú mo stór mo uan is mo thaisge.Is tú an réalt olais roman ins gach bealach agus as gleann na ndeor seo go dtreoruigh tú manam. Améan.



"Go mbeannuighidh Dia dhuit a Paidir ghil." "Go mbeannuighidh Dia is Muire dhuit." Cé'r chodhail tú aréir, faoi cosaí Mac Dé,Cé gcodhlóch tú amáireach faoi chosaoi Naomh Padhruig.Céard sin romhat, tá fice Aingeal. Céard sin do diaidh tá fiche Asbal. Céard sin ar do láimh deas tá naoi ndeora d'uisge an Domhnaigh a chuir Muire liom ag déanamh an eolais ó thigh Phádhruig go tigh Phárais. Cé'n teac geal é sin tall a bhfuil
(continues on next page)

4606380/4593686/4606449.title: Don Mhaighdean Mhuire
4606380/4593686/4606449.text:
Don' Maighdin Mhuire.A Mhuire Mháthair is tú máthair Mhic DéGo gcuiridh tú ar mo bhealach mé,Go mbreathnuighidh tú orm i bhfus agus thall,Agus go raibh tú liom gach uile lá.



Ag Coigilt na teineadhCoiglim an teine seo mar choigil Críost,Brighid i n-a bun agus Muire in a bárr,An dá Easpal Déag atá i Ríoghacht na bhflaitheas,Ag cumhdach an tighe ar na ndaoine go lá.



Páidrín Páirteach i nGáirdín PhárthusAg moladh na máthar a bhí ariamh gan locht.A mhic na ngrásta a d'fhulaing a pháise.Tabhair mo anam slán ar gach uile olc.

4606380/4593687/4606450.title: Paidreacha
4606380/4593687/4606450.text: Ag dul ag ithe.Míle buidheachas duit a thigearna Dé faoi gur raibh tú com maith agus an beatha atá os mo cóir annseo a tubhairt dom, agus go dteigeadh sé i mbeatha da n-anamaibh agus do na daoine ata in asbaidh beatha go dtugadh tu doibh é. Mas fearr atá muid indiu go mo seacht fearr a bios muid bliadhain o indiu ár gcuid agus ar ndaoine.Dócas doras na bflaitheas ag gach duine a thógas triall chuige, gach a bfuil meas aige ar Dia go bfuigheadh sé gach rud dá n-iarraidh sé in-aisce. Bhíodh a Dhé a Athair neamhda go minic i mbéal agus i gcroide ga duine T-ainm le saogal na saoghal dá naomhadh ar feadh na cruinne.

4606380/4593688/4606452.title: Paidreacha
4606380/4593688/4606452.text: tar-éis bidh.Míle buideachas duit a tighearna DiaAn t-é thugh an beatha seo dúinnGo dtugaidh sé an beatha d'ár n-anamaibh.Ma's féarr atá muid indiú go mba seacht féarr a beas muid bliadain ó indiú.Ár gcuid agus ár ndaoine slán i ngradh Dé agus i ngrádh na gcomharsanI dtrochaire agus i ngrásta i saoghal agus i sláinte.Nearthuigh mé a Dia le grásta an Spioraidh NaoimhCearthuigh mo lochta is chuir grádh ar Iasadh i mo croidheNa peacaigh loit mé as chiméad mé i bfad ó do taobhAs bealach do leinbh dibhir go brátach as a coidhche.

4606380/4593691/4606456.text:

Ifreann dúnta rómhainn;Purgadóir múchta rómhainnagus flaithis De fosgailte rómhainn.



Luighim-se le Dia, go luighidh Dia liom.Scáth Dé os mo cionn,Crios na n-Aingeal faoi mo cheann.Cé luighfidh tú anocht?Idir Muire agus a mac,Idir Brighid agus a brat,Idir Colmcille agus a sgiath,Idir Dia agus a lámh dheas,Cé n-éireochaidh tú i mbárach?Eireochaidh tú le PadraicCé h-iad sin in ár n-aghaidh?An dá chéad aingeal.Cé h-iad sin in-ar ndiaidh?

4606380/4593693/4606458.title: Paidir
4606380/4593693/4606458.text:

Hata Iarainn ar mo cheann.Lultrach(?) iarainn ar mo chomh.Ceo Mhuire Ceo te CríostaSonas agus séan ar chuile bhéal dá ndéarasAgus ar chuile chluais dá n-eisteas,Agus Amén a Thighearna.

4602698/4596175/4606511.title: An Phaidir Gheal
4602698/4596175/4606511.text:
Chár chodail tú aréir. Fá cosaí Mhic Dé.Chá gcodlócaidh tú anocht, fá cosaí na mbochtChé sin romhat. Tá na h-aingle. Ché sinChé sin in do dhiaidh. Tá na h-aspail. Ché sin ar do láimh dheis tá braon de uisge an Domhnaigh. Chuir Muire liom ag déanamh an eólais ó dhoras go doras go doras Phárthais. Eochair Phartáis atá mé ag iarraidh ort san dabhach úd-an thall a bhfuil fleasg óir ar a cheann agus an coróin soillseach i a láthair.Tháinig oidhche tháinig ceó tháinig Bríghid le na brat tháinig Míceál le na sgiath, brionglán fada brionglán gearr cé déarfas an pháidir geal d'oidhche agus de ló go m'aoibhann dó.



Cailleach bheag san gcómhra agus sgian sáithte go feirc innti.Freagra cruca ime.TomhaisChuaidh rud dubh agus rud bán suas an cnoc tháinig an rud dubh anuas agus d'fhan an rud bán shuas. Cearc dhubh a chuaid suas an chnoc agus rug sí ubh shuas agus tháinig sí fhéin anuas. Dhá bhó bhainne ar thaobh na gaoithe cheann san oidhche agus cheann sa ló
(continues on next page)

4591089/4589575/4606570.title: Folklore - Giants
4591089/4589575/4606570.text:

the name of the blasted stone.



As I lay down to sleep to god I give my soul to keep. God withen God without God may bless us round about. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on. If anything happens me blessed Mary wakens me. There are four corners on my bed there are four angels and them spread Matthey, Mark, Luke and John. God bless this bed that I lay on. If anything happens me blessed Mary wakens me.

4602698/4596250/4606580.title: (no title)
4602698/4596250/4606580.text:
Nuair is cruaidh do'n challaigh caithfhidh sí rith.Nuair is mó an deifir is mó an mhoill.Beirt fhear de mhuinntir cró ag baint shlat lá cheóidh, an tslat a bhaineann siad caitheann siad uatha í. Is an tslat nach mbaineann siad bhéarfhaidh siad leo í."Dhá charróig ag piocadh a gcuid cluaithigh."Chuaidh caora isteach i mbearna Céad chaora eile, an maor agus an madhadh. Cé mhéad cos é sin."Dhá chois."



Ag Críost an síol ag Críost an fóghmharI n-iothlainn De go dtugtar sin.Ag Críost an t-iasg

in the lake and they thought the water parted. They saw a horse coming up from the water. He went out on the bank and eat grass.



PrayerDear mother make me love to pray to thee in thy sweet month of May.  And kneel before thee every day."Our sweetest Queen"Thine altar shall be ever greenMay sweetest flowers shall there be seen.And ? bright shall hail thee Queen,On the month of MayMy mother she may cease to loveHer earthly friends on faithful proofBut not my mother from aboveOur Sweetest Queen

4591089/4589582/4606602.title: Folklore - Leipreacháin
4591089/4589582/4606602.text:
There was a Leipreachain going around the village of Cappagh, Dunmore Co Galway long ago. One day a man caught him in a sand-pit and asked him for gold. The Leipreachain said that there was gold under a big stone. The man asked him for more gold and the Leipreachain said he had no more gold. The man looked around him and when he looked again the Leipreachain was gone.



As I laid down on my right side, I prayed to God to be my guide. If any evil thing control me the
(continues on next page)

4591089/4589583/4606604.title: Folklore - A Prayer
4591089/4589583/4606604.text:
(continued from previous page)
Blessed Virgin Mary awaken me. Four corners to my bed, four angels on the spread Mark, Matthew, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on. If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.



O Jesus who for love of me didst spear thy cross to calvary in thy sweet mercy grant to thee to suffer and to die for me.

4602696/4595847/4606607.title: Seanphaidreacha
4602696/4595847/4606607.text:
A Maighdean ghlórmhar mhúmar[?]mhaiseacGo mo tú mo stór mo luam agus mo taisgeGo mo tú an réalt ólaishom ins gach bealachIs ar uair mo bháis go bhfághadh na FlathaisTá mé ag carradh na déirc[?]isteach i dteach na féileag feitheamh na glóire is gháhéisteachtSan áit mach mbeidh mé ag iarraidh biad ná éadachCorra do chos go moch ina nAifreannOsgail do bhéal ar briathra beannuigtheOsgail do croidhe agus díbir an ghangadi [?}Agus breathnuigh suas ar mhac na banaltraCránn díreach dilleach glascrann ar ceasad críost

4602697/4595949/4606716.title: Seanphaidreacha
4602697/4595949/4606716.text:
Coruigimse an leabhaidh seo anocht i nainim na naomh agus naimim an Athar An Mhic is An Spioradh Naom  is an t-ainim fhéin a [mhic.?]  Céard sin tá tú rádh a mháthair   Paidirín bheannuighthe a mhic.  Shíl mé nach dtiochfadh tú go lá agus níl aon nduine a dearfhadh e trí huaire  agus [dul?] i mbáis codlata na hoídche dhó ar bhaoghal dhó pianta Ifrinn go bráth.Paidir a déarfhá a'cogailt na teineadhCoiglímse an teine seo anocht mar coiglins Críost cách   Bríghid na bun is Muire ina bárr an dá eangal deag atá i bflaitheas na nGrást a' [comhduacht?]an tighe is na ndaoine go lá.
