4605927/4603205/4645251.title: A Collection of Prayers
4605927/4603205/4645251.text:
This prayer used be said in the morning.Life is short and death is sure,A soul I have and only one,If that be lost all hope is gone,Waste not time, while time shall last,For after death tis ever past,All seeing God, your judge will be,And Heaven or Hell your destiny,All earthly things will speed away,,Eternity alone will stay.At night this was said.Eternal Father I offer thee the Sacred Heart with all its love, all the sufferings, and its merits to explate all the sins I have commited this day, during all my life. Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to Holy Ghost.When seasons work would be beginning they used say: "God bless the crop that I am preparing to put in,This used be said when going on a journey."May Jesus, Mary and Joseph be with us on
(continues on next page)

4605927/4603207/4645254.title: A Collection of Prayers
4605927/4603207/4645254.text:
The old people have many prayers that they learned at home, and were not taught in school or learned from a book. Among these are,"Holy Mary, Queen of Charity. Pray for me that I may never die in mortal sin. This pryer was generally repeated when going to bed at night."There is another prayer which is said after the Rosary at night. It is as follows,"O Merciful Jesus have mercy on me"My soul and my body I resign until thee,Five bleeding wounds were nailed to a tree.""O Merciful Jesus have pitty on me."Another prayer the people used say when going to bed at night is,"When I go to my bed I go to my grave,Lord Jesus Christ bring my soul to receive,Jesus the Flower and mary the Leaf,Be with me at my last dying hour."The old people used say this prayer at night."As I lie down upon this bed,I pray to God to be my guide,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God mysoul to take."
(continues on next page)

4605938/4604042/4645262.title: The Penal Days
4605938/4604042/4645262.text:
In the penal days Father O’Meehan was going to say mass in the valley of Glendale.  An English man stole the gospel of the Mass, and when the priest came on to the gospel he could not go any farther.  The English man did this to have a laugh at the priest.  The priest prayed and to the surprise of many a gospel descended from Heaven and the priest finished the mass.  This gospel was preserved in the O’Meehan family for many years.  Father Joseph O’Meehan was looking for this gospel.  If a person swore a lie on this gospel he would soon become insane.  Some people say that it is in the museum.Supplied byMiss McLoughlin. 50yearsWritten by Tessie McLoughlin, Killadiskert, Drumkeerin.

4649679/4646081/4650355.title: Paidir
4649679/4646081/4650355.text:
There was once a man and there was a spring well in his land. People used to come there every day for water. The man did not want them to be coming there. So he quenched the well and nobody could get any water. When the well was a few days quenched his son got sick and they could not give him enough of water. They used to bring hi buckets of water every day but it was no use. Day by day he began to get worse for the want of water and he got so thin that nobody knew him. At last somebody told his father that he would open the well and get some water from
(continues on next page)

4649689/4647510/4651266.text: 76A Prayer to be said before going to bed.As I lay down my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,And if I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over-head,St Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,And bless the bed that I lie on,And if any danger crosses me,The Blessed Virgin waken me.(My mother told me this prayer.)Eileen Golden, Corderry Peyton.

(I) When blessing with holy water: -"Sprinkle me O Lord; with hoissip wash me, then I may be made whiter than the snow".(II) Althú tar éis bídh: -Althuighmíd leis an Rí nách gann, althuighmíd gach am le Dia, beirimíd céad baodhchas agus althú leis. [?] an bheatha san dhúinn go dtugadh Dé an bheatha shiórraidha [?] n-anamaidh i bhflaitheamh. Más 'naith atháimíd indiu, gur a slacht fearr a beimíd bliain ó indiu, i gcuid is i gcabhair, i ngreann Dé is ná gComharsan. Dhia tairbheach na trócaire, na glóire, le na síothchána, do Cheannuig sinn, do Ghruthnaig sinn, do thug dúinn láthair sásaimh corpordha, go raibh ár n-anama beannuithe ar uair ár mBáis. Amen.

4613728/4613434/4658507.title: A Prayer
4613728/4613434/4658507.text: Here I lay down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep.If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners in my bedThere are four angels oe'r my head.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lay on.On Good Friday the jews cameWith a spear so sharpThey struck our Saviour throughthe heart and through the side.His Blessed Mother standing by,With a heavy heart and a mournful sigh.Who ever says this prayer three times a night, shall never see the burning flames of hell.

4649691/4647724/4659005.title: Prayers Said in Olden Times
4649691/4647724/4659005.text:
See the morning light decay, God of all to thee we pray. Thy helpful grace to send, thee to guard me and defend. Guard from dreams that may afright, guard from terrors of the night. Guard from foes without within, outward danger, inward sin. Mindful of our only stay, duly to thee we pray.Pupil - Margaret GibbonsRecorded - Mrs GibbonsDrumbollog, Kilclare 58 yrs



It was on a Good Friday in the afternoon, when the Jews passed by. With their sharp spears they pierced Our Saviour through the heart. From heart to hand his precious blood did flow. His blessed mother standing by, with her grieved heart and troubled mind.(Whoever shall say these prayers five times shall never die in mortal sin nor hell's fire shall never see)Pupil - Josephine LynchRecorder - Pat Kelly, Kilclare66 yrs

4649691/4647725/4659022.title: Prayers Said in Olden Times
4649691/4647725/4659022.text:
A Prayer said when getting out of bed:I will arise from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul. Oh may I arise on the last day to Life Everlasting. AmenA Prayer said when going on a journey:Show me O Lord thy ways, and teach me thy paths to direct my steps according to thy words. O Lord that no injustice may rule over me. To perfect my walking in thy paths and that my steps may not be moved. AmenA Prayer said when getting out of bed:Here I lay myself down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil trouble me, O Blessed Virgin awaken me. And if I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take. AmenPrayer said every morning and evening:Holy Saint whose name I bear, to Heaven direct my humble prayer. Holy Saint pray for me, the joys of Heaven that I may see. O sweet loving Jesus who died for thee, those five bleeding wounds that have suffered for me. My heart and my soul I give up unto thee, oh sweet loving Jesus have mercy on me. Amen
(continues on next page)

The Father, Son and Holy Ghost, bless my work this day, direct and protect men. AmenWhen the people hear of an accident or of any tragedy, they aways say God bless theheavens.On seeing the new moon this prayer is said:I see the new moon adn the new moon sees me. 4649691/4647727/4659030.title: Prayers Said in Olden Times - On Awakening
4649691/4647727/4659030.text:
On Awakening:God I offer thee my sight and keep it from all evil sights.When getting out of bed:Dear God, help me to walk in thy footsteps when preparing for work. Dear God, do not let my work fail, as those did'st not let thine own work fail.On lighting a lamp:God give us the light and glory of heaven when we die. Amen.Thank God for the grace to save my soul. Amen.On going to bed:Loving God, let me have a happy sleep, and I am heavenly sorry for having put thorns in thy sacred head, or any wound in thy sacred hands or feet. Amen.Pupil - Margaret Mc CabeRecorder - H. Molloy, Sheafield, Leitrim PO37 yrs



May the will of God be done by us. May the death of the saints be won by us. And the light of the kingdom begun in us. May Jesus, the child, be beside my bed. May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed. And Michael be steward of my soul.

4649691/4647728/4659038.title: Prayers Said in Olden Days
4649691/4647728/4659038.text: Prayer to St. Finian:O great St. Finian, Sainted teacher of the Irish Saints, bless our Irish Bishops. priests, and us all religious and faithful, so that illuminated by faith and learning with clarity in the future as in the past we may continue to follow in thy footsteps imitate thy virtues and so come to share in thy eternal recompense with all the saints of Holy Ireland. Amen.Prayer to St. Columbanus:O Lord eradicate from my soul whatever the adversary has planted therein; take away from my heart and from my life all iniquity, enlighten my mind and strenghten my will tht I may serve thee alone in deed and in truth. Give me O Lord chastity, (chauly?) adn faith. Give me whatever you think profitable for my soul. Amen.Prayer to St. Brigid:O god who gives us joy by the power of the intercession of Blessed Brigid, thy virgin, graciously grant that we may be assisted by her merits by the merits of whose chastity we are enlightened.Pupil - Winfred Mc CabeRecorder - Brigid Mc Cabe, Sheafield, Leitrim40 yrs

roads and ruins of houses in my townland and the railroad from Dublin to Sligo separates it from Gortinee.  The Lordly Shannon separates it from Roscommon.There is also a wood in close proximity to the townland and the people of Mullagh find fuel therein.  There are no mass-rocks in Mullagh.



On this bed I lay my head to sleep.  To God. I give my soul to keep if any danger should happen me the Blessed Virgin will waken me.  There are four corners on this bed, there are four angels on this spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John. God Bless this bed I lie on.  This prayer is to be said at bed time.

Tá sé 10 mbliadhain o fuair mé uaidh iad agus níl mé in ndon  a rádh cá bhfuair seisean iad. 4591084/4588939/4659849.title: Paidreacha
4591084/4588939/4659849.text:
Seo paidir a deartear taréis oibre.A Thighearna cuirim an saothar s fa coimhrce do croidhe ró naomhta agus beirim suas duit é i gcómhpairt lé do cuid saothair morsluaigh féin. AmenSeo paidir a deartear ar tosac oibreNuair a biod na daoine fadó ag dul ag obair déarfadh siadh paidir.A thighearna tabhar grásta duinn an saotar so do déanmadh cumh do gloir so. do leasa na anma agus do réir mar áta orduighthe agat-sa. AmenPaidir lé radh a fágail an tighe dhuitleanmuid tú a tighearna pé aít a ngabhar de brigh gur agat-sa atá briatra na beathaidh siorraide agus go dtuiria tú abhaile slan aris mé. AmenA Righ an DhomhaighCéad failte romhat-sa a rígh an DomhaighIs tú a foirmeas ar gach duineD'fuasgail sin ó gach contabhairtMó anam leat a Mich MhuireA Mhuire Máthair a righ an DomhnaighCeásad lé do mic beannuighthé.
(continues on next page)

Seo paidir a deirtear ar fheicheál an grian do duine.A Dia liomh is tú grian m'anam agus is geal liom do soillseacht. Grádaim tú a solais siorraidhe tabair do radarch orth i soillseacht do ghlóire. Amen.Nuair a bhead duine ag tigeacht abaile.Osglaigidh dom doírse an chirt agus ar mo dul isteach dom deánfad admáil do Tígearna.Seo páidir le rád roimh labhairt dhuit nuair a thiocfá isteach.A Íosa a mhich Dé a bhí ciúin ós cómhair Piólaith
(continues on next page)

4591084/4588942/4659887.text:

feitheamh lé h- aiseírge glórmar An té d'fulaing bháis ar bur son go dtugaid sé aoibneas siorraidhe dhíbh.Nuair a thiocfhas duine slán ó bhaoghal báis.Moladh go deó leath-sa a Slánuightéoir a thug saor mé ón bhaoghal seo ar son nach fiú mé go gcuirfeá rath mo shean ort. Míle glóire leat ar do mór trócaireSeo páidir a deirtear ag coigilith na teine do duine.Coigluigimh -se an teine seo mar coigilimh í is cácBrígid in a mullach is Muire in a bárr.An Cuigeadh Aingeal is aoirde i gCatair rí na ngrást a cludúghadh na teine seo ó oidhche go lá. Amen.Seo paidir a deirtear nuair a beas duine i dtrioblóid.A Íosa sár mhílís is tusa mo coimirce agus mo neart i n- ámh an chatha. Ó Deónuigh fuasgailt orm ins an gcruadcás seo. Amen.



An páidhir geal an t-ainm atá air an bpáidhir seo. Deirtear é ar maidhin agus deirtear é freisin má bhíonn aon duine go dona ins an teach. Bíodh na sean ndaoine dhá rádh sin fadó agus is é a bhíodh dá rádh acú nuair a d'eireocadh siad Seo é an caoí a deirtear é. Go mbeannuigh Dia dúith a páidhir
(continues on next page)

4591084/4588943/4659913.title: Paidreacha
4591084/4588943/4659913.text:

geal. Go mbeannuigh Dia is Mure dúith Cár codhail tú aréir. Mar codhail Mach Dé. Cá gcodlochad tú anocht. Mar codhlochas na boicht Cá gcodlochadh tú amháireach. Mar codhail Dia is Naomh Pádhraigh. Cé iad sin romhat. Naoí n-Aingheal ce iadh sin in do dhiaidh Naoi n-Aspól Cé iad sin ar taobh do laimhe deise. Naoí ndeoir as tobhar Rí an Domhnaigh cúir Muire cugamh cumh éolas a tabairt ó páras go h-áras. Ce iad sin thall Muire is a mach brighidh is a brath cumhdac t-anam arist go maidhin Amen.Is mairg a cuir is mairg a caill is mairg a bhí ar an gcnoc úd tall. Ag eíseacht leis an gclog bhínn a bhí ag fear a bhí ag dul na cílle gan brát óir ná cónra claír. An te a dearfas mo páidhir ar maidin gach lá ní baogal greim damnú dá anam frídh an lá. Amen.



Nuair a téigheadh siad a coladh san oidhce deireadh siad luigim-se le Dia go luigeadh Dia liom Sgát Diá ós mo cionn. Crois na n-aíngeal faoí mo druimh.Nuair a éirigeann tú ar maidin.Éirigimh suas le Diá go n-eírighe Diá liom. Laimh Dé í mo timhceall ag suidhe, ag luige is ag éirig domh.Paidhir le rádh lá BrighidhA brighidh a Muire na ngeadhil A Brighidh leatnaidh orm do brátIs coinnigh faoí do tearma mé. Go bhfághaidh mé bás i gcairdheas leath.
(continues on next page)

ní creidfead Naom Tomás . Act fuil is feoil mo Slánuighteór admóchad - sa go bás. Lás creideamh láidir in mo croidhe las docas agus grád. Go mbeidh agam leat a Iosa Criost dlút- cairdeas go bráth. Is tú a Thighearna roga an aráin a congbhuigeas ar n-anama beó. A Bidh na n- aingeal beatuigh sin agus neartuig sin go deó. Dféadfá an domain go léir tabhairt saor le fiú aon braoin amain. Ní feicim annseo tú a tigearna Dia acht deonuig sin a rí na ngrást go mbéid go deó fós ámarc ort suas san t-saogal siorraidhe Ámhen.



Seo é an páidir a deárfá sul a ngobfadh ag an aifreannFáilte an domhnach taréis na seachmhaineLá breagh saoire thug Críost lé freagairt dúinn corruigh do chois go moch chun an aifreann . corruigh do mhéir ar slighe an anama, osgail do chroidhe is breathnuigh suas ar an rí beannuighthe is ar impidhe naomhtha na trionóide ag bualadh an chluig.A thígearna deónuigh dom thú a gradú anois agus ar feadh na siorraidheAithneantaí DéSeo é an caoi a dearadh na sean daoine na deich aiteantaí fadó

Creid a mhic is an Dia go glan.Ná tabhair ainm Dé gan fáth.Connuigh an saoire mar is cóir.Tabhair go t- athair is do mháthair onóir.Ná dean marbh goid ná drúis.Ná sanntuigh bean do comharsan.Ná fionaise breagach in aon chúisCuid duine eile ná aírnis.



Paidhir é seó a d'arbruigeadh na sean daoine fadó ag dul aisteach go teach pobail doibh.Deírigh an mhaigdein glormhar dhá uair roimh lá.Gus cuaidh ina teamhpull ag caoineadh a grádh.Casadh dí an taingeál is coinnéal ina deas láimh.Sé de bheatha a mhuire dubairt Rígh geal na ngrást.Tuighe nar chaoin tú nuair a d'fulaing tú an país.No tuighe nar chaoin tú nuair a d'fulaing tú an bás.Gus fheabhas is a chaoin tú clann Eabha agus Adhámh. 4591084/4588947/4660043.title: Paidreacha
4591084/4588947/4660043.text:
Paidir é seo a n- abruigheann na sean daoíne ag dul a chodhladh dhoib:Siothchan ar d-tigearna iosa críostBhrigh a Pháise beannuighthe Fiocmhar na croíse ro namhtha. An tiodhal caithreimeach. Iosa An Nasared. Rí na N-Iudach Maighdean as Múire. Mathair Choimirce na naomh Aingeal Eadarghuidhe ar Uile Firéin idir mé agus na Namhaid go léir istigh is amhuigh Anois agus ar uair mo bháis.Paidhir ag dul a colad duithA Brighidh a muire na ngaedhil. A Brighidh leataid orm do brath is connuigh faoí do teim mé go bhfuig mé bás i gcairdeas déRoimh labhairt.A Íosa a mhic dé a bhí ós comhair geoláir ná leig duinn ar dteanga a luasgadh gan smaoineadh ar cad atá againn lé rádh agus cionas é a rádhAg teacht abhaile dhuit.Osglaigid dorais an chirt agus ar mo dhul isteach dom deanfadh adhmain dom a Thíghearna.I dtosach oibre.A Thighearna tabhair grasta dam an saotar seo do déanamh cun do glóire-sé cun m' anma ag do réir mar ata orduighthe agat-sa.
(continues on next page)

4591084/4588948/4660044.text:
(continued from previous page)
Duan an t-Slánuightheóraag dul isteach i dteach an phobail duit.Mo ghrádh-sa mo dhia mo ghrádh i mo luigheMo ghrádh gheal mo thíghearna throchaireachMo ghrádh mhilis Críost is grádhaim é lem chroidheMo ghrádh thú a rí na nglóire,Mo ghrádh-sa do shuil, mo ghrádh-sa do shiubhalMo ghrádh-sa do clú is do chomhachtaMo ghrádh-thú le fhonn ciodh táim bun-ós-cionnIs ní dheárna mo chumha do chomhairle. Amen.Páidir ar maidinA Iosa is duitse gach nídh is gach focal is gach smaoineadh uaimse indiu. Amen



Seo páidir le rád nuair a beiteá sa leabaidhLuigimh ar an leabaid seoMar luighimh ins an uaighDéánaim m'faoistín leathÍosa go cruaidh.Tré gniomhartha mo cholnaTré smaointe mo chroidheTré amarch mo shúilTré labairt mo bhéilTré siubal mo chos
(continues on next page)

4591084/4588949/4660045.title: Paidreacha
4591084/4588949/4660045.text:
(continued from previous page)
Tré gach ní adubhairtIs nach raibh fíorTré gach níd gheallasIs nár chóimhlíonasGach níd do rinneas i gcoinne do dligheNó do thola naomhthaIarraim-se maitheamhnas ort a Rí na Glóire. Amen.



Ag dul a chodhlad do duine deirtear an páidir seo.Go luigímid le Dia is go luigeadh Dia linnSgát Dé ós mo cionn. Crois na n- Aingeal fé mo chomCá luigead tú anocht idir Muire agus a MachIdir Bríghid agus a brat. Idir Columh cille agus a sgath. Idir Dia is a lamh dheas Cá luigeadh tú amaireach. Éireóchadh suas le Naomh Pádraich. Cá iad sin ar aghaidh. Aingeal Dé. Cá iad sin indiaidh an oireadh seo eile de muinntír Dé.D'innsighídís duinn fá ifreann agus oscail geatha flaitheas dé. leig an t- ulcas mó amach is an t-anamh truaigh isteach. Ó a Dia déan trócaire orainn agus mach na hóige go bfuireadh ar a n-anam.

4658419/4653148/4660734.title: Collection of Prayers
4658419/4653148/4660734.text:
RisingThanks be to God for bringing me safe over the night.Oh my God my only good the author of my being and my last end I give Thee my heart Praise honour and glory be to Thee for ever and ever amen.When going a journeyShow me oh Lord Thy ways and teach me Thy paths Direct my steps according to Thy word that no injustice may rule over me make perfect my walking in Thy paths that my steps may not be moved.When getting out of bedOh I will raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul Oh may I rise on the last day to life everlasting amenRetiringThere are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels over my head Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless me and the bed I lie on.Prayer for a toothacheSt Peter sat upon a stone and unto his God he make great moan.  What pains thou Peter or makes thee quake?  Oh my Lord my tooth doth ache.  Arise Peter and be well.  Anyone says this prayer every day and every night shall never have a pain
(continues on next page)

4658432/4654977/4660747.title: Cures
4658432/4654977/4660747.text:
(continued from previous page)
person with the back ache lie down and let the person with the cure walk across the small of their back.



To be said when rising:-As I walked out the Holy land,I met the Blessed Virgin with seven mass books in her hand,Seven priests singing, seven bells ringingSeven candles lit, Lamb of God, shutthe gates of hell, open the gates of heavenAnd let these poor sinners in.To be said at night after RosaryGod bless Friday and Good Friday too,The day our Saviour was crucified by the JewsThe Jews came with their spears sharpAnd pierced Our Saviour through the heartHis precious blood did flow from heart to handHis blessed mother stood looking on,With heavy sighs and grevious tearsAll ye who say this prayerThree times rising and three times lying,Shall never enter mortal sin or thegates of hell.
(continues on next page)

4658451/4656997/4660983.title: Soap-Making
4658451/4656997/4660983.text:
Long ago the people made soap in their houses and this was the way they made it. A quantity of fat or tallow and powdered fullers earth and some soda were all mixed together. This mixture was then stirred into moulds and let stiffen and cool. After a while they had a very servicable soap for washing purposes.

Defend and  govern us and after this short and miserable pilgrimage, bring is to live everlasting Amen. 5. 4591085/4589082/4661547.title: Seanphaidreacha
4591085/4589082/4661547.text: Ceithre coirnéil ar mo leabaidh, ceithre aingil orra sgartha. Má fhághaim-sa bás anocht nó ar maidin i bhFlaitheas na ngrást go raibh m'anam.Cóirighim mo leabaidh i ngleann uaignigh ar phunán luachra, in ainm na h-oidhche a geineadh tú, in ainm na h-oidhche a rugadh tú, in ainm na Naomh is aoirde i bhFlaitheas na nGrást, in ainm an Mhic gur shíl tú nach dtiocfadh go mbeadh sé 'na lá. Ó, a Mháthair níl aon duine a deireas do phaidir trí h-uaire sa lá a bhfuil damní síoruidhe dá anam go bráth.Ceithre phosta ar mo leabaidh- ceithre aingil ag rinnc' orra, Naomh Maitiú Marcus, Lúcas, Eoin. Beannuigh an leabaidh seo a bhfuil mé 'mo luighe uirri. Luighim sos, glacaim mo shuaimhneas, cuimhnigheann m'anam ar Mac Dé Is má fhághaim bás uaidh seo go maidin go raibh m'anam ardheis láimh Dé.Go mbeannuighe Tú dhom a Shéipéil Dé mar bheannochas mé féin duit, is go mbeannuighe Béal Dé dhom. In ainm Maighdine na Flaithis íslighim anseo ar mo leath-ghluin dheas le súil go bhfaighim agus anama    ....... an domhain slán ar leic na bpian. Amen.A Bhainrioghain is gile ná an ghrian, ná fulaing i bpian mé i bhfad. A Mhic Mhuire, sgaoil na glais agus tabhair m'anam leat. Glaoidhim ort a  Mhaighdin Mhuire.

4666572/4663042/4666825.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666572/4663042/4666825.text: When in bed say: - There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels at my head,One to guard me, two to guide,One to carry my soul to God.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lay on.If I die before I awake,I pray to God my soul to take,And if I die before I get up,I give my soul to God above.

4666572/4663043/4666827.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666572/4663043/4666827.text:
When in bed say: -I lie in this bed to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I awake,I pray to God my soul to take.



At night say: - Little Flower by thy power,At this hour help me.Mother of Jesus,Be my Mother two.Little Child Jesus, come to me,Little Child Jesus, stay with me,My heart is so small,Thou fillest it all,
(continues on next page)

4666572/4663043/4666843.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666572/4663043/4666843.text:
When in bed say: -I lie in this bed to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I awake,I pray to God my soul to take.



At night say: - Little Flower by thy power,At this hour help me.Mother of Jesus,Be my Mother two.Little Child Jesus, come to me,Little Child Jesus, stay with me,My heart is so small,Thou fillest it all,
(continues on next page)

4666572/4663044/4666853.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666572/4663044/4666853.text:
(continued from previous page)
There is room for none but Thee.



On Good Friday say: -God bless Friday, and Good Friday too,For that is the day Our Saviour was crucified,The Jews passed by with a long spear in his hand,To dart Our Saviour from the heart to the hand.His Precious Blodd began to flow,His tender Mother was standing by,With a heavy heart and a downcast eye,Whoever shall repeat those graceful words,Three times a day, three times a night,Shall never enter the gates of HellOr die in Mortal sin. Amen.

4666572/4663045/4666854.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666572/4663045/4666854.text: At night say: -O, Jesus, I know I must die,I don't know when, where, or how,But if I die in mortal sin,I am lost for ever,O, Jesus save me.

4666570/4662803/4666879.title: Prayers
4666570/4662803/4666879.text:
50PrayersThis prayer is to be said when going into bed.1As I lie down my bed to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.2There are four corners in my bedThere are four angels at my headOne to guide two to guardAnd one to keep me watch and ward.3Infant Jesus meek and mildPity me a little childPity mine and pity meSuffer me to come to Thee4Good night my angel guardianThe day has sped awayWell spent or ill spentIs written down for yea.And now in go God's kind ProvidenceThe image and brightwatch over me while I'm sleepingO angel dear good night5
(continues on next page)

4666570/4662804/4666880.title: Prayers
4666570/4662804/4666880.text:
(continued from previous page)
Good day my angel guardianThe night is passt and goneAnd thou has watched beside meAt midnight and at dawnThe day is now before meAnd as it glides awayOh help me well to make itA bright and holy day.



O God grant me light to know my sins and grace to confess them with true sorrow that I may obtain forgiveness through my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

(continued from previous page)
ring will soon get married.



Two old prayers of this district are: - When a person is going to bed he says"Heart of Jesus I adore thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,Hear of Joseph pure and justIn these three hears I place my trust"When a person is going on a journey and that he gets into trouble he says:-"Jesus, Mary and Joseph be with me within and without,And the twelve Apostles be with me in and out"

4658420/4653371/4667026.title: Old Prayers
4658420/4653371/4667026.text:
(i)"I see the new moon, the moon sees me,Got bless the new moon, God bless me"(ii)"There I lay me down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepAnd if there is anything to happen meI pray to God to waken meAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my Soul to takeRise now, Rise neverI give my Soul to God forever.Sweet Jesus sit on Mary's kneesTo grant me grace to honour threeUpon Mount Calvary the bloody sweat.The                 by those who sayThis prayer three times by nightThree times by dayShall never enter the gates of hell"(iii)Here I lay me down to sleepTo God I give me soul to keepAs there is four corners on my bedAs there are four angels on each stead
(continues on next page)

4658420/4653373/4667027.title: Old Prayers
4658420/4653373/4667027.text:
1. A prayer before you begin your morning prayers or night prayers"My Lord and my Saviour,My King and my Crown,Raise me to glory and free me from Sin,And give me the benefit of the prayers which I am going to begin"2. A cure for tooth-ache"As Jesus was walking along,He met St. Peter sitting on a marble stoneArise up Peter what ails you?I am suffering from a toothache"Any person who repeats this prayer five times a night or five times a day, shall never be troubled with a tooth-ache, head-ache or fever.3. My Jesus have mercy on me.My soul and my body I raise unto thee.Thy five bleeding wounds were nailed to a treeOh crucified Jesus have mercy on me".
(continues on next page)

4666581/4663830/4667160.title: Traditional Prayers
4666581/4663830/4667160.text:
A list of traditional prayers heard commonly in this district."God bless us" is said when a person sneezes."God bless all here" is said when a person enters a house."God bless the hearers" is said when a person hears of an accident occuring or some other serious happening."I. P. R. I." - a person puts those letters on his forehead when going to bed and repeats the following words: "My Jesus of Nazareth the King of the Jews save me from a sudden and unprepared death". If those words are said a person will not get a sudden death.
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664496/4667466.title: A Collection of Prayers - To Be Said in Bed
4666590/4664496/4667466.text:
To be said in bed when lying on the right side.As I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,And if any evil thing comes near meThe Blessed Lady may waken meMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on,There are four corners on my
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664497/4667468.title: A Collection of Prayers - To Be Said in Bed
4666590/4664497/4667468.text:
(continued from previous page)
bedThere are four Angels on it spreadAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to god my soul to take.God the Father may bless me,Jesus Christ may defend me,Now and at the hour of my death. Amen.



Hail and blessed be the hour and momentIn which the Son of God was born of the B. V. M.In a stable at midnight in BethlehemIn that hour and moment
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664498/4667469.title: A Collection of Prayers - To Be Said from the 1st of December until Christmas Day
4666590/4664498/4667469.text:
(continued from previous page)
we beseech thee O Lord to hear our prayers and grant our requests.



I humble myself at the foot of the Altar,My heart and soul to me Heavenly Father,To the Lamb of God who was led to slaughter,To give me the benefit of Mass and the Holy Water.



Lord help me to do this work,
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664498/4667704.title: A Collection of Prayers - To Be Said from the 1st of December until Christmas Day
4666590/4664498/4667704.text:
(continued from previous page)
we beseech thee O Lord to hear our prayers and grant our requests.



I humble myself at the foot of the Altar,My heart and soul to me Heavenly Father,To the Lamb of God who was led to slaughter,To give me the benefit of Mass and the Holy Water.



Lord help me to do this work,
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664499/4667711.title: A Collection of Prayers - To Be Said before Starting Work
4666590/4664499/4667711.text:
(continued from previous page)
For what I do is all for thee.To be said every time the clock strikes.The hour has passed,Death is approaching,Jesus and Mary help me.



Jesus the branch, Mary the Flower,Jesus and Mary be with me in my dying hour.Heart of Jesus I adore thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,
(continues on next page)

4666590/4664500/4667717.title: A Collection of Prayers
4666590/4664500/4667717.text:
(continued from previous page)
Heart of Joseph pure and just,On those three hearts I place my trust.Infant Jesus meek and mild,Look on me a little child,Pity mine, pity me,Suffer me, to come to thee.



Fear not, Joseph, to take into thee Mary thy Spouse,For that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost,She shall bring forth a sonAnd thou shall call his name Jesus.

4666594/4665187/4668114.title: An Old Prayer
4666594/4665187/4668114.text: I thank Thee, Lord, for quiet rest, and for Thy care of me, oh let me through this day be blest, and kept from harm by Thee, kind Thou art, to children such as I. Give me a gentle holy heart, be Thou my friend on high. Help me to please my parents dear, and do whatever they tell. Bless all my friends, both far and near and keep them safe and well.
4666594/4665187/4668114.school_info: School: Baile an Chlochair, Lic Snámha

4666597/4665546/4668368.title: An Old Prayer
4666597/4665546/4668368.text: As I lie down to sleep, to God I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wake to God I give my soul to takeThere are four corners in my bed, there are four angels at my headOne to guard me, one to guide me, and two to carry my soul safe to heavenMathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie onOn Good Friday, the Jews came and pierced our Blessed Saviour through the heartHis precious Blood began to flow His tender Mother standing by with a heavy heart and dismal eyesAnd she says who ever will say this little prayer three times a day and three times a nightShall never die in the state of mortal sin. Amen.

4666597/4665547/4668372.title: Another Prayer
4666597/4665547/4668372.text: As I look up, as I look down I see the Blessed Virgin coming down with a holy prayer book in her handSeven candles lighting, seven priests singing, seven bells ringingShut the gates of hell, open the gates of heaven, for my poor soul now and at the hour of my death. Amen.

4649702/4648695/4668580.title: Folklore - Prayers
4649702/4648695/4668580.text:
(continued from previous page)
Lord be thy branch, Lord be thy flower, sweet Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, that you may take me under your protection this present night and day coming on..  These were told to me by Bernard Toole, Corrick, Dromod, Co Leitrim.



When getting up in the morning.  These are some of the prayers which were said by the old people.  In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I arise bless me O Lord defend and govern, and keep me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting life. Amen.  These are usually said at bed-time.As I lay on my right side I pray to god to be my guide.  And I die before I walk, I pray to God my soul to take.These were told to me by Charles Foley, Aughamore, Dromod, Co. Leitrim

4658459/4657858/4672172.title: Old Prayer
4658459/4657858/4672172.text:
Taught to me E Maguire Drumbreanlis by my mother forty years ago.Eternal father, I unite myself with every priest who is now saying mass in any part of the world, or who will say mass for the next twenty four hours, offering you the precious blood of Jesus Christ for the living and the dead.O my God I offer you all the masses that are being celebrated throughout the world at this moment for myself, for my living relatives for the sinners of the whole world and for the souls in Purgatary especially the souls who are most neglected and for the souls of my own relatives in Purgartary



Taught to me by my mother forty years ago.Eternal father , I unite myself with every priest who is now saying mass in any part of the world, or who will say mass for the next twenty four hours, offering you the precious blood of Jesus Christ for the living and the dead.O my god I offer you all the masses that are being celebrated throughout the world at this moment for myself, for my living relatives for the sinners of the whole world and for the souls in Purgotary especially the souls who are most neglected and for the souls of my own relatives in PurgortaryPrayer heard from an old woman in Aran Isles ( Mary Dirane ) Deónuigh go bhfeicfead thú a Rí na GloíreAgus Muire Óigh an uile GhrástDeonuigh go bhfeicfead thú a Iosa áluinnTú féin a's do mháthair ar uair mo bháis

4658459/4657859/4672183.title: Another Prayer Taught to me by My Mother
4658459/4657859/4672183.text:
Three Hail Mary's in honour of The Immaculate Conceptionfollowed by:-O Mary My Mother preserve me this day from mortal sinThrough Thy Immaculate ConceptionO Mary make my soul holy and my body pure.To Saint JosephAt times within the little shopSt Joseph all his tools would dropAnd kneel in reverent lovelinessThat Jesus' love his soul might blessDear Saint, help me to learn thy waysThat amid distracting busy daysMy heart may pause and lift its cupThat Jesus' love may fill it up.



Abide with me!  Fast falls the eventideThe darkness deepens  - Lord with me abideWhen other helpers fail, and comforts fleeHelp of the helpless oh, abide with me!Swift to its close ebbs our life's little dayEarths joys grown dim its glories pass awayChange and decay in all around  I seeO Thou who changest not abide with me

4658459/4657860/4672184.title: A Night Prayer
4658459/4657860/4672184.text:
May the Will of God be done by UsMay the death of the Saints be won by us!And the light of the Kingdom begun in usMany Jesus, the Child, be beside my bedMay the Lamb of Mercy uplift my headMay the Virgin Mary her brightness shedAnd Michael he steward of my soul.Another night PrayerJesus Dear the day is ov'rNow I leave my labours lightsAnd before I seek my slumberCome to day a sweet good nightWould that I might tarry near TheeRest before thy lonely shrineThou wouldst wisper loving secretsAnd I'd tell Thee all of mineBut I cannot linger JesusI must leave Thee for a whileNow bestow on me a blessingAnd a sweet approving smileI would leave my heart beside TheeIt would rest securest thereAnd in Thy Son embracesIt would grow to Thee more dear
(continues on next page)

4672113/4671326/4672293.title: Paidir
4672113/4671326/4672293.text:
Imigh Eoin agus tabhair 'gam mo mháthairAgus bíodh sí annso imbarach leatNa go gcríochnuighthear liomsa i Ar Deireadh na PáiseTá feistcios mór ormgo bhfuil a bás uirthiD'imthigh ar Eoghan Na gur thainic sé insan áit a rabh MuireEoghan ar Eoghan a' bhfaca tu mo leanbhChonnaic mé É a bhean bheannuightheTá sé ar laimh a namhaid gabhthaAgus É go mór mór da theasgairt.D'eirigh Muire go foideamhail, misniúilNíor ghan sé le na coiriú na len a socrúNíor airidh si clocháin na mboithrí 'ga gortúNa gar tainic sí insan áit a rabh an garda 'ga shocrúEogan ar Eoghan Cé siúd thuas i gcrann na Páise
(continues on next page)

4672113/4671328/4672295.title: Paidir Eile
4672113/4671328/4672295.text: Ocht lán deag  umba CríostaReilice Padraic do bhrat bríghdedo rán na naomhdo bheannachta dílis Dé'gus na hEoglaisele h-anam mhairbh Purgadóir go h-iomlánDia gus a mhaidhdin Glórmhargo d-uigaidh sibh fuasgailt agus fóirtínDho na h-ainmneachas bochta atá i bhfad i bpían

4672086/4668990/4672662.title: A Prayer
4672086/4668990/4672662.text: On a good Friday our Saviour was crucified.The crown (of) of thorns was platted and pressed down upon his head. His blessed mother was standing by with a heavy heart and a mournful sigh.His precious blood began to flow.Lord be our branch. Lady be our flower.Lord (be out) receive my poor soul in it's dying hour.Those that will repeat those words, three times by night, and three times by day, the gates of hell he shall never enter and heave shall be their bed.

4672115/4671507/4672854.title: Prayers
4672115/4671507/4672854.text:
Ones said in connection with death:O Most Merciful Jesus, lover of souls, I pray thee by the agony of thy Sacredheart, Sorrows of Thy Immaculate mother, to cleanse in thine own blood the sinners of the whole world who are now in their agony and about to die.    Agonizing heart of jesus have mercy on the dying.    Holy Mary and Blessed St Joseph assist the poor souls who are now in their agony and about to die.  O Merciful Jesus have mercy on the dying.   There are four corners on my bed.Four angels on each spread.Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.God Bless the bed that I lie on.God rest the dead, God rest the dead,God rest the dead.Prayer said when something lost is Please St. Anthony look around something lost but cannot be found.
(continues on next page)

4672089/4669172/4678624.title: Prayers
4672089/4669172/4678624.text:
PrayersWhen going to bed:-As I lay down my weary head,Jesus be about my bed.Darkness is to Thee as lightand keep me safely through the night.In bed:-Four corners on my bed,Four angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.If I die before I wake.To God I give my soul to take.In bed:-Pray father pray to God to bless mePray mother pray to God to bless mePray all pray to God to bless meTo make me true and faithful,To my life's end. Amen.When lying down in bed:-In the name of thee, O LordJesus Christ crucified, I lay me down to rest, govern, defend and instruct me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me, and bring us all to life everlasting.
(continues on next page)

4605949/4605205/4678652.title: Prayers
4605949/4605205/4678652.text:
The following prayers are said in bed before going to sleep.As I lie down on my bed to sleepI give to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels over headMathew Mark Luke and JohnGod Bless the bed that I lie on.God bring me safe to heaven.The following prayer is said when suffering
(continues on next page)

4672090/4669206/4678726.title: Prayers
4672090/4669206/4678726.text:
When going to bed:-As I lay down my wearry head,Jesus be about my bed,Darkness is to Thee as light,And keep me safely through the night.In bed:-Four corners on my bed,Four angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,god bless this bed that I lie on,If I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take,In bed:-Pray, father, pray to God to bless me," , mother " " " " " ""   all,  " " " " " "To make me true and faithful,To my life's end. Amen.When lying down in bed:- In the name of thee, O Lord, Jesus Christ crucified, I lay me down to rest, govern, defend, and instrict me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me, and bring us all to life everylasting.
(continues on next page)

4678376/4673476/4678876.title: Old Prayers
4678376/4673476/4678876.text:
When kindling the fire at night the old people used to say this prayer.Immaculate mother of god we choose thee to be the Lady of this house. Guard us from fires, sudden death, storms and from burglars. Protect us all, sweet Mary. Pray that all may live fervently in God's holy service and may depart this life in His holy grace.When going to bed the people said this little prayer. I lie with God, God lies with me, I won't lie with the bad, the bad won't lie with me, God bless Good Friday the day our saviour was crucified. The Jews pierced him through the heart. His blood began to flow. His blesses Mother standing by with a heavy heart and dismal eye. Whoever will say this little prayer once or twice at night, will never feel the
(continues on next page)

4613689/4608999/4679220.title: Seanchluiche
4613689/4608999/4679220.text:
Ag imirt báire. Ag imirt ball dhóighte. An Fáinne; sagart an pharáisde; datanna; Marbles: Caststóne; hop scotch, ag imirt cluichthe cártaí agus phitch an' toss, ag imirt cluichthe pule, ag déanamh púicín.



Triúr Gréasaidhe nach mbeadh bréagach. Triúr Franncach nach mbeadh buide, Triúr Sagart nach mbeadh sanntach sin dáréag nach ngabhfá i Dthír.Ceithre cailleach gan a bheith manntachCeithre Franncach dan a bheith buidhe,Ceithre ghréasaide gan a bheith bréaghach.Sin dáréag nach bfuightheá i dthír.



An triúr is fearr a bhí;
(continues on next page)

4678381/4673958/4681611.title: Paidreacha - Paidir le linn Dul a Chodladh Istoíche
4678381/4673958/4681611.text: Paidear lé linn dul nChodhladh.Cuiglim an teine fé mar chuigleann Críost cáchCuirim Muire i dhá gceann mo thighe is Bríghde 'na lárCuirim a bhfuil d'asboil 's d'aingil i gcathair na ngrástAg cosaint mo thíghe agus a bhfuil ann go lá.                             nóCuiglimíd an teine seo fé mar chuiglídh  Críost cáchMuire i gceann a' tighe agus Brighde  'na lárNa seacht(?) aingil is aoirde i gcathair na ngrástA' teacht ag cárdáil (gárdáil) an tighe seo is a bhfuil ann go lá.

4678381/4673959/4681623.title: Paidreacha - Paidir an Uaignis
4678381/4673959/4681623.text: Paidear an Uaignis.(Is ceart í rádh ist-oídhche nuair a bhraithfeá uaigneas ag teacht ort).An Aisling a deineadh do Chríost agus gan é ach mí a mbruighean a MhátharCuirim-se an aisling sin idir mé sa namhaidChun mé fuascailt ó shluaighthibh bearta bróin.

4678384/4674375/4681633.title: Paidreacha
4678384/4674375/4681633.text:
Paidreacha.  Ag gabháil an átha go doimhin, Rí na foighne glac mé láimh; le heagla na tuinne tuille tréan, a Mhuire féach is ná fág.



Luighimíd síos le Rí na Glóire, leis an Maighdain Mhuire agus le Naomh Iosaiph; leis an dtriúr is sine, leis an dtriúr is óige; leis an dtriúr is mó gradam i gcathaoir na glóire. Tá ceithre cúinne ar mo leabaidh; ceithre aingil im timcheall. Bríghid agus Peadar is na hangail ag deanamh díon dom im shabháilt ar bás dorchad na hoidhche.



Íosa féach, Íosa fóir orainn. A Slanuighthóir
(continues on next page)

Glóire. Déirc ó'n Sprid Naomh d'ár gcroí agus d'ár mbréithre; gach nidhe a iarrfam Dia d'á réidhtheacht. Iarraimíd déirc do shólás agus d'aoibhneas na bhflathas, dar n-anam agus d'anam na marbh.



Síothcáin ar dtighearna Íosa Críost fé bhríghe a pháise agus a chroise beannuighthe Íosa rí na nGiúdeach. Maighdean is a Mhuire mháthair, comairce na Naomh aingil eadar ghuidhe na deilbh feiréan idir mé agus mo namhaibh go léir istig agus amuich, anocht agus ar uair mo bháis.Amen.   Cuirim m'anam ar chumairce Chríost. Ó a Íosa agus  Eogháin baiste agus a dhá aspal deag. Teidhim ar chomairce Chríost na mbeann.Chuirim an chrann ar céasad Críost idir mé agus an tromluighe agus idir mé agus gach ní eile a bheidh ar mo tíghe.

4678381/4673973/4681773.title: Paidreacha, Arthaí - Artha an Uaignis
4678381/4673973/4681773.text: "Glacaimíd dá gcoimirceDiúltuighmíd dá n-imirceA gcúl linn sa n-aghaidh uainn                  (a radh)I n-ainm a n-Athar sa Mic sa Spioraid Naomh (Amen)"(An méid seo do rádh dá mbraithfeá uaigneas ag teacht ort).

4678381/4673976/4681794.text:
An Bacach ar a theacht isteach thar Dorus:A bheannughadhGo mbeannuigheadh Dia is Muire is Rí an DomhnuigDo mhná na gceannuighthe ar fuaid Chiarraighe anochtMise Pádraig bocht ó Dálaig go gcailleadh a athairlá cruaidh fuar Earraig agus go mbádhadh a mháthair i dtor mór aitinn, ceud míle moladh lé Dia Mór.Deo gratias.

Chiarraighe(Deirtear í seo lé linn tosnú ar Thuras Gobnait a tugtar sa pharóiste seo thall ar Chill Gobnait ar an 11adh lá d'Feabhra gach bliadhain ).Beannuighim-se dhuit-se a Ghobnait NaomhthaMar  beannuigheann na Naoimh agus na h-aingil go léir duit.Chúghat-sa thánga ag gearrán mo péin leat,Is ag iarraidh mo leighis i gcúntas Dé ort.

4678381/4673995/4681867.text: Paidreacha.   Paidreacha a deirtear nuair a bhuaileann an sluagh sidhe lé duine sa bhóthar ist-oidhche.1:  Gur sluagh dall an sluagh so.2:  Cuirim Dia idir sibh is mé.Factha ó Thomás Ó Dalaigh.

4678382/4674049/4682150.title: Naomh Caitlín
4678382/4674049/4682150.text:
(continued from previous page)
Gach bliain cidhtí an solus ins an dTeampull i bhFionntrágha go dtí gur cuireadh an chéad phrotustúnach ann. Cidhtí Naomh Caitiline féin ann deirtear, ach ní feacthas í ó cuireadh an chéad phrotustúnach ann. Tugtar turas Teampall Fionntrágha ina honóir gach bliain ó shoin ar an gcúigmheadh lá fichead de Shamhain.



Ar mo ghabháil dom tríd an áth go doimhin,A Dhia na foighne glac mé ar láimh,Ar eagla na toinne a bheith ró-thréan,A Mhuire féach is ná fág.



Naomh Caitlíne IIInghean do thaoiseach mór i Sasana ab'eadh Naomh Caitlíne agus cailín breágh áluinn Naomhtha ab' eadh í.D'iomphuig sí ar ár gCreideamh Caitliceach san am ná raibh puinn meas

4678382/4674053/4682174.title: Paidear tréis na Corónach
4678382/4674053/4682174.text: Paidear t'réis na Corónnach.A Íosa féach orainn a Íosa fóirA Slánuighteóir is a Dhia dhíl dein díon d'ár n-anam go léir,Dibir na droch smaointe is an   peaca as ár mbéalSar a sínfear sinn síos sa leabaidh bheag caolA Rí na nAingeal is a Chara na gcruaidh bhochtán,A Mhichíl Naomhtha Árd Aingeal bí farainn ar uair ár mbáis.Cabhair is cáirde is grásda ó Dhia chúghainn,A chabhair gach lá is táimid dá iarraidh,Sácraimint na h-aithrighe go neartuighidh Dia linn,Is m'anam fe'd choimirce a Mhaighdean an Tighearna.Luighmíd fed' ainm a Mhaighdean Ghlórmhór,A Mháthair Dé, a Realtan Eóluis,A Bhannríoghain na nAsbol, freagair is fóir sinn,Is beir leat ár n'anam go Cathaoir na Glóire.Déirc an Spioraid Naomh in ár gcroidhe is in ár mbréithre,Is gach nídh a iarraimíd Dia 'á réidteach.                Amen.

4672112/4671157/4682189.title: Prayers
4672112/4671157/4682189.text:
PrayersPrayer when going to bed:-1. "There are four corners on my bed.There are four angles on my spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke, and JohnGod bless this bed that I lay onIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAnd if I die before I sleepI pray to God my soul to keep."2. Prayer before going to sleep:-"This night as I lay down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf any evil shall come over me.That the Blessed Virgin Mary may assist me."3. Prayers before going to bed:-"O Jesus I must dieI don't know when not where nor why

4678402/4677450/4682384.title: Paidir a Deirtear Oíche Dé Sathairn
4678402/4677450/4682384.text: Míle fáilte romhat-sa a Dhomhnaigh Bheannuighte a thagann lá agus oidhche chun Críost a teagasc dúinn. Corruigh do chos go moch chun Aifrinn. 4678390/4675688/4682568.title: Seanphaidreacha Eile
4678390/4675688/4682568.text:
1. Ghaibh Muire agus a mach amach go moch sa ló,Cé casfaidhe leótha ach Naomh Siomhan fear beanuighthe ón Róimh.Thug sé dóibh scaball na mbríoghansí oir,Is níl éinne a raghadh fé'n mbrath is a dheanfadh e mar ba chóir,Ná beadh seála beanuighthe an Tighearna ar anamh sa Flathais go deo.2. Feach an fear a Bhríghidh, feách féin a mhich, féach féin a máthair is agath athá. Fear caoin aige mnaoí bhuirb a chuir mach Chríost na luighe i gcoladh. Deárna Muire is chúig meára Íosa ag líaghadh agus ag leathadh an ghreamadh seo an uair is mó agus is measa atá sé.3. Tá pian um súil, tá Dia ós mo chionn, tá an Maigdean Muire ar a dá glúin ag guidhe cun rí na n-úball é leigeas agus do leata ag an pian a baint as mo súil.4. Cuisle a cuireadh ar Íosa agus gan é ach mí i mbroinn a mháthar, cuirim-si an cuisle seo idir mé agus cleasaibh agus rocair mo namaid um saorad ar na sluaithaib bearta brónaca á rád i n-ainm an nAtar, agus an Mic, agus an Spraoid, Naoim, Amen.
(continues on next page)

4678390/4675729/4682646.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678390/4675729/4682646.text:
1. A Mhuire a rúin guídhim chúgat ar Chríost láithreachFairsinge is flúirse do theacht chúghat ó Ríocht NeamachMo thart féin do mhúchais go húr sa núr bhláthachIs gur dhoirtais im scórnach é dar liomh seacht cáirte2. Aifreann an Dómhnaig ná leig uait,Pé fliuch fuar a bheidh an lálé heagla ná mairfá Dé Luain,Agus gur bhí an uaigh do leabhaid ghnát3. An tAifreann ná tugáidh i naon rudMar ná fhuil nídh air an saoghal so níos feárr,Agus céad míle moladh agus buadchas,Leis an té a dhein an tais-eiríge slán.4. Seacht lán do roilig Phádraig

Allen, 3 miles from Drumshambo (North) quite near Slíabh-an-Íarain mountain.DERRINTUBBERtownland. 2 1/2 miles from Drumshambo North, in Co. Leitrim, adjoining L. Allen. 4678402/4677513/4682753.title: Seanleigheasanna
4678402/4677513/4682753.text:
Seanleigheaseanna 'Sé an leigheas a bhíodh ag na sean-daoine ar tinneas fiacail ná breith ar fhrog agus é chur isteach i mbéal an té bheadh an tinneas air. Chun an bhruitíneach a chur amach tré leanbhaí deinidís tae le aoileach caoraí agus é sin a thabhairt le n-ól dóibh. Sé an t-slighe i n-a leighisidís an chraos-galar ná gob an ghanndail do chur isteach i mbéal an té a bheadh an aicíd air naoi maidne i ndiaidh a chéile. Eibhlín Nic Gearailt. Féach leath. 96-------



Sean-PhaidirA Aingil chuideachtan do chuir Dia chun mo threorú chun mo theagasc, múin dom a Naomh Thoil i ngach uile ní is ar gach uile ocáid. Stiúirigh mé ar bhealach mo shláinte, díon mé om' namhaidibh is cuidigh liom ar uair mo bháis. Amen.
4678402/4677513/4682753.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677549/4683049.title: Paidreacha do na Mairbh
4678403/4677549/4683049.text: Má tá smúit ná smáilc ó'n saoghal so,Dearmad Aifrinn, baois óige, breitheamhnachas airighthe gan cóimhlionadh, briseadh lae saoire ná Domhnaigh ag teacht i gcoinnibh an anma, Dia agus an Mhaighdean Muire a' réidhteach dóibh. Méadú ar a ngloire,  agus luigheadú ar a bpurgadóireacht go mbrostuigh Dia chum rioghacht na bhFlathas an té is goire do purgadóireacht a fhágaint. Amen.  Anamna mairbh an domhain Mar órduigheann Dia 's an Eaglais dúinn, Guidheachtain ortha Agus ár n-anam bocht féin,An lá déanach.                             Amen.
4678403/4677549/4683049.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677550/4683052.title: Paidir Eile
4678403/4677550/4683052.text:
Molaimíd Íosa Críost,Molaimíd dho chinn agus do chnámha,Molaimíd an Mhaighdean ró-ghlórmhar a geineadh gan an peaca.Go gcuiridh Dia na Flaithis le'n ár n-anamAgus le h-anam mairbh an domhainMar órduigheann Dia is an Eaglais dúinn Guidheachtain ortha.



An chéad fhocal:  Ó Thighearna maith dóibh siúd, mar na feadar siad cad tá siad a dhéanamh.An tarna focal:  Beidh tú in aonfhacht liom indiu i bParrathas .An triomhadh focal:   Ó a Mháthair, féach ar do mhac. Le Naomh Eoin: "Féach ar do mháthair".An ceathramhadh focal:  Tá tart orm.An cúigeamhadh focal:  Ó mo Dhia, cad fáth gur thréigis mé?An séamhadh focal:  Ort-sa a Dhia a chuirim comraidhe mo spride.An seachtmhadh focal:  Ar do thoil a chriochnuigheadar .Amen, a Thighearna.
4678403/4677550/4683052.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677551/4683071.title: (no title)
4678403/4677551/4683071.text: Seacht bPaidreacha fighe na reacht do chuir Muire Máthair faoi na mac, do chuir Brighde faoi na brat, do chuir Micheál faoi na scéith, do chuir Dia faoi na neart.Saor sinn ó ghaoith an chnuic,Saor sinn ó shluasaidí,Saor sinn ó dá spíc,Saor sinn ó náire shaoghalta,Saor sinn ó temptation an árseora.Luighim sios leat a Dhia na gloire,Leis an Maighdean Muire is le Naomh Ioseph,Aingeal cuimhdeachta mo láimhe deise Ag déanamh treoir dom,Agus brat beannuighthe na Maighdean glórmhar , An t-Aon Mhac go luighir ar leabaidh liom,Sa talamh naomhtha go n-éirighidh ar maidin liom,A Mhaighdean ghlórmhar is a dá ghéig ar leathadhA Mhicheál Naomhtha saor ár n-anam.                     Amen.
4678403/4677551/4683071.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677552/4683081.title: I gComhair Bronntanas na hAthbhliana
4678403/4677552/4683081.text:
Úrnuighthe do múineadh dom leanbh agus dom féinÁ dúiseadh le dúthracht ar leabaidh na n-éan.Mo ghluin deas a leigint fúm gan achairt chun DéAr son an úr-mhac a bhí go túiseacht ag sileadh san ngéig.A Rí na n-Aingeal, na n-Asbol na bhfáidh agus na gcliar, Íosa a baisteadh ina leanbh is gan é áirighthe blian.Iad-so atáim ag iarraidh ort, a rí, athair mhic na nGrást,Bí fial dúinn, tabhair trócaire duinn, Is ná leig m'anam do'n áirseoir.



Ó Mhaighdean Mhuire cheannsa, cuimhnigh id' aigne Éinne a tháinigh chughat-sa fé athtuirse,Agus chuir a mhuinighin asat agus comraighe anama ort, Nár cloiseadh riamh fós gur chailis air.Chughat-sa dá bhrígh sin a thagaim-se Ag éigheamh is ag sgreadaigh ortGo nglacfá mé im leanbh chughat,Is mé bhreith saor go flaitheas leat.Ó a Mháthair an Aon-Mhic ná h-éimhigh m'athchuinge, Ach fóir agus freagair mé go trócaireach taithneamhach.                               Aman.
4678403/4677552/4683081.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677553/4683082.title: Paidir Eile
4678403/4677553/4683082.text:
Comhartha na Croise trí h-uaire agus annsan an chros do phógadh.   Beannuighim duit-se a Íosa a céasadh ar an gcrois,  Ar chrann an duilleabhair ghlais,  An crann do céasadh Críost air,  Beannuighim duit-se a Íosa,  A dheineann na naoimh agus na h-Aingil beannú uait.   Ó, a Íosa do síneadh do ghéagaAr chrann na Croise chum sinn do shaoradhDéan dion dúinn, sinn a ghárdáil Is a shábháilt ó ghach dainséir.                                         Amen.



Coiglim an teine seo fé mar coiglim Criost cách,Muire ar ghach ceann an tighe agus Brighid ina lár,An dá asbol déag is aoirde i gcathair na ngrást ,Coimeád an tigh seo agus a bhfuil innte go lá.                          Amen.



Luighim le Dia agus go luighidh Dé liom, Na luighim leis an olc agus ná luighidh an t-olc liom.
4678403/4677553/4683082.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677554/4683089.title: Paidir Eile
4678403/4677554/4683089.text:
Ó, a Mhaighdean Mhuire ró-diadha, cuimhnigh ná bhfuil éinne riamh do chuir é féin fé'd dhion ná déibh (?) go duthrachtach ar do chabhair nó t-eadarguidhe ná bhfuigheadh sé saothrú relíf' a shláinte. Seasami ar do mhaitheas agus ar do thrócaire, caithim mé féin fé do chosaibh beannuighthe, guidhim tú go ró-iseal a mháthair an fhocail shiorruidhe chum mise do bheith ionnraic mar leanbh duit. Tóg ort fé'd thearmain mo bheatha, a Mhaighdean ró-dhílis ná bíodh sé le rádh go gcaillfí mise san áit ná fuair éinne riamh acht grásta agus slánú.                                            Amen.An focal Béarla "relief".



A Chroidhe Íosa, naomhuigh mé  A Chorp an Tighearna beannuigh mé , Fuil agus uisce a tháinigh amach tré thaobh ár dTighearna ar an gCrois, nigh agus glan ó'm peaca mé.                                        Amen.



Luighim síos leis na trí pearsanna is aoirde i Rioghacht na bhFlaitheas, im' ghárdáil is im' dhion ó oidhche go maidin. Ó a Íosa Mhic Dé foillsigh ar an lá, is go mbeirir ár n-anam slán go Flaitheas geal na ngrást.                            Amen.
4678403/4677554/4683089.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678395/4676337/4683122.title: Seanphaidir
4678395/4676337/4683122.text: Sean-Phaidir.Míle fáilte rómhat-sa a Dhomhnaig beannuighteA thagann chugainn in deire na seachtmhaine,Corruig ár gcos go moch go dti an Aifreann,Tabhair d'ár mbéil na bréithre beannuighte,Cuir as ar gcroidhe na smaointe mallaithe,go mbuailfead mo lámh ar slabhra m'anama,Is go bhfeachfadh suas ar mac na (??),Mar sé is feárr a cheannuig sin,gur leis beó agus marbh sinn.Cros an Spioraid Naomh, im chroidhe is am bréithre,Is gach nídh dá ndeirim , Dia dá réidteach,Aithríghe mo pheacaí go ndéanfadIs leis na h-iarnaí do stéaladh do gheaga.Osna óm croidhe fóiríl ná déin sin,Deóir óm shúil le cuainí gléigilIndiaidh báis ár dTíghearna a fuair na pianta ar saoradh.

4672101/4670175/4683235.title: An Old Prayer
4672101/4670175/4683235.text: There are four corners on my bed, there are four angles on it spread, Mathew Mark Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lay on, Seven candles lit, seven Priests singing, seven bells ringing, shut the gates of Hell and open the gates of Heaven and let this poor soul in, if I die before I wake, and if any evil comes to me the Lord of Lady waken me. Corpus Christi on my breast above in heaven my soul at rest.This prayer was said by the old people long ago when they were lying in bed at night.

4672101/4670176/4683238.title: An Old Prayer
4672101/4670176/4683238.text: There are four corners on my bed. Four angles on it spread, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on. If I die before I awake to God I give my soul to take, and if any evil spirit comes my way I hope the Almighty God will set me free.I rake this fire with the will of God, Saint Bridget at each end of the house and Blessed Virgin in the middle. Twenty nine angles be guarding this house and all that is in it mourning.

4678403/4677573/4683426.title: Comhairle
4678403/4677573/4683426.text:
(continued from previous page)
Go dtiúbhfaidh Tú saor sinn gan baoghal ar ár n-anamIs go maithfear dúinn a ndearnamair.Beidh a béal dá dhúnadh agus an tsúil á leathadh ,Agus a mheabhair ag imtheacht chum fáin uainn, Beidh ár gcúiseanna á nglaodhach is ár léiseanna caithte,Agus Dia le n-ár n-anam an lá san.



Nuair luighim sa leabaidh luighim san uaig,M'fhaoisdin go cruaidh leat a Dhia,Táim ag iarraidh asblóid ort a Mhuire mheidhreach,is a Mhaighdean ró-thrócairigh,Go bhfeicead-sa radharc ar do theaghlachAgus ar do mhór-thrócaire;Solus na Soillse is radharc na Trionóide, Is grásta na foidne in-aghaidh na h-éagcóireach.Grásta na foidne go bhfaghad-sa is mo cháirde, Ó Rí gheal na Soillse ag déanamh aoibhnis d'Á mháthair.
(continues on next page)
4678403/4677573/4683426.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677575/4683429.title: Paidir ar Maidin
4678403/4677575/4683429.text:
Tugaim suas m'anam duit ar maidin a Dhia mhór na Gloire,Is go dtí an Bhainrioghain Bheannuighthe glórmhar, máthair na Trionóide,Do's na naoimh is do's na h-Aingealaibh is d'asbail na TrionóideAg sábháilt m'anam ó mhaidin go dtí oidhche is ó oidhche go maidin.



A Athair mhic a shealbhuigh an ghrian 's an mhuir,Go leigir orainn do bheannacht agus go bhfanair againn,
(continues on next page)



(continued from previous page)
Naomh Ann, máthair na Maigdne Muire,Is a Mhaighdean Mhuire, máthair Críost,Naomh Elisibet, máthair Eoin Baiste,Mé ag iarraidh ar an dtriúr sanMé a shaoradh agus a shábháiltAr an drom-luighe agus ar an annsprid atá inár ndiaidh, Agus gach aon droch-nidh go maidin.         Amen.
4678403/4677575/4683429.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677574/4683438.title: Paidir roimh Dhul a Chodladh do Dhuine
4678403/4677574/4683438.text:
(continued from previous page)
Mhuire mháthair, mo dhian-ghrádh tú,  Is ár gcabhair conganta in am ár ngábhtair.Mo cheirín leighis tinn nó sláinte,Is cumraighe m'anam ort insa bhFlaithis anáirde.Gabhaim féd' thimpeall a Mhichíl Naomhtha,Is ar an Mhaigdin a bhí ag adhlacadh a h-Aon- Mhac,Ar naoimh, ar aingil, ar asbail cléirigh, Is ar a n-athair atá sa bhFlaitheas dá n-éisteacht.Nó ar na lobhair a bhí bodhar gan éisteacht,Nó ar na daill ná feicfeadh aon rud, Nó ar an mnaoi do chuimil Díot an t-éadach,Go bhfuair sí na grásta agus an tsláinte in aonfhacht.



Bhí bean bhocht amuich i Loch agus ní fhéadfadh sí néal do chodladh aon oidhche mar thagadh an trom-luighe uirthe. Sa deire tháinigh bean ó Baile Mór agus mhúin sí an paidir di. Dubhairt sí é an chéad oidhche eile agus thuit codladh sámh uirthe. Ní bréag é.
(continues on next page)
4678403/4677574/4683438.school_info: School: Clochar na Toirbhirte, An Daingean

4678403/4677578/4683519.title: Altú tar éis Bídh
4678403/4677578/4683519.text:
(continued from previous page)
Mar lón siorruidhe ar ár n-anam i bhFlaitheamnachas, Is go dtugadh Sé an deíre is trócaire D'anam na bhfioraon d'imthigh romhainn.



Céad buidheachas le Dia a thug saor ó'n lá sinn,Go dtugaidh sé saor ó bhás codalta na h-oidhche sinn,Ó thubaistí is ó thrioblóide na bliadna.



Cros na leanbh sa leabaidh 'na luighfidh tú, Brat ó's na Flaithis go leathtar ár dtimcheall,Braon do' d' ghrásta ar lár a' chroidhe 'gainn, Ag tógaint ceo agus smút na bpeacaí dinn.   Amen Íosa.

4678382/4674199/4687849.title: Paidear
4678382/4674199/4687849.text: A Íósa, déan díon dom' anamh bocht féin,Díbir gach droch smaoineamh is an peaca ó nár mbéal,Tabhair an slighe glan díreach d'ár n-anamh chúghat féinSar a sínfear sinn síos san leabaidh beag caol.A Rí na nAingeal a's a Athair Mhac, ríar an ádh,A Mhichíl Naomhtha árd Aingeal, bí farainn ar uair ár mbáis.

4678382/4674195/4688058.title: Paidear le Rá tréis na Corónach Mhuire
4678382/4674195/4688058.text: Cabhair a's cairde a's grásda ó Dhia chughainn,A chabhair gach lá a's táimíd 'á iarraidh,Sacraimint na haithrighe go neartuighidh Dia dhúinn,Is m' anam féd' choimirce a Mhuire a bhuime an Tíghearna.Luighmíd fed' theármoinn a Mhaighdean Glórmhar,A Mháthair Dé a réaltann eóluis,A Bhannríoghan na bhFlathas freagair is fóir meIs beir leat m'anam go cathaoir na GloireDéirc de shólás is d'aoibhneas síorruidhe na bhFlathas d'ar m'anam anois a's go deó.Amen.A Chroidhe a dhoirt gach braon dod' chuid fola ar ár son, go lasaidh ár gcroidhe-ne le grádh dhuit.Ó A Mhaighdean Mhuire do rugadh gan an peaca, guidh go gcuirfheadh Dia ar ár leas sinn anois a's go deo.Amen.

4678408/4678043/4688242.text:
(continued from previous page)
5: An cúigmhadh dólás a bhí ar an Maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a cuireadh ar an gcrois céasta é agus na tairrgní géara á stracadh.hé hó héd   & rl6: An séamhadh dólás a bhí ar an maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a leagadh 'na hucht féin é agus é marbh.hé hó héd irl7: An seachtmhadh dólás a bhí ar an Maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a cuireadh san uaig é go fuar lag gan anam.hé hó héd  & c



5:   An cúigmhadh dólás a bhí ar an Maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a cuireadh ar an gcrois céasta é agus na tairrgní géara á stracadh.    hé hó héd ....agus araile.6:   An séamhadh dólás a bhí ar an maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a leagadh 'na hucht féin é agus é marbh.     hé hó héd...agus araile.7:  An seachtmhadh dólás a bhí ar an Maighdin agus í ag féachaint ar an leanbh nuair a cuireadh san uaig é go fuar lag gan anam.    hé hó héd...agus araile.       Seana Phaidreacha. Nuair a choisrigheadh daoine iad féin leis an scaball ag dul a chodladh dhóibh, deiridís:-"Seo seóid a fuaireas óm' mháthair mar is maighdean ró naomhtha í. Is mise an peacach bocht atá ag dul fád' dhíon, agus beannuig mé led' bhrat. In ainm an Athar atá ar Neamh , mhic a d'fhuiling péin, Spioraid Naomh a bheannuig sinn, agus a Mhaigdin Ghlórmhar tair ár dtriall. Amen.

4678408/4678046/4688354.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678408/4678046/4688354.text:
Padruig Ó Muineacháin, Na hAcraí, Abha na scáil,   a thug an phaidir seo.Cabhair agus grásta agus cárta ó Dhia chughainn,Cabhair gach aon lá chughainn agus táimid'á iarraidh.Sácraimínt na h-Áithrighe go neartuighidh Dia  linnAgus cumaraí ár n-anama ort a Mhuire Bhain TighearnaScreadaim ortsa a Íosa, ar an Maighdean  Muire GlórmharAr Naomh Bhrighid agus ar Mainleach Cuinnleachta ( ? m'aingeal coimhdeachta?)Go dtagaid siad im thimcheall de ló  agus d'oidhcheAgus ar mo leabaidh luighim ann.Amen



Eibhlín Bean Uí Shuilleabháin, Mináird, Abha-na-scáil, a thug na sean phaidreacha leanas:Coróinn Naomh Iosaiph:-Abair ar na clocha móra-Patriarch ró ghlórmhar Naomh IosaiphA bhí ceapaithe mar athair ag ÍosaIs mar chéile ag Máthair Mac De.Fr: Guidh orainn anois agus ar uair ár mbáis. AmenAbair ar na clocha beaga:Ó Naomh Iosaiph impighmíd ort fa charaid is chéile,
(continues on next page)

4678408/4678046/4688356.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678408/4678046/4688356.text:
Padruig Ó Muineacháin, Na hAcraí, Abha na scáil,   a thug an phaidir seo.Cabhair agus grásta agus cárta ó Dhia chughainn,Cabhair gach aon lá chughainn agus táimid'á iarraidh.Sácraimínt na h-Áithrighe go neartuighidh Dia  linnAgus cumaraí ár n-anama ort a Mhuire Bhain TighearnaScreadaim ortsa a Íosa, ar an Maighdean  Muire GlórmharAr Naomh Bhrighid agus ar Mainleach Cuinnleachta ( ? m'aingeal coimhdeachta?)Go dtagaid siad im thimcheall de ló  agus d'oidhcheAgus ar mo leabaidh luighim ann.Amen

4678408/4678058/4688388.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678408/4678058/4688388.text:
Fuairtheas na paidreacha seo leacas trúi bliana ó shoir, ó Nóra Ní Chonchubhair, a cailleadh anuiridh in aois 84 bl. di. Níor phós Nóra riamh, bhí an bhean bhocht bachach, agus bhí sí ana naomtha. Do chaith sí a saoghal ar an mBánóig i bparóisde seo na Mináirde, agus bhí sí go beo bocht.1. Ó a athair mhic do thalmhuig grian agus muir,Go bhfuil an peaca seo orm ceangailte riamh go dtí indiu.A athair ag iarraidh maitheamhnachas ort atáím id' thóir;Gur le taithneamh duit a ghlacas mo Thighearna indiu.2. Cuirim mé féin fé dhion agus tearmainn na Maighdine ghlórmhairne,Fé's na triur aingeal is mó i ngradam na Glóire,Ag déanamh díon dem' anam leis an Rí glórmhar, Ó oidhche go maidion ag ó mhaidion go tráthnóna.Ó a Banrioghan na bhFlaitheas is a Bhanaltran Rí na ngrástTugaim suas m'anam ar maidin duit agus gacham eile de'n lá,Nuair a searfaidh an t-anam leis an colann
(continues on next page)

4678408/4678060/4688397.title: Paidreacha
4678408/4678060/4688397.text:
1. Coróinn Chroidhe ÍosaAbair na cúig deichneabhair ar dtúis. Ansan abair ar an gcrois:-An onóir d'á chroidhe íseal,An onóir d'á chroidhe uasal,An onóir d'á chroidhe leanbaí,An onóir d'á chroidhe geanamnaí,An onóir do chroidhe na mbocht is na mbochtán,An onóir do'n chroidhe nár chaill ar aoinne riamhA chuireadh a muinghín agus a ndóchas i gcroidhe ghlórmhar Íosa,Cuirimíd á'r muignín agus á'r ndóchas ar do chroidhe fírinneachMar ionad somarc is mar chomharthaí ghrádh.Go bhfaighimis suaimhneas siorruidhe á'r níobairt ar an saoghal so.Agus compórd milis ar uair á'r mbáis.Do rileónach le Dia an chroidhe claon donn mailíseach,Atá againn 'á thógailt uainn.Croidhe lán des na ngrást a thabhairt dúinn
(continues on next page)

4678408/4678093/4688487.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678408/4678093/4688487.text:
Seana PhaidreachaA Mhic Mhuire na nGrást do cuireadh chun báis,Is d'fhulaing an bás pheannaideach,Do cheannuig síol áimh le h-allus do cnámhaFuil agus cneadha dearga.Freagair mé a ghrádh, beir m'anam i dtráthGo Parathas lán gradhamach,Ag caitheamh an tsóláis fhada dhíl bhreághIdir Asboil is Ard Aingealaibh.Freagair mé a Chríost, mo chara mo chroidheAn charraig seo im' chroidhe corruig í,Is óm'dhearcaibh leig síos srutha aithrígheGo mbéarfas go crích flaithis mé.Mar is peacach mé a bhí sgannalach síor droch bheartach fíor mhalluithe,Mo bheart ar an saoghal cealgach claonGangaireacht baoth do mhaitheamh dom.Níl le rádh, ach gainimh ar thráighNá drúcht ar bharr lasrachNa peaca le suim ar m'anam fóiríorCeangailte im' chroidhe cealgaithe.
(continues on next page)

4666577/4663455/4688491.title: Prayers
4666577/4663455/4688491.text:
This is a prayer that is a cure for a toothache. It must be said when you hear the bell ring the first time during Mass. "God bless us, God spare us our health. May the Lord have mercy on the dead and grant peace to the living".



Long ago when a person would do a good turn for another they would say this prayer. "May God and Mary bless you and may the Heavens be your bed."



"I lay my body down to sleep, to God I give my soul to keep and if I die before I wake, to God I give my soul to take. I must die I do not know when nor where nor how, but if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever. Jesus have mercy on us." At night this is always said. My uncle told it to me.



This is a prayer that was said long ago. "Ere the waning light decay, God of all to thee do we pray.
(continues on next page)

4678408/4678095/4688492.title: Paidreacha
4678408/4678095/4688492.text:
Nóra Ní Mhuineacháin,cailín scoile, a fuair na paidreacha seo leanas ó shean bhean ins na h-Acraí(baile fearainn leath mhíle ón scoil. Tá an baile i bParóiste Abha na Scáil)      Brighid, Bean Uí Chonaill             Na hAcraí                Abha na Scáil(Baintreach feirme 82 bl.)1. Gníomh Buidheachais:-                  Beirim míle buidheachas leat a Thighearna i dtaobh mar gur chruthuighis mé, gur fhuscailighis mé,gur rinnis Críostuidhe agus Caitliocach díom,gur thugais slán mé tré gach cruadhchás agus baoghal bháis,go mór mhór ar feadh na h-oidhche atá imthighthe tharm,agus i dtaobh gach grásta eile dá'r bhronnais orm go nuige so.2. Gníomh Dóchais:-                  A Thighearna,ag seasamh ar do mhór thrócaire agus le muinghín as do naomh gheallamhna, Tá súil agam maitheamhnachas d'fhágailt uait im'pheacaidhibh go h-uile,mar aon le deagh bhás agus glóire siorruidhe na bhflaitheas, Tré mo Thighearna agus mo Shlánuightheóir Íosa Críost,Amen.3. Gearr Úrnaighthe na Maidne;-               Beirim suas duit a Íosa,tré
(continues on next page)

cailín áluinn an-phósta.Deirtear gur pósadh í san Mhachaire agus go bhfuil a sliocht le feiscint ann fós: agus gur fuirist gach duine 'ca d'aithniúint; go bhfuil scánán beag tanaidhe de chroicean idir méireannaibh a gcos ar nós na ngéan 's na lachan.



Go sábálaighidh Dia sin ar lúbharnó ar Phláig,Nó ar aicídeacha coimhtheacha,Ar bhás obann,Nó ar an-bhás,Nó ar bhás gan Ola an Chroidhe.

4687695/4684609/4688686.title: Paidir an Tromluí
4687695/4684609/4688686.text:
Anna Máthair Mhuire,Muire Mathair Dé,Elisabat Máthair EóinAn Cros 'nar crochadh DiaSabháil me ar an Tromluighe



Gaibh isteach 'an Roilig. Faig méar duine mhairbh nó tairgne cómhrann. Chuir ad bhéal, is fáisc go maith.



An tarna taoide dh'éis ré nuadh an taoide is aoirde agus rabharta.Rabharta Lae 'Le Pádruig  -  Béal le h-Éirinn - an rabharta is aoirde sa bhliain.Nuair a bhíonnan Ghealach díreach taréis dul fúithi dhi, bíonn ceathrú den taoide imighthe amach, (tráighte), agus bíonn ceathrú de imighthe amach nuair a eirighean sí, arís.Grúnlús :-  An leigheas a tugtar do bhó go mbeadh {let} innti.

4687695/4684657/4688811.title: Paidir - Ag Cuimhneamh ar an mBás duit

4678409/4678219/4688910.title: Paidir
4678409/4678219/4688910.text: Cabhair agus grásta agus cáirde ó Dhia chúghainn.Cabhair gach aon lá chugainn agus táimid á iarraidh.Sácrimínt na h-aithrighe go neartuighidh Dia linn. Agus comraighe m'anama ort a Mhaighdean Bhain-tighearna.Sgreadaim ortsa, a Íosa,agus ar an Maighdin ghlórmhair.Ar Naomh Brighde agus ar m'aingeal coinnleachta.Go dtagaid siad im timcheall ló agus d'oidhche.Agus ar mo leabaidh a luighim ann.                   AmenÓ bhéal aithris Siobhán Bhartún.Cailleadh í ó sríobhadh é seo i n-aois 94 bliadna. I mBaile an Teramoin a chaith sí a saoghal. Togtha síos 6-5-'38

4678410/4678331/4689196.title: Paidir
4678410/4678331/4689196.text: Go gcuirfidh Dia ar do leasa thúGo dtugaidh Dia cabhair agus congnamh dom fhéin agus do lucht mo cabhartha agus mo choghanta gach áit go bhfuil siad.Go meadaighe Dia na h-éinne is fearr 'ná chéile cughat."Is mairg a bhíonn i dtír gan duine aige féin, lá na bruighne luigheann bata ar a thaobh."Siobhán Ní ChurtáinFuaireas an Paidir seo óMáire bean Uí Fhlaithaimh 80 bl.Abhainn-a'-Sgáil

Sean Phaidreacha.       "Ortha an Greama".Fear séimh ag mnaoí buirb,Do chuir corp Críost na luíghe ar cholgDeárna Mhuire agus a Mhac leis ngreim In ainm an Athar, agus an Mhic agus an Spioraid Naoimh.             Paidear na mbacach.Fé mar a shínis do láimh,Nár shínis í go bráthI bfiabhras ná i bpláig,Ná in aon aicíd eile go lá do bháis.Lá do bháis an Slánuightheóir go nglachadh thú,Is ar Mhuire , Máigh an Tighearna Go riabh Comhaire t-anam. 4678398/4676679/4689350.title: Paidir le Rá an Oíche Dheireanach den Bhliain
4678398/4676679/4689350.text: Paidir le rádh an oidhche dheireannach den bhliadhain.Úrnaighthe a múineadh im leanbh dom féinigIm dhúiseacht le dúthracht le gairbh na néanMo ghlúin a ligint fúm is me ag agairt chun DéChúgatsa a úr-mhic a bhí go tuirseach ag silleadh as an ngéagÍosa na nAingeal na nAspol na bhfarr is na gcliathÍosa do baisteadhleanbh  le Máire bliadhanM'iarsma do chaithim ort a mhic Athair na nGrást bí fiallTabhair trócaire dom anam agus maith dhom mar dheinis riamhPaidir a déarfá sa leabaidhCros na nAingeal sa leaba ina luighmídbratacha na bhFlaitheas go dtaga inár dtímcheallbraon dod' ghrástaibh ar lár an chroidhe againnAg tógaint smúit na bpeacaí dinn-neNuair a luím ar mo leabaidh luighim ar an uaigM'faoisdne gur mhór leatsa a DhiaSolas na soillse a thabhairt dom agus radharc na TríonóideAgus grásta na foidhne i naghaidh na héagcóraMo ghrádh sa tusa a Mhuire MháthairMar is tú ár gcabhair fóghanta le linn a ghátairIdir a bheith tinn nó slán duinnbean Uí Fhiannachta a thug na paidreaacha seo dhom. 80 bl. ó Bhaile Ghóilín iseadh í.
4678398/4676679/4689350.school_info: School: Baile an Ghóilín (Scoil N. Finghín)

4687702/4685439/4689360.title: Paidir i gcomhair Turais
4687702/4685439/4689360.text: When starting  to pay a round in the Cloghane graveyard, the following prayer used be said at the entrance to the ruins of the old Catholic Church, and the final prayers were said  within the ruins, in front of the image of Crom Dubh:-"Go mbeannuighidh Dia is Muire dhuit A Theampaill naomhthaFé mar beannuigheaim na NaoimhIs na h-aingil go léir leatA gearán mo chás a thána fein leatAgus iarraim mo leigheasI gCunntas Dé ort."

4678394/4676142/4689775.text:
Beannuíghim díbh a lucht na Sgaball ná tugaidh aon fhaillíghe bhúr gcás, is a mhairg a bhíonn gan carad ag lúighe ar leabaidh an bháis. Umhluíghidh sio do'n gcléir agus do's  na trí raonta Muire, bídhigidh-se ag guídhe chun Dé agus beidh sé ag éisteacht libh agus ná deinídh éargaonadh do thinneas. Ghaibh Muire agus a mac amach go moch sa ló cé thárlóchadh leó ach Naomh Símón fear beannuighthe ó'n Róimh. Thug sé súid dóibh sgaball na mbhrainnsí óir an té chaithfeadh é mar ba chóir bheadh séala beannuighthe an Thigearna ar a anam go deó. Crios Mhuire mo chrios. Chrios na gceithre gcros. Crios 'na mbaisteadh Críosd ann. Crios 'na mbaisteadh Criosd as "Article" a Mhuire Mháthair an té a dhéanfadh mó dhualgas trí n-uaire gach maidin luain geóbhaidh sé Flaithis Dé gan dualgas agus Muire do d'feiscint trí n-uaire roimh bháis.
(continues on next page)

4658459/4657858/4689994.title: Old Prayer
4658459/4657858/4689994.text:
Taught to me E Maguire Drumbreanlis by my mother forty years ago.Eternal father, I unite myself with every priest who is now saying mass in any part of the world, or who will say mass for the next twenty four hours, offering you the precious blood of Jesus Christ for the living and the dead.O my God I offer you all the masses that are being celebrated throughout the world at this moment for myself, for my living relatives for the sinners of the whole world and for the souls in Purgatary especially the souls who are most neglected and for the souls of my own relatives in Purgartary



Taught to me by my mother forty years ago.Eternal father , I unite myself with every priest who is now saying mass in any part of the world, or who will say mass for the next twenty four hours, offering you the precious blood of Jesus Christ for the living and the dead.O my god I offer you all the masses that are being celebrated throughout the world at this moment for myself, for my living relatives for the sinners of the whole world and for the souls in Purgotary especially the souls who are most neglected and for the souls of my own relatives in PurgortaryPrayer heard from an old woman in Aran Isles ( Mary Dirane ) Deónuigh go bhfeicfead thú a Rí na GloíreAgus Muire Óigh an uile GhrástDeonuigh go bhfeicfead thú a Iosa áluinnTú féin a's do mháthair ar uair mo bháis

4678389/4675358/4702084.title: Paidir in Am Cogaidh
4678389/4675358/4702084.text: Paidir i n-am cogaidh.                     (1)A Dhia na ngrásta, id' láthair,San árus na mbír,Tiochfaidh ógánaig amáireach,Ó pháirc ghrándha na bpian,  Ná h-áirimh an dubh áireamh,Na gcoinne tá agat a Dhia,Ach slánuig a gcneádha dhóibh,As ucht na dtáirní bhí id' thaoibh.                     (2)A Mhuire Mháthair atá anáirde,Ar lámh dheis an Ríogh,Bí id' mháthair dóibh amáireach,Tar mháithreacha an t-saoighil,Idir namhaid dóibh is cáirde,Iarr grásta dhóibh a Dhia,Ós ó mháithreacha a thángadar,Mar tháinig uait Críost.

4701708/4694774/4706600.text: Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie onThere are our corners on my bedThere are four Angels on them spreadTwo at my feet, two at my headAnd two to carry my soul to Heaven.As I went out to view the Blessed LandI met the Blessed VirginWith seven Mass  books in her handsSeven hymns a singingWith seven bells a ringingOpen the gates of HeavenAnd close the gates of Hell

4687698/4685099/4706963.title: Paidreacha - Le Rá Lá Caille
4687698/4685099/4706963.text:
Le Rádh, Lá Coille  A Rígh na nAingeal na Asbal na bhfáigh na gcliar,Íosa a baisteadh na leanbh ins an tráth so bhliain. Iarsma táim ag iarraidh ort.A Athair, A Mhic na ngrást bí fiall, tabhair trocaire ar m'anam agus maith dom mar dhéarnais riamh.



Nuair a bheifá ag tógaint trí deocha den uisce taréis comaoine do ghlacad abair:- Sláinte Naomh Pádhruig do bheannuigh Éire, Sláinte na mná a fuair an leanbh gan Céile, agus Sláinte na nGrásta a raibh againn le na chéile.



Nuair a bheifá ag dul choladh abair:- Luighimíd síos leat a Rí na glóire, Leis an Maighdean Muire agus Naomh Sheósaimh agus na dá Asbal déag atá i gcathair na Glóire



Le linn dul a choladh dhuit abair:- Dia am mhúineadh, Dia am theagasc, Dia am ghárdáil Ins gach áit go ndéanfhainn peaca, A mhic Athar na ngrást,Thabhair lámh ar chaithíbh.

4678389/4675442/4706965.title: Seanphaidreacha
4678389/4675442/4706965.text:
Paidir i gcoigilt na teine san oidhce1. Coigilimíst an teine seo fé mar do choigil Críost cách. Cuirimíst an Mhaighdean Mhuire i mbarr an tíghe agus Naomh Bríghde na lár. An dárra Aspol agus i Naomh is mó cómhacht i bhFlaitheas na nGrást, ag féireacht an tíghe seo go lá.2. Paidir i gcoinne tromlaigheCuirim m'anam fé chómaraibh Críost. Ó a Íosa agus a Naomh Eoín baiste agus a dhá Aspol deag. Téighim ar choimirce Chroise na mbeann. Cuirim an crann ar ar ceasad Críost idir mé féin agus na tromlaighe agus níd eile do bheadh ar mo thíghe.3. Paidir do dhuine a bheadh ag fágáil bháisAr choaraibh Mhuire do chuireas indé tú.
(continues on next page)
