A Prayer"Thanks be to God. I have eaten my fill. But if I had more I would keep eating still. But for the times they are so bad. Thanks be to God for what I had." Some people say this prayer after meals.  Tom Regan Allenwood Middle from his father

4723864/4720256/4784746.title: Some Old Prayers
4723864/4720256/4784746.text:
When going to bed and old custom was to say some prayers.One was: -1. "There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over-spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on".Another bed-time prayer was.2. "O most merciful Jesus - have mercy on me,My soul and my body I resign unto Thee,These five bleeding wounds that were nailed to the tree,O most merciful Jesus - have mercy on me.Another prayer at bedtime -3. "God the Father, bless me.Jesus Christ, defend and keep me,The virtue of the Holy Ghost enlighten and sanctify me this night & forever. Amen.Another bedtime prayer: -4. In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ cruci-
(continues on next page)

4770019/4767266/4784861.title: An Old Prayer
4770019/4767266/4784861.text:
I heard this old prayer from my father. He lives in Castle-cool. He was born in Brandra. He is a labourer. He spent his early days in Watercastle. He heard this prayer from Pat Dowlng who was his grandfather. He heard it about forty years ago. The person was about 50 years of age about then. That person was living in a place called Graceswood road  or better still Pat Dowling's lane. I wrote this prayer on the 5th October 193X.Joseph L. Holohan,Castlecool,Ballinakill,Leix.
(continues on next page)

4770019/4767269/4784863.title: Old Prayer
4770019/4767269/4784863.text: May Brigid bless the house wherein you dwell.Bless every fireside, every wall, and floor.Bless every heart that beats beneath the roof.And every tongue and mind for evermore.Bless every hand that toils to bring it joy.And every foot that walks its portals through.This is my wish today my constant prayer.May Saint Brigid bless the house that shelters you.

4723831/4717222/4784879.title: Sayings, Prayers, Poems
4723831/4717222/4784879.text:
God save us from the bite of the mad dog or the kick of a galloping turkey.As I lie on my bed, as I lie on my grave,Begging the Lord my soul to save,The Lord by the branch, the Lady by the flower,That Jesus & Mary be with me in my last dying hour.I rise from my bed of sleep, to adore my great God And to labour for the salvation of my soul.Oh, may I rise on the last day to life everlasting.In the name of God, the way Kelly set the hen.When any two persons would quarrel and become great friends again, it was said & is said "They are as great as Art & Paddy".When poor people would be given anything by a young girl of the house, they would say"God bless you and may you gain your love at your leisure".When a favour was done the grateful old person would say "May you live till the skin
(continues on next page)

4758498/4748907/4786395.title: An Old Woman's Prayer
4758498/4748907/4786395.text: Good Friday is coming onThe day that Our Saviour was crucifiedA crown of thorns on his headWhich pierced into his Sacred heartHis Blessed Mother standing byWith heavy heart and dismal sighNote:- Any one will say this prayer three times a day and three times a night will never die in the state of mortal sin.

4758499/4749027/4786833.title: The Prayer
4758499/4749027/4786833.text: By the fall of Adam our sins first beganFor our sake Christ's blood first ran,By those words I do thee charge,The blood that ran to run no more at large,Through Christ Our Lord. Amen.A short time ago a man named Walsh stopped a bleeding by reciting these words. This man's father & mother were Walshe's. These cures are handed down from father to son.The blood from a black cats tail will cure "Wildfire" (probably St Anthony's FireThe cat must be entirely black & must have not even one spot of white.Ivy leaves relieve a burnBoiled Ivy for painsGround Ivy for pains(Ivy that grows along the ground & along the ditches)

This woman never fails to put out the ribbon sinceI remember my own mother get a furze stick & put one end of the stick in the fire & when that end was charred she used put St Patrick's Cross on our left shoulders outside on the clothes just the mark of an ordinary cross

4770030/4767990/4813941.text:
(1)   As I lie down on my right side,I pray to God my soul to guide.O lamb of God take care of meThis Blessed and Holy night(2)Blessed Virgin Mary come with speedAnd relieve me at my need.(3)God Bless this bed that I lie onAs I look up at the Blessed lambI see the Blessed Virgin Mary looking downSeven Mass books in her handSeven bells ringingSeven priests singingOpen the gates of HeavenClose the gates of hellAnd enter my poor soul into heavenFor ever and ever, Amen



There is four corners on this bed that I lie on.There is four angels there be spread.
(continues on next page)

4723826/4716736/4814062.title: Composition - On Prayers
4723826/4716736/4814062.text:
I learned a number of prayers at school, and I have read some in books, but I have also learned a number at home. here are a few of them:-There are four corners on my bed,There are four Angels at my head, Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. God bless the bed which I lay on. When I lay down my head to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep. If any danger happens me, Almighty God shall waken me.Oh, My God I thank thee for all Thy graces, Thou, Oh Lord, enable me, In all my temptations, dangers and afflictions.Oh, my Savior I love thee entirely from my heart. When I am sick I will ask,
(continues on next page)

4723826/4716738/4814066.title: Composition - On Prayers
4723826/4716738/4814066.text:
God bless Friday and Good Friday too,The Friday Our Lord was crucified on,The Jews they came with their spears so sharp,And pierced Our Savior from hand to heart,His Blessed Mother was standing by,With a heavy heart and a mournful cry,Those who say these words three times by day,or three times by night, in rememberence of Him, neither death nor fire, nor the seven deadly sins, nor the gates of hell shall they enter in. "I lay my heard unto the Cross, O Lord, O Lord, remember me."O Queen of Heaven, Queen of Angels, You are always good and kind to me,And when I am on my great trial,I hope you will plead for me,With fear that I would be cast away,Your Son no more to see, O glories Queen of Angels, I hope you will plead for me. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ, crucified. I lay myself down to rest. Bless me, O Lord, defend, and govern me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage, bring me to ever-lasting life.
(continues on next page)

4723826/4716739/4814068.title: Composition - On Prayers
4723826/4716739/4814068.text:
(continued from previous page)
The gloomy night embraced the place, Wherein the noble infant lay,The babe looked up and showed His face, In spite of darkness it was day,It was our day, and light did rise,Not in the East but from His eyes.



The gloomy night embraced the place, Wherein the noble infant lay,The babe looked up and showed His face, In spite of darkness it was day,It was our day, and light did rise,Not in the East but from His eyes.Infant Jesus, meek and milk,Look on me a little child. Pity mine, pity me,And suffer me to come to Thee.Lord of the branch,Lady of the flower,Lord be my guide,And Mary be my power.Oh Jesus, Mary and Joseph, be with me at my dying hour.In the morning when I rise,To the almighty God I turn my eyes,Begging of Him night and day,Not to let my poor soul astray.Oh Sweet Sacred of Jesus, grant me the grace to receive the Sacraments, at the hour of my death.

4723826/4716740/4814070.title: Composition - On Prayers
4723826/4716740/4814070.text:
Away in a manger, A crib for a bed, The Little Lord, Jesus, Laid down His sweet Head,The stars in the bright sky, Looked down where He lay, The Little Lord Jesus, Asleep on the hay. The cattle was lowing, The baby awakes, But, the Little Lord JesusNo crying He makes,I love Thee, Lord Jesus, Look down from the sky,And stay by my bedside,Till morning is nigh.Be near me, Lord JesusI ask Thee, to stay,Close by me forever, and love me I pray,Bless all the dear children,In They tender care, And fit us for Heaven, To live with Thee, there. Oh Jesus, at They feet,I cry to Thee for mercy, I am now going to ask You,
(continues on next page)

4723826/4716754/4814082.title: Prayers
4723826/4716754/4814082.text:
O Lord of youth, while yet our feet untiring, speed towards the goal of our desires, give us the grace of willingness to hearken to older folk, whose zeal outlasts youth's fires.O Thou, Who knowest how our souls are eager.To be and do the grandest things and best, To waste our strength in one sustained endeavour,O draw us aft aside with Thee, to rest.Dost thou on a journey sped,Pause and kiss the feet that bled,Feet that fared so far for thee,Ever they nailed Them to the Tree,Bruise Feet that yet kept pace,With the sinner fleeing from grace,Kiss My Feet, then go thy way,Danger shall not near three stray,When at morn or close of day,Thou would set thyself to pray.O Eternal Father we offer Thee the precious Blood of Jesus, through the Immaculate Heart of Mary, in satisfaction for our own sins,
(continues on next page)

4723826/4716755/4814083.title: Prayers
4723826/4716755/4814083.text:

and for the release of the soul of the priest most neglected.Eternal Father I offer to you the precious blood of Thy Divine Son, Jesus, in satisfaction for my own sins, the sins of the whole world, and to supply for the wants of our holy Mother, the Church. Praise honour and glory be to the three persons of the most glorious, peaceful, ineffable Trinity.Let thy name, O God! be praised and glorified in this world, which thou has created according to thy good pleasure; "The Lord unbinds those who are fettered, the Lord enlightens those who are blind. A woman going to Kilmeague saw a car coming. There was a stack of straw & the woman went over to the stack to let the car pass. A woman rose out of the stack of straw & went away. She was the banshee.



A man went into Mag Foxe's rath in Newtown  Robertstown Co Kildare & began to cut a tree. A piece of wood went into his eye & his eye withered away. A very old man named Danaher  told this to James Dunne Allenwood N.S.



People used to put a bit of hay at the door for St. Brigid to wipe her feet passing by door on St. Brigid's eve.

4770037/4768480/4816793.text:

lived where Grattans field is now There was a tree near his house and apples grew on it. One day a tinker came to the door begging. He told her that he had nothing for her. She persevered at him and he got a knife and cut her throat. The splatters fell on the apples and ever since they are red to the core. Ever since it is called the red apple tree Grattans field is about a mile from Portlaoighise on the mountrath roadFrom Mr. Hartford,      Sean MacComáisGrattan St.                Sráid MicReaccain

4742161/4741086/4818892.title: A Collection of Prayers
4742161/4741086/4818892.text: "God save all here" when a person is coming into a house."God bless your work" said when passing by a person at work."May you never see a poor day" said by a person when receiving some assistance."May the Heavens be four bed" said in gratitude."The light of Heaven be to his soul" said when a person dies."God spare you your health" said to a person who helps you in some work."May God leave you your eye sight" said when a person finds a lost article.A childs bed time prayer:-There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over head.St Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on.Another prayer;-O Mary, my mother, under thy mantle, I take refuge, there to live and die.  O Mary, my mother deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing.Gentle Jesus, meek and mild, look on me a little child, Pity mine and pity me, suffer me to come to thee.

4742170/4741891/4822485.title: Folklore - The Old Graveyards
4742170/4741891/4822485.text:
There are three graveyards in this locality. One is situated in Pollardstown another is situated in Rathbride and a third is situated in Milltown.Rathbride Churchyard is not used now. Pollardstown graveyard is used by a few families while Miltown graveyard is used by all the people of the district.The ruins of a Church can still be seen in Pollardstown graveyard. There was never a Church in Rathbride graveyard.The graveyard in Rathbride slopes towards the middle where there is a hollow. The other two are level. There are a few tombs and iron crosses in them but they are not very old.Signed: - E. TiernanMilltown, Droichead Nua, Co. Kildare.



When starting work each morning some people say the following short prayer. O my God give me the grace to perform my daily task faithfully, and if any temptations  be set before me this day, sweet Jesus give me the grace to overcome them all. When we are in trouble we should say Dear Jesus Thou hast given me many a good hour, my moment for trouble is not at hand, my God help me to bear those troubles patiently, the Lord has
(continues on next page)

4742170/4741892/4822490.title: Prayers
4742170/4741892/4822490.text:
(continued from previous page)
given, the Lord has taken away, blessed be the name of the Lord.In sickness and Pain. Lord, Thy will be done, I take this for my sins, I offer up to Thee my sufferings, together with all my Saviour has suffered for me, and I beg of Thee through his sufferings to have mercy on me, Free me from this illness and pain if thou wilt, and if it be for my good. Thou lovest me too much, to let me suffer unless it be for my good. Therefore O Lord, I trust myself to Thee, do with me as Thou pleasest. In sickness and in health I wish to love Thee always. I got those prayers from my aunt.



I learned the following prayers at home from my mother and some of them she learned from her mother when she was young. The following prayer is to be said in bed with a hand on each shoulder resembling the sign of the cross. I must die, I dont know when or how or where, but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever. Oh Jesus have mercy on me. I learned another prayer at home which must be said three times. Blessed St Rock patron of the sick preserve me this night from all sickness and maladies. I also learned the following prayer. Oh Jesus of Nazareth. King of the Jews preserve me this night from a sudden death.I got my information from my mother.

4742170/4742021/4822662.title: Folklore - Food in Olden Times
4742170/4742021/4822662.text:
(continued from previous page)
many eggs on Sunday, and most people have lamb for dinner or that day. On Shrove Tuesday it is a custom to have pancakes for the tea. On Michaelmas Day, many people have the flesh of a goose for dinner. It is about seventy years ago, since tea was first drunk in my locality. Before cups became common, the old people drank out of wooden mugs, which they used to call goblets. In most places, the tables were hung up by the wall, when they were not in use. When the old people finished their last meal every night, they would stay around the table telling stories until late in the night.I got this information from my father.



Now I wake and see the light. God has kept me through the night. Make me good O God I pray. Guide and guard me night and day.I got this prayer from my mother.Mrs. Mary Clinton (age 44 years)Dunbyrne, Kilmeague, Naas, Co. Kildare

4798692/4790684/4823450.title: Collection of Prayers
4798692/4790684/4823450.text:
My grandmother gave me this prayer.   She used always say it.  The name of the prayer was prayer against the loss of time.  "O my Lord Jesus, I will use time.  It will be too late to pray when life is over.  There is no prayer in the grave, there is no meriting in purgatory.  Low as I am in thy all Holy sight, I am strong in thee, strong through thy Immaculate Mother, through thy Saints, and thus I can do much for the church, for the world, for all I love.  Let me bring everything before thee asking thy leave for everything I purpose.  Thy blessing on everything I do.  As the dial speaks of the sun so will I be ruled by thee alone.  If thou will take me and rule me.  Be it so my Lord, Jesus, I give myself wholly to thee."  At home we always say these aspirations.  When awakening in the morning I say, "God be thankful for having kept me safe through this night."  When getting up I say, "O Mary my Mother guide and protect me through this day."  When starting I say "God almighty direct me to the best this day."  When going on
(continues on next page)

4798694/4790722/4823638.title: Composition - Local Prayers
4798694/4790722/4823638.text: Long ago people were not as well educated as they are now and did not have any books.  Some of the poorer people were not able to read books and they therefore said prayers, which they made themselves, at Mass and other times during the day.  The following prayer which is very old was said after awaking in the morning and is as follows:-"I thank the great God for having brought me safe the night.  May He bring me safe through the day and keep me in the blessed and holy state of grace and in the ways of salvation,  Sweet heavenly Father Amen."  If a man were going on a journey at night or any other time he would bless himself and say "May God be with me and direct me on this journey and keep me safe from all accident, Amen".When going to bed at night the following prayer was said.  "O my God, I must die, I don't know when were or how.  O my God, you who knows it, grant me the grace to die a holy and a happy death and never to die in mortal sin. Amen.  The following prayer was often said also "Mother of mercy, Mother of grace.  Mary help a fallow vase [?], shield us when the foe is nigh and recieve us when we die. Amen."

Paidear roimh Dhul a chodhla chun ná beadh tromluighe ort.Anna, Máthair Muire; Muire Máthair Chríost, Eilisabet, Máthair Eóin Baiste, Crann ar a crochadh Críost, cuirimse iad san idir me a's chnaisde na leabthan, 'om shaoradh ar an dtromluighe.



Paidéar le Rádh Lá Coille.Úrnaighthe a múineadh im leanbh dom féin Is me im' dhúiseacht le duthracht ar gairm na n-éan,Mo ghlúin dheas a leigint chúgham ag guidheachtaint chun Dé, Is chun an Úr Mhac a bhí go túirseach ag sileadh as an ngéig. Rí na nAsbol is na nAingeal is a bháb na gcléirRí na nAsbol do bhaisteadh 'na leanbh gan áireamh bliadhan,Miasma loirgimse ort a Mhic Athair na nGrast bí fial,Tabair an trócaire dom anam is maith dom ar dearnas riamh.

4798671/4788921/4823824.text: As I lie on my right hand side,I pray to God to be my guide. If any evil comes to happen me, The Blessed Virgin Mary keep it awayfrom me.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAnd if I die in mortal sin,I'm lost forever more Amen.

4798671/4788922/4823825.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said When Lying Down at Night
4798671/4788922/4823825.text:
Oh God I know I have to die. I don't when or where or how, or what time. but if I die in the state of mortal sin, I'm lost forever. Sweet Jesus have mercy on me.Amen



As I lie down on this bed to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,As there are four corners on my bed,There are four bright angels over head,St Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,And if I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take.

4798671/4788922/4823829.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said When Lying Down at Night
4798671/4788922/4823829.text:
Oh God I know I have to die. I don't when or where or how, or what time. but if I die in the state of mortal sin, I'm lost forever. Sweet Jesus have mercy on me.Amen



As I lie down on this bed to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,As there are four corners on my bed,There are four bright angels over head,St Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,And if I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take.

4798671/4788923/4823840.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayers
4798671/4788923/4823840.text: (Night is SMay the will of God be done by us,May the death of saints be won by us,And the light of the Kingdom begun in us!May Jesus the child be beside my bedMay the Lamb of Mercy uplift my headMay the Virgin Mary her brightness shed,And (Michel) Michael be steward of my soulGiven by Frank Wallace

4798671/4788924/4823844.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788924/4823844.text:
Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on.There are four corners to my bedFour bright angels round my headOne to sing, one to pray.And two to carry my soul away.



O Lord of heaven, wherever I be,My heart and soul I give unto Thee,Blessed be Thy five bleeding wounds, which were nailed to a tree.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.

4798671/4788924/4823848.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788924/4823848.text:
Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on.There are four corners to my bedFour bright angels round my headOne to sing, one to pray.And two to carry my soul away.



O Lord of heaven, wherever I be,My heart and soul I give unto Thee,Blessed be Thy five bleeding wounds, which were nailed to a tree.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.

4798671/4788925/4823852.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788925/4823852.text:
All praises and prayers,I lay at thy feet.O Virgin of Virgins,O Mary most sweet.Be thou my true guideThrough this pilgrimage here.And stand by my side,When death draweth near.



As I rise up from this bed of sleep,To adore my God, and to labour for the salvation of my own soul.O Lord, clothe my soul with an nuptial robe of charity, that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy Judgement seat. Through Christ
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788925/4823857.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788925/4823857.text:
All praises and prayers,I lay at thy feet.O Virgin of Virgins,O Mary most sweet.Be thou my true guideThrough this pilgrimage here.And stand by my side,When death draweth near.



As I rise up from this bed of sleep,To adore my God, and to labour for the salvation of my own soul.O Lord, clothe my soul with an nuptial robe of charity, that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy Judgement seat. Through Christ
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788926/4823859.title: Old Irish Prayers - Morning Prayer
4798671/4788926/4823859.text:
(continued from previous page)
Life is short and death is sureThe hour of death remains obscureA soul you have and only one,If that be lost all hope is goneWaste no time while time shall last;For after death 'tis ever past,All-seeing God your judge shall be,And heaven or hell your destiny,All earthly things shall speed awayEternity alone will stay.



Waste no time while time shall last;For after death 'tis ever past,All-seeing God your judge shall be,And heaven or hell your destiny,All earthly things shall speed awayEternity alone will stay.

4798671/4788927/4823865.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788927/4823865.text:
O jesus if I die to-night,I do not know when nor where noe how,But if I die in mortal sin, I am lost for ever,O jesus have mercy on me.



Infant Jesus meek and mild.Look on me a little child.Pity mine and pity me.Suffer me to come to Thee.Heart of Jesus I adore theeHeart of Mary I implore thee.Heart of Joseph pure and justIn those three hearts I put my trust Amen.

4798671/4788927/4823881.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788927/4823881.text:
O jesus if I die to-night,I do not know when nor where noe how,But if I die in mortal sin, I am lost for ever,O jesus have mercy on me.



Infant Jesus meek and mild.Look on me a little child.Pity mine and pity me.Suffer me to come to Thee.Heart of Jesus I adore theeHeart of Mary I implore thee.Heart of Joseph pure and justIn those three hearts I put my trust Amen.

4798671/4788928/4823889.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer Said After Going to Bed
4798671/4788928/4823889.text:
When in bed, I think of Jesus,and my arms I fold like the cross.Jesus, Mary and Joeseph, I would give you my heart and my soul.Amen.



I.N.R.I Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews assist me from a sudden and unprovided death.Five bleeding wounds (wounds) nailed to a tree,O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me,My heart and my soul I resign unto Thee.Five bleeding wounds nailed to a tree,O crucified Jesus have pity on me.Amen.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788928/4823890.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer Said After Going to Bed
4798671/4788928/4823890.text:
When in bed, I think of Jesus,and my arms I fold like the cross.Jesus, Mary and Joeseph, I would give you my heart and my soul.Amen.



I.N.R.I Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews assist me from a sudden and unprovided death.Five bleeding wounds (wounds) nailed to a tree,O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me,My heart and my soul I resign unto Thee.Five bleeding wounds nailed to a tree,O crucified Jesus have pity on me.Amen.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788929/4823895.title: Old Irish Prayers - Another Prayer Said at Night
4798671/4788929/4823895.text:
(continued from previous page)
Eibhlín Ní SearcaighCluánfadaDún-Gár



Welcome Infant Jesus, from your home on high,Now in Bethlehem's stable 'mid the straw you lie,Poor and weak and helpless on a cold, damp floor,You the God of heaven, angel hosts adore,Welcome, Infant Jesus, to this earth all drear,Love has brought you to us,Love will keep you here,With Mary and with Joseph while the angels sing,Kneeling we adore Thee,Jesus Infant King.

4798671/4788930/4823902.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Morning Prayer
4798671/4788930/4823902.text:
I put my trust forever,O Mary pure in thee,Then show thyself a mother,And daily succour me,And when death's hand shall touch me,Thy pity I implore,Oh lead me dearest mother,To God forever moreAmen



Live Jesus so in meThat all I do, be done by TheeAll that I do or think or sayMay be for thee alone todayEach beat of heart and breath of mineMay thee sweet Jesus always
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788930/4823905.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Morning Prayer
4798671/4788930/4823905.text:
I put my trust forever,O Mary pure in thee,Then show thyself a mother,And daily succour me,And when death's hand shall touch me,Thy pity I implore,Oh lead me dearest mother,To God forever moreAmen



Live Jesus so in meThat all I do, be done by TheeAll that I do or think or sayMay be for thee alone todayEach beat of heart and breath of mineMay thee sweet Jesus always
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788932/4823910.title: Old Irish Prayers - When Clothing Yourself
4798671/4788932/4823910.text:
O my God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy judgement seat. Amen



Blessed be the Holy and undivided Trinity now and evermore.Amen



I will now with the Divine assistance rise from this bed of sleep adore and serve God and labour for the salvation of my soulGrant O my God that I may rise on the last day to life everlasting.

4798671/4788932/4823911.title: Old Irish Prayers - When Clothing Yourself
4798671/4788932/4823911.text:
O my God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy judgement seat. Amen



Blessed be the Holy and undivided Trinity now and evermore.Amen



I will now with the Divine assistance rise from this bed of sleep adore and serve God and labour for the salvation of my soulGrant O my God that I may rise on the last day to life everlasting.

4798671/4788932/4823912.title: Old Irish Prayers - When Clothing Yourself
4798671/4788932/4823912.text:
O my God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy judgement seat. Amen



Blessed be the Holy and undivided Trinity now and evermore.Amen



I will now with the Divine assistance rise from this bed of sleep adore and serve God and labour for the salvation of my soulGrant O my God that I may rise on the last day to life everlasting.

4798671/4788933/4823920.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Morning Prayer
4798671/4788933/4823920.text: 1) While morning's rose and gold are heavenly fair,Before my crucifix I kneel in prayer,For now I may give Him this day,With all its joys, its trials and anxious care.2) To this sure refuge I may freely go The love that knows the things I do not know,Knows my poor heart and will not partWith my love-gift because He loves me so.

4798671/4788934/4823928.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer in the Morning to the Crucifix
4798671/4788934/4823928.text: The hands of Christ S seem very frailFor they were broken by a nailBut only they reach heaven at lastWhom these frail broken hands hold fast

4798671/4788935/4823929.title: Old Irish Prayers - Morning Prayer
4798671/4788935/4823929.text: O God thou hast through the nightWatched me with fathers care.I praise thee with the morning light.For all the blessings that I share. Protect me still throughout the day, From sin, from evil, from distress.And what I think, or do, or say.Do thou, o best of fathers blessAngel of God to thee I prayBe with me where I go this dayOh Mary pray, before God's throneFor me to Jesus Christ, thy sonWhose name in love we all adoreTo whom be praise for evermore "Amen"

4798671/4788936/4823931.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said Before Hearing Mass
4798671/4788936/4823931.text:
I kneel down before the Holy AltarBegging pardon of the Son and of the father Oh Bleeding Lamb crowned with thornsGrant me the benefit of this day's Mass and Holy Water



As I look up, as I look down,As I look into Heaven's crownI see the Blessed Virgin Mary coming down.Twelve blessed mass books in her handTwelve blessed bells ringing,Twelve blessed priests singing.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788936/4823933.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said Before Hearing Mass
4798671/4788936/4823933.text:
I kneel down before the Holy AltarBegging pardon of the Son and of the father Oh Bleeding Lamb crowned with thornsGrant me the benefit of this day's Mass and Holy Water



As I look up, as I look down,As I look into Heaven's crownI see the Blessed Virgin Mary coming down.Twelve blessed mass books in her handTwelve blessed bells ringing,Twelve blessed priests singing.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788937/4823935.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer Said Every Day and Night
4798671/4788937/4823935.text:
(continued from previous page)
Shut the gates of Hell and open the gates of Heaven.And let all the poor suffering souls in.God bless Friday and Good Friday too.The day our Saviour was Crucified from the heart to the hand.His peaceful mother standing by,With a heavy heart and a mournful sigh.All that say this prayer three times by day, and three times by nightThe gates of hell they shall never enter in.Amen.



Iarraim-se maitheamhnas agus pardún í geomnaidhe,Ar Íosa Christ, is ar an Mhaidhean Bheannuigthe

4798671/4788938/4823966.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer to Save Us from All Sickness
4798671/4788938/4823966.text:
102A prayer to save us from all sickness.O Jesus Divine Redeemer, be merciful to us and the whole world, "Amen."O powerful God, O Holy God have pity on us, and the whole world, O pardon us and have mercy. O my Jesus during these present dangers, pour on us Thy most Precious Blood. O, Eternal Father be merciful to us and to this whol world, "Amen."By the Precious Blood of Thy only Son our Lord, be merciful to us we beseech Thee. Amen, Amen, Amen.



In the name of Our Lord and Saviour,Jesus Christ crucified, I lay me down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.Into thy hands O God I command my spirits,Lord Jesus, recieve my soul.

4798671/4788938/4823970.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer to Save Us from All Sickness
4798671/4788938/4823970.text:
102A prayer to save us from all sickness.O Jesus Divine Redeemer, be merciful to us and the whole world, "Amen."O powerful God, O Holy God have pity on us, and the whole world, O pardon us and have mercy. O my Jesus during these present dangers, pour on us Thy most Precious Blood. O, Eternal Father be merciful to us and to this whol world, "Amen."By the Precious Blood of Thy only Son our Lord, be merciful to us we beseech Thee. Amen, Amen, Amen.



In the name of Our Lord and Saviour,Jesus Christ crucified, I lay me down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.Into thy hands O God I command my spirits,Lord Jesus, recieve my soul.

4798671/4788939/4823982.title: Old Irish Prayers - To Jesus When Asking Any Request
4798671/4788939/4823982.text:
O Jesus, Thou love of my soul, succour me, I beseech Theeby those five bleeding wounds, which for my sake,Thou hast suffered on the Cross. Amen



For all my nights of perfect restMay God Who gave be thanked and blessed.Jesus Who on the cross didst dieHere on my cross less hard I lieGive me the grace this pain to bearFor Thee with patience and with prayerToo long thou will not let it lastThis night, this life, will soon be pastAnd then, In heaven with Thee, no pain, no nightBut endless life and love and light. Amen

4798671/4788939/4823986.title: Old Irish Prayers - To Jesus When Asking Any Request
4798671/4788939/4823986.text:
O Jesus, Thou love of my soul, succour me, I beseech Theeby those five bleeding wounds, which for my sake,Thou hast suffered on the Cross. Amen



For all my nights of perfect restMay God Who gave be thanked and blessed.Jesus Who on the cross didst dieHere on my cross less hard I lieGive me the grace this pain to bearFor Thee with patience and with prayerToo long thou will not let it lastThis night, this life, will soon be pastAnd then, In heaven with Thee, no pain, no nightBut endless life and love and light. Amen

4798666/4788521/4823987.title: Prayers
4798666/4788521/4823987.text:
On awakening is said."O 'my God' I thank Thee for having brought me safely through the night'."I rise from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul. O may I rise on the last day to Life everlasting." (said on rising)."O my God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy judgement seat" (said while dressing)."O my God enkindle in my soul the fire of Thy divine love" (said when lighting the fire)."All for Thee O Lord, O My Jesus All for Thee" (said when beginning work)."God direct my foot steps and grant that my journey may succeed." (said when setting out on a journey)."May Jesus give me patience" (said when inclined to anger)."May I enjoy the light of heaven" (said when lighting candle or lamp).
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788940/4823989.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said to the Blessed Sacrament
4798671/4788940/4823989.text: A Prayer said to the blessed SacramentO saving Host that Heaven's gate. Host opened at so dear a rate. Internal wars invade our breast Be thou our strength support and                                      restTo God the Father and the Son Holy Spirit three in One.Be endless praise in Him above. With life eternal crown our love.                                 Amen.                     Máire Eibhlín Ní Druraide                     Liathdruim                     Dun Gar.

4798671/4788941/4823991.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer to St Teresa
4798671/4788941/4823991.text:
A prayer to St.                    TeresaSt. Teresa. St Teresa. I comewith a whispered prayer,St. Teresa. have you rose to           spare?no pale bud do I ask of youbut a bloom that is wondrous fair.St. Teresa. St. Teresa have you     a rose to spare?                      Bridget Mahon.                        Grallaugh,                           Frenchpark.



Night Prayer.God the Father bless me.Jesus Christ defend and keep me,The virtue of the Holy Ghost enlightenand sanctify me forever                                 AmenTessie Flynn Clegernagh

4798671/4788941/4823994.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer to St Teresa
4798671/4788941/4823994.text:
A prayer to St.                    TeresaSt. Teresa. St Teresa. I comewith a whispered prayer,St. Teresa. have you rose to           spare?no pale bud do I ask of youbut a bloom that is wondrous fair.St. Teresa. St. Teresa have you     a rose to spare?                      Bridget Mahon.                        Grallaugh,                           Frenchpark.



Night Prayer.God the Father bless me.Jesus Christ defend and keep me,The virtue of the Holy Ghost enlightenand sanctify me forever                                 AmenTessie Flynn Clegernagh

4798671/4788942/4823998.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer
4798671/4788942/4823998.text:
A crown of twelve stars around Mary you'll see,If for twelve days you'll pray faithfully,Each day is a star,Each star is a prayer,Wont you make a crown for our queen so fair?



Another day is endedHow many more to liveAlas too many wastedMay God forgive, forgive.

4798671/4788942/4824001.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer
4798671/4788942/4824001.text:
A crown of twelve stars around Mary you'll see,If for twelve days you'll pray faithfully,Each day is a star,Each star is a prayer,Wont you make a crown for our queen so fair?



Another day is endedHow many more to liveAlas too many wastedMay God forgive, forgive.

4823687/4790838/4824004.title: Prayers
4823687/4790838/4824004.text:
Oh my God clothe my soul with a nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure and just and undefiled and grant that I may do my work well for thy sake to-day. Grant that I may love thee always and keep me from sin and lead me straight on to a happy eternity. Amen.At Night.In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ bless me and Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to life everlasting. Amen.Oh: Lord Jesus Christ whose unwearied eye neither slumber nor sleeps but continually watches over us in defence of Thy Service. Take me and mine I beseech Thee into the holy protection and grant that while my body is asleep my soul may be awake to Thee. Amen.The Peace of our Lord Jesus Christ. The
(continues on next page)

4823687/4790841/4824005.title: Prayers
4823687/4790841/4824005.text:
Holy Mary meek and mild pray for me a little child.Good morning good Jesus good morning bright day Jesus direct me on the right way my soul to save my body from shame I rise and get up in God's holy name.Jesus meek and Jesus mild look on me a little child Pity mine and pity me Suffer us to come to thee.I.N.R.I. Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jues preserve us from a sudden and unprovided deathJesus are you coming Jesus are you there with my curly head bent this is my wee prayer. Jesus Lord I love you I am listening to you for your gentle voice to whisper Little child I love you tooO Jesus I must die I don't know when nor where nor how but if I die on mortal sin I am lost forever O Jesus
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788943/4824006.title: Prayer for the Holy Souls
4798671/4788943/4824006.text:
Lord God almighty I be-seech Thee by the precious blood which Thy divine Son Jesus shed in the garden, deliver the souls in purgatory and amongst them all expecially that soul which is most destitute of aid, and bring it to Thy glory, there to praise and bless Thee for ever. Amen?



Lord, grant that the Greater harvest which we came on earth to saveMay be golden and ripe for reaping Ere we go to the lonely grave.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788943/4824008.title: Prayer for the Holy Souls
4798671/4788943/4824008.text:
Lord God almighty I be-seech Thee by the precious blood which Thy divine Son Jesus shed in the garden, deliver the souls in purgatory and amongst them all expecially that soul which is most destitute of aid, and bring it to Thy glory, there to praise and bless Thee for ever. Amen?



Lord, grant that the Greater harvest which we came on earth to saveMay be golden and ripe for reaping Ere we go to the lonely grave.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788944/4824014.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Harvest Prayer
4798671/4788944/4824014.text:
(continued from previous page)
That our souls in the last dread AutumnMay be clean as the hill and lea,When we bring lives grain to the haggardAnd offer it all to TheeGot from my Grandmother



Lord God almighty I beseech thee, by the precious blood which Thy divine Son Shed on this day upon the wood of the cross from His most Sacret hands and feet deliver the souls in purgatory and especially that soul for which I am most bound to pray for that the blame may rest not with me.That thou bringest it forthwith to praise thee in thy glory and to bless Thee forever Amen

4798671/4788945/4824016.title: A Prayer for the Holy Souls
4798671/4788945/4824016.text:
Lord God almighty, I be-seech Thee by the precious blood which Thy divine Son Jesus shed in His cruel scourging deliver the souls in purgatory and amongst them all especially that soul which is nearest to its enterance into Thy glory that so it may soon begin to praise and bless Thee forever. Amen.



Gods minuteI have only just a minute.Only sixty seconds in it.Forced upon me, cant refuse it.Didn't seek it, didn't choose it.But its up to me to use it.I must suffer if I lose itGive account if I abuse itJust a tiny little minuteBut Eternity is in it.Áine Ní GlacainMullach Na SidheCaisleáin Riabach

4798671/4788945/4824017.title: A Prayer for the Holy Souls
4798671/4788945/4824017.text:
Lord God almighty, I be-seech Thee by the precious blood which Thy divine Son Jesus shed in His cruel scourging deliver the souls in purgatory and amongst them all especially that soul which is nearest to its enterance into Thy glory that so it may soon begin to praise and bless Thee forever. Amen.



Gods minuteI have only just a minute.Only sixty seconds in it.Forced upon me, cant refuse it.Didn't seek it, didn't choose it.But its up to me to use it.I must suffer if I lose itGive account if I abuse itJust a tiny little minuteBut Eternity is in it.Áine Ní GlacainMullach Na SidheCaisleáin Riabach

4798671/4788946/4824020.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said Before Retiring
4798671/4788946/4824020.text:
Jesus is condemed to die,God, through sin, I crucify,Lord who died for love of me,Help me live and die with Thee,Jesus bears the bitter cross,Bear Him up in grief and loss,Jesus falls in blood and woe,Sins of mine have struck Him low,Son and mother meet in pain,Must they grieve for me in vain?Simon helps to bear the load,Lead me too along Thy road,On a cloth He prints his face,In my soul Thine image trace,Struck to earth again by me,Help me rise and follow Thee,"Weep for sin" He tells us here,Jesus make my grief sincere,
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788948/4824021.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer for the Holy Souls
4798671/4788948/4824021.text: 1. O Jesus pity those poor soulsWho burn in cleansing fireTo soon behold you face to faceIs now their one desireThey cannot help themselves todayAnd so they seek our aidThat their admittance to your heartBe not Too long delayed2.Hear then our prayers for them Those soulsAre to you very dearOur relatives perhaps or friendsWho once were with us hereNow suffering in devouring flamesThey long for sweet releaseOh Jesus grant those Holy SoulsEternal rest and peace.

4798671/4788949/4824023.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788949/4824023.text:
In the name of our Lord and Saviour,Jesus Christ crucified I lay me down to restBless me O Lord after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to life and everlasting happiness Amen.



O Sacred Heart, beloved KingI long to love Thee moreTo live for Thee, my dearest GuestAnd find in Thee eternal restWhen this short life is o'er

4798671/4788949/4824025.title: Old Irish Prayers - Night Prayer
4798671/4788949/4824025.text:
In the name of our Lord and Saviour,Jesus Christ crucified I lay me down to restBless me O Lord after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to life and everlasting happiness Amen.



O Sacred Heart, beloved KingI long to love Thee moreTo live for Thee, my dearest GuestAnd find in Thee eternal restWhen this short life is o'er

4798671/4788950/4824026.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer Said at Mass
4798671/4788950/4824026.text: There is one true and only God our Maker and our LordAnd he created everything by his almighty wordAll this and all the church does teach my God I do believeFor Thou has bid us here the church and Thou canst not deceiveBut in this one and only God there yet are persons threeThe Father Son and Holy Ghost one blessed Trinity

4798671/4788951/4824027.title: Old Irish Prayers - Comfort When Dying
4798671/4788951/4824027.text: IJesus Heart is your true refugeTo Him you can always fleeEven when your hopes are sinkingHe will then a true friend be.2He will soothe your lonely spiritHe will love and bless and say.Come to me and I will comfortYou to-day and every day.3My own sweet Immaculate mother,When deaths dreary shadows draw nigh.Wilt thou come from thy throne in the HeavensAnd teach me thy-self how to die.4Oh come by Saint Joseph attendedLet me hear the sweet tones of thy voice.Saying now that my exile is endedThe time is at hand to rejoice.5Bring me home to the heart of thy masterTo the land overflowing with bliss.Where my joys shall be deep and undyingTo repay all my sorrows in this.

4798671/4788952/4824030.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer to Christ the King of All
4798671/4788952/4824030.text:
O Jesus! I acknowlege thee as the King of all.Whatsoever has been created for TheeExercise thy rights over me.I renew my baptismal vows renouncing SatanWith all of his works and pomps.And promising to live as a good christianI pledge myself especially to promote as far as in me liesThe triumph of Gods rights and those of Thy church.



Merciful Jesus, Lover of Souls I pray Thee by the agony of Thy most Sacred Heart, and by the woes of thy Immaculate Mother of sorrow's, wash in Thy Blood the sinners of the whole world who are now in their agony, and who are to die this day. Amen.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788952/4824033.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer to Christ the King of All
4798671/4788952/4824033.text:
O Jesus! I acknowlege thee as the King of all.Whatsoever has been created for TheeExercise thy rights over me.I renew my baptismal vows renouncing SatanWith all of his works and pomps.And promising to live as a good christianI pledge myself especially to promote as far as in me liesThe triumph of Gods rights and those of Thy church.



Merciful Jesus, Lover of Souls I pray Thee by the agony of Thy most Sacred Heart, and by the woes of thy Immaculate Mother of sorrow's, wash in Thy Blood the sinners of the whole world who are now in their agony, and who are to die this day. Amen.
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788953/4824035.title: Old Irish Prayers - Prayer for Those in Their Agony
4798671/4788953/4824035.text:
(continued from previous page)
[/]



Do you not remember when we wandered hand in handAnd chased our lengthening shadows across the evening landAh all who played together along that river sideStill linked in living friendship I am the one who diedI am the one forgotten (departed but) departed long but how I need your prayer and pityI need your friendship now.

4798671/4788954/4824036.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Night Prayer
4798671/4788954/4824036.text:
O God the Father, bless me.Jesus Christ defend and keep me.the virtue of the Holy Ghost enlighten and sanctify me this night and for ever. Amen.Into thy hands, O Lord, I commend my spirit. Lord Jesus, receive my soul,Live, Jesus, live and let it beMy life to die for love of thee.



May the christ child bless your labourMay his grace dispel all fearsRichly crown you with His favourGuide you through the coming years

4798671/4788955/4824054.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Morning Prayer
4798671/4788955/4824054.text:
Come to Jesus little children.Come to Him this very day.Bend upon your knees before Him.He will teach you how to pray.Come to Jesus for he loves you.He is so great so kind so good.Come to Jesus He will wash you.In His own most precious blood.Blessed Jesus love and cleanse us.Make our little hearts all whiteNever take Thy Spirit from usTill we love and serve Thee right.Amen.



Thy blood was broken and Thy blood was shed for us grant us O sweet Jesus that we who recieve Thee in this Holy sacrament may ever believe in Thee and Hope in Thee and love Thee more and more.Amen.
(continues on next page)

(continued from previous page)

In the name of Our Lord Jesus crucified I lay me down to rest Bless the repose I am going to take that by renewing my daily strength I may be better enabled to serve Thee through Christ Our Lord Amen.



Oh Heavenly King of Kings Let all the world adore thee.And to the son who died for me and spilt his blood to safe meUnto the Redeemer I humble pray Let this be my devoution. To guard me in my dying hourSweet Jesus, Mary, Joseph.

4798671/4788957/4824097.text:
I am the Lord and thou shalt serve no other Gods but meReligion truth thou shalt obey Faith Hope and CharityThou shalt not curse or take revenge nor hate thy enemyForgive and love for Jesus sake all that have injured thee



O most rich, O most wise, and most merciful Queen, I see that show knows far better than I do the wants of my soul and that thou lovest me far more than I can love thee. Know, then, the grace for which I now ask thee; obtain me the grace which thou knowest to be the most expedient

4798671/4788960/4824152.title: Old Irish Prayers - A Prayer
4798671/4788960/4824152.text: O Loving Lord, A thousant welcomes.O Son of Mary I love you. Indeed I do.Who am I at all that You should come next or near me.O God of heaven make a little corner for me in your heart and never while there is life in me let me loose my place there.And after death may I still hide there.

4798671/4788961/4824154.title: Old Irish Prayers - In the Morning
4798671/4788961/4824154.text:
My father God, I wake to TheeAll Thy commandments to fulfilAssist me that in heaven with TheeI may for ever do Thy will



Now while I dress me, I would pray,That Thou wouldst keep me all the dayIn virtue's path, Thy will to doTo strive for heaven, and good pursue.



Assist the souls in Purgatory through this most Holy Sacrifice
(continues on next page)

4798671/4788963/4824160.title: Old Irish Prayers - O Mary Blest
4798671/4788963/4824160.text: O Mary Blest a Mother be to meFor who in heaven or earth can find A Mother half so good and kind think Mother blest.That thine own son divineWhen nailed upon his cross on high For me he was about to dieMade thee his mother mineO thou who are in heaven atHis right hand obtain that I again may see my parents dear with him and thee in that bright happy land.

O Jesus pity those poor souls,Who burn in cleansing fireTo soon behold You face to faceIs now their one desire.They cannot help themselves to-daytAnd so they seek our aid,That their admittance to Your HeartBe not too long delayed.Hear they now hear our prayers for themThose souls that are to You so dearOr relatives, perhaps our friendsWho once were with us hereNow suffering in devouring flamesThey long for sweet release.
(continues on next page)

4798672/4789087/4922448.title: A Prayer
4798672/4789087/4922448.text:
O Jesus this hour I give to TheeFor all the past pardon meFor out of the world I must departO save me in thy Sacred Heart, Amen.



There are four corners on my bedThere are four Angels on them spreadMatthew Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie onIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take Amen.

4798672/4789088/4922450.title: A Prayer to the Holy Cross of Christ
4798672/4789088/4922450.text:
Oh adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ dying on cross for our sins altogether.Oh holy cross of Christ see how I believe in Thee,Oh holy cross of Christ stir up in me all good and truthOh holy cross of Christ that I will be in the right way of happinessOh holy cross of Christ warn me from all danger death and Sin also give me lifeOh Crucified Jesus of Nazareth have mercy on me now and for ever more.In honor of Jesus Christ bring us in the right path to heaven.True as Jesus was born on Christmas day in a stable at Bethlehem,Here as Jesus was circumised on New Years dayTrue as He ascended into Heaven on the 40th day.So in honor of Jesus spare us from our enemies
(continues on next page)

4798672/4789090/4922451.title: Prayer Never Known to Fail
4798672/4789090/4922451.text: O Eternal Father I offer thee the precious blood of Jeasus through the Immaculate Heart of Mary in satisfaction for my sins and for the relief of the soul of the Priest most neglected in Purgatory.O holy soul obtain for me the favour I implore if it be the holy will of God.This prayer should be said fifteen times on each day for thirty days, and you must receive on three consecutive Sundays.I got this prayer from my Mother.

Oh Son of Mary I love you.Indeed I do.Who am I at all, that you should come next or near me?O God of Heaven, make a little corner for me in Your heart.And never while there is life in me let me lose my place there,And after death may I still hide there. Amen.Have pity on me O Blessed Mother?Talk to my God for me.Tell him Im a poor ignorant creature.Full of sin and misery.But that I love you His own dear Mother;That I am a poor servant and for your sweet

4758574/4755988/4923259.title: A Collection of Prayers - Local Prayer
4758574/4755988/4923259.text:
Hail and blessed be the hour and moment, on which the Son Of God was born of the most pure Vergin Mary, at midnight in Bethlehem in piercing cold.At that same hour vouchsafe O Lord, to hear our prayers and grant our requests.This prayer is said by many people for some days preceding Christmas, and some persons try to have it said four thousand times before Christmas Day, in memory of the 4,000 years the world was waiting for the coming of the Messias.May Jesus, Mary and Joseph, make our home like the home of Nazareth. Our hearts like thy own hearts. And bring us all from our home on earth, to our true home beyond the skies.There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels overhead. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, Goo bless this bed that I lie on. I lay my body down to sleep. I pray to God my soul to keep. And if I die before I wake. I pray to God my soul to take.
(continues on next page)

287were called "nailers" and that is why we have such names as "Nailer Mahon"Pottery-work was carried on in Crenane, long ago. Crocks and other such vessels were made of clay which was used to be found in that district.An Old PrayerMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I onAnd if I die before I wake,I pray to thee my soul to take.

An Old PrayerHoly Mary, bless me, forgive me and keep me from all the harm until he end. Amen.

4798682/4789963/4923361.title: An Old Prayer
4798682/4789963/4923361.text: 300An Old PrayerBarony: Costello County: RoscommonRelated By: Mrs Downes, 80 yearsAddress: BallaghaderreenWritten By: Louis FrainAddress: BallaghaderreenAge: 12 yrsDate: 20-6-1938Holy Mary, Mother of God,Bless me until I am under the sod,Bless my father and bless my son, Bless me until the battle is won.

4798684/4789972/4923404.title: A Prayer
4798684/4789972/4923404.text: A PrayerAs I lay down to rest, I pray to God my soul to bless, four corners on my bed, four angels on them spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on Christ Jesus bless me while upon this bed I lie. If I die before I awake I pray to God my soul to take, Amen. Pupil. Michael O'Donnell. Ardcull, BallaghaderreenFrom - Michael Ryan, CastlecalhareThis is a prayer which was said in olden times If a person had dust in his eye"O Blessed Virgin, I give my eye to thee to take out the dust as I have failed myself."When saying this prayer sign of the cross was made over the eye. The eye was shut for a few minutes to show confidence in the prayer. When the eye was opened the dust had vanished. It was believed that if this prayer was well said the Blessed Virgin would assist the person.

4798684/4789973/4923405.title: A Prayer
4798684/4789973/4923405.text: A prayer said before going to sleep.There are four corners on my bed. Four blessed angles round them spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on. When I lie down to rest I give my soul to God to bless, and when I lie down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil thing comes to hurt or harm me may the Blessed Virgin Mary awaken me. Amen

Luighim síos an trí onóir glórmhar An Maighdean Muire agus an Naomh Ioseip.  A aingeal caomhdeacht ag deanamh treó dhom fe'n brat beannuigthe an Maigdean na Glórmhar. Leanbh Íosa ag luigheadh l'em leabaidh liom ar treó an trócaire eirighid ar maidin linn. Micheál Naomhtha agus a dhá láimh ar leaththadh linn is Micheál Ioseip ar saor ár n-anama.



Dia dhuit a Máthair, Dia is Muire duit a grádh geal in a codhlaidhtí a máthair ní headh grádh geal daoinibh ar sin atáim se bheith mé a grádh geal agus ní bréig. Cé híoch agus mo corp dul a rarc caol dogh. Cé dearg a lámha athair criochán Críost ó bfhuil uaisle do croidhe do sileadh. Cé direach in aisce sin trí uair leabaidh suan, faghaid sé flaitheas Dé marbhughadh agus ní raghaidh sé go h-Ifrinn riamh go bráth.



Cros an Aingeal ar an leabaidh a luighim, cros dá grástaig ar láithreach croidhe agam. Portach
(continues on next page)

4742098/4735717/4924371.title: Prayers - In Bed
4742098/4735717/4924371.text:
Oh Mary Immaculate Mother of Jesus offer we beseech thee to thy Divine Son his precious Blood to prevent Mortal Sin this this half hour somewhere in this world Live, Jesus, live in me that all I do be done by Thee that what I think and do and say may be your thoughts and words to day. Mrs. MacDowney The Cottages



My God I offer up this dayThrough Mary's heart to TheeMy thoughts, words, prayers and all that mayBe done or borne to meAll, all to gain thy Hearts desiresOh, light in mine its heavenly firesMrs McCarthyDerrahSneem[over 90.]



I love you my Jesus I love youMy dear little Brother so sweetYou will come to my heart in the morningI shall lay all my cares at your feetI shall know that your Great heart is throbbingQuite close to the Heart in my breast
(continues on next page)
