(continued from previous page)
Oh stay with me Jesus foreverAway from you there is no rest.Mrs. McCarthy Derrah,Sneem [over 90]



Oh Angel["u" struck out]s, blessed Angel["u" struck out]s, fly swiftly down to meFor my Lord and God is comingIn my Heart to beI want to make Him happy all the time that he is hereSo come and help me to love him Angel["u" struck out]s dearOh make a tent all round me with your white and shining wingsThat I may fix my eyes on him and shut out other thingsAnd bring with your harps of gold and silver trumpets clearAnd play sweet tunes and sing sweet songs To please him Ange["u" struck out]s dear



Come Jesus my dear one then hastenTo come to your poor sinnerAnd by your example so lowly may I become gentle and mild.



I believe just because you have said it
(continues on next page)

4742098/4735718/4924378.title: Prayers - Before Communion
4742098/4735718/4924378.text:
(continued from previous page)
Oh stay with me Jesus foreverAway from you there is no rest.Mrs. McCarthy Derrah,Sneem [over 90]



Oh Angel["u" struck out]s, blessed Angel["u" struck out]s, fly swiftly down to meFor my Lord and God is comingIn my Heart to beI want to make Him happy all the time that he is hereSo come and help me to love him Angel["u" struck out]s dearOh make a tent all round me with your white and shining wingsThat I may fix my eyes on him and shut out other thingsAnd bring with your harps of gold and silver trumpets clearAnd play sweet tunes and sing sweet songs To please him Ange["u" struck out]s dear



Come Jesus my dear one then hastenTo come to your poor sinnerAnd by your example so lowly may I become gentle and mild.



I believe just because you have said it
(continues on next page)

4742099/4735860/4924699.title: Paidrín a Deirtear nuair a Chloistear Clog an Aifrinn
4742099/4735860/4924699.text:
ó! a Thighearnabog mo chosa go bog cun Aifrinn,bog mo bhéal cun na mbréitre mbeannuighthe,Árduig mo smaointe is m’ aigne,Is díbir uaim na gníomharta malluighthe



Ar eagla an abha so bheith doimhin,A Rí na Foidhne, glach mo lámhAr eagla an tuile bheith tréanA Mhuire! Féach is ná Fág.



“Molaomaoid Íosa CríostMolamaoid Dia de síor a’s de gnáthÓ, a Tigearna, go molaidh Tú sinnIs go ngabaidh Tú sinn it lámhaibbhMar níl toradh le maoidheamh againnAcht toradh an Ríogh d’Fuiling a pháis.”

4742099/4735863/4924713.title: Sláinte
4742099/4735863/4924713.text: Sláinte abhfuil láithreachIs a gcapaid go léirIs gura fearr beam amáireachNá ar maidhean indéSláinte agus cabhair agus dealbh go deo na rabhas

4798699/4791294/4924852.title: Prayers
4798699/4791294/4924852.text: "Matthew, Martin, Luke and John,Bless this bed I lie upon,And if I die before I wake,Pray to God my soul to take"This prayer should be said going to bed."And now I lay me down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take"This prayer should be said going to bed.Little Flower show thy power all for Jesus' sake.This prayer should be said in the morning.Mary My mother keep me from mortal end venial sin this night and day.This prayer should be said in the morning.

4798699/4791297/4924857.title: Old Prayers
4798699/4791297/4924857.text: There are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels overhead.  St. Mattew Mark Luke and John.  God bless the bed that I lay on.  If any evil comes over me may the blessed Virgin Mary may take it away from me.  Lord by the branch Mary by the flowers God may assist me now and in my last dying hours.

4798709/4792247/4925148.title: (no title)
4798709/4792247/4925148.text:
(continued from previous page)
words and so on from child to child. The child who holds the chip when it dies has to pay a forfeit



As I lie down upon my bed I pray to God to be my guide, and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed, there are four Angels overhead. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John Bless his bed that I lie on. If any evil troubles me. "oh", Sweet Jesus waken me. Lady of the flowers, Lady of the branch open the gates of Heaven at my dying hour,This prayer is said after going to bed.On seeing a New-Moon this prayer is usually said:-I see the moon and the moon sees meGod bless the moon and God bless me.
(continues on next page)

4798709/4792248/4925158.title: Prayers
4798709/4792248/4925158.text:
(continued from previous page)
A prayer said frequently during the day:-As I went out the Chapel-door I met the Blessed Virgin, seven mass-books in her hand seven bells ringing, seven songs singing. Open the gates of Heaven, shut the gates of Hell, let those poor souls pass into Heaven



There are four corners on my bedAnd four angels on them spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless the bed the I lie onThis prayer is said when going to bed.I see the new moon and the new moon sees meGod bless the new moon and God bless meAs God brought us safe into itGod bring us safe out of it.On seeing a new moon, this prayer is said
(continues on next page)

4925220/4791513/4925504.title: Prayers
4925220/4791513/4925504.text: To be said when you lie down in bed at night. As I lay down my head to sleep.I give my soul to God to keep. Whether I rise now or never The Lord may rest my soul in heaven.There are four corners on the bed. There are four angles overhead Mathew Mark Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lie on.

4925220/4791514/4925507.title: Prayers
4925220/4791514/4925507.text: Oh Lord preserve me from the greatest of all evils a sudden and unprepared death and may Thou of Gracious Saviour meet me with a meek and merciful countenance at the moment of my departure from this life Amen.In the name of the Lord Jeasus Christ crusified I lay me down to sleep bless me oh Lords defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting life Amen.

4925220/4791515/4925508.title: Prayers
4925220/4791515/4925508.text: Honour Friday and Good Friday too The day our Saviour was crucified by the Jew.Up comes the Jew with his long spear.And peirced the heart of our Saviour dear.His tender mother was standing  by.With a heavy heart and a mournful cry

4925220/4791516/4925509.title: Prayers
4925220/4791516/4925509.text: As Peter sat on a marble stone Jeasus came to him all alone Peter Peyter why dost thou wakeOh Lord and master I have the toothache. Arise up Peter and do not fear. Anybody who says thoes words in memory or in writing for my sake shall never be troubled with the toothache.This prayer is to be said when a person has a toothache And if a person has faith in it  It is said to cure it.O Lord by the branch Oh Lady by the flower. Oh Lord Jeasus Christ be with me at my dying hour

4925220/4791517/4925513.title: Prayers
4925220/4791517/4925513.text: Oh merciful Jeasus have mercy on me. My heart and my soul I bestow to thee. To think on the cross that was was nailed on the tree. Oh merciful Jeasus have mercy on me.I looketh up I looketh down. I see the Queen of heaven coming down. Seven mass books in her hand. Seven bells ringing. Seven priest singing. Shut the gates of hell. Open the gates of heaven and let in my poor soul for ever.

4925220/4791518/4925515.title: Prayers
4925220/4791518/4925515.text:
As I lay down to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep.Four corners on my bed. Four angels on its spread. Mathew and Mark Luke and John God bless us all on those beds that we lie on.When christ our Lord had seen the cross that he was going to be crucified on his body did shiver and shake. The Jews asked him had he either fever or ache. Jeasus answered and said he had either fever or ache but he or she who keeps these words in memory of me shall never be troubled with fever or ache. Blessed be the hearer
(continues on next page)

4925220/4791520/4925522.title: Prayers
4925220/4791520/4925522.text: Oh God of charity without limit and of mercy without measure. It was thy love induced thee to come to me. I give thee my body as a temple, my will as a Sacrifice, my heart as an alter, my soul as a pysc. O Lord merciful Redeemer of Heaven. O noble lowly Infant keep me in thy peace. Give me a dwelling in thy heart. Dissolve me in the fragrance of thy Charity. Strengthen me with thy love, receive me through thy death. O Lord make me entirely pleasing to thee through the fruits of the Sacred Heart.

4798716/4792950/4925800.title: Local Prayers
4798716/4792950/4925800.text:
Local Prayers.My aunt told me that when her mother would be going any where. She would say, "Oh my gentle Jesus help me go and do not let anything happen to me until I come home again". Then she said if you have not some little prayer when you are going out or going to bed some thing might happen you. Then she said you should always have some little prayer to say when when you are going to bed or going anywhere.Some old people say this prayer when they are going to bed. Gentle Jesus meek and mild, look on me a little child pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee. I say that little prayer every morning and night also.My aunt told me this little prayer. As I lie down my head to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep and if I die before I wake I give my soul to God to take. If any evil troubles me God and his Blessed mother awaken me.I see the new moon and the
(continues on next page)

4798716/4792971/4925834.title: Old Prayers
4798716/4792971/4925834.text:
Old PrayersMy granny Mrs Jane Clabby, Rooskey, Co. mRoscommon, aged 82 years told me the prayers she says. Here is some she says at night.I see the New moon, and the New moon sees me.God bless the new moon and God bless me.Grace in the kitchen grace in the hallGrace in the parlour amongst us all. This is another one she says There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over my head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on.And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.If any evil comes to me, I pray the Blessed Virgin to look on me.With seven candles in her hands,Seven bells ringing,Shut the gates of hellOpen the gates of Heaven.
(continues on next page)

4798716/4792998/4925940.title: Old Prayers
4798716/4792998/4925940.text:
Old PrayersMy grandmother Mrs Jane Cox of New Ruskey told me some of the prayers that used to be said in olden times. This is some of them.As I lie down on my bedside I pray to God to be my guide, And if I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take. There are four corners on my bed, There are four angles at my head, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on. There is another old prayer, and this is it.As I go to my bed, As I go to my grave. The great God Almighty, my soul for to save. Jesus my branch, Mary my flower, Jesus, Mary and Joseph be with me at my dying hour.This is another old prayer.God bless good Friday night God bless good Friday day. The day our Blessed Lord was crucified. With a crown of thorns on his head. Our Blessed Lady standing by, With a pitiful look, and a mournful cry. Any one who says this little prayer three times by day and three times
(continues on next page)

4798718/4793114/4926418.title: Local Marriage Customs
4798718/4793114/4926418.text:
(continued from previous page)
They come back at night for the wedding.  It is always counted unlucky for a bride to loose her wedding ring.  It was on horses that the people went to get married & the bride & bridegroom sat on the same horse on their return home.It is an old belief that if a marriage party forgot anything on their way  to the church that it was unlucky to turn back.



There are many beautiful prayers which I have never learned.  Those are some of them.Hail & Blessed be the hour of moment, In which thy Divine Son was born at midnight in Bethlehem,In the piercing cold,In that hour of moment,Oh, most pious Virgin obtain for me the grant of my petition.
(continues on next page)

4798718/4793116/4926420.title: A Collection of Prayers
4798718/4793116/4926420.text:
Here as on this bed I lie,I pray to God to be my guide;There are four corners on my bedFour Guardian Angels over headMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless this bed I lie upon.If any evil crosses me,Holy Mary waken me,If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.(to be said when you lie down in bed).A prayer for a toothacheAs Saint Peter knelt on a marble stone,Sweet Jesus came up to him alone,What ails thou Peter said Our Lord?Oh Dear Jesus a Great toothacheThen rise up Peter thou shall be healed.(Who ever says this prayer three times night and day shall never have a toothache)Short prayer to the Holy FamilyHeart of Jesus I adore theeHeart of Mary I emplore thee
(continues on next page)

4769959/4762794/4926680.title: An Old Prayer
4769959/4762794/4926680.text: An Old PrayerThis is a holy prayer which is to be said when a person is bleeding from the head or from a cut on the hand."There was a Child born on Bethleham It was Baptised in the flood of the river Jordan where the waters were thick and muddy and as the Child was meek and good and as the waters flowed at the Baptism of Our Blessed Savious so may this man's blood stop with the help of Our Blessed Saviour and His holy Mother Amen Jesus"Must be reaped three times when needed Not to be given if asked for because it would be no good except it was given without being asked for.This is a prayer said when getting upI raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul May I raise on the last day into everlasting life Amen.

4798725/4793746/4926878.title: Old Prayers
4798725/4793746/4926878.text:
There are many old prayers which were said by the old people and which were not put print. Some were said when going to bed and when getting up, when raking the fire, when beginning work, or when passing the Chapel.Going to bed. "As I lay down to take my sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep.If any evil happens me.O blessed Lady waken me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadMathew, Mark Luke and John,God Bless this bed I lay down upon
(continues on next page)

4798725/4793750/4926880.title: Old Prayers
4798725/4793750/4926880.text:
Although this district is not all over pious they have some prayers which were never in print. As a rule they never start work or business without some prayer or aspiration.Going to bed I lay my body down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepAnd If I die before I  wake,I pray to God my soul to take,"
(continues on next page)

4798725/4793754/4926882.title: Old Prayers
4798725/4793754/4926882.text:
Before the closing of the day this prayers is said.Creator thee we humbly pray. For Thy vaunted mery sake,Thou us unto protection take.Let nothing in our minds vain drems or phantoms of the night. Keep off the enemy that so our bodies no uncleanliness know.This Jesus from a virgin sprung.
(continues on next page)

4798688/4790306/4926949.title: Old Prayer
4798688/4790306/4926949.text:
In good Friday our Saviour died. On good Friday he was scarified. The jews came up with this sharp spears and pierced him through his tender heart. His mother Mary standing by Dark and dismal she did cry and anyone who say this prayer There times by night and there times by day never shall suffer the pains of purgatory on die in mortal sin



As I lay down on my right sideI pray to Thee to be my guide.If I don't rise now or everI give my soul to God for ever.There are four corners on my bedAnd four Angels on them spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.

4798688/4790306/4926958.title: Old Prayer
4798688/4790306/4926958.text:
In good Friday our Saviour died. On good Friday he was scarified. The jews came up with this sharp spears and pierced him through his tender heart. His mother Mary standing by Dark and dismal she did cry and anyone who say this prayer There times by night and there times by day never shall suffer the pains of purgatory on die in mortal sin



As I lay down on my right sideI pray to Thee to be my guide.If I don't rise now or everI give my soul to God for ever.There are four corners on my bedAnd four Angels on them spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.

4769982/4763890/4927063.title: Old Prayers
4769982/4763890/4927063.text:
Old prayers said by Mrs. Kearney of Barnhill, a Centenarian, who died about ten years ago."In the Name of the Lord Jesus Christ lay me down to rest. Bless me, O Lord, defend and favour me now, and, after this short & miserable pilgrimage, bring me to everlasting life, May the souls of the faithful departed etc"Oh Blessed Virgin Mary, hear my prayers or the prayer of some good christian that it may be the will of your Divine Son, Jesus that we may all meet in happy Eternity Amen.Prayers on RetiringThere are four corners on this bedThere are four angels on it spread St. Matthew, Mark St Luke St. John God bless this bed that I lie on.
(continues on next page)

4811583/4799171/4927146.title: Local Prayers
4811583/4799171/4927146.text:
Local Prayers.A house blessing.God bless each corner of this house,And be the lintel blest,And bless the hearth, and bless the board.And bless each place of rest.God bless the door that opens wide,The stranger as to kin.And bless each window crystal pane.That lets the sky light inGod bless the roof-tree overhead,And every sturdy wallThe peace of God, the peace of manThe peace of love on all. Amen
(continues on next page)

4811581/4798918/4927752.title: Old Customs
4811581/4798918/4927752.text:
(continued from previous page)
Winkwas another game played at wakes long ago.  One man would stand on the middle of the floor and six men would stand around him.  He would put a hand on one eye and some one would hold a candle fornint the other eye and keep on slapping him on the hands until he would know who was slapping him.



Long ago people used to get married at wakes and it was against the rules of the Church so the custom died out.Long ago the priest used to come to the houses and Christen the children.



When Our Saviour saw the CrossHe was to be Crucified on He shivered and shookThe Jews asked him was it fever or ague He hadAnd He said "No, Thank God".Anyone that keeps this prayer in memory or in writing shall never have fever or ague (ache).

4811581/4798919/4927755.title: Mass Rocks
4811581/4798919/4927755.text:
There is a ditch in Friars Park and it is said that the priests used to say Mass there in the Penal Times.The priest used to say Mass below in a field of Maypothers in Kilteevan on the top of the hill.  They used to say it unknownst to the soldiers or they would kill them if they caught them.  Often they used to go from house to house looking for the priests.  Christ was seen on this hill.



As Peter sat on a marble stoneChrist came passing by."What ails thee Peter"?"Oh' Lord my tooth doth sorely ache."Arise, Peter, and behold".He who says this prayer three times a day three times a night will never have a toothache

4811581/4798920/4927756.title: Prayer
4811581/4798920/4927756.text:
God grant the wearyA calm and sweet reposeAnd with Thy tenderest blessingMay my eyelids close.Comfort all poor sinnersThat's watching this night in painAnd those thats planning evilOh, God, only them restrainAnd when the morning wakensThen may I arisePure and fresh and sinlessIn Thy Holy Eyes.



Good Friday was the day,When Our Saviour's heart was pierced,From side to side.His Blessed Mother standing by,With a heavy heart and a dismal cry.Whoever says this prayerThree times a day and three times a nightShall never see Hell  Nor the gates of PurgatoryShall never enter in.

4811581/4798921/4927760.title: Prayer
4811581/4798921/4927760.text:
As I lay down on my right sideI pray to God to be my GuideAnd if I die before I wakeI give my soul to God to takeThere are four corners on my bedFour white angels on my spreadMathew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless me and this bed that I lie on"Jesus, Mary, and Joseph in lightness and darknessAid us and save us"



This is a song the old women used to cune when they were raking the fire.Níl mar radlág mar ádbar.Duineas is an duinas,bochtna is bochtna,M'anam mo néasIs bocht gan abaire.

4798687/4790067/4927816.title: Prayers
4798687/4790067/4927816.text:
The following prayers are said by an old man Thomas Horhan morning and evening :—"O Virgin! Be praying, be praying for me in the morning and in the evening; and open the gates and show us the way to Heaven and let other poor souls into heaven."When lighting the lamp or candle. — "Go Lasaiḋ an Maiġdean Ṁuire coinneal duinn i bḞlaiṫeas".



(I)When I lay down on my right sideI give my soul to God to guideAnd if any evil come to meThe Blessed Virgin may save me.(II)When I lay down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepAnd if any trouble comes to meJesus Christ will set me free(III)There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadMatthew Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I be on.

4798687/4790067/4927838.title: Prayers
4798687/4790067/4927838.text:
The following prayers are said by an old man Thomas Horhan morning and evening :—"O Virgin! Be praying, be praying for me in the morning and in the evening; and open the gates and show us the way to Heaven and let other poor souls into heaven."When lighting the lamp or candle. — "Go Lasaiḋ an Maiġdean Ṁuire coinneal duinn i bḞlaiṫeas".



(I)When I lay down on my right sideI give my soul to God to guideAnd if any evil come to meThe Blessed Virgin may save me.(II)When I lay down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepAnd if any trouble comes to meJesus Christ will set me free(III)There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadMatthew Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I be on.

4798687/4790068/4927839.title: Prayers
4798687/4790068/4927839.text:
On entering the Church say — At the chapel-door, I enter in, and outside I mean to leave my sins, and before the Blessed Altar I will kneel and give my soul to the Son and Father to grant me the benefit of this Mass and Holy Water. Amen



O Adorable Saviour, dying on the cross for my sins – the Holy Cross of Jesus Christ, I believe thee Christ guard me in all truths and save me from an unprovided death. Crucified Jesus of Nazareth give me grace to put wicked enemy from me now and forever. Sweet Saviour. Amen.(2)God that gives, God that takes, God be blessed and may be praised.



God bless Friday and Good Friday too the day Our Saviour died. The Jews ran the sharp spear through His Sacred Heart. Mary Mother standing by with the heavy heart and dismal sigh intercede for us that I may never die without true sorrow for my sins. Amen.

4798687/4790068/4927842.title: Prayers
4798687/4790068/4927842.text:
On entering the Church say — At the chapel-door, I enter in, and outside I mean to leave my sins, and before the Blessed Altar I will kneel and give my soul to the Son and Father to grant me the benefit of this Mass and Holy Water. Amen



O Adorable Saviour, dying on the cross for my sins – the Holy Cross of Jesus Christ, I believe thee Christ guard me in all truths and save me from an unprovided death. Crucified Jesus of Nazareth give me grace to put wicked enemy from me now and forever. Sweet Saviour. Amen.(2)God that gives, God that takes, God be blessed and may be praised.



God bless Friday and Good Friday too the day Our Saviour died. The Jews ran the sharp spear through His Sacred Heart. Mary Mother standing by with the heavy heart and dismal sigh intercede for us that I may never die without true sorrow for my sins. Amen.

4798687/4790068/4927844.title: Prayers
4798687/4790068/4927844.text:
On entering the Church say — At the chapel-door, I enter in, and outside I mean to leave my sins, and before the Blessed Altar I will kneel and give my soul to the Son and Father to grant me the benefit of this Mass and Holy Water. Amen



O Adorable Saviour, dying on the cross for my sins – the Holy Cross of Jesus Christ, I believe thee Christ guard me in all truths and save me from an unprovided death. Crucified Jesus of Nazareth give me grace to put wicked enemy from me now and forever. Sweet Saviour. Amen.(2)God that gives, God that takes, God be blessed and may be praised.



God bless Friday and Good Friday too the day Our Saviour died. The Jews ran the sharp spear through His Sacred Heart. Mary Mother standing by with the heavy heart and dismal sigh intercede for us that I may never die without true sorrow for my sins. Amen.

4798687/4790069/4927847.title: Prayers
4798687/4790069/4927847.text:
O Glorious Virgin, you are my store my bread, and my dear. You are the star in front of me and everywhere. Bring us to the brink of Heaven. Amen.



Night is falling dear mother, the long day is over and before thy loved image I am kneeling once more to thank you for keeping me safe during the day, to ask you this night to keep all evil away. Many (th) times have I fallen to-day Mother dear, many graces neglected since last I knelt here. Oh will thou not in pity, my own Mother mild ask Jesus to pardon the sins of thy child. I am going to rest now for the day's work is done. Its hours and its moments are passed one by one. And the God that will judge us has counted them all. He has numbered each grace He has counted each fall. In his books they are written against the last day. O Mother ask Jesus to wash them away. One drop of his blood which for sinners was spilt is sufficient to cleanse the whole world from its guilt. And if, ere dawn I shall draw my last breath and the sleep that I take be the long sleep of death. Be near me dear Mother for Jesus sake when my soul in eternity shall awake. Amen.

4798687/4790069/4927848.title: Prayers
4798687/4790069/4927848.text:
O Glorious Virgin, you are my store my bread, and my dear. You are the star in front of me and everywhere. Bring us to the brink of Heaven. Amen.



Night is falling dear mother, the long day is over and before thy loved image I am kneeling once more to thank you for keeping me safe during the day, to ask you this night to keep all evil away. Many (th) times have I fallen to-day Mother dear, many graces neglected since last I knelt here. Oh will thou not in pity, my own Mother mild ask Jesus to pardon the sins of thy child. I am going to rest now for the day's work is done. Its hours and its moments are passed one by one. And the God that will judge us has counted them all. He has numbered each grace He has counted each fall. In his books they are written against the last day. O Mother ask Jesus to wash them away. One drop of his blood which for sinners was spilt is sufficient to cleanse the whole world from its guilt. And if, ere dawn I shall draw my last breath and the sleep that I take be the long sleep of death. Be near me dear Mother for Jesus sake when my soul in eternity shall awake. Amen.

4758562/4754885/4928162.title: Prayers
4758562/4754885/4928162.text: O Glorious St. Joseph, for the love and glory of Jesus Christ, come to our assistance.Said 7 times after Rosary.Here I lay down my head to sleep,God my soul to keep,There are four cormers on my bed,There are four Angels overspread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lay on,If any evil thing come near me,Jesus within me, Jesus around meNow and forever more.  Amen.

4758562/4754886/4928163.title: Night Prayer
4758562/4754886/4928163.text:
Here I lie down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake, give my soul to God to takeThere are four corners on my bed,There are four Angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on,If any bad spirit comes to me,God come and save me,I pray to God in Trinity, that no bad spirit betray me.God be in my heart, God be in my mindGod be my Guide, day and night.  Amen.



In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ, I arise,Bless me O Lord, defend and keep me,That after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to everlasting life,May the souls of the faithful departedThrough the Mercy of God rest in peace.  Amen.

4758562/4754886/4928167.title: Night Prayer
4758562/4754886/4928167.text:
Here I lie down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake, give my soul to God to takeThere are four corners on my bed,There are four Angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on,If any bad spirit comes to me,God come and save me,I pray to God in Trinity, that no bad spirit betray me.God be in my heart, God be in my mindGod be my Guide, day and night.  Amen.



In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ, I arise,Bless me O Lord, defend and keep me,That after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to everlasting life,May the souls of the faithful departedThrough the Mercy of God rest in peace.  Amen.

4758562/4754887/4928168.title: Prayer
4758562/4754887/4928168.text: As I walked out in Holy Land,I met the Blessed Virgin,With seven Mass books in her hand,Seven priests singing,Seven bells ringing.Whoever shall say this prayer seven times a day, seven times a night, shall never die in mortal sin; nor the gates of Heaven shall never be shut against them.

4811582/4799102/4928217.title: Old Prayers
4811582/4799102/4928217.text:
There are some prayers the old people have - God Bless Good Friday.Good Friday is the day our Saviour was crucified. The devil passing by with a spear in his hand. Struck Our Saviour from heart to hand, His flesh and blood began to flow,His tender mother standing by,With a heavy heart and could not cryHow happy happy those will beWho say this prayer three times a dayAnd three times a night never shall enter the fires of Hell or purgatory, Amen sweet Jesus.



Long ago people had beautiful old prayers which were handed down to the people of the present day. Most of these prayers were in rhyme. Some are-As I lay down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide
(continues on next page)

4811582/4799102/4928219.title: Old Prayers
4811582/4799102/4928219.text:
There are some prayers the old people have - God Bless Good Friday.Good Friday is the day our Saviour was crucified. The devil passing by with a spear in his hand. Struck Our Saviour from heart to hand, His flesh and blood began to flow,His tender mother standing by,With a heavy heart and could not cryHow happy happy those will beWho say this prayer three times a dayAnd three times a night never shall enter the fires of Hell or purgatory, Amen sweet Jesus.



Long ago people had beautiful old prayers which were handed down to the people of the present day. Most of these prayers were in rhyme. Some are-As I lay down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide
(continues on next page)

4811582/4799104/4928220.title: Old Prayers
4811582/4799104/4928220.text:
(continued from previous page)
answer is "You kindly."



When going on a journey people say "God direct us on our journey and bring us safe home" or "God speed you."  When they see lightning they say "God save us from harm"  When starting work they say "I'll do this in the name of god"  When they have eaten their dinner they say "Thanks be to god for that meal"  When a person comes in he says "God save all here"  When a person wants to do something an other person says "God direct you to do best"  When starting work they say "I'll do this in the name of the Three that never failed the Father, The son, and the Holy Ghost."

4798685/4790183/4928282.title: An Old Prayer
4798685/4790183/4928282.text: One prayer the old people had wits[?]:- On good Friday our Saviour died. On good Friday Our Saviour was crucified. The Jews came with long spears and pierced his heart through, his loving Mother being standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal cry. Any one that says this prayer three times by day and three times by night shall never enter the gates of hell. When the old people used to visit houses if he was every minute in the day it was God save all here and God bless the workhand thousand thanks to Jesus for everything. This was on their lips every minute and hour in the day.

4798685/4790193/4928288.title: Prayers in Olden Times
4798685/4790193/4928288.text: One prayer the old people had was. On Good Friday Our Saviour was crucified.The Jews came with long spears and pierced his heart through, His Loving Mother standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal cry. Any one that says this prayer three times by day and three times by night shall never enter the gates of hell. When the old people used to visit houses even if it was every minute in the day they would say "God save all here, God bless the work and A thousand thanks to Jesus for everything". This was on their lips every minute in the day.

4811593/4800101/4928522.title: Prayers
4811593/4800101/4928522.text:
In the name of out Lord Jesus Christ, crucified I lay down to rest. Bless me o Lord defend and govern me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to life everlasting in to the hands of our Lord and commend my spirit.O my God I offer to thee all the thoughts words and actions pains and sufferings of this day in union with those of Jesus Christ. Infant Jesus meek and mild look on me thy little child. Pity mine and pity me, and I will suffer to come to me.Heart of Jesus I adore thee" of Mary I emplore thee" " Joseph pure and just in these three hearts I place my trust, thrustHoly Mary pray for me call me among thy chosen. Guard me on my dying day, sweet Jesus Mary and Joseph.O Mary my Mother so loving and mild you cannot reject your poor suppliant child In all my afflictions I hasten to thee
(continues on next page)

4798663/4788291/4928955.title: Old Prayers
4798663/4788291/4928955.text:
The following are some prayers which I gathered from an old woman who still recites them.After Holy Communion:- My loving Lord a thousand welcome!  O son of Mary I love you indeed. I do, who am I at all that thou wouldst come next or near me. O God of heaven! make a little corner for me in your heart and never while there is life in me let me lose my place. There and after death may I still hide there. Amen. During Mass:- My Jesus I offer up this holy mass. The grace it brings to me. As some small token of love. My poor heart holds for thee. And all I ask, O dearest LordI beg it o'er and o'erIs that my soul each-day          that dawnsMay love thee more and more. At Night-:Infant Jesus meek and mild,Look on me a little child,
(continues on next page)

4811597/4800438/4928957.title: Local Ruins
4811597/4800438/4928957.text:
(continued from previous page)
which belonged to a man named McGivern.Written byRosie MooreInformation obtained fromThomas FinneranDundonnell



The old people say certain prayers during the day.  They used say a prayer getting up in the morning.  'Oh crucified Jesus nailed to a tree, Oh crucified Jesus have mercy on me'.  They used say another prayer also 'Oh heavenly Father save us from the evils of this world, save all living creatures and keep them safe
(continues on next page)

4798663/4788294/4928964.title: Old Prayers
4798663/4788294/4928964.text:
(continued from previous page)
On earth by Jesus Christ Thy Son.'' Amen.The following is a prayer to Our Lady of Good Success.''Our Lady, Our Queen and Our MotherIn the name of Jesus and, orthe love of Jesus,We implore Thee to take our causein hands,And grant it a good success.'' Amen.



Here are some old prayers used locally.''Hail! full of grace, the lord is with the and blessed is the fruit of Saint Anne, the mother without stain of original sin of whom Jesus Christ our Lord and Son of the Living God, was born, who livest and reignest, world without end.'' AmenAs I went up the Blessed Land,I met the Blessed Virgin,Three Mass Books in her hand,Three priests singing,Three bells ringing,
(continues on next page)

4742094/4735354/4929400.title: An Paidrín Páirteach
4742094/4735354/4929400.text: Admhuigim féin do’n tsaoghal gur pheacuigeasD’aon Mhac geal chroidheach MháireThagas tamall dem’ saoghal go claon tamhail, stairtheamhail Ag réabadh ceart dlighe an Phápa.Le monabhar béil is gan spéis in aithrigheIs lem dhéirc ní althuighead páiste Ach a(g) magadh is a’ sgleíp fé bhréithre an Phaidrín Gléigeal , ainglídhe , grádhmhar.IIAifreann Dé ná tréigh le failligheAgus déirc le deagh-chroidhe deárnaighAgus maithfidh Mac Dé go léir do pheacaidheTar eís na h-aithrighe tháinic Ba chuma liom féin cad é an taobh go leagfaidheI bpéin nó in aicíd bháis méAch go mbeadh duine de’n cléir do ghléasadh m’aibídAgus céar go lasfaidhe ar chlár orm IIINách damannta an sgeul do’n té ná smachtuigheannAn Beus Eig iseadhaidhe atá aigeMar bheidh cé sa chré agus daoltha a’teacht Feár agus seasgaí a’ fás air Tá an fiolar ag éigeamh ar phéic a’ gcrannaibhIs mé á cheuladh ag madraibh sraídeÓ  ghlacadar mé fá sgeímh a mbrathaibh(is mé) ag éisteacht an Phaidrín Pháirtigh

4811589/4799606/4929804.title: Prayers
4811589/4799606/4929804.text:
PrayersThere are four corners on this bed, There are four angels at my head, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lay on.As I lay down my head to sleep, I leave my soul to God to keep. And if I chance to die before I wake, I leave my soul to God to take.Here I lie on my right side, I pray to God to be my guide. If I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.If this pain attends me, Blessed Lady waken me, Four corners on my bed, Four angels on it spread. Mathew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless this bed that I lay on.O Mother of sorrows by the love with which you stood by the cross of Jesus stand by me in my last agony. To your maternal heart I commend
(continues on next page)

4811589/4799607/4929808.title: Prayers
4811589/4799607/4929808.text:
(continued from previous page)
the last three hours of my life. After these of the eternal Father in union with the agony of our Dearest Lord. Offer frequently to the Eternal Father in atonement for my sins the precious blood of Jesus mingled with your tears on Calvery to obtain for me the grace to receive Holy Communion with the most perfect love and contrition before my death and to breathe forth my soul in the actual presence of Jesus. Dearest Mother  when the hour of death has at last come, present me as your child of Jesus. Say to him in my behalf: Son forgive her for  she knew not what she did. receive her this day into thy  kingdom. Mother of Jesus be a mother to me. Amen.(Mrs Fallon Tubberconnor)



Holy Mary Queen of Heaven,that is good and kind to me,When I am at my dying hour,that you may pray for me.For fear that I would be sent away, your Son no more.O Mary Queen of Heaven,that you pray for me.An other day is ended,how many more to live,Alas, too many wasted.
(continues on next page)

4811589/4799608/4929812.title: Prayers
4811589/4799608/4929812.text:
(continued from previous page)
My God, forgive, forgive.



(These rhyme prayers are well know in this district)1. O Blessed Jesus wherever be my heart & soul I offer onto Thee O Blessed Five Wounds that were nailed to a tree. Merciful Jesus have mercy on me.2. God bless Good Friday & Good Friday's day, The day our Lord was crucified.A crown of thorns piercing in His Head. His grieving Mother standing by with sorrowful heart & pitiful cry. (Anyone who says this prayer  three times a night shall never die in mortal sin & never enter the flames of hell.)3. As I lie down on my right side, as Jesus did on Mary's knee, If any evil comes near me  O Blessed Lady waken me.(Chualas na crí ranta sin ag m'athair i mo mhathair. D'fhoghlinn siad san iad ón a n-aithreacha is a máthreachaithM. Ní Bheirn)

4921566/4880319/4929861.title: Old Graveyards
4921566/4880319/4929861.text:
There is one old Church - yard and one new one in the Parish of Kiltoom. There are both in use but very few are buried in the old Churchyard.The new Churchyard is about five years old. In the old churchyard are the ruins of an old Church. There are a great many crosses in it made out of stone and a great many of Headstones in it.



The first prayer that people say when they awake in the morning. "The morning offering, They say the other prayers also, The Hail Mary, Our Father
(continues on next page)

4742092/4735069/4929885.title: Paidreacha
4742092/4735069/4929885.text: Paidreacha (duine ag faghail bháis)(1)	A Mhic úd thall do bhí ar an gcrann Agus do dhoirt do chuid fola annAnois atá an t-amNá leig an t-anam i dtreall(2)	A Mhichíl naomhtha guidhim-se it ainmA Naomh Eoin baiste graidhim túNa Naoimh go léir i gcabhair dom  anamIn am an catha na tháinig(3)	 Nuair a bheidh mo shúile a ndunadhAgus mo bheal ar leathadhgus mo chiall ag imteacht chun fain uaimMo chúis da glaodhach gus mo téarma caithteDia lem’ an anam an lá san.ó Tadhg O SeaghdhaCathairdómhnaill Cill Airne

4742093/4735129/4930110.title: Paidreacha
4742093/4735129/4930110.text:
go dtughaidh Dia suimhneas siorruidhe do hanamaibh na marbh go léir agus mo anam féin an lá ragaimh á íarriadh".Nuair a bhíod na sean daoine ag dul ar aistear fada deireadh siad an paidir seo:-"Paidir mór le Dia go dtugadh tú saor ón aistear seo mé atá mé ag triall""Go bhfágad Dia do shlainte agat agus nár a bhfaid sin do luicean [?] bliana ort"



Chuala an phaidir seo á rádh ag mo shean-athair, beannacht Dé le na anam, agus é ag éiriú as an leabhaid fó féin ar maidin:-"A Thighearna Dia: dein manam do gléasadh,Sé hEadaighe carthanach póstach

go dtughaidh Dia suimhneas siorruidhe do hanamaibh na marbh go léir agus mo anam féin an lá ragaimh á íarriadh".Nuair a bhíod na sean daoine ag dul ar aistear fada deireadh siad an paidir seo:-"Paidir mór le Dia go dtugadh tú saor ón aistear seo mé atá mé ag triall""Go bhfágad Dia do shlainte agat agus nár a bhfaid sin do luicean [?] bliana ort"

4921570/4880577/4930331.title: A Prayer
4921570/4880577/4930331.text: 1 My loving lord a thousand welcoms, oh son of Mary I love you. Indeed I do, Who am I at all that you should come next or near me. Oh God of heaven make a little corner for me in your heart, and never while there is life in me let me loose my place there. Talk to my God for me tell him that I am a poor ignorant creature full of nothing but sin and misery but that I love you his own dear mother and for his sweet sake help and pity me, Amen.11As I lie on this bed to sleep I give my soul to God to keep. If any temtation comes over me I pray to God to waken me. There are four corners on this bed. There are four angels lying on the spread. St. Matthew St. Mark St Luke and St John. Oh Lord Jesus bless the bed that I lie on.

4921570/4880578/4930333.title: Prayers
4921570/4880578/4930333.text:
On Good Friday after noon, the Jews came to spy on Our Lord, with a spear in their hands. His blessed Mother standing by, with a heavy heart and a dismal cry.Anyone who says this prayer three times by night shall never die in mortal sin, nor the gates of hell They'll never enter.As I look up as I look down I saw the blessed Virgin Mary coming down, seven Mass Books in her hand, seven priests singing, seven Bells ringing shut the gates of hell open the gates of heaven and let my poor soul inn. As I lie down on my right side I pray to God to be my Guide. Mathew, Marke, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie
(continues on next page)

4921569/4880504/4930994.title: Prayers
4921569/4880504/4930994.text:
Here as I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my  guideThere 'is' four corners on my bedThere is four angels on my spreadMatthew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless this bed bed that I lie on.If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.If any evil thing comes to happen meI pray to God to waken me.



As I lie down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep.If any hurt or harm come near me the Blessed Virgin Mary defend and keep me.There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels over headSt. Mathew, St. Mark, St. Luke and St. John, God bless this bed that I lie on.

4921569/4880504/4930995.title: Prayers
4921569/4880504/4930995.text:
Here as I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my  guideThere 'is' four corners on my bedThere is four angels on my spreadMatthew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless this bed bed that I lie on.If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.If any evil thing comes to happen meI pray to God to waken me.



As I lie down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep.If any hurt or harm come near me the Blessed Virgin Mary defend and keep me.There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels over headSt. Mathew, St. Mark, St. Luke and St. John, God bless this bed that I lie on.

4798713/4792644/4931212.title: Prayers
4798713/4792644/4931212.text:
I lay my body down to sleepand pray to god my soul to keepand if I die before I wakeI pray to god my soul to take.There are four corners on my bedThere are four Angels over head.Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless me and the bed I lie on.Every hour the clock strikes the following pray is supposed to be said.Another hour of my life is pastMy Jesus remember me in my fastWhen you are lighting anything the prayer to say is:The light of Heaven to our soulsand eternal rest to the souls of the faithful departed.O good Jesus I must dieI do not know when how or whereBut if I die in mortal sin, I am lost foreverO Good Jesus have mercy on meThis prayer is also to be said when
(continues on next page)

4798713/4792646/4931214.title: Prayers
4798713/4792646/4931214.text: When you go to bed at night make the sign of the cross on your forehead and say Jesus of Nazareth king of the Jews preserve us from a sudden and unprepared death. When you cannot receive Holy Communion say “Since I cannot receive you sacramentally come spiritually into my soul and make me good, humble, and mortified.”When you say your prayers in the morning, say “O Sacrament most Holy O Sacrament divine all praise and all thanksgiving be every moment thine, and “O Mary conceived without sin pray for us.”

4798713/4792647/4931216.title: Prayers
4798713/4792647/4931216.text: "I lie down with God"And may God lie down with me""The right hand of God under my head"The two hands of Mary round about me"The cross of the nine white angels from the back of my head to the soles of my feet"May I not lie with evil"And "may evil not lie with me"This prayer is generally said in bed at nightShow me o Lord thy ways and teach me thy pathsDirect my steps according to thy word,That no injustice may rule over meMake perfect my walking in thy pathsThat my steps may not be movedThis prayer is said when a person is going on a journey.

4769997/4765186/4931278.title: Old Prayers
4769997/4765186/4931278.text: Saints Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lay on.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels overhead.One to guard me, one to guide meAnd two to carry my soul to Godif any evil comes to meBlessed Lady waken me.As I went out into the Holy LandI met the Blessed Virgin with seven Mass Books in her handSeven candles lighting, seven priests singingI shut the gates of hell and I opened the gates of heaven to let the poor souls in.God bless Friday and Good Friday,The day Our Savour was crucifiedThe Jews passed by with sharp spears,Which pierced Him from the heart to the hand.His blessed mother was standing by.With a heavy heart which made a dismal cry.Those who would preach this prayer three times a day, three times a night.The gates of hell they will never enter.

4921934/4911085/4931620.title: Folklore - A Prayer
4921934/4911085/4931620.text:
There are four corners to my bed and four angels round my head. One to guard me, one to guide me,  two to carry my soul to God. May Mathew, Mark, Luke and John bless the bed that I lay on. But is i die before I wake i give my soul to God to take.Christy Sheahan(given by my mother _ Mrs SheahanBallyguiltenane, Glin. Co. Limerick.)1.7.38



Oh Mary my mother and my hope I take refuge under thy mantle, then shall I live and die. Deliver me from sin and grant us thy Holy Blessings. We know we must die we don't know how, where or when bur if we die in mortal sin we are lost for ever. Most sacred heart of Jesus have mercy on us.Christy Sheahan.(given by my mother. 18.7.38

4921934/4911094/4931685.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911094/4931685.text: A PrayerHail and blessed be the hour and moment when the Son of God was born of the most pure Virgin Mary in Bethlehem at midnight during piercing cold ; through the merits of our Dear Lord and Saviour and his most blessed Mother Mary vouchsafe Oh my God to hear our prayers and grant our requests at the hour. Amen.Patrick Wallace(told me by my mother Mrs Wallace.Tullyleague, Glin, Co. Limerick)19.9.38
4921934/4911094/4931685.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911095/4931688.title: Folklore - A Prayer
4921934/4911095/4931688.text: FolkloreA Prayer,There are four corners to my bed, There are four angels round me spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless this bed that I lay on.And if I die before I wake,I pray the Lord my soul to take.Patrick Wallace.(told me by my mother- Mrs. Wallace.Tullyleague, Glin. Co. Limerick)20.9.38

4921934/4911105/4931739.title: A Funny Story
4921934/4911105/4931739.text:
An Irishman and an Englishman were talking about Ireland. The Englishman said that Ireland was very small, and the Irishman replied that the land was so plentiful there, that they had to make heaps of it.



A Funny Story.An Irishman and an Englishman were talking about Ireland. The Englishman said that Ireland was very small and the Irishman replied that the land was so plentiful there that they had to make heaps of it. Con MulvihillGlenlappa, Newtownsandes, Co. Kerry22.9.38A Prayer.Good-bye O Blessed Virgin MaryGood-bye O LordMay ye save my soul till I will come back again.This is said when leaving the Church.Con Mulvihill(given me by my uncle- Michael Mulvihill.Glenlappa,Newtonsandes,Co. Kerry.22.9.38
4921934/4911105/4931739.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911106/4931751.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911106/4931751.text:
O Holy Mary, Mother of God Empress of Heaven and earth I humbly beseech thee from my heart to watch over me in this life I know there are none that can withstand  your power O Blessed Virgin Mary.



Though I have asked for a long time still I ask thee once more. Most Sacred Heart of Jesus to plead for me to Thy eternal Father for a great favour.Here ask your request.



Oh most loving Jesus I ask of you and your Blessed Mother Mary to protect me and guard me this day and this night. Amen.
4921934/4911106/4931751.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911107/4931755.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911107/4931755.text:
I know I must die I do not know how nor when nor where but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever.



There are four corners in my bed and for angels at my head Matthew, Matt, Luke, and John bless the bed that I lay on if I die before I wake I offer them my soul to take.



Oh my God I beg of thee all the graces whitch I want for my soul and body this day and I ask thee to bless and protect me. Amen.
4921934/4911107/4931755.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4811587/4799412/4931801.title: Prayers
4811587/4799412/4931801.text:
PrayersThese are some of the many old prayers I have learned at home.This is the prayer which was said when commencing work:-"Jesus, Mary and Joseph help me.""Here goes: In the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Ghost."When going on a journey:-"Holy Mary come with me I m going.""My Angel Guardian protect me."When going to bed:-"God give me a good night's rest"As I lie down upon my bed, There are four angels on this spread,O Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless me and the bed I lie on.Another prayer said when going to bed:-O crucified Jesus have mercy on me,My soul and my body I give unto
(continues on next page)

4811591/4799999/4931849.title: Old Shops
4811591/4799999/4931849.text:
Shops were not common in olden times. Some people had to go to the nearest towns for goods butt others had not. Buying and selling was not carried on after Mass. Money was not always given for goods. Goods were often bartered. Labour was given in exchange for goods.   Tick was the word used in connection with buying. Farthings Crowns, and Sovereigns are gone out of use.



As I lie down on my right side I pray to God to be my guide. If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take. There are four corners on this bed. There are four Angels on it spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John ask God to bless this bed that
(continues on next page)

4921934/4911118/4931879.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911118/4931879.text: 134A Prayer.There are four corners to my bed. there are four angels around me spread. Matthew Mark Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on. If I die before I wake to God I give my soul to take. If I die before I sleep to God I give my soul to keep.William Kiely(told me by my father - Michael Kiely (Aged 52)Aughrim Newtown Sandes Co. Kerry.10.10.'38
4921934/4911118/4931879.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4811587/4799429/4931909.title: Prayers
4811587/4799429/4931909.text:
PrayersThe following are some which I learned at home:God bless Good Friday, it was on Good Friday our Savour was crucified from his head to his hands and his Blessed Mother standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal ery. (Any one that says this prayer in remembrance of me three times by day three times by night, neither death no danger mortal sin, the gates of hell, their souls shall never enter in.)



This is another prayer which I learned at home.O Mary my mother and my hope I take refuge under thy mantle - there will I live and die - deliver me from hell and from sin and grant me thy holy blessing

4811587/4799430/4931911.title: Prayers
4811587/4799430/4931911.text:
An-other prayer.O mother is it asleep you are? O no but dreaming of your son. What is your dream mother?O Mary when the hour of my departing soul shall lose its hold on earthly things and stand in file of its great Creator O' then be to me a tender mother and place in the arms of your Divine Son Jesus in favour of my poor soul.



An other Prayer that I learned at home.I must die I do not know when or how or where but if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever. Jesus have mercy on me.



This is also another prayer I heard at home.As I lie down on my right side, I pray to God to be my guideThere are four corners on my bed, there are four Angels over head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, Bless the bed that I lie upon.If I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.If any evil come to me, Hail Mary waken me.God is the branch, Our Lady is the flowerGod be with me now, and at my dying hour.

4811587/4799433/4931915.title: Riddles
4811587/4799433/4931915.text:
(continued from previous page)
Fire under and fire over and never touches fire? (Cake in an oven)Why does a hen pick a pot? (because she can't lick it)As flat as a pancake, as round as a pan one side a woman and the other a man? (Penny)Two black men and one white man went out in a car, the two black men ate the white man what was the no of the car? (281)As I looked out my grandfathers window, I saw two dead men fighting, two dummies talking, two deaf men listening, two cripples running for the peelers, two blind men looking on? (lie)



God bless those who honour Good Friday. Good Friday is the day our lord was crucified. With a crown of thorns from his head to his heart from his heart to his side. Up come a Jew with his sharp spear and pierced his tender heart. His Blessed Mother standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal cry.Anyone who says this prayer shall never die in debt or danger.

4921934/4911126/4931969.title: Folklore - A Prayer
4921934/4911126/4931969.text: Here i lay down to sleep. I pray to God my soul to keep. If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take. There are four corners to my bed there are four angels at my head. One to guide us two to guard us and one to open the gates of heaven before us. Twas a good Friday after noon the bloody jews came with a long spear in His hand to pierce our Saviour through the heart. His tender Mother being standing by with a dismal heart and a heavy sigh. Those children who say these prayers three times a day three times a night shall never die in mortal sin or fear the pains of hell.
4921934/4911126/4931969.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911127/4931987.title: Folklore - A Prayer
4921934/4911127/4931987.text: Jesus, tender shepherd hear me. Bless thy little lamb to-night. All this day Thy hand has led me. Keep me safe till morning light. Let my sins be all forgiven. Bless the friends I love so well. Take us all at last to heaven. Happy there with Thee to dwell.
4921934/4911127/4931987.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911129/4931994.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911129/4931994.text: A Prayer. Ere in my bed my limbs I lay,God grant me grace my prayers to say,O God preserve my mother dear,In health and in strength for many a year,And o preserve my father too and may I pray severence due,And after my last sleep I may rise to thy eternal life. Amen. Tom Walsh, Tullyleague, Glin,Co. Limerick.
4921934/4911129/4931994.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911130/4931996.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911130/4931996.text: A Prayer. I offer up those seven paters and aves, seven glorious paters in honour of the seven griefs and the seven joys of the Blessed Virgin Mary, begging and beseeching of the Almighty God, through her powerful intercession that she may be a true patron to me and take me under her holy protection. Begging of Jesus Christ grace to lead a holy life to fullfill the end of her creation the chief of which were pure humility and love of God above all things that he might never take me out of this world until I am fully fit and prepared to appear before the heavenly tribunal of justice with the Holy Oil stamped upon my soul and the Blessed Sacrament to strengthen me against the road and a real, perfect inclination of the will of God and the celestial light of Heaven to shine upon me and my dear Jesus to comfort me. That He may never give me a sudden and unprovided death free me from all evil temptations the World the Flesh and the Devil. Con Mulvihill Ballygiltenan, Glin, Co. Limerick(Told by my mother- aged 42)20.10.38
4921934/4911130/4931996.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921573/4880860/4932035.title: Old Prayer
4921573/4880860/4932035.text: It was on a Good Friday Our Savior was crucifiedThe crown of thorns pierced on His Head and the Jesus passing byThey pierced Our Saviour's innocent Head, and from the Head into the HeartHis precious Blood it did flowHis Blessed Mother was standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal eye. God bless those that says those prayers.Three times by day and three times night,They never shall die in death nor dangerAnd the Gates of Hell never shall be openedFor their souls to enter in.

4921934/4911145/4932059.title: Folklore - Prayers Learned in Childhood
4921934/4911145/4932059.text: Folk Lore.Prayers Learned in Childhood.There are many beautiful prayers to be found in our Catholic prayer books; but we have also some which are handed down from mother to child in the homes. Of the latter kind are the following; which are said morning and night to the Blessed Virgin.Through thy sacred Virginity and Immaculate Conception, oh most chaste Mother of God and Queen of Angels obtain for us purity of soul and body.Oh Mary my mother and my hope I take refuge under thy mantles there will I live and die. Deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing.Tim Joseph CaseyThe Terrace,Glin. Co. Limerick.24.10.38
4921934/4911145/4932059.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921573/4880861/4932071.title: Old Prayer
4921573/4880861/4932071.text: May is the branch and the Lord is the flowerSweet Jesus be with me at my dying hour.On first seeing new moonI see the moon and the moon sees meGod bless the moon and God bless meGrace in the kitchen and grace in the hallAnd the Grace of God about us all.Chip-chop-cherry All the men in DerryCouldn't catch chip chop cherry.Ans. Smoke going up the chimney.

4921934/4911190/4932211.title: A Sad Accident
4921934/4911190/4932211.text:
About twenty years ago there lived a man by the name of Ned Donovan in Newtown-Sandes Co. Kerry, four miles or so from my school. He was sleeping one night in bed and awaking he heard the rafters cracking and he got up. He was going out the door when the house fell down on him and he was killed.



God bless Friday, Good Friday too; the day Our Saviour suffered too; from His Heart to His Hand His Precious Blood did flow; and His tender mother standing by, with a weighty heart and a heavy sigh.
4921934/4911190/4932211.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

4921934/4911238/4932432.title: A Prayer
4921934/4911238/4932432.text: Oh Mary my mother and my hope.I take refuge under thy mantle.There shall I live and die.Deliver us from sin.And grant us thy holy blessings.We know we must die.We don't know how, where or when.But if we die in mortal sin.We are lost for ever.May the Scared heart of Jesus.Have mercy on us.
4921934/4911238/4932432.school_info: School: Baile Giolla tSionáin (B.), An Gleann

Grant through his intercession abundance of faithful graces that he soon may be glorified by the Church in honour of canonization through Jesus Christ our Lord Amen.O God who givest us joy by

Although I have asked for a long time still I ask thee O' Jesus once more to plead for me to thy Eternal Father for a great favour. I place it in the centre of thy broken bleeding heart when covered with the crimson cloak of they most precious blood. Thy Eternal Father cannot refuse to hear, not my prayer, but thine. Sacred Heart of Jesus in thee I trust.



O Lord Jesus Christ who, in wearied eyes, neither slumbers nor sleeps but continually watches in defence of thy servants, take me and mine into thy protection and grant that whilst my body is asleep, my soul may be awake to thee and that I may hereafter behold thee in that blessed and Heavenly country where thou with the Father and the Holy Ghost art eternally governed. Where the angels with the blessed saints are citizens for ever. Amen.

O Eternal Father, I beseech thee, by the precious blood which flowed from the wounded side of Jesus, they divine son, deliver the souls in Purgatoy, especially those who have manifested the greatest love for his Sacred Heart, that they may enter into the Kingdom of Glory and begin to praise and thank thee eternally in the company of the Saints. Amen.



Our Lady, Our Queen and our Mother, in the name of Jesus, and for the love of Jesus, I implore thee to take our cause in hands and grant it good success. Our Lady of Good success pray for us.

Kitchen door, and immediately he died in her hands. "Now," she said, "everything is all right and nothing will happen to any of us." So she brought the two men down a few fields below their house and pointed out to them the exact spot in which the gold was hidden. "Now," she said, "I will go home, and you dig until you come to a flat stone. Loosen the stone, but don't lift it. If you do, something will come out and kill you both. But come home for me and I will come with you and I will make everything all right." So they did as they were told. When they came to the flag they loosened it and ran home for the old woman. But to their surprise when they went home the old woman was not there. They immediately suspected some trick and hurried back to the spot, but to their surprise the stone was lifted and the crock of gold was gone. They never saw the old woman or the crock of Gold again.

4742027/4729429/4933175.title: Prayers
4742027/4729429/4933175.text: When in bed we should fold our arms in the form of a cross and say O my God I know I must die, but I do not know when, where or how, but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever. Oh Jesus have mercy on us.A Prayer before Work. All for Thee Oh Lord Oh my Jesus all for Thee.Morning Prayer. Oh most merciful Jesus lover of souls I pray thee by the agony of thy most Sacred Heart and the sorrows of the Immaculate Mother cleanse in Thine Own Blood sinners of the whole world who are now in thy agony and are to die this day. Heart of Jesus once in agony pity the dying.

4922323/4870162/4933338.title: Pious Sayings and Prayers of Long Ago
4922323/4870162/4933338.text:
The people long ago had a prayer for every occasion. When they heard of any great disaster they said "God bless the hearers and where it is told," and when a man died they said "the bed of heaven to his or her soul." When they eat the first meal of potatoes, they said that we may be alive this time next year.When a beggar women came to the door for alms they said "God increase your store and that you may be ten times better this time next year," "and long life to you" and the blessing of God on you. They used also say "may God never take you short or in your sins" and God and Mary be with you." When a (m) person would enter a house he generally said God bless all here and received the response "God bless you kindly or God and Mary bless you," and the same expressions were used when passing each other on the road.When a star was seen falling the people said "I wish I were in heaven. When a person showed a wound to another they said God bless the mark When something suddenly happened (said) they said
(continues on next page)

4758581/4756410/4933858.title: Local Prayers
4758581/4756410/4933858.text: When we are lying down to sleep we say the following prayers.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overspread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.If I die before I awake I pray to God my soul to take.Jesus Tender Shepherd hear me,Bless this little child to-night,Through the darkness be thou near me,Keep me safe till morning's light,All the sinners that are forgiven,All the friends I have loved so wellTake us all at last to Heaven,Happy there for thee to dwell.

4758582/4756449/4934159.title: Old Prayers
4758582/4756449/4934159.text: Blood PrayerIt was in Jerusalem Our Lord was bornAnd in the Rivier Jordan he was baptized.In the name of Jesus, the river stood.In the name of Jesus stop this blood.----As I went up to the Holy Land, I saw the Blessed Virgin coming with seven Mass books in her hand. Seven priests singing Seven bells ringingO Lord Jesus Christ shut the gates of HellOpen the gates of Heaven and let my poor soul in. Mary the branch, Jesus the flower, Mary be with me, At my dying hour.

4758582/4756474/4934331.title: Old Prayer
4758582/4756474/4934331.text: As Peter sat on a Marble stone,Christ himself came there alone.What is the matter Peter what makes thee quake.Oh Lord it is a tooth ache.Rise up Peter though healed.Not you alone but all who carries those lines for my sake,Shall never be troubled with a toothache.

4758582/4756539/4934492.title: Old Prayers
4758582/4756539/4934492.text: Good Luck to you,God speed you,God save you,Poor people say the Blessing of God on you, may you always have it.As Peter sat on a marble stone,Outside the gates of Jerusalem,Our Lord came to him alone,What ails thee, Peter, He said,And Peter said a toothache.Rise up Peter though healed.Not you alone but all who carried those lines for my sake.

4758582/4756540/4934496.title: Old Prayer
4758582/4756540/4934496.text: Matthew, Mark, Luck and John,Bless the bed that I lie on,There are four corners to my bed.There are four angels on them spread.Jesus within me,Jesus without me,twelve apostles round about me,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.

A sure cure for childblains is to go into a house you were never in before and take off your boots and stockings at the fire and rub the soles of your feet on the hearth and you will leave the childblains after you.

4770014/4766938/4935036.title: Prayers from Durrow District
4770014/4766938/4935036.text:
Prayer sent in by Miceal FitzPatrick, Tubberboe Durrow.(1)God bless Friday and Good Friday.  The Jews have been passing by with sharp spears in their hands.  They pierced our Blessed Lord from this Heart and into the Hand His Blessed Mother standing by with heavy heart and dismal cry.Anyone that says this prayer three times by day and three times by night need never fear a sudden death or danger and inside the gates of hell shall never enter.



(2)As I lay down myself to sleepMy heart and soul I give to God to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeIf any evil come to meI pray the B Virgin to protect and strengthen me.

metadata.Address: Toberboe or Killenny More, Co. Laois

4770014/4766940/4935052.title: Prayers from Durrow District - Said Going to Bed
4770014/4766940/4935052.text: (1)Here I lay me down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take(2)There are four corners on my bedFour angels on them spreadMathew Mark Luke & JohnGod bless this bed that I be on

4770017/4767027/4935189.title: A Collection of Prayers
4770017/4767027/4935189.text:
One of the prayers I learned at home is,As I lie on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,There are four corners on this bed,And around them four angels spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on,And if I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take,And if an evil crosses me,O good Jesus waken me,That I may have my right hand to see,And bless me,Amen.This prayer is generally said when persons are going to bed at night.Another prayer is,Infant Jesus meek and mild,Pity me a little child,Pity mine and pity me.Suffer me to come to Thee,Heart of Jesus, I adore thee,Heart of Mary, I implore thee,Heart of Joseph, pure and just,
(continues on next page)

4921957/4913233/4935317.title: Old Prayers
4921957/4913233/4935317.text: Kitty Byrnes.Old Prayers.Discover to me O'My God, the nothingness of this world.  The greatness of Heaven. The shortness of time, and the length of eternity.  Here I lay down my head to sleep.  If I die before I awake to God, I give my soul to take.  If an evil come my way, O'Blessed Saviour come and save me.  There are four corners round my bed. There are four Angels at my head,  St. Mathew, Mark, St. Luke and St. John. God bless the bed that I lay on. I will arise from the bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul.  O may I rise again on the last day to life everlasting.Told by my mother.Mrs. Byrnes,Kilscannell,Ardagh,Co. Limerick.I will arise form this bed of sleep to adore my God, and to labour for the salvation of my Soul.  O May I arise  on the last day to life everlasting.

4770018/4767189/4935345.title: A Collection of Prayers
4770018/4767189/4935345.text:
Long ago in Ireland when there was very little printing of religious magazines, the people made up short prayers of their own,most of which have died away;but some are still preserved in this district since mediaival ages.The following are some of the beautiful prayers my mother has taught me.  "Should Jesus fear the cross alone,No I there is a cross for everyone  and there is a cross for me."The above mentioned prayer is said in time of affliction whilst following is very often quoted when we rise in the morning:-"Good morning day God keep me from going astray,God keep me from sin and shameThat I may rise again on the Lords Day."Before people retire to bed, they say the following prayer, dedicated to the
(continues on next page)

4770018/4767192/4935348.title: A Collection of Prayers
4770018/4767192/4935348.text:
Every Christian is obliged to say their morning and night prayers and our 'grace' before and after meals, but this is not enough to do for God. We can make our lives a eeaseless prayer, if we say a word to God about what we are going to do, and offer it up to Him. When I wake in the morning I was always taught to bless myself and say :-"Good morning, day,God keep me from going astrayGod keep me from sin and shame That I may rise again on the Lord's day"On a fine day I was taught to say"Good morrow, morning, fine day,Jesus assist me the right way,my soul from sin, my body from shame, And here I go in the Lord's name"When I'm starting to learn or to take work I always say
(continues on next page)

4935120/4879760/4935388.text: Nar iomdha grainne gainmhidhe sa traigNa ribe fein ag fasNa braon druchta ar a barNa an meid bheannachtai a bheidh le d t'anamAnois agus ar uair do bhaisAgus le gach aon anam eile Ata in a bprainn.Lan uaighe Phadraig agus tuamba ChriostDe bheannachtai a bheidh led t.anamAnois agus ar uair do bhaisAgus gach aon anam eile Ata in a bprainn.

4742029/4729615/4935659.text:

selling clothes, needles and all such things. Bobby Grace also used to go around selling small articles and he is the only local one alive at present.Crowns and four-penny pieces were very common long ago but they are gone out of use now.People used also sell goods in stalls by the roadside. They sometimes used to put a hole in a coin to see if it would return to them and very often it did.



People say the following prayer to keep off nightmares.Ann is the mother of Mary,Mary is the mother of Jesus,

4921969/4914293/4935876.title: Prayers
4921969/4914293/4935876.text:
Prayers.Prayer to Angel guardian on waking.  Good morning angel guardian.  The night is past and gone.  Thou hast watched beside me at midnight as the dawn.  Another day is before me and as it flies away.  O make it Angel guardian, a holy, happy day.



Prayer on Rising.With my eyes fixed on Jesus, I hail the new born day.I ask the Sacred Heart, to guard and guide me all the way.With my eyes fixed on Jesus, I go my daily round.For well I know where health and grace and love's light are found.With my eyes fixed on Jesus at length from labour free.
(continues on next page)

4798736/4794543/4936146.title: Collection of Prayers
4798736/4794543/4936146.text: As I lie down to sleep, I give my heart and some to God to keep.The Blessed Virgin Mary comes to waken me, for fear anything would come to hurt or harm me.There are four corners on my bed, Four Angels over spread, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on.The night of a storm an old woman's prayer is that the Lord may raise the wind above the house. God bless and save the people and preserve them from all harm. if I die before I Rise, I leave my some to God.  lord be the flower and Lady be the branch.  Blessed Virgin Mary, maybe with me, at my dying hour.

4742112/4737074/4936215.title: Paidir Nuair a Bheadh Duine ar Tí Bás
4742112/4737074/4936215.text: Chómhairle nuair do bheidhtheá ag cheannach capaill.Bhíodh sé slán follán i gcnámh agus i n-áil, gan stadaoil, gan bhradaoil, gan sgáth i dtreabhadh i bhfuirseadh i marchuigheacht, nó i dtarraing cárr, gan mharc mhuinéil, nó béil goile, spabhán dheiridh, nó thosuig, nó locht ar bhith a raibh ar gearann capall, múilidh, nó asal a dheacaidh.J. Naughton- Pupil-from grandmother, 87 ys

he opened it he found to his bitter disappointment that it did not contain the gold he had expected to see, but only a small hammer, and all the other implements that are used for repairing boots. The boy then looked from the box to the Leiprechaun in astonishment. The Leiprechaun told to go home and make use of what he had found, and in this way he would make his gold as he himself had to do. The went home and did as he was told.

Morning Prayer.Holy Mary, Virgin Mother of God who was conceived without sin I chose thee this day for the Lady and Mistress of this house. I beceech thee through the Immaculate Conception to preserve it from pestilence fire and water from lightening from tempests from robbers from earthquakes and a sudden death. Bless and protect holy Virgin Mary all its enemies save, them from sin and all others misfortune and accidents.

(continues on next page)

4723824/4716590/4937263.title: Prayers
4723824/4716590/4937263.text:
PrayersGod bless Friday and Good-Friday to the day that our Saviour was crucified by the Jews that came with their piercing sharp and pierced our Saviour from hand to heart. His blessed Mother was standing by with a heavy heart and a mournful cry.O Say these word three times a day and three times a night in Remembrance of Me. Death nor fire nor the seven deadly sins shall never enter in. I lay my heart unto the cross, O Lord, O Lord, damn me not in Eternity! Amen.



Prayer to be Said at MornLord! every time I kiss a crucifix or make the sign of the cross, put my hand on my heart, or take holy water. Everytime I raise my eyes to heaven, speak, act or breathe I mean to give myself entirely to thee, to serve and to love thee, more
(continues on next page)

August Queen of Heaven! Sovereign mistress of the Angels. Thou! who from the beggining hast received from God the power and permission to crush the head of Satan, we humbly beseech thee to send thy holy legions that under they commands and by thy power, they may pursue the evil spirits, encounter them on every side, resist their bold attacks, and drive them hence into the abyss of everlasting woe! 119       Folklore  A Collection of Prayers.  *Raise me O Lord from this bed of sleep that I may adore and praise Thee.(That is said when a person rises.)  *Good luck to the work.(That is said when a person is churning,milking or working in the field.)  *All I do this day,I do it for Thee,my Jesus.(This is said when a person begins work.)  *God bless all here.(That is said when a stranger comes into a house.)  *God be merciful to his soul.    May he rest in peace.(That is said when a person dies.)The sign of the cross is made on the forehead while saying the following prayer  *May Jesus of Nazareth,King of the
(continues on next page)

4921974/4914649/4938388.title: The Palatine's Prayer
4921974/4914649/4938388.text: The Palatine’s PrayerThe following is told of a family of Palatines who settled in Co Limerick many years ago.In this particular household there were an old man and his wife, their son and the son’s wife, and an Irish Catholic servant boy.Every night before retiring they recited prayers and the old man always concluded by saying aloud“God bless me and my wife.Son and his wifeWe four and no more.”For a long time the servant boy listened patiently. But at last one evening he showed his displeasure. Just as the old man was about to repeat the usual ending. The boy faced him and said“The Devil sweep you and your wife,Sam and his wife,You four and no more.”
4921974/4914649/4938388.school_info: School: Móin na nGé (C.), An Caisleán Nua

4922006/4917501/4939288.title: Prayers
4922006/4917501/4939288.text: Prayers:-A prayer said when danger is near.Mary, Mary, Christ and the saints be between us and all harm.  Mary and her son Patrick with his staff.  Martin with his mantle.  Brigid with her hood.  Michael with his shield and God before them all with His strong right arm.John Murphy,Ballyroe,Ballingarry.Got from my mother.   Aged 46.

4922006/4917502/4939291.title: Prayers
4922006/4917502/4939291.text:
Prayers:-A prayer to be said at St. Patrick's well which is about two and half miles from Ballingarry.  St. Patrick I come to you for the good of my health in the honour and glory of God and the good of my own salvation.A prayer said going to bed -Sweet Jesus I now go the rest in union with thy repose in the bosom of thy eternal Father. In thy arms of thy blessed Mother.  May every breath I breathe to night be an act of love, praise, thanksgiving and sorrow for having offended You.A child's prayer going to bed.
(continues on next page)
