4922006/4917505/4939294.title: Prayers
4922006/4917505/4939294.text: This prayer is said immediately after the Angels in the eveningJesus Mary and Joseph take charge of us all for this night and ever. Always keep us from all hurt and harm sin and trouble and danger from the hands and tongues of our enemies [bath] should and body amen.

forty acres he would put about twenty acres under crop. He plougs, harrows grubs, cultivated and opens the drills Most of the farmers round our district ploughs the manure down Which leaves very little trouble when they are putting in the potatoes. Their are lots of kinds of potatoes Such as:- Cares-pinks, queens, ann-banners. Long white ones Champions black-jacks. Epicures, which are known as the early potatoes. They are the first put in and the first dug. Aran Councellors is another potatoe. Queens are the best potatoes for eating.

4723866/4720593/4940976.title: Prayers
4723866/4720593/4940976.text:
PrayersThe people of ancient Ireland were very fond of prayer. One fo the prayers they said at night wasI lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to (take) keep.In Ireland long ago people used to say little prayers. One of them wasMy God I hope in TheeAnother of them wasWe thank Thee I Lord for all Thy goodness and kindnessThe prayers that I learned at home were short prayers that people say going to bed. Some of them areThere are four four corners on my bed. There are four angels at my head. Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lay onHere I do lie down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keep
(continues on next page)

4723866/4720601/4940981.title: Prayer
4723866/4720601/4940981.text: PrayerThere are a lot of payers that never saw print. These prayers were taught by the old women of long ago. One of them isGod the Father bless theeJesus Christ defend theeAnd keep thee this night and this dayNow and forever Amen. The old people had an old habit of when they were kindling the fire. First they put the poker in straight into the fire. Then they put it in sideways. This resembled the cross. Then they saidO' Good JesusGuard me and Guide meHelp me in my distress nowand if I may die this day at that hour.

4723866/4720623/4941252.title: Proverbs
4723866/4720623/4941252.text:
There are a lot of old sayings such as. A stitch in time saves nine, Long runs the Fox but he is caught at last. Never wait until to -morrow what we can do to -day. A wise man always carries his coat. Too many cooks spoil the broth. A bird in your hand is worth too in a bush. A borrowed horse has hard hooves. Live horse and you'll get grass. Dead with tea and dead without it. The Juice of a cow is good living or dead. Listen to the river and you will catch fish. You can never make a silk purse out of a sows ear. One can never get blood out of a  turnip. It is hard to cut wool of a goat.



There are a lot of prayers which never saw print. These prayers were taugh by the old women of Long ago. One of them is God the father bless thee Christ defend

4723869/4720911/4941308.title: Local Prayers
4723869/4720911/4941308.text:
Local Prayers.There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels at my head.  Matthew Mark Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on.As I lie down tonight to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake, I ask of God my soul to take.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me and my soul and body I give to thee. Through the merits of Thy wounds Thou didst duffer on the tree. O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.God save us.  O God bless us.  Lord protect us. May God bless us.  Jesus Christ defend and keep us, the virtue of the Holy Ghost may lighten and sanctify this night and for ever. Amen.May the most just, the most high and adorable will of God by done, praised and eternally exalted in all things.

4723869/4720913/4941309.title: An Old Prayer
4723869/4720913/4941309.text: I heard the following "prayer" from Peter McElvaney. (Farmer) Ballagh. 3 M.House.Let us pray our Lord with the hammers of hell, and the sledge of damnation, may banish the Orangemen out of the nation before St. Patrick's Day, that they may be damned, rammed and crammed into the big gun of Athlone, and come down in a shower of toe sparables  to pave the shoes of the Papists.

4811605/4801148/4941714.title: Old Prayers
4811605/4801148/4941714.text: The old people said a prayer every night after the rosary and offered it for the living and deceased persons.An Coróinn Mhuire PáirtiachDo álaimíd fuar in Coróinn Mhuire mar agus ir mar nGnadh an Tíghneana Trochaire ir an Maighdean Muire. Ar ceann ár shláinte agus mhuilegan. Dia ir Muire Gur Míchál agus na dha Aspolig ghlórmhairch agus do thabhairt Aingealí do tug. Fuargaul fuipne agus, saor mBreithianchar ap na h-anam ra na bhFláthar agus ar n anam bocht rinne an lá deirineach. Amen.

The names of the Landlords were Mr. Pain, Mr. Hitchen, Mr. Turner and Mr. Edles.The landlords were very long in the place. They were very bad landlords they put the farmers out of their farms and the people went away to foreign countries. The landlords came from England and took the land off the people and they had to pay a high rent.

My father told me another prayer last night - One, two, three, four, five, six, seven.All young children go to heaven,When they die their sins are forgiven.One two, three, four, five, six, seven.

Here I lay down my head to sleep.I pray that God my soul will keep.And if I die before I wakeI pray that God my soul will take.There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels over head,St. Matthew, St. Mark, St. Luke, and St. John.God bless the bed that I lay on.As I go out to holy land, I see the Virgin Mary stand byWith her heavy heart of mourning flies.Seven bells ringing, Seven priests singing.

4922016/4918660/4942423.title: Religious Stories
4922016/4918660/4942423.text:
Once a good holy girl who attended Mass very often wished to know how many Masses she would hear during life.  This was a hard thing to count so she decided to put a stone, for every Mass she heard, into a box and to her surprise she found only one stone in the box which was a sign that she had heard only one good Mass during her life.

4922016/4918663/4942430.title: Old Prayers
4922016/4918663/4942430.text: When going to bed at night:-Sweet Jesus I now go to rest in union with Thy ReposeIn the arms of Thy Blessed Father and in the bosom of Thy Blessed Mother.May every breath I breathe this night be an act of praise, love and thanks-giving and sorrow for having offended Thee and I wish to love Thee daily more and more.  Sweet Jesus have mercy on me.When getting up in the morning:-I will rise from my bed of sleep to labour for the salvation of my soul.

4922016/4918664/4942431.title: Old Prayers
4922016/4918664/4942431.text: When kindling the fire:-        My Jesus and Mary keep me from the harm of the day as you did in the night.On awakening in the morning:-    O my God, my only God, the author of my being and my last end I give Thee my heart.  Praise, honour and glory be to Thee for ever Amen.While clothing oneself:-        O my God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may wear it pure + undefiled before Thy Judgement seat.

On Palm Sunday palm is blessed. It is worn that day. On May Eve people never pick any flowers - never bring them into the house. All the crops and the house are blessed with Holy Water to keep away all harm

In this district the Rosary was always prefixed with this Introduction -"We offer up this rosary in honour and glory of God begging and beseeching of the Almighty God to forgive us all our sins".Another old prayerThere are four corners on this bedThere are four angels overhead Matthew, Mark, Luke & JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on.----------------------When anything died the owner was heard to remark"That the harm of the year may go with it"
(continues on next page)

4723847/4718407/4943333.title: Old Prayers
4723847/4718407/4943333.text:
Here are some of the old prayers that are said in this district.When lighting the lamp at night:-Lord send us the light of Heaven.When in bed:-(1)Here I lay me down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,Wake in hour waken never,Lord Jesus receive my soul for ever.(2)If any evil bothers me,Sweet Blessed Virgin waken me.(3)Lord within and Lord withoutand Lord of Heaven be about us.(4)There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels on my spreadMatthew Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.(5) As I put my right foot in to bed.
(continues on next page)

4922023/4919332/4943366.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922023/4919332/4943366.text:
A Collection of Prayers.   2/2/1938A Night Prayer, said before retiringThere are four corners in my bed.There are four Angels overspread,Matthew, Michael, Luke and John,Good bless this bed that I lay on.In this bed I lay to sleep.To God I give my soul to keep.And if I die before I wake.To God I give my soul to take.A Prayer for Protection - said at night.St Mark, St. Luke, St. James, St. John.God bless the bed that I lay on.If an evil spirit comes to me.Jesus, banish him away from me.A Prayer to the Blessed Sacrament.Dear vault of Heaven serenely blue.How many stars are shining through.Thy azure depths beyond all count are they.Praised be the Holy Sacrament as many times a day.Fair world,  the work of God's right hand.How many are the grains of sand.In all thy frame
(continues on next page)

4922017/4918822/4943806.title: Prayers
4922017/4918822/4943806.text:
When people were sick long ago, they had an old prayer to say "The Lord will not take me with an unprovided death".This prayer was said long ago by the people at night"May the Lord shed his grace on us to-nightAnd may we be guided by his light".In bed at night"Take me up to heaven soon Lord"

4921950/4912634/4943820.title: Paidreacha
4921950/4912634/4943820.text: Paidir mar cosg ar an dtromluighe:-Áine Máthair Mhuire,Muire, Máthair Criost,Lisbeth, Máthair Eóin BaisteCuirim an triúr sinIdir me agus cnaiste na leapthanAn crann gur crochadh CriostChun me a shábháil ó'n dtromluighe.Ámén.Chun Bás Naomhtha D'fhághail:'Íosa, a Mhuire, a Naomh SheósaimhBeirim suas díbh mo chroidhe is m'anam;A Íosa, a Mhuire, is a Naomh SheósaimhBídhidh ag cabhrú liom ar feadh mo saoghail,Isteach id'lámhaibh féin go nglacair mo sprid a ÍosaM'anam go nglacair uaim, a Thighearna ÍosaAmén.Eibhlís Ní Chatháin a d'aithris. 4921950/4912635/4943823.title: Aisling a Deineadh do Mhuire
4921950/4912635/4943823.text: "Dia dhuit, a Mháthairín,""Dia is Muire dhuit, a ghrádh gheal,""Id' chodladh ataoi, a Mháthairín?"Ní h-eadh airiú, a ghradh ghil,Ach a deanamh aisling' atáim-seAr fhear caol dubhAtá ar each caol donn, deargSleadh nimhe 'na dheis-láimhLe sáth trí chroidhe ro-naomhtha an TighearnaSin í an fhirinne, is ní h-aon bhréugAgus an t-é a dearfadh an duain seoTrí h-uaire na luighe ar leabaidh chiúinFlaithis Dé do gheobhadh sé mar dhuaisAr uair a bháis".( ó Eibhlís Ní Chatháin )

4921950/4912636/4943828.title: Paidir Luain
4921950/4912636/4943828.text: Do ghaibh Muire amach ar maidin roim lá,Do thárlaidh uirthe Naomh JóbAn fear beannuighthe ó'n Róimh.Do bhronn sé uirthe brat,An brat a bhí "beannuighthe" le banndaí óir."Go mbeannuightear díbh, a lucht an bhruit !Ná tugaidh faillighe bhur ngnó,Ná h-ithídh feóil Dé Céadaoin,Is ná tugaidh faillighe sa troscasdhUmhlaighídh sios do'n gcléir is do's na cúig láLe MuireUmhluighidh síos do Mhic DéIs beidh sibh in bhúr gcómh aos leis na leinbhNá h-innisídh bréug do MhuireIs beidh sí 'na bean-charaid agaibhAr uair bhúr mbáis".An t-é a dearfaidh an duain seo trí h-uaire gach maidin Luain, do gheobhaidh sé Flaithis Dé mar dhuais, agus radharc ar an Maighdin Mhuire trí h-uaire romh bás.ó Eiblís Ní Chatháin

Who livest and reignest world with end Amen.IIITo be said with your night prayers.O my God I return thee thanks for all the benefits which I have recieved from thee this day. 4922089/4851471/4944760.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922089/4851471/4944760.text: Oh Good morrow bright day.  Oh Jesus direct me onthe right way.  Keep my soul from sin and my body from shame and I arise this day in God's Holy Name.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels standing by.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.Bless this bed that I lay on.If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul he'll take.To be said when you are in bed at night.A Prayer to the B.V.Oh Hold Virgin mother of God and sure refuge of penitent sinners, intercede for me at this moment that this confession which I am about to make may not render me more guilty but may obtain for me the remission of all my sins and the necessary grace to avoid them hereafter, Amen.

Amen3. Here I lay down to sleepJesus at my head and Saint Joseph at my feetAnd the twelve apostles guard me until morning. Amen4. 4922091/4851576/4945021.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922091/4851576/4945021.text: A Collection of Prayers.When the clock strikes the following prayer is said - "Oh most holy Mother of God, life passes away and death approached. When the hour comes beyond to me, Oh most tender Mother expose the heart of thy blessed Son, favour of plea in my regard through Christ Our Lord" Amen. When going to bed the following prayer is "As I lay down to sleep, To God I give my soul to keep, If I die before I wake, To God I give my soul to take. There are four corners on my bed, There are four angels down spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lay on. O Mary, My Mother and My Hope, I take refuge under thy mantle, There let me live and die, Deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing." Another prayer usually said when going to bed is "Matthew Mark, Luke and John, Bless the bed that I lay on, Four corners to my bed, Four angels round my head, One to sing, one to pray, Two to carry my soul away.

For breakfast porridge made from oaten meal and yellow meal was made and eaten with skimmed milk. The milk was drunk from a wooden mug called a peggin or noggan.For dinner:- potatoes and milk and sometimes eggs.Supper like either breakfast or dinner Three meals only were taken each day. Barley bread oaten bread and wheaten bread were used.
(continues on next page)

4922085/4850934/4946642.title: Local Prayers
4922085/4850934/4946642.text:
On entering a house the person says, "God bless all here".  Then the people inside say "And you too".  On seeing a terrible wound or birth-mark, one would say "God bless the mark".When a person meets with an accident, if another person tells the other one about it, the latter would say, "Lord between us and all harm.If a person does a job for another person, the latter would say "Lord spare you your health"If a person pays some money to another one, the person who got it would say, "More increase to you",On passing a grave-yard people say "The Lord have mercy on the dead".When you do any job for a person, the person says, "May the lord leave you your health".When people hear that there is a
(continues on next page)

4921993/4916271/4947184.title: Local Prayers
4921993/4916271/4947184.text: The old women of this locality long ago composed short prayers in rhymes. The prayers they composed are as follows.There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels over my head,One to guard me,One to guide me,Two to carry my soul to heaven.St.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on,And if I die before I wake,I pray to god my soul to take.Grace in the kitchen and grace in the hallMay the grace of God be about us all.The above prayers were composed years ago and were taught to the children of the surrounding districts.

4921994/4916436/4947508.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921994/4916436/4947508.text: The old Irish people had always a custom of starting the day with prayer. In the morning when they awoke, they blessed themselves and returned God thanks for the nights sleep, and for bringing them safely throgh the dangers of the night. When going on a journey they said "God speed us, or God speed all travellers." When they went into bed at night they said a prayer as follows:-"Here as I lay down to sleep,To God I give my sol to keep.And if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeThere are four corners in my bed, There are four angels at my head,St Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lay on".

4811611/4801913/4947659.title: Tobar Beannaithe
4811611/4801913/4947659.text: There is a holy well near Eyeries called [?] Beannaithe. Long ago many people used go there to perform rounds on this little well before and after first Mass. There is a cure in it for sore eyes. They used bathe their eyes with water. They used always leave some little token after them. Many people were cured. They are giving up the custom now as they are not paying any rounds there.

4742093/4735127/4947764.title: Paidreacha
4742093/4735127/4947764.text:
Deireadh na sean daoine an paidhir seo gach oidhche agus iadh sínte sa leabhaidh agus deirtear gur ana phaidir é. Sa phaidhir seo iarrain tú ar Dhia na Glormhaire aimisir a thabhairt duit chun dul chun Foisidín agus aithríghe do dhéanamh:-"Luigim ar leabhaid leis andTríonóidh Naomhthaleis An Mhaighdhean MuireAgus le Naoimh Ióseph,Aingeal cuinnle go ndeineadhtréo  na Maighdheana glormhaireIICóngnamh is grásta.
(continues on next page)

4921994/4916437/4947838.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921994/4916437/4947838.text: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I rise I thank Thee O my God for having preserved me from the dangers of the past night. I offer thee my heart, and soul, my whole being all thoughts, words, and actions and I intend to gain all the indulgences I can and I place them the hands of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

4921995/4916453/4947906.title: Collection of Prayers
4921995/4916453/4947906.text:
Collection of Prayers.Amongst the old people there were many beautiful short prayers, and many of them were in the Irish language. The prayer of pious salutation "Dia's Muire  was in everyone's mouth, when he or she entered a house, or met each other."God bless the work", was always spoken when a person entered a garden or fields or workshop, where men would be at work.  In praising a crop of any kind, or praising a cow or other animal, a person would say "God bless it".  The old people always thanked God for gifts as they always believed that everything carries through the prayer of God, and in thanking Him, they used to say "Praise be to God", even
(continues on next page)

4922013/4918213/4947935.title: Prayers
4922013/4918213/4947935.text: Prayers.Jesus, dear Jesus, have mercy on me.My heart and my soul, I resign unto thee.By the five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree.O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.This prayer was got from.Mrs. Fitzgerald  (Age 82)Cappagh,Askeaton,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918214/4947937.title: Prayers
4922013/4918214/4947937.text: O'Mary my  mother and my hope,I take refuge under thy mantle, there will I live and die.Deliver me from sin and grant one thy Holy blessing.This prayer was given by.Mrs. Fitzerald  (Age 82)Cappagh,Askeaton,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918215/4947941.title: Prayers
4922013/4918215/4947941.text: O'Lord Jesus Christ, son of the living God, accept this prayer, with the surpassing love with which thou didst endure all the wounds of thy most holy body, and have mercy on me and on all sinners and on all the faithful, living and departed.Grant unto them grace and mercy, remission of sins and everlasting life. Amen.This prayer was given by. Mrs. Fitzgerald  (Age 82)Cappagh,Askeaton,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918216/4947942.title: Prayers
4922013/4918216/4947942.text: O'Lord, I need shelter from the storm.  refuge from my enemies, a place of rest in my weariness, hide me within thy wounds, for there is shelter, refuge and rest.This prayer was given by .Mrs. fitzgerald (Age 82)Cappagh,Askeaton,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918217/4947951.title: Prayers
4922013/4918217/4947951.text: As I lie in my bed,I pray to god to be my guide,If I die before I wake,I give my soul to god to take,If I dream of nay evil thing,O'Blessed Lady wake me then.This prayer was given by .Mrs. Sheehy (Age 76).Ballycannon,Croagh,Rathkeale,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918218/4947954.title: Prayers
4922013/4918218/4947954.text: In the name of Our Lord, Jesus Christ, crucified. I lay myself down to rest, bless me O'Lord after this short and miserable pilgrimage, bring me to life everlasting, Amen.  I must die but I don't know when,where, nor how.  all I know that if I died in mortal sin I am lost for ever.  O' Jesus have mercy on me, may the Lord save me from a sudden and unprovided death, that I may never die in sin.This prayer was given by. Mrs. Sheehy  (Age 76)Ballycannon,Croagh,Rathkeale,Co. Limerick.

4922013/4918219/4947958.title: Prayers
4922013/4918219/4947958.text: O Mary, my Mother assist me tonight. To be humble and patient, to labour and to pray, amidst trials and crosses my life course to run, and to whisper to Jesus thy holy will be done.

4922013/4918220/4947995.title: Prayers
4922013/4918220/4947995.text: O Son of Mary, I love you, indeed I do. Who am I at all, that you should come next or near me?  O God of Heaven, make a little corner for me in your heart and never while there is life in me let me lose my place there and after death may I still hide there.  Amen.Have pity on me, O Blessed Mother, talk to my God for me.  Tell Him I am a poor, ignorant creature, full of nothing but sin and misery, but that I love you, His own dear Mother.  I am a poor servant and for your sweet sake to help and pity me.  Amen.This prayer is got from.Mrs. Whelan,Clough,Rathkeale,Co. Limerick.

4922100/4852362/4948174.title: Prayers
4922100/4852362/4948174.text: This prayer is said going to bed and in bed.Jesus the branch and Mary the flower.Jesus be with me at my hourJesus be with when I am in sinJesus be with when I am aloneAnd Jesus be with me when I have noneWhen in bed this prayer is saidAs I lay my right hand side praying to God to be my guide if any evil come to me. "Stoop down Jesus and cover me"This prayer is said at massMay God be with me and forgive me my sin. May he always show his divine countenance and give me his holy benediction. AmenThis prayer is said on Good FridayGod Bless Good Friday and every Friday too. The day our Saviour was Crucified. His blessed mother standing by with a heavy heart and a mournful sigh.

4922083/4850665/4949765.text:
The following are given by Mrs Ahern, Foilaclera, Doon, Co. Limerick. Prayer to be said when a person is in bed. As I lie down on my right side, I pray to God to be my guide. If I die before I wake, to God I give my soul to take, God within me, God without me. God Almighty be about me, There are four corners on my bed, There are four Angels on it spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on.



Another PrayerGod bless Good Friday, Good Friday, The dau on which Our Blessed Saviour was Crucified,The Crown of Thorns on His headHis Blessed Mother Standing by,With a heavy heart and a dismal cry, She crying out whoever will this prayer Three times by day, three times by night Never shall enter the gate of Hell.

4922083/4850667/4949781.text: Irish prayers, saying etc., from Mr. Patrick Devitt"Is dóig le muinntir Faill Uí Cléirig nach bhfuil Dia ann ar aon chor""Tá mise dreoighte is ní mhairfid(?) i bhfad"" Do chorp dara go diabhal is do phatóga""Mo chorp ó'n Diabhal""Fágaim é súid mar atá sé"."Mo ghrádh croidhe, A Mhuire Mháthair,Mo chabhair cunta is tú mo shláinte,Luighimid síos fé do scith anocht"(This prayer was given by Mr Michael Devitt and was taught to him by his Grandmother)He did not understand much IrishHe only repeated what he heard his grandmother saying."Cúis gair ó Dhia cughaim" was a favourite expression with my mother Mrs. Mary Ahern (Nee Ryan) of (?), Doon, Col. Soon they came near the river Shannon. The poor man trembled with fear as he thought "Will the plough jump the river"? The next instant horses, plough and all flew up into the air and landed on the other side.The poor man was so delighted he shouted with joy "Wisha, mo ghrádh thú old plough". The plough stuck in the ground and the poor old man had to walk back home to Limerick.

4922033/4920603/4953741.title: Piseoga
4922033/4920603/4953741.text:
Piseoga.In the event of a farm being in two separate lots, necessitating, at harvesting time.  A journey by road from the home to the outlying farm, it was always laid down that the harvest works if mowing or reaping, should begin on a Friday on the out-farm.  In the event of that being impossible when the Friday arrived, a member of the family, and very often a child - but I cannot infer that that was the rule - would go to the outlying farm, and cut a fistful of the hay or corn with a penknife or table knife or any convenient blade on that appointed day.  The work was accordingly begun according to schedule.



A Prayer.I learned the following Prayer from hearing my two sisters recite it at bed-time or rather after having gone to bed, when I was a child of five or six years of age.  They learned it. I believe from my mother, whose nebulous form,  I can still see, after nearly forty years, standing at the bed-side in the "big room", listening to the children saying their prayers. "That big room", was my bedroom, shared with my two oldest sister, until I was promoted in the less tender, but much more desired, charge of an older brother who slept under the thatch:There are four corners on my bed.Four blessed angels round my head.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lie on.If I die in my sleep or in my wake (sic)
(continues on next page)

Protect and guard me for a sudden and unprovided (?) death and give me a long and happy life in this world"Bless me O Heavenly Father and give

I see the moon and the moon sees me,God bless the moon and God bless me, Grace in the kitchen, Grace in the hallAnd the Grace of God above us all. This was said by the old people when they would see a new moon for the first time. Here I lay down for to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeI do now know know, nor where or whenBut if I die in mortal sinI am lost forever, O Jesus have mercy on my,This was said in bed before going to sleep.



The old people long ago used to say this prayer before going to sleep and when getting up in the morning. "I return thee thanks O Lord for health and strength, eyesight and the use of my limbs. Protect and guard me from sudden and unprovided death and give me a long and happy life in this world."

4742044/4730599/4955383.title: Prayers
4742044/4730599/4955383.text:
Prayers told by Mrs Susan McDonald, Carrickakelly.She is over 70 years of age. It was from her aunt Mrs Nancy Finnegan who used to live with her in the same house as McDonald occupies now, that she heard them and many other old stories now forgotten. Her aunt and her grandfather were fluent Irish speakers. Her grandfather was a recognised authority in the neighbourhood on the language both written and spoken. He taught the Parish Priest of that time to say the prayers after mass in Irish. Her aunt told her of how they used to be trying to keep the children in her time from speaking Irish. A "tally" would be hung around their neck if they spoke an Irish word. Her mother also spoke Irish and English and always said her prayers in Irish.Guidim Peadar, guidhim PolGuidim Eoin BáisteGuidim Rí an Domhain gCumannCudach m'anam agus mo chuirp"Greas" Muire mo "ghreas"Greas chugam ÍosaÍosa aige na coisGreas na gCeithre gCroisA choinneal anéag na luighe na siúd(?)Íosa Mhílis a Mháthair DéGo raibh tú agam féin anois agus ar uair mo bháis. Amen.
(continues on next page)

I lie on this bed as I lie in my grave,Begging of Jesus my soul to saveJesus the branch, Mary the flower.May they both be around me at my dying hour.As I lie in this bed to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep.If any evil comes to me,O Mary Mother waken me.God bless this house from thatch to flower.The twelve apostles guard my door.Four good angels at my bed.Two at the foot and two at the head.Four corners in my bed.Four angels round my headOne to watch and one to prayAnd two to bear my soul awayJesus, kinder Shepard, bless they little land tonight.In the darkness be thou near me.Keep me safe till mornings light.
(continues on next page)

4922053/4847920/4955957.title: Old Prayers
4922053/4847920/4955957.text: A prayer I learned from hearing others say it when I was a child -"Here as I lay down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeMatthew Mark Luke and JohnBless the bed that I lie onThere are four corners to my bedThere are four angels round my head"The foregoing was said when lying down to sleep.Another version of above has added to it at the end.If I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeThere are four corners to my bed.There are four angels on them spread.As I looked up at the Blessed lambI saw the Blessed Virgin coming onSeven mass books in her handSeven candles lighting seven  bells ringing Seven priests singingOpen the gates of Heaven shut the gates of hell'tis time for my poor soul to go to Heaven for evermore.Amen

4770007/4766439/4957418.text: Prayer when going to bed:O Lord bless this bed I am going to lie onAnd bless this sleep I am going to take Sweet Mary my Mother be thou at my headBlessed John the Apostle be thou at my feetMy dear Angel guardian be thou at my sideMay Christ's messengers with the holy oilsBe in time at my death to put the seal on my soul.In the name of Christ Crucified.

4742037/4729970/5009400.title: Prayers
4742037/4729970/5009400.text:
Children when they are yound are always taught little prayers, by their parents before they begin to go to school. Some of those prayers are to be said in the morning, and some at night-time, or during the day.These prayers are usually short, little simple ones, and easy to learn.A prayer to say in bed -There are four corners on my bed,There are four angles overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless this bed I lie on.If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.Jesus the branch,Mary the flower,Jesus, Mary and JosephAssist me at my dying hour.O Jesus of Nazareth.Preseve my father and mother,My brothers and sisters and myself,From all accidents or sudden death.
(continues on next page)

The Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost, The Father to direct me. The Son to protect me and the Holy Ghost to take full possession of my soul. Long ago when people had no prayers printed, they made up beautiful prayers, which they taught to their children, they had a special prayer practically for every hour of the dayOf course the rosary was the commonest of all. 4922130/4854839/5009967.title: Prayer - To the Blessed Virgin Mary
4922130/4854839/5009967.text: Oh Mary my Mother and my hope I take refuge under thy mantle.  There will I live and die.  Deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessings.AmenWritten by Elizabeth HodginsBehamore.Obtained fromMrs. Mary Ryan (38)NewtownCloughjordanCo Tipperary.

4922130/4854840/5009970.title: Night Prayer
4922130/4854840/5009970.text: May the will of God be done by us.May the death of the Saints be won by us.And the light of the Kingdom begun in us.May Jesus the Child be beside my bed.May the Lamb of mercy uplift my head.May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed.And Michael be steward of my soul.Written by Elizabeth HodginsBehamore.Obtained fromMiss Elizabeth Hodgins senior (45)BehamoreCloughjordanCo Tipperary.

4922130/4854841/5009972.title: Prayer
4922130/4854841/5009972.text: Jesus the Branch and Mary the FlowerBe with me at my dying hour.If anything happens to me while I sleep I give my soul to Christ to keep.If anything happens to me when I wakeI give my soul to Christ to take.Written byElizabeth HodginsBehamore.Obtained fromMrs Kathleen Hodgins (38)BehamoreCloughjordanCo Tipperary.

4922130/4854842/5009976.title: Prayer to the Infant Jesus
4922130/4854842/5009976.text: Infant Jesus meek and mildLook on me the little childPity mine and pity meAnd suffer me to come to theeSweet Heart of Jesus I adore theeSweet Heart of Mary I implore theeSweet Heart of Joseph poor and justIn these three hearts I put my trustJesus keep me from sin and shameAnd I rise up in God's name.God give me heart and soul and Jesus be about me.The twelve Apostles be my guideAnd guide all badness from about meAmen.Written byElizabeth HodginsBehamoreObtained fromMrs Mary Ryan (38)NewtownCloughjordanCo Tipperary.

4922130/4854843/5009981.title: Prayer to the Guardian Angel
4922130/4854843/5009981.text: O Holy Angel to whose care God in His mercy hath commited me.  I return thee now my most sincere and humble thanks.I conjure thee O admirable Guide to continue still thy care to defend me against my enemies to remove from me the occasions of sin to obtain for me a constant docility to Divine inspirations to protect me in particular at the hour of my death and then to conduct me to the mansions of eternal repose where in Thy blessed society I may praise our Creator for ever.Amen.Written byElizabeth HodginsBehamore.Obtained fromMr John Hassett (58)BehamoreCloughjordanCo Tipperary

4922130/4854844/5009984.title: Prayer Against Wicked Thoughts
4922130/4854844/5009984.text: O Almighty and Most Gracious God Mercifully regard our prayers and deliver our hearts from the temptations of evil thoughts that our souls may be made worthy habitations of the Holy Ghost.Amen.Written byElizabeth HodginsBehamore.Obtained fromMrs Mary Griffin (35)SopwellCloughjordanCo Tipperary.

4922130/4854845/5009989.title: Prayer for a Happy Death
4922130/4854845/5009989.text: Jesus the Branch and Mary the FlowerBe with me at my dying hour;If anything happens to me while I sleepIll give my soul to Christ to keepIf anything happens to me while I wakeIll give my soul to Christ to takeWritten byMary HassettBehamoreCloughjordanObtained from Mr Michael Morouney (62)The PikeOffaly.

4922130/4854846/5010000.title: Prayer to Saint Joseph
4922130/4854846/5010000.text:
O Faithful Servant whom God had charged with the care of His Family thou whom He had established the Guardian and Protector of the life of Jesus, the Consoler and Support of His Mother and His own faithful associate in the great affair of our Redemption, thou who hadst the happiness to live with Jesus and Mary and to expire in their arms, Chaste Spouse of the Mother of God, thou model of pure, humble, and interior souls be touched with the confidence we have in thee and graciously accept these testamonies of our devotion.We return God thanks for the favours He has bestowed on thee and we beg through thy intercession that we may imitate thy virtues.  Pray for us then O glorious Saint and by that love thou always hadst for Jesus and for Mary and which Jesus and Mary had always for thee obtain always for us the incomparable advantage of living faithful to Jesus and
(continues on next page)

4922060/4848661/5010190.title: Prayers Learned at Home - A Very Old Prayer Said After Holy Communion
4922060/4848661/5010190.text: My loving God, A hundred thousand welcomes. Oh, God Son of Mary I love you, indeed I do. Who am I at all that you should come next or near me. Oh God of Heaven make a little corner for me in your heart that never while I have life in me may I lose my place there and after death may I still hide there. Oh Blessed Mother, talk to my God for me. Tell Him that I am a poor ignorant creature  full of nothing but of sin and misery but that I love you His own dear mother and for your dear sake to help and pity me Amen.

4922109/4852901/5010598.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922109/4852901/5010598.text:
My mother taught me at home "The Lord's Prayer", and the "Hail Mary", when I was very young.  The first prayer I heard at school was the morning offering - "I offer to thee, O! my God all my thoughts, words, actions and sufferings, and I beseech thee to give me thy grace, that I may not offend thee this day, but that I may faithfully serve thee and do thy Holy will in all things.  I intend to gain all the indulgences I can, and I place them in the hands of the Blessed Virgin Mary, for the intentions of the souls in Purgatory". The most perfect prayer of all is the "Lord's Prayer", because it was composed by Our Lord himself when on earth.The following is a prayer said when going on a journey.  "When going on a journey, bless yourself, and say, "Jesus, Mary and Joseph, be with us on our way".  I also learned, "An act of contrition" in Irish - "A Thiagharna Dia, atá go ró-mhaith, tá cathú orm mar gheall air mo pheacaibh.  Maith dhom iad, agus tabhair chongnamh dom chun gan iad do dhéanamh arís.This is an Irish prayer I say when I'm going into bed, -  "A Íosa, a Mhuire, a Jóseiph, tugaim suas díbh mo croidhe agus m'anam." A Íosa, a Mhuire, a Jóseiph, bidhidh a cabhruighadh liom le lin mo bás.  A Íosa, a Mhuire, a Jóseiph, go dtugadh suas m'anam dibh  síocháin Dé isteach i do láimh féin go nglacair a sprid, a
(continues on next page)

4742033/4729768/5010672.title: Old Prayers
4742033/4729768/5010672.text: 1Old people say this prayer,"Here I lay myself down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf any evil trouble meO Blessed Virgin waken me.There are four corners on this bed.There are four angels o'er my head.Named Mathew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on.If I should die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take."2When a person was bleeding very badly, they used to say"Beside the river Jordon, St John baptized Our Lord,The Saviour spoke, the river stood,and why not Jesus stop the blood."

4758538/4752681/5010858.title: Irish Prayer
4758538/4752681/5010858.text: Irish PrayerO God, and the Virgin             MaryWho have brought me          and mineSafe from  the death         of sleepTo the bright sun-shine.Bring ye us wholeFrom every woeAnd body and soulProtect us foe.        Nancy Meade         88 Patrick Street              Kilkenny

4758538/4752692/5010884.title: A Collection of Prayers
4758538/4752692/5010884.text: A Colection of Prayers1.  A prayer is said when retiring to rest.As I lie on my right side, I pray to God to be my guide.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lie on.There are four corners on this bedThere are four angels spread.And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAnd if any evil comes to meI pray to God to wake up meJesus the Branch Mary the FlowerJesus, Mary and JosephGo with me at my dying hour.              Josie Mc Cabe

4758538/4752693/5010888.title: A Prayer when Rising - An Aspiration
4758538/4752693/5010888.text: 2. A prayer when rising I rise from this bed of sleep,To adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my own soul.Oh may I rise on the last day to life everlastingAn Aspiration Little Flower every hourShow to me your love and power.            Josie Mc Cabe,              50 Lord Edward St,                Kilkenny

4922109/4852942/5010895.title: Paidir
4922109/4852942/5010895.text:
some wheat in a saucepan. She then left to beg in other houses, but did not return. When St. Martin returned he found that the wheat had grown in the boiling water. This he saw was a sign of the anger of God. He threw himself into a mill. The mill stopped. Since then all mills are not worked on St. Martin's Day.
(continues on next page)

4922109/4852943/5010977.title: Legend of St Martin
4922109/4852943/5010977.text:
(continued from previous page)
gréinseachán - gruel boiled wheat.St. Martin (St. Martin's Day 11th September. On that night a hen is killed in his honour as the mill refused to grind.St. Martin sat a field with wheat. Owing to a lack of rain he was forced to sprinkle the wheat with a watering-can. A woman came to the door of the house. St. Martin's mother had wheat on the floor. The woman asked leave to boil(cont. bottom of opp. page)



When Our Lord was passing through a cornfield he told the sowers to tell the soldiers that He had not passed there since the corn was sown. The corn sprang up over-night. The soldiers came and inquired. The sowers replied as directed by Our Lord. But.The Dearga-Daol - "Indé, Indé." Since then this beetle is detested.



"Ó luighim ins a leaba seo mar luighim ins an uaigh,Mo ghradhin's (?) mo chumha leat a ghaoilDhera mochón! agus a phardún ort-sa ' ch (?)A Choír (?) Íosa Críost,Dhera m'ochón agus a phardúnIn ainm an Athar agus an Mhic agus an Spirid Naoimh."

4742034/4729833/5011139.title: Local Prayers
4742034/4729833/5011139.text:
When in bed fold your arms in the form of a cross and say to yourself "I must die I do not know when nor how nor where I will die, but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever O Jesus! have mercy on us." When passing a church-yard say, "Behold me now where I do lie, as you are now so once was I, as I am now so must you be, therefore prepare to follow me." In the morning when you awake say, "Jesus, Mary and Joseph I give you my heart and my soul." When you begin your work say, "All for Thee o Lord, O my Jesus all for Thee.



In the parish of Lisdowney Co. Kilkenny there is a field which is owned by Mr. Staunton. It is called the "Castle Meadow" and it gets its name from an old castle that was built on it. This castle was owned by Lord Mt. Garret.There is also a field in the parish of Lisdowney which is owned by Mr. Fitzpatrick. It is called the "Cillín" for years ago a Church stood there but now it is in ruins. In the centre of this field is a bush which is called the "Monument Bush".
(continues on next page)

4742034/4729843/5011221.title: Local Prayers
4742034/4729843/5011221.text:
When going for a walk say "Sacred Heart of Jesus grant me the grace to love Thee and protect me from all harm." When putting oil in the lamp say "God may fill my soul with the oil of love." When pulling down the bilinds say "Lord when will thou lift the veil which hides Thee from me." When lighting the fire say "Lord fill me with the fire of Charity."



"A face that cannot smill is never good." "How much the dunce that has been sent to Rome excels the dunce that has been kept at home." "There is no use crying over spilt milk." "No man is happy unless he thinks himself so." "It is not good that every man should travel it makes a wise man better and a fool worse." "Music is the medicine of a broken heart." "Laugh and the world laughs with you weep and you weep alone for this sad old earth has to borrow its mirth, it has grief enough of its own." "He who receives a benefit should never forget it and he who bestows it should never remember it.
(continues on next page)

4922152/4856618/5012316.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922152/4856618/5012316.text: A Collection of Prayers 28-10-38These are the prayers which were learned at home from our fathers and mothers. "God Bless Daddy and Mammy and brothers and sisters and bring them up in the fear and love of God." The prayers said when getting up at morn is the Morning Offering.When going on a journey holy water is used to bless ourselves and the aspiration is "May God speed me on my journey." None of these prayers appeared in print except the Morning Offering.

4758492/4748469/5012873.title: Prayers Said before the Rosary in Mullinavat
4758492/4748469/5012873.text: Ofráilimíd na Gníomhartha le onóir páise agus bás ár Slánuightheóra ag iarraidh Dé gan geara-bhás ná bás obann ná bás i bpeacaidh ná i bhfiachaibh a thabhairt dúinn; bás glan ola agus aithrighe a thabhairt dúinn i ngrádh Dé agus na gcomharsan; agus Corp ár dTighearna bheith mar lán déanach ag ár n-anama ag fágaint na tíre seo.Ofráilimíd Ave Maria le h-anama mhairbh a'domhain atá a'fhulaing planta purgadóireachta go speisialta le h-anama ár muinntire féin má tá pian purgadóireachta moill buaidhirt, nó dearmhad Aifrinn nó breitheamhnas aithrighe dan cómhlíonadh leis an anam go bhfuascaile Dea mór na gComhacht. Laighduighadh ar phianta, méadú ar ghlóire. Cuirimíd éinne ná fuil duine aige féin fé bhrigh na guidhe seo. Éinne atá ar dhá chomhairle nó ar stád peaca mhairbh go dtuga Dia mór an uile chomhachta grásta na h-aithrighe chun eirighe as.

The humming bees harmonize the trees,Falling from Slieve Bloom to their retreatWhere they explore their sweet hunny store,In that spicy harbour in Lacca Seat.

church or grave yard was. The custom still prevails of people being taken to another County, sometimes to their family resting place.



In olden times people of religious turn of mind accompanied every little act with a suitable prayer. Lighting a fire or candle "the light of heaven open to us",Going on a journey "God send you safely there and here". When going to bed "Lord as thow dost clost close our eyes in sleep grant that we may open them to the light of another day." The sign of the cross when the clock would strike saying "God almighty bless me, mark me with grace
(continues on next page)

4758526/4751847/5014265.text:
Said after going into bed at night"There are four corners in my bedThere are four angels overheadSt Matthew, St Mark, St Luke & St JohnGod bless this bed that I lie onAnd if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take."



Ml Hearne gives another version:-"Matthew, Mark, Luke & John!There are four corners in my bedThere are four angels at my headOne to watch & one to pray& two to bear my soul away."



"Infant Jesus, meek & mildLook on me a little child,Make me humble as thou wertWith thy love inflame my heart."

4758526/4751848/5014269.title: A Prayer to Saint Joseph
4758526/4751848/5014269.text: O Glorious St Joseph, spouse of the Immaculate Virgin, obtain for me a pure humble & charitable mind & perfect resignation to the Divine Will. Be my guide, father & model through life that I may merit to die as thou didst, in the arms of Jesus & Mary.St Joseph, friend of the Sacred Heart, Pray for us.

4758531/4752333/5014484.title: Prayers - The Wounded Shoulder of Our Lord
4758531/4752333/5014484.text:
O sweet and gentle Jesus. Who didst so meekly suffer that cruel pain from the wound inflicted by the Cross on thy Sacred Shoulder I desire to honour that hidden suffering of Thine. It is little honour because it is so little known but I offer the love with which throughout all ages, the angels have worshipped that Sacred Wond. I unite my love to theirs and I desire to bear in silence whatever hidden suffering Thou mayest send me in memory of that sacred pain Thou didst endure in carrying Thy cross for me.  Amen.



Jesus, Mary and Joseph I offer myself into the hands of your protection for this day to save me from all harm dangers sin and trouble and that you may break all crosses and misfortunes before me, Jesus be with me for the day give light to my mind and touch my heart.

4758531/4752333/5014485.title: Prayers - The Wounded Shoulder of Our Lord
4758531/4752333/5014485.text:

4758531/4752334/5014486.title: Prayers - A Burst of Love
4758531/4752334/5014486.text:
How much do I love thee sweetest MotherOh how can I tell it to theeMy love is as wide as the ocean,My love is as deep as the sea,As the rosebuds long for the rain dropAs the captive lark longs to be free,AS the streamlet longs for the ocean -So the heart of my child longs for thee.



Mother, for thee my days I'll spend,For when my life comes to its end,What sorrow it would be!To hear you ask "Is that you pet?"And have to answer with regret -"Ah no! it's only me.



But my heart with joy is throbbingMary, Queen of MayFor there's nothing now but youAnd my love is strong and trueOh how much my heart loves you
(continues on next page)

As black as ink as white as snow and hops along the ground like hail stones?A Magpie.If a black cat sat on a black cats tail how many cats were there?One cat.Long legs, crooked thighs little head and no eyes.A Thongs.The flowers of Africa, the flowers of Spain all mixed up with a shower of rain, put in a sugar bag tied with a string, riddle me that and I will

4922159/4857088/5015376.title: Prayer
4922159/4857088/5015376.text:
"O Virgin Mary assist me now and at the hour of my death"(The following prayer is said at night time before going to rest) "Here I lay me down to sleep,   To Jesus I give my soul to keepIf any evil spirit come to me  Queen of heaven awaken meThere are four corners on my bed  There are four angels on them spreadMatthew, Mark, Luke and John  God bless this bed which I lie onGod bless myself. Amen."Mary the branch, Jesus the flowerMay Jesus and Mary be with me at my dying hourThe five bleeding wounds nailed to a treeO Merciful Jesus have mercy on me.
(continues on next page)

4758546/4753492/5015472.title: Old Prayers
4758546/4753492/5015472.text: Old Prayers.The old people had some nice prayers.  Of course they were in their own language.  There was one poor woman who had two sons in America and her daily prayer was "God may save all our neighbours by sea and by land", she lived in the Dock.  Betty Cooke was her name.  There was an old man who lived in Tinnechinch. John F Lynn was his name and every night when going to bed he used catch the bars of the bed and say, "Here is God and the Holy Ghost against the devil".

4770049/4769329/5015585.title: Prayer
4770049/4769329/5015585.text: God bless Friday and Good FridayThe day in which our Saviour was crucifiedThe Jew passed by with naked sword in his handand pierced our saviour through the heartHis tender mother being standing byWith a heavy sigh and dismal moanAnd anyone that says this prayerThree times by day and three times by nightShall be free from mortal sin and the gates of HellTheir souls shall never enter in

4758547/4753637/5016127.title: Old Prayers - Graignamanagh
4758547/4753637/5016127.text:
Old PrayersJesus is the branch,Mary is the bough,Lord Jesus be with me.At my dying hour.As Peter was sitting on a marble stone, Jesus came to him all alone.  What ails you Peter, and why do you weep.O Jesus I am troubled with a toothache "Arise", said Jesus, "and thou shall be cured".  Whoever shall say this paryer three times by day and three times by night in remembrance of me shall never be troubled with a toothache.
(continues on next page)
4758547/4753637/5016127.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire,  Gráig na Manach

4922160/4857166/5016183.title: Prayers Said at Night
4922160/4857166/5016183.text: It's on this bed I lie down to sleep.I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners on this bed.Four angels over it spread.Saints Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod Bless mea nd this bed I lie on.God Almighty free me as free as the Jews.That came on Good Friday with their spikes and spears so sharpTo pierce our sweet saviour through his sacred HeartThe blessed mother standing by, With a doleful heart and a pitiful eye.

4922161/4857297/5016428.title: Local Prayers
4922161/4857297/5016428.text: 1 Oh Infant Jesus, meek and mild. Look on me a little child. pity me and pity mine and suffer me to come to Thee.2 Heart of Jesus I adore, Heart of Mary I implore , Heart of Joseph most pure and just, in those three hearts I place my trust.3 Mary will call to her child Jesus for me to convey. He is my Lord, He is my Saviour, He is my Redeemer and all.4 Lord Jesus be with me in dread I should fall; God be with the Cross that I should grumble to.5 Our Lord is in the branch, and Mary is in the flower. Lord Jesus be with me now at my dying hour.

4922161/4857298/5016429.title: Local Prayers
4922161/4857298/5016429.text: 3 God bless me and make me a good girl, and keep me in the state of grace Amen4 Lord have mercy on grandfathers', grandmothers' and Aunties souls   Amen

4770054/4769685/5016860.title: Strong People
4770054/4769685/5016860.text:
(continued from previous page)
night Joe Toole beat his father Thomas Toole, Thomas Toole was drunk which prevented him from winning.There was a strong man in the Berr Bog named Thomas Malone and with him his brother John Malone.  There was a strong man in Dromagh namely John Byrne.  One night there was a boxing match going on in America, one man was being defeated.  John Byrne asked the winner would he fight him, the man consented.  The match took place John Byrne won.  There was a strong man in Newtown namely Patrick Ward.



The prayers which I know are Morning Offering, Our Father, Hail Mary, Act of Contrition, Rememberance, Prayer to St. Jude, the prayer for Christmas, the Night Offering.   These prayers
(continues on next page)

4770054/4769737/5016980.title: Folklore - Local Fairs
4770054/4769737/5016980.text:
(continued from previous page)
fair in Abbeyleix is held every first Monday. The pig fair in Carlow is always held on Tuesday. The cattle fair and horse fair in Carlow is held the last Wednesday. The pig fair and horse in Abbeyleix is on Monday. The pig fair and cattle fair in Castlecomer is held the first Friday.



The prayers which I know best are the morning offering. The night offering, Our Father, the Creed   the Hail Mary. The prayer to the Holy Ghost and the prayer to st. Joseph

5009219/4999061/5017236.title: The Local Prayer
5009219/4999061/5017236.text: Before the closing of the day,Creator, we Thee humbly pray,That for Thy wonted mercy's sake,Thous us into protection take.May nothing in our minds escite,Vain dreams or phantoms of the night;Keep off our enemies, that soOur bodies no uncleanness know.To Jesus from a Virgin sprung,Be glory given and praises sung;The like to God the Father be,And Holy Ghost eternally.Amen.Taken down from her mother by Mary Egan    Boley Ballcullane

5009219/4999062/5017237.title: The Local Prayers
5009219/4999062/5017237.text: O my God my only God, the author of my being, and my last end.  I give thee my heart Praise, honour, and glory be to thee for ever, and ever.  Amen.Written by Joan Stafford from her grandfather Mr. Crowley  BallycullaneO sweet Jesus pardon me all the sins I have committed, through my five senses.  I am sorry from my hearth for having offended thee.Amen.Come holy Ghost send down thy beams'.Which sweetly flow in silent streams.From thy bright throne above.O come thou father of the poor.O come thou source of all our store.Come fill our hearths with love.O thou, of comforters the best.O thou, the souls delightful guest.The pilgrims sweet relief.Thou art true rest in toil an sweat.Refreshment in the exess of heatAnd solace in our grief.Amen.

5009219/4999063/5017238.title: Prayers
5009219/4999063/5017238.text:
Cling to my aid O LordMake haste to help meJesus protect meHoly Mary pray for meGuardain angel pray for meHoly St Joseph pray for meAll ye holy saints and angles in Heven pray for me.  O my God I raise myself up from this bed of sleep.  O Jesus clothe my soul with the utmost robes of charity that on the last day I may be found worthy to enter into thy glory.Taken down by L. Furlong from her Granny Mrs. P. Condon Ballycullane 72    Night PrayerMy Queen and my Mother help me. with your pure and holy hand, that I may get a good night's rest and the shield from all bad and distracted thoughts.  That I may waken in time in the morning, and have the grace and energy to rise promptly, and do the work which Thy Divine Son has entrusted to my feeble handsTaken down from Mrs. Staunton (aged 70) Ballycullane by K. Caulfield VIII

5009219/4999064/5017242.title: Morning Prayer
5009219/4999064/5017242.text: Mary my Mother and my hope I take refuge under Thy mantle.  There shall I live and die.  Deliver me from sin, and grant me Thy blessing.  Amen.Night PrayerHere I lay down to sleep, to God I give my soul to keep, if I die before I wake, I hope thy Lord my soul may take.  When I lay down and cant see, Jesus Mary convert me Jesus be with me.  Jesus be about me Jesus may carry my soul to the Kindom of glory,  There are fore coners on bed there are fore angel over spread, Matthew Mark Luke and John God bless the bed that I lay on for all this night and ever more.  Amen.Taken down by Una Dunne from her mother Mrs. Dunne Yoletown Ballycullane age 5[?]9

5009219/4999065/5017245.title: An Ancient Prayer to our Lady
5009219/4999065/5017245.text: O Glorious Virgin, Mother of God, blessed among all nations, worthy of praise, and the greatest of praise intercede for me with thy beloved son.  O honoured Lady, Mother of the King of Angels and Archangel's assist and deliver me from every difficulty and danger.  Admiration of Angel's and Archangel's remember me and forsake me not I beseech thee at the terrible hour of my death.  Amen.Taken down by Brigid Whelan from her parents at Boley Ballycullane.

4922232/4862865/5019378.title: Prayer
4922232/4862865/5019378.text: My God, I offer Thee this day, All I may do, or think, or say.Uniting it with what was doneOn earth by Jesus Christ they Son.I adore thee O Most precious cross which has been adorned with the tender and venerable hands and feet of my Lord and Savour Jesus Christ embraced and dyed by his Precious Blood I adore thee O my God nailed on the cross for me. Again adore thee O Holy cross for the love of my true God and Lord Jesus Christ.

5009219/4999073/5019795.title: Prayer
5009219/4999073/5019795.text:
Angel of Heaven how loving you must be to leave your home and Heaven so bright to guide a little child like me. Amen.



Oh, adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ dying on the gallious tree to save us.  Oh holy Cross of Christ see us through life.  Holy Cross of Christ ward off from me all things that are evil.  Oh holy Cross of Christ guard me on the right road to happiness.  Oh, holy Cross of Christ ward of from me all dangerous diseases and give me life always.  Oh, Crucified Jesus of Nazareth have mercy on me now and for evermore.  Oh, Blessed Mother of God intercede for us poor sinners.  I ask your holy intercession in honour of the Immaculate Purity through the death and passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ
(continues on next page)

4922183/4858998/5020113.text: 1. God increase tour store and put it in your heart to give me more.2. God bless all here.3. God save you kindly.4. God bless the work - God save you kndly.5. God between us and all harm.6. God be with you.

4922229/4862732/5021383.title: Old Irish Prayers
4922229/4862732/5021383.text:
"There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels over spreadMathew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie onI look upon the Blessed LambI see the Blessed Mary coming on,Seven spirits in her hand,Seven priests singing,Open the gates of Heaven,And shut the gates of hell,And enter my poor soul into Heaven all over amen""This night as I lie down to sleep.My soul I give to God to keep.And if I die before I wake.My soul I give to God to take.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadSt Mathew St Mark St Luke St John
(continues on next page)

4922224/4862313/5021453.title: Prayers
4922224/4862313/5021453.text:
1. God bless you. That you may not be so long sick. Any may every letter in my prayer be a bright star in Heaven before you.



1. As I lay on my right hand side,I pray to God to be my guide,If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners round my bed,And four angels round it spread,Matthew, (Mary) Mark, Saint Luke and JohnMay God Almighty bless the bed that I lay on.

4922224/4862313/5021470.title: Prayers

1. God bless you. That you may not be so long sick. Any may every letter in my prayer be a bright star in Heaven before you.



1. As I lay on my right hand side,I pray to God to be my guide,If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners round my bed,And four angels round it spread,Matthew, (Mary) Mark, Saint Luke and JohnMay God Almighty bless the bed that I lay on.

4922259/4865046/5022179.title: Old Prayers
4922259/4865046/5022179.text: There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels over headTwo at my feet and two at my headMarts, Mary, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lay onIf I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to takeIf I die before I sleep I pray to God my soul to keepBefore leaving for work the old people used to sayO Jesus be with use when we go out.Before going on a journey they used say, God speed us.Before kindling the fire they used say, the light of heaven to us, and before going into the church they used to pray for the souls.

4922225/4862412/5022446.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862412/5022446.text:
May God grant me grace and make a good boy of me. Holy Mary queen of charity pray for me that I may not die in the state of mortal sin. Amen.Here I lie on my right side,Jesus and Mary to be my guide,Jesus the branch, Mary the flower,Jesus and Mary be with me at my dying hour. AmenThere are four corners on my bed,There are four Angels on them spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on,And if I die before I wake,To God I give to God my soul to takeI trace the letters with my finger I.N.R.I
(continues on next page)

4922225/4862414/5022448.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862414/5022448.text: As I lie down this night to rest,I pray to God my soul to bless.There are four corners to my bedThere are four Angels overheadMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless this bed that I lie onAnd if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeIf any evil touches meHoly Mary save me.

4922225/4862415/5022449.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862415/5022449.text:
As I lie down to sleep,To God I give my sould to keep.And if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed,There are four Angels overhead,That the four may be carryingMy soul up to heaven.Saints Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless this bed that I lie on.On Good Friday our Saviour diedOn Good Friday our Saviour was crusifiedThey nailed a cap of thornsOn His Sacred Head.Up came the Jews with a long spear,They pierced him through the head.
(continues on next page)

4922225/4862419/5022454.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862419/5022454.text: A woman was dying and she asked her son to say a prayer for her and this is what he said:-May the Lord in His mercyTake you Mrs PercyUp to His heavenly throneAnd comfort poor NedWho is here in your steadAnd leave him live happy at home.

4922225/4862422/5022458.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862422/5022458.text: When people are about to set potatoes they say "We will set them in the name of God" and when they were planted they would say "Thanks be to God". If an accident happened or if they met with a loss, they would say "Welcome be the will of God". When people go where others are working they say "God bless the work" and the answering salutation is "God save you kindly". When people are leaving home their friends say "God be with you".

4922225/4862443/5022503.title: Old Prayers
4922225/4862443/5022503.text: Here I lay down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take.If any evil passes byO blessed Lady awaken me.There are four corners on this bed,There are four Angels on them spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless this bed that I lie on.God bless it within and God bless it withoutGod bless the house all round about,And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take.

4922261/4865210/5051635.title: Paidreacha
4922261/4865210/5051635.text: PaidreachaÁine Máthar Muire, Muire Mháthair Críost, Elizabeth máthair Sheain Baisteadh, cuir an triúr ban naoimhtha san ider mé agus galairt na leabtán. Ar an crann a céasadh Criost cuir é ider mé agus an tromluidhe agus gach aon galar go maidin.Fear mian agus bean borb a chuir Íosa Criost 'na luighe sa codhladh. Dearna Muire liom. Cuig méaraca Criost sgaoil an pian san díom.
4922261/4865210/5051635.school_info: School: An Caisleán Nua (C.), Cluain Meala

4922261/4865211/5051636.title: Paidreacha
4922261/4865211/5051636.text:
Paidreacha.A Íosa a chroidhe na páirte, bí dom gárda an lae, Dian is cabhruig  láimh liom, Is ná fág mé i bearna bhaoghail. Is tusa a rí is a ghrádh gheal. Do fhalaing bás im thaobh, Ar crann na croise créidhte, imeasc do namhaide go léir, Bhí allus fola ag tráigh díot, is tá ag guidhe sa ghairdín léighear. Míle moladh is grásta, led ainm grásach féin.



Sgéal.Fadó bhí cailín éigin ag obair i dtigh feirmeóra. Bíodh sí ag obair go dian gach lá agus gach oidhche théigheagh sí isteach sa leabaidh gan dul ar a glúinibh, bhí sí chomh thuirseach san. Nuair a bhíodh sí sa leabaidh deireadh sí aon paidir beag amháin:- "Tá cheithre cúinne im leabaidh. Tá ceithre aingle ós mo cionn, Márta, Séamus,Luke is Séan beannacht Dia ar an leabaidh se atáim im luighe" Oidhche amháin nuair a bhí bhean an tighe ag dul thar doras seomra an cailín chonnaich sí dhearg istigh sa seomra. Chuagh sí isteach ann agus chonnaich sí ceithre saighdiúirí ar gach
(continues on next page)
4922261/4865211/5051636.school_info: School: An Caisleán Nua (C.), Cluain Meala

4922293/4867627/5051851.title: Prayers
4922293/4867627/5051851.text: PrayersThere is one long old prayer said by the old people long ago. This prayer was said when there was a scarcity of food etc.Thank God for the good day.Thank God for the bad day.Thank God for the pleasure.Thank God for the pain.Thank God for the rain.Thank God when our barns are empty.Thank God when they're full again.Told by Mrs. Crosse, 21 Cashel Road, TipperaryWritten by Nancy Bushby
4922293/4867627/5051851.school_info: School: Tiobraid Árann, Cl. na Trócaire

4922293/4867657/5051921.title: Story
4922293/4867657/5051921.text:
There was a tinker at a fair in Lappawhite one day. He was arrested for being drunk and disorderly. On the way to the barracks the peeler said in decision "I wonder is there any tinker in Heaven""There is" said the tinker "one got in by mistake and Heaven was searched for a peeler to put him out and once couldn't be found"



May Jesus be at my head The Blessed Virgin at my feetAnd the Twelve Apostles round my bed When I am fast asleep
(continues on next page)

broke on the hearse. The people all said he wanted to come out for a sit down.He had two sisters who went to live in Clonmel and his wife could never live with him, she went to work at Kehoes in Toor.



The following prayer was given by Eileen Cahill who got it from her father David Cahill (R.I.P.). It is said by people when their nose begins to bleed."Little Infant Jesus, Baptized in the river Jordan. The river stood and so will my blood".An old prayer given by my grandmother to me was to make the letters I.N.R.I. on your forehead and say"Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews. Keep us from a sudden and unprovided death this night".This prayer was said on lying down in bed at night.

4922184/4859032/5052279.title: Prayer in Time of Plague or Sickness
4922184/4859032/5052279.text: This prayer I learned from a poor travelling woman 50 years ago who often got lodging in a neighbour's house:-The Star of Heaven that nourished the Lord drove away the plague of death which the first parents of man brought into this world. May this bright star now vouchsafe to extinguish that foul constellation whose battle has slain people with the wound of death.  O most pious Star of the Sea preserve us from plague, hear us O Jesus for whom Thy Virgin Mother supplicates Thee.Pray for us o holy Mother of God.That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ.God of Mercy, God of pity, God of benign Clemency. Thou who hast had compassion on the affliction of the people say to the Angel striking them"Stop thy hand for the love of this Glorious Star whose breast Thou didst sweetly drink as antidote for our crimes. Grant the assistance of Thy Grace that we may be safely freed from all pestilence, and unprovided death and mercifully save us from  the gulf of eternal perdition through our Lord Jesus Christ, King of Glory who livest  and reignest one God world without end. AmenS. S. O'DúnaidheCaisleán AoibhneTeampoll Mór

4922302/4868467/5053745.title: Some Old Prayers
4922302/4868467/5053745.text: God guard this house from roof to floor.The twelve apostles guard the door,Four good angels guard my bedTwo at the foot and two at the headThis prayer is said at night before going to sleep.A Daily offering and also a prayer for the Souls in PurgatoryOh, my God, I offer you this dayAll I shall do and think and sayUniting it with what was doneOn earth by Jesus Christ thy SonI make this offering for the soulsWhom God's own Mother would releaseThat She may place them near her SonIn everlasting peace.Amen.

4922302/4868468/5053746.title: Some Old Prayers
4922302/4868468/5053746.text:
Here, I lay me down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf any evil thing come over meI pray the Queen of Glory waken meThere are four corners in my bedThere are four angels overheadMatthew, Mark, Luke, and JohnTo bless this bed that I lie onIf I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to takeTo Heaven above where I may restWith God’s saints and angels ever blestThis prayer to be said after retiring to rest.



Most Holy Infant Jesus bless us, hear us and grant our petitions.Most Sacred Heart of JesusThrough Mary and Joseph have mercy on usHelp the dying, help the faithful departedAnd grant us all we ask.Infinite Jesus meek and mild

Old Prayers and GreetingsIf a person met another person on the road his salute was "Dia is Muire duit", His answer was "Dia is Muire duit is Padraig". When there was any big gathering such as a threshing, when all the people were leaving that night the man of the house would say, "Go mbeirimid slan an t-am seo aris"When charity is given to any poor person or when you give a present to anyone they say, "May God increase your store". 4922265/4865536/5054918.title: Scéal
4922265/4865536/5054918.text:
Deunaun faoisdín leat a Dhia, trídhroch i maoinre mo cholna agus trí dhroch cora mo chosa agus mo láimh. Trí a ndubhras agus ná raibh fíon ar geallas agus nár chomh-liónar.Dia a thighearna is ag iarraidh as polóid ort atá mé ag cosa do chric fó naomhtha.



Sean-fhocail.(1) Is feárr síor ualach ná sár ualach.(2) Níl sólás ar an domhan ná fuil dólás ós a ceann.(3)Níl thaise gan maise is níl díreac gan cam.(4) Tá an crúdh ar a gcoig agaibh.
