4922242/4863712/5055378.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922242/4863712/5055378.text: 400A Collection of PrayersAs I lay on my side to sleep as Jesus did on Mary's knee. When I am asleep and cannot see, wake up Jesus and pray for me. There are four corners on my bed, there are four Angels over-spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. God bless this bed that I lay on, and If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take. When I go to my bed I go to my grave; if any of these evils waken me O Sweet Jesus waken me. The five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree O Merciful Jesus have mercy on me, my soul and my body. I resign unto thee.

5008802/4957588/5056211.title: Seanphaidir
5008802/4957588/5056211.text: Comhrádh idir an Mháthair Chaointe agus Íosa CríostAn i ndo chodhladh atá tú a mháthair?(un inna hulloo ata tú, a wawr)Chan eadh ach a téanamh aisling, a ghrádh(han ya ahath yainoo eshling a graw)Goidé an aisling é, a mháthair?(gudge ay an eshling ay, a wawr)Tá go bhfaca mé fear caol dubh(Tá gu waca mi fear cool dhoo)Agus sleagh in a láimh(Uggus lug inna láimh)Ag gabháil fríd do thaoibh dheis a ghrádh(a goal freedge do hoo yesh a graw)Agus a' leigint do chuid fola beannuighthe ar lár(Uggus al yigin do hutch fola banee ar lár)Fuaras é seo ó'n t-Athair Seán Ó CuinnCuailgne, Co. Lughaidhesé bliadhna ó shoinFuair seisean é ó Julia King Crossalaney (nach maireann)Tá an t-Athair Ó Cuinn i n-Árd Mhacha fé láthair.Sílim go bhfuil béaloideas go leór aige.

4922334/4871102/5056283.title: Prayers
4922334/4871102/5056283.text:
O Angel of God to whose care I am commmited, by supreme clemency enlighten me this night from all sin and danger. O God the Father bless me. O Jesus Christ defend and keep me. The virtue of the Holy Ghost enlighten and sanctify me. this night and forever. Into the hands of the Lord I commend my spirit. Lord Jesus receive my soul.[three lines left blank]When I lie on this bed to sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf I die before I wakeI give my soul to God to takeIf any evil thing comes over meO Blessed Lady waken meThere are four corners in my bedFour Angels in them spreadGod bless me in this bed I lie on. Amen.
(continues on next page)

4922334/4871106/5056286.title: Prayers
4922334/4871106/5056286.text:
The following prayers were given to me by my aunt, who got them from her mother, and as I am aware, they are not written in prayer books: —There are four cornors in my bed,There are four angels in my spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lay on.O My God I lay myself down to rest, Bless me, O God. Amen.May I die consumed of an ardent thirst to see the adorable face of my Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.O Mary watch the hour when my departing soul will lose its hold on all earthly things, and place the scales of Justice in the favour of my poor soul. AmenHail and blessed be that hour and
(continues on next page)

4922334/4871107/5058030.title: Prayers
4922334/4871107/5058030.text:
(continued from previous page)
moment, in which the Son of God was born of the Virgin Mary, at Bethlehem, at mid-night, in piercing cold in that hour, Vousafe, O My God, to hear my prayer, and grant my desire. Amen.A prayer for a pain in the side.A nIosa Críost. laighin sa colaidh, cuirim i nAthair, agus an Mhic, agus an Sprid NaomhAmen.



Here I lay down my head to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,If I die before I wake,I pray to the Lord my soul to take,If any evil spirits trouble me,Oh sweet Saviour waken me.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957628/5058193.title: Prayers
5008803/4957628/5058193.text:
1. A Mother's Prayer.O, Queen of Angels, give ear to my pleading.I earnestly ask you to heark to my call.God's innocent- children, O Many, Sin fearingWhere they run in life's race, that they'll slip - maybe fall.Wont you let them join hands in "ringa-a-rosies" around you. I know they'll be safe when they're under our care.Of your chastity, wisdom, and love, oh my Mary, wont you see that they all have an extra big share?Oh, ne'er let the Devil's dread Angels waylay them, keep them ever immaculate, pure as the snow.Dear Mother of Jesus, I know you are listening.You'll lie near to watch o'er them wherever they go.2. Beneath the Cross.Light from the face of Jesus shine down upon me.Eyes of Jesus smile on me.Lips of Jesus speak to me.Hands of Jesus hold me.Feet of Jesus walk beside me.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957629/5058194.title: Prayers
5008803/4957629/5058194.text:
(continued from previous page)
Heart of Jesus comfort me,Glory of Jesus be my rewardLove of Jesus cover me for eternity.



1.A prayer to be said at night.I lie down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide.If I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels overhead,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie onGod bless Friday and Good Friday too.The Friday Our Saviour was crucified.The wicked jews were passing by with the sharp spears in their hands. They pierced Our Saviour from the Heart into the Hand, with His tender mother standing by with her pitiful heart and mournful cry.Those who say these prayers three times by night, three times by day, death nor
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957630/5058195.title: Prayers
5008803/4957630/5058195.text:
(continued from previous page)
danger they need never fear nor the seven deadly sins, nor the gates of hell they shall never enter in.2. Oh, my heart lies on the cross, oh, my heart was dearly bought. Oh, Jesus, pity me and bless me forever. Amen.



1. Jesus, the Branch, Mary, the Flower, Jesus, receive us in our dying hour.2. God be praised and thanked for bringing us safely over the dangers of the night, and if it be God's holy will bring us safely over the dangers of the day - to be said morning + night.3. Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews, save us from a sudden and unprovided death. Amen!4. The will of God be done by us,The law of god be kept by us,Our evil will be controlled by us,Repentance timely made by us,Christ's passion understood by us,Our last deed pondered oft by us,And death be blessed, found by us,With angel's music heard by us,For ever and for aye - Amen! -- A morning prayer.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957631/5058201.title: Prayers
5008803/4957631/5058201.text:
(continued from previous page)
5.Thanks be to God for His goodness to me.Thanks be to God now and for eternityThanks be to God for His Blessed Virgin Mother,Thanks be to God for becoming our BrotherThanks be to God for His most precious food,Thanks be to god for his Body and his BloodThanks be to God in all ages and all climes.Thanks be to God one hundred thousand times.Thanks be to God in sickness and in health,thanks be to God in poverty and in wealth.Thanks be to God in all joy and all sorrow.Thanks be to God for today and tomorrow.And when my poor heart lies under the sod,May my soul sing in heaven "Thanks be to God."



1. St. Anne, the Mother of Mary,Mary, the Mother of god, save us from all dangers and disorders during the year - to be said every day.2. May the Sweet name of Jesus be lovingly scribed on my heart, inside. Oh, Mother of Jesus, may I with thee be, and Jesus with me.May abiding love, that nothing can sever be between us for ever. Amen. Oh Jesus, for ever + ever(To be said during work)
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957633/5058202.title: Prayers
5008803/4957633/5058202.text:
(continued from previous page)
8. Ye. Lord, I ask that this short day be spend for thee and Thine.Beloved, grant its every hour may reach Thy Heart Divine.Let not my foolish love of praise, rob work or prayer from Thee,Jesus, from pride from self, from sin,May this one day be free - Amen



1. Jesus, Dear, The day is over.Now I leave my labour light.And before my slumbersCome to say a sweet Good Night.Would that I could tarry near Thee,Rest before Thy lonely Shrine,You would whisper loving secrets,And I'd tell Thee all of mine.So good-night once more, my Jesus.Grant, no matter where I beAll my day thoughts and night dreaming.be of Thee and only thee.This prayer is said when going to bed.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957634/5058203.title: Prayers
5008803/4957634/5058203.text:
(continued from previous page)
2. I ask God and His Blessed Mother when she was born in the stable of Bethlehem at the hour of midnight, to forgive me, to pardon me, to bless me and have mercy on my soul. Amen!3. May the poverty of my sweet and suffering little child be your richesHis sighs and his tears the consolation of your daysThe Love of His Infant Heart your all, your earthly treasure, and the clear mission of his sweet and glorified humanity your eternal joy and recompense.



1. I will arise from this bed of sleep to adore my god,and to labour for the salvation of my soul.Oh, may I rise on the last day of life everlasting2. Now, with the rising golden dawn,Let us, the children of this dayCast off the darkness which so longhas led our guilty souls astray.And ever as the days glide by. May we the busy senses rein, keep guard upon the hand and eye,Nor let the body suffer stain. Amen.This prayer is said during the day.Before Communion -- To The Alter now I go.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957635/5058204.title: Prayers
5008803/4957635/5058204.text:
(continued from previous page)
I Hope my heart is white as snow.As white as snow, and free from sin,For my Dear Lord to enter in.    After Holy communionFrom the Altar I depart with my Dear Saviour in my heart, exempt and free from sin, for my Dear Lord has entered inIta Rice. Age 15 years.Newry St. CarlingfordPrayers given to me by my GrandmotherMrs. Morgan, Dundalk St. Carlingford



1. The will of God be done by us.The law of God be kept by us.Our evil will controlled by us.Repentance timely made by us.Christs' passion understood by us.All sinful deeds be shunned by usOur last end pondered off by us.And death be blessed found by us.With Angels music heard by usAnd God's high praises sung by usFor ever and for aye. Amen.This prayer is said in the morning.
(continues on next page)

5008803/4957637/5058205.title: Prayers
5008803/4957637/5058205.text:
(continued from previous page)
Margaret Ue Kevitt,    Age-14 years.Newry St. Carlingford



1. Oh, Sacred Heart of Jesus, be thou our dearest friendWhen the battle of life is over, and we come to the journey's end.2. Oh, Mary our Loving Mother, all through the storm and strife be thou our strength and solace at the closing hour of life.3. Be Thou Our Friend, Jesus, as we near our parting breath, and secure for us, Mary and JosephThe grace of a happy death.4. Jesus, tender Shepard, hear me. Bless thy little lamb tonight. through the darkness be thou near me, keep me safe till morning light.All this day Thy hand has led me, and I thank thee for Thy care. thou hast warmed meClothed me, fed me. Listen to my evening prayerLet my sins be all forgiven. Bless the friends I love so well. Take us all at last to heaven, happy there with Thee to dwell.Pauline Cunningham, Aged 13 yearsNewry St. Carlingford.Prayers given to me by my Mother.

5008805/4957773/5070995.title: Prayers
5008805/4957773/5070995.text:
A prayer that is said before going to sleep is " Here I lay me down to sleep, I give my soul to God to Keep and if I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take,  there are four corners on my bed, there are four angels over spread, one to guide me, one to guard me, one to carry my sins away and one to carry me to God, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God Bless the bed that I lie on."             When people were going a journey they said " Desnact leave agus Spirit Naoim".  When poeple are starting work they say " here we go in the name of God.              When people are going to bed they say this prayer " Ainm Maitair Muire Maitair De Aríos a Déig, Marair ó busice eadar ón Deiges agus go h-aras bé na líonad cuid is a Mic Dia.               I took this prayer down phoenetically from my mother, Brigid Fearon, Ballyoonan, Omeath.               The old people on entering a house would say " God save all here," The responce would be "God save you kindly". People going  on a journey they would say to them, "God Be
(continues on next page)

4922340/4871815/5072401.title: A Collection of Prayers
4922340/4871815/5072401.text:
A pious custom people had in olden times was every time the clock struck the hour to say the following short ejauculation. O God teach me to love thee in time and eternity.Quenching the candle going to bed. Solas na flaireas duinn ar fad. As I lay down to sleep to God I give my soul to keep, and if I die before I wake to God I give my soul to keep. O Infant Jesus waken me. O Infant Jesus meek and mild look on me a little child. Pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee. O heart of Jesus I adore thee, O heart of Mary Implore thee, O heart of Joseph pure and just in these three hearts I place my trust.Shall Jesus bear the cross alone and let the world go free, no there is a cross for every one and there is a cross for me.Getting up in the morning old people used say the following
(continues on next page)

4922340/4871839/5072420.title: Local Ruins
4922340/4871839/5072420.text:
(continued from previous page)
time of Elizabeth



1. There are four corners to my bed.There are four angels at its head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.2. As I came down the Blessed Mountain,I saw the Blessed Virgin standing,With seven Mass Books in her hand.Seven Priests singing.Seven Bells ringing.She opened the gates of heaven andShe shut the gates of Hell.3. O Jesus my white Love,My Star of the Altar.I bless you, I Love youA thousand times Welcome.At MassA Tighearna, you came when your
(continues on next page)

5008825/4959152/5072843.title: Old Prayers
5008825/4959152/5072843.text:
Old PrayersThe following payers are said by the old people of our district.1. This prayer is said before the fun on Hollow Eve night. "The Five sorrowful wounds suffered on the tree, O Jesus son of David have mercy on me."2. The following prayer is said as a protection against the fever. "As our Blessed Saviour saw the cross coming 16 foot high and 8 foot wide, He trembled. "What ails you Master" said the Jews "or have you the ague Neither fever nor ague have I ever had, nor those that will carry this about, neither fever nor ague shall they ever have."3. The old people say this prayer on retiring to bed. "As I was going over the Holy hand I meet the Blessed Virgin Mary she had seven Mass books in her hand, seven bells singing seven Priests singing. Lift the Sand of God in your hand. Shut the Gates of Hell, open the gates of Heaven, any one who says this prayer three times by day three times by night the gates of Hell they will never see, to Heaven they will get."4. When the old people rise in the
(continues on next page)

5008818/4958820/5073154.title: Prayers
5008818/4958820/5073154.text:
332PrayersMathew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.  There are four corners on my bed there are four angles over head.  One to guide and one to pray and two to bear my soul away.To be said in bed.When going to bed and when rising in the morning make the letters I.N.R.I. on your forehead three times and say Iron nails ran in.  Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews preserve me from a sudden and unprepared death. Amen.As I lay down my head to sleep.  I ask of God my soul to keep but if I die before I wake I ask of God my soul
(continues on next page)

4922346/4872472/5073376.title: Paidir
4922346/4872472/5073376.text: 149Paidir    "Cabhair is cáirde is grast           ó Dia CugainnCabhair gac la { ó síth am adhíre}        Sacraimint na h-aithright agus go neartuighidh Dia linn Agus m'anam ar do chumairighe (A)Mhuire maithe mháthair an Tighearna"Nóta:- An dara cuid de'n dara líne,idir luibíní gan bheith so-thuigse dom.Ceistigheadh an Suileabháineach agus dubhairt sé gur thuig sé ón line sin ná "cabhair"do thabairt.An rud céadna le "máthair san line deirneach-"mhaith" a chualas uaid bíodh is go ndubharthas trí uaire dom.

4922272/4866271/5073702.title: Folk Prayer
4922272/4866271/5073702.text:
When a person is cutting the harvest before he begin he shakes the holy water on the horses and on himself and then begin cutting it.



Long ago when the people were going on a journey they women of the house especially the old women of the house would have a bottle of holy water and shake it on the horse also on the people themselves and the people would raise  their caps and make the sign of the cross other people when going on a journey the old women would have a bottle of holy-water ready for the people who were on the journey to glue it to them.  The old people say that it is good to have holy water about you.



Long ago the old people used that on a May evening it is right to shake the Easter-water on the fields and on the animals also.  There is a custom that on May evening the person go to each field and shake the Easter
(continues on next page)

5008834/4959615/5074119.title: Old Prayers - Prayers after Communion
5008834/4959615/5074119.text:
Oh, my God, I know that I am united to thee, by Thy real presence, filled with consolation, I clasp thee to my heart, and return you thanks for having come down to dwell in my miserable heart. Amen.O'H; my God, I am sorry that my soul is not a more fitting place for your Divine Majesty and goodness. I trust in Your mercy for the grace to thee, and always to remember that You are near me. Amen.



She said that when she was young her grandmother used to come to her house on the twelfth night after Christmas, with a bundle of rushes. She would dip them in oil and light them, and give one to every child in the house. Then when they had their prayers said, she would gather them in
(continues on next page)

her own hands, and say the following prayer.I offer up all my prayers to Almighty God in the name of Jesus for preserving one this day from all sickness, and disorders, fire, or water, blame, shame, or scandal, the temptations of the devil, or from sudden or onprovided death. Amen.



Brigid and he Cloak,Patrick and his staff,Mary and her son,Mike and his shield,Dominic and his ring,Francis and his cordes.Be about us, upon us, under and over us, behind and before us, now, and at the hour of our death. Amen.

5008834/4959617/5074133.title: Old Prayers - A Night Prayer
5008834/4959617/5074133.text:
May the will of God be done by us.May the death of the Saints be won by us.And the light of the Kingdom begun in us.May Jesus, the child, be beside my bed.May the lamb of Mercy uplift my head.May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed.And Michael be steward of my soul.



Christ be with me, Christ be before me,Christ be after me, Christ be within me,Christ be beneath me, Christ be above me,Christ be at my right hand,Christ be at my left hand,Christ be in the fort,Christ be in the chariot,Christ be in the shipChrist be in the heart of every man who thinks of me,Christ be in the the mouth of every man who speaks of me,Christ be in every eye that sees me,Christ be in every ear that hears me.



I offer Thee -Every flower that ever grew,

5008834/4959618/5074142.text:
(continued from previous page)
Every bird that ever flew,Every wind that ever blew,Good God!Every thunder rolling,Every church-bell tolling,Every leaf and sod.Each communicant praying,Every angel staying,Before Thy Throne to sing.I offer Thee -Every wave that ever moved,Every heart that ever loved,Thee Thy Father's well-Beloved,Dear Lord,Every river dashing,Every lightning flashing,Like an Angel's sword.



Oh, God of charity without limit and of mercy, without measure, it was they love induced Thee to come to me, I give Thee my body as a temple, my will as a sacrifice, my heart as an altar, my soul as a pyx. Oh, Lord merciful Redeemer of heaven, O, noble lowly infant keep me in they peace. Give me a
(continues on next page)

5008834/4959619/5074150.text:
(continued from previous page)
dwelling in thy heart, dissolve me in the fragrance of thy charity, strengthen me with thy love, revive me through thy death. Oh, Lord, make me entirely pleasing to thee through the fruits of thy Sacred Heart. Amen.



As I lie down this night to sleep,I pray to God, my soul to keep,St. Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round me spreadAs I look up, as I look down,As I look over the heaven's groundI see the Virgin Mary coming,Seven Mass Books in her hand,Seven priests singing, seven bells ringingRise up, oh Lamb of God

And open the gates of HeavenAnd shut the gates of [?]And let these poor souls into HeavenThat pray three times by dayThree times by nightAnd the gates of Hell shall not prevail against them.



God bless Friday and Good Friday too,And the Friday oun Lord was crucified too,And the Jews they came with spears so sharp,And pierced Our Lord from hand to heart,And His Blessed Mother was standing by,With a heavy heart and a dismal sigh.All those that say this little prayer,Three times by night and three times by day,They never shall fall into mortal sin,And the gates of Hell they never shall enter in

4922342/4871987/5074981.title: Seanphaidreacha
4922342/4871987/5074981.text: As Mary + Joseph went out walking one morningThey met cherries and apples growing on a treeMary asked Joseph so meek and so mildTo give her a cherry as she was with childJoseph said to Mary so meek and so mild"Ill give you no cherry till you tell the father of your child".Out spoke our blessed Saviour from under her womb"Bow down gentle tree till my mother pick some."The highest branch in the tree bent down to her kneeAnd Mary picked cherries both one two and three.The next day Mary took the Baby on her kneeAnd asked the Babe how the world would beThe World is sinful and sinful twill beSince the walls of the city voted against Me.On Spy Wednesday great pains I will takeOn Good Friday I will die for your sakeOn Easter Sunday great wonders you'll seeThe sun and moon dancing in honour of Me.

4922342/4871988/5074984.title: Paidir an Scafula
4922342/4871988/5074984.text: Go mbeannuightear dhíbh a lucht na ScafulaNa tugaidh Faillighe inbhúr gcásIs mairg a bhíonn gan caraid luighe go lag ar leaba a a bháisA Pheacaigh bhoicht gan ciall ná dein bréagh le MuireNa h-ith Feóil Dé Chéadaoin agus ná h-éagchaoin bheith tuirseachDein do shiothcháin le Mac Dé agus beidh tu ag Féasta ag  is na LeinbhChuaidh Muire is a Mac amach sa LáChonnacadar cúcha St Simon ag teacht agus é beannuighthe ón RóimhShín sé cuige Scapular na mBrainnse ÓirCrios Muire mo Chriost. Crios na gCeithre gCrosCrios na gCeithre  mBeann. Crios ar rugadh Críost annO A Mhuire feac ar airtigeal a bháisÓ Feach Féin air a Mhich ó ós agat atáNíl aoinne a dhearfaidh mo phaidir gach aon Maidin LuainNá beidh Flaitheas Dé mar dhualgas agus a iarraidh le fághailA Mhaighdin Ghlórmhar Bháin le Feiscint trí lá roimh a bhásA Mhaighdin Ghlórmhar bháin dein fuasgailt ar mo chásAnois agus ar uair mo bháis.Seamas E. MacMathghamhnaCabhar,Sráid na Cathrach

4922346/4872465/5075027.text: 3As I went up a blessed MountI met the Blessed VirginShe had seven Mass books in her handsShe had seven priests singingShe had seven bells ringingShut the gates of hellOpen the gates of HeavenAnd let the poor souls enter.

PrayersThis is a prayer that my mother taught me to say to God during the day."They told me of your tinyhome within this house ofprayer and all alone to youI'v come "o" Jesus are you thereThey say that every little childgets welcome warm from you."they say that you are kindand milk. "O" Jesus is it true:Here is another little prayer to say at night to my Guardian Angel.Beautiful Angel My Guardian so

4922356/4873863/5075778.title: Paidreacha
4922356/4873863/5075778.text: (1)Solus na soilse, radharc na glóire,Soilse siorraidhe na bhflathas,I gcathair na trionóide.(II)Cabhair agus grásta agus cáirde ó Dhia chughainnCabhair gach lá agus táimíd dá íarraidh,Sacraimint na h-aithrighte is do neartuigh Dia linnAgus m'anam ar do ChomharaigheA Mhuire bhán tíghearna.(III)A Mhaighdean glórmhar bhúbrach mhaiseach,Is tú mo stór mo léin agus mo haisge,Is tú an réaltsolus romhann sa mbealach,Gleann na n-deor foghmhar ar m'anam,Umhal mo lámh agus lámh na bpeacach,Is ar uair ár mbáis do rabhais a gardáilagus ag sabháilt mo anam.(IV)Íosa na h-Aoine agus athair an t-suan,Diobruig gach smaoineamh malluighthe uaim,Im luighe agus im shuidhe, im chodhladh agus im shuanBhí im thimcheall im choinnleach(t) im uire gach úair(V)Tar a Mhíchíl glac mo lámh,Agus deirc mo shioacheán le mac Dé,Má thá dada ar mo shuidhe,Nach dílis Dé idir mise agus é.

4922356/4873864/5075779.title: An Phaidir Gheal
4922356/4873864/5075779.text: Go mbeannaigh Dia dhuit a Phaidir gealGo mbeannaigh Dia dhuit féinCár codail tú aréirI bfochair Mac DéCá gcodaileochais anochtI bfochair na mbochtCá gcodaileóchais imbháireachI mbúaile PhádraigCéard é sin rómhat amachDhá chead aingealCéard é sin id' dhiaidh aniarDá chead aspalCéárd é sin id lámh deasUisge coisricin chuir Muire liom-saÓ dhoras go doras FaratharDabhac óir annsúd thallFléásg óir in a cheannCoinneal ghorm ina a lárCoinneal nách féidir a mhúcadhGo ndeanaid mise cleas ainictheBríd 'sa brat Miceál is a sgiathDá laimh gheala Dé idir sin.Agus gach pían anocht agus dtí bliadhanÓ anocht agus anocht féin.

4922356/4873865/5075780.title: An Phaidir Gheal
4922356/4873865/5075780.text:
Go mbeannuigh Dia dhuit a Phaidir geal,Go mbeannuigh Dia dhuit féin,Cár codail tú aréir,I bhfochair Mac Dé,Cá gcodaileochair anocht,I bhfochair na mbocht,Cá gcodaileóchair imbháireach,I mbúaile Phádraig,Céard é sin rómhat amach,Dhá chead aingeal,Céard é sin id' dhiaidh aniar,Dá chead aspal,Céárd é sin id lámh deas,Uisge coisricin chuir Muire liom-sa,Dhoras so  go doras Farathar,Dabhac óir annsúd thall,Fleasg óir in a cheann,Coinneal ghorm in a lár,Coinneal nách féidir a mhúcadh,Go ndeanaidh mise cleas (n-ainne) ainicthe,Bríd 'sá  brat Miceál is a sgiath,Dá laimh gheala Dé idir sin,Agus gach pían anocht agus dtíbliadhan ó anocht agus anocht féin.
(continues on next page)

5008861/4961795/5077051.title: Prayer to Sacred Heart
5008861/4961795/5077051.text: O Most Sweet Jesus, I commend the Thy Divine Heart all that I have done in the hour that is gone to be cleansed and purified and offered to God the Father for his eternal praise, and whatsoever I shall do in the hour that is beginning I resolve to do it simply for the glory of God for the salvation of all mankind.

5008870/4962324/5077170.title: Our Lady's Seven Joys
5008870/4962324/5077170.text:
(continued from previous page)
It was the joy of the young SonWhen He read the Bible over.The very next joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of fiveIt was the joy of her young SonWhen he made the dead alive.The very next joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of sixIt was the joy of her Young SonWhen He bore the CrucifixThe very next joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of seven.It was the joy of her Young SonWhen He was made King of Heaven



God is good and very kindHe spilled his blood to save mankindHis wounds He brought to the living GodHe being Father, Son and Holy Ghost.
(continues on next page)

5008837/4959959/5077238.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959959/5077238.text: God save all hereGod save you kindlyMay God increase your storeGod save you and yoursGod bless your workGod enable you.Gods blessing on you and yoursThe Lord have mercy on the souls that left you.If the child sneezed, the grandmother would say:God almighty may bless you childGood further to the workThis was a prayer the old people used to say while dressing:O God clothe my sould with the nuptial robe of charity and grant that I may carry it pure and undefilled before the judgement seat.

5008837/4959960/5077242.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959960/5077242.text: Here as I lay down to sleep.I give my soul to God to keep.May I waken now or never.I give my soul to God to keep for ever.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angles overspread.Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on.If any evil comes to me.The Blessed Virgin may waken me.That I may have my eyes to see.And my right hand to bless me.               People say that prayer when they are lying down to sleep.Merciful Jesus lover of souls we pray Thee by the agony of Thy most Sacred Wounds to cleanse in They Blood the sinners of the whole world who are now in their agony and who are to die today.

5008837/4959961/5077247.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959961/5077247.text: Memorare to the Sacred Heart.Remember! Oh most loving Jesus that it is a thing unheard of in all ages that those who implore Thy powerful protection were ever abandoned by Thee.  Confiding therefore in Thy infinite goodness.  I cast myself before Thee, Oh Heart King of Hearts.  I do most humbly supplicate Thee to hear my prayers to receive my soul as thy spouse, to take upon you the case of my eternal salvation and watch over me at the hour of my death.  Show Divine Jesus that thou hast a Heart of the best of Fathers, shelter me therin where naught is found but grace and salvation.Amen.

5008837/4959962/5077252.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959962/5077252.text: God save all here.God bless the work.God save you.God speed you.May God and his Blessed Mother protect you.God bless you.God love you.God spare you and God spare your health.God be with you.the blessings of God on you.God be good to you.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angles overspread.Saint Mathew, Saint Mark, Saint Luke, Saint John.God bless the bed that I lie on.

5008837/4959963/5077255.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959963/5077255.text: God bless Friday and Good Friday too,and the Friday our Saviour was crucified on.  The wicked Jews with their spears so sharp.   Pierced our Saviours hand and luck.  Our Blessed Lady was standing by with heavy heart and mournful say.  Any person who says this prayer, three times by night, and three times by day, need not fear death, judgement, or the seven deathly sins.  the gates of hell thou will never enter.Amen.Act of ContritionHere I lie down to sleep.I give my soul to God to keep.And if I die before I wake.I pray to God my soul to take.Sleep I now, wake I may never,I give my soul to God forever.There are four corners on my bed.There are four Angels over spread.And my right side I turn to thee.As Jesus did on Mary's knee.The lily of the branch.The Lord of the flower.Jesus, Mary and Joseph,Watch over me forever.

5008837/4959964/5077265.title: Act of Contrition
5008837/4959964/5077265.text:
O my god, I am heartily sorry for having offended Thee because thou art the chief good and worthy of all good, love and tverthing that is sinful and displeasing to Thee.  I resolve to amend my life here after.



There are four corners on my bed.Four Blessed Angels round me spread.Saint Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on.I go to my bed as I go to my grave.Begging of Jesus my soul for to leave.The bright Queen of Heaven and Christ be my flower and Jesus be with me at my dying hour.Long ago when a person lifted the latch he would say "God save all here", when going away they say "May you have an easy death, and a grand finish".

5008837/4959965/5077268.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959965/5077268.text: O Lord! that I may see.I know that my Redeemer lived.That I shall again rise out of the dust.And shall be again clothed in this body.And in my flesh shall see My God.Here I lay my head to sleep.To God I give my soul to keep.Waiting hour, Waiting hour,To God I give my soul for ever.There are four corners on my bedAnd four angels over spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John.God bless the bed that I lay on.

5008837/4959966/5077272.title: Local Prayers
5008837/4959966/5077272.text: Prayer to be said leaving the chapelBeannact leat, A Muire!Beannact leat, A Criost!Go gcumhdai sib mo anamGo dtagid me arisPrayers to be said when workingGod bless the work.  God save the work.  God save all here.  God save us.  God bless us. God help us.

5008871/4962380/5077422.title: Folk Prayer
5008871/4962380/5077422.text:
Long ago old women had a rhyme of a prayer here they called the Lord's Prayer in Irish - It ran on -"Shad Pagra, com in then a mac com-in dan a brath, auger [?] hall com a [?] crsl a [?] a, devin a drietna, throckna. Amen.Heart of Jesus I adore Thee,Heart of May I implore thee,Heart of Joseph pure and sweet,In these three hearts I place my trust."Change not thyself with the weight of yearsChild of thy master faithful and dear,Don't choose the cross for the coming weekFor that is more than He bids us seekBend not your arm with tomorrow's load,For that my be left to the glorious God.For daily He only said to theeTake up your Cross and follow me.""Take by the cross, take up thy cross,Don't heed its weight or length,He who heed and died thereon,(continued over leaf [p 142])
(continues on next page)

5008871/4962382/5077432.title: Folk Prayer
5008871/4962382/5077432.text:
(continued from previous page)
Will give you grace and strength.Take up thy cross, take up thy cross,Embrace its thorny crown,These are the biddings Jesus givesTo those He calls His own."



Oh God thou hast throughout the nightWatched me with a father's careI praise thee with the morning lightFor all the blessings that I have.



I lie down this night to sleepI give my soul to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round my head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lied on.If anything happens meThe Lord may waken me. Amen.



God bless this house from dawn to dark,God bless our work and play,God bless our loved ones far and near
(continues on next page)

5008871/4962382/5077434.text:
(continued from previous page)
Will give you grace and strength.Take up thy cross, take up thy cross,Embrace its thorny crown,These are the biddings Jesus givesTo those He calls His own."



Oh God thou hast throughout the nightWatched me with a father's careI praise thee with the morning lightFor all the blessings that I have.



I lie down this night to sleepI give my soul to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round my head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lied on.If anything happens meThe Lord may waken me. Amen.



God bless this house from dawn to dark,God bless our work and play,God bless our loved ones far and near

5008882/4963379/5077465.title: Prayers
5008882/4963379/5077465.text:
Heart of Jesus I adore youHeart of Mary I implore youHeart of Saint Joseph pure and justIn your three divine hearts I place my trust.  Amen.O crucified JesusHave mercy on meMy soul and my body I give onto theeIn honour of your five bleeding woundsThat were nailed to a treeO crucified Jesue have mercy on meAmen.

5008847/4960847/5077679.title: Prayers
5008847/4960847/5077679.text: Now I lay me down to sleep. I pray the Lord my soul to keep,If I die before I awake.I pray the Lord my soul to take. There are four corners on my bedThere are six angels at my headTwo to sing and two to pray and two to carry my soul away. I place my arms in the form of a cross for love Jesus who died on the cross for love of me. Do bhailgheas an t-eolas seo ó Cáit Ní ConghaileCorcreaghyDundalk

5008847/4960851/5077689.title: More Prayers
5008847/4960851/5077689.text:
The following prayer was found in the grave of our Lord Jesus Christ in the year 803 and was sent from the Pope to Emperor Charles as he was going to battle for safety.The PrayerOh adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ dying on the cross save me. Oh holy cross of Christ see me safe through. Oh hold cross of Christ ward off from me all weapons of danger. Oh holy cross of Christ ward off from me all things that are evil. Oh holy cross of Christ guide me in the right way to happiness. Oh crucified Jesus of Nazareth have mercy on me now and for ever Amen. Another PrayerLord Jesus Christ and in honour of his Sacred Passion and Death and in honour of his glorious Ressurrection and God like ascension to which he liked to bring me the right way to happiness. The true as Jesus Christ died to save sinners. True as the three wise kings brought their offerings to Jesus on the 13th day. True as He ascended into heaven. So the honour of
(continues on next page)

5008847/4960853/5077694.title: Prayer - At Bedtime
5008847/4960853/5077694.text:
The protection of God and of the Blessed Virgin, St Colum Cill, St John the Baptist, St Peter and Paul and all the holy angels and Saints be about me, AmenSacred heart of Jesus be my salvation,Holy Mary pray for me.Blessed Oliver intercede in Heaven for me.Collected fromSéamús Ó MuireadhaighBaile na gClochCo Lughdhaidhe



This strange story is the actual words of the narrator and witness, Paddy Martin (Labourer), Stonetown, Concreaghy, Dundalk. This is a man of the "hard-headed" type, one not given to much belief in the spirit world. The year of this "seeing"would be either 1928 or '29.The "men" were dressed in a [sort?] of dark-greenish clothes and appeared to be about 2 feet tall.
(continues on next page)

5008848/4960888/5077747.title: Prayers - The Seven Joys of Our Lady
5008848/4960888/5077747.text:
1. The very first Joy that Our Blessed Lady got, it was the Joy of One: It was the joy of her young Son when he was born in Bethlehem. ChorusBlesses is He, Blessed is she, and he who sings Her Seven Blessed Joys or wears her livery.2. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got, it was the joy of Two. It was the joy of Her young Son when he read the bible through. Chorus.3. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got , was the joy of Three. It was the joy of Her Young Son when he made the blind to see. Chorus. 4. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got was the joy of Four. It was the joy of her young Son when he begged from door to door. Chorus. 5. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got was the joy of Five. It was the joy of her young Son when He raised the dead to life. Chorus. 6. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got was the the joy
(continues on next page)

5008848/4960889/5077751.title: Prayers - The Seven Joys of Our Lady
5008848/4960889/5077751.text:
(continued from previous page)
of Six. It was the joy of her young Son when he carried the Crucifix. Chorus. 7. The very next joy that Our Blessed Lady got was the joy of Seven. It was the joy of her young Son when He opened the gates of heaven. Chorus.



A Prayer for the living and the Dead -:Have mercy on all sinners O Lord and grant the just the grace to persevere and advance in virtue, and may the souls of the faithful departed through the mercy of God rest in peace. Amen.A Prayer in bed -:I lie in my bed as I lie in my grave and I pray to my God my soul to receive.Going to bed. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I lay my body down to rest. Bless me O Lord, defend, govern and keep me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to life everlasting happiness. Amen.O My God I adore Thee. I love Thee with my whole heart. I thank thee for all Thy favours and mercies. I place myself under Thy protection and beg of Thee through the merits of Jesus Christ to grant me graces to serve Thee faithfully. All the days of my life I offer to Thee
(continues on next page)

5008848/4960890/5077753.title: Prayers
5008848/4960890/5077753.text:
(continued from previous page)
O My God all my thought, all my words, all my actions, all my crosses and afflictions, every breath I breathe, every step I walk, everything I do this day. I propose O lord to avoid this day every offence against Thee, and, do Thou extend Thy protecting hand over me that I may not betray Thee. Most Holy Mary take me under Thy protection. My angel guardian and patron saint assist me. Amen.



Going into a Church.O Good Lord, I'm coming to pay you a little visit, help me and assist me.Going to bed. I adore Thee O Christ and praise Thee. Save me from the dangers of the night. Awakening in the morning.O My God I adore Thee for bringing me safe through the night.Going to bed. There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels overhead. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on. Bless O Lord the repose I am going to take, that by renewing my bodily strength and I may be better able to serve Thee. O all ye saints and angels especially Thou O Mother of God intercede for for me not only during this  night and the rest of my
(continues on next page)

5008863/4962016/5077862.title: Prayers
5008863/4962016/5077862.text:
Prayer for going on a journey"O Good God, guide me on this journey, and protect me from all dangers and accidents." Amen.When getting up in the morning "O Dearest Jesus, sanctify this day and bless all its toils, and divert all its dangers." AmenBefore Holy Communion"Jesus, Jesus come to me, Jesus, Jesus how I long for thee,Jesus, Jesus how I sigh for Thee.  Amen.Before going to bed"I lay my body down to sleep, I beg to God my soul to keep and if I die before I wake, I pray to God
(continues on next page)

5008883/4963558/5078023.title: Prayer
5008883/4963558/5078023.text: Here I lay myself down to sleep and give my soul to God to keep.If anything happens me Blessed Lady waken me.There are four corners on my bed there are four angels over my head.St. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on.Five bleeding wounds have been nailed to a tree.Oh merciful Jesus have mercy on me.
5008883/4963558/5078023.school_info: School: St. Vincent de Paul, Drogheda

5008883/4963580/5078117.title: A Prayer
5008883/4963580/5078117.text: May God bless and spare us all.St. Patrick, Brigid and Colmcille guard each wall.May the Queen of Heaven and angels bright.Watch over us by day and night.
5008883/4963580/5078117.school_info: School: St. Vincent de Paul, Drogheda

5008883/4963615/5078223.text: God bless good Friday the Friday tooThe Friday our Saviour was crucifiedFrom His heart to His hands His precious blood did flowHis blessed mother was standing by with a heavy heart and dismal cryOh son dear son pity me and don't leave me here for eternityAnyone who says those prayers three times by day the gates of hell they shall never enter in

4922395/4877808/5078544.title: Old Prayers
4922395/4877808/5078544.school_info: School: Cill Mhuire, Sráid na Cathrach

5008892/4964355/5078603.title: Prayers
5008892/4964355/5078603.text:
May Jesus the Child be near my bed,May the Lamb of Mercy uplift my head,May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed,And St. Michael be steward of my soul.



O glorious Virgin, Mother of God, blessed among all nations, worthy of praise, and the greatest of praise, intercede for me with thy beloved Son.  O honoured Lady, Mother of the King of Angels, assist and deliver me from every difficulty and danger.  AmenThe above prayer used to be said by people when they were in any danger.

5008892/4964355/5078604.title: Prayers
5008892/4964355/5078604.text:
May Jesus the Child be near my bed,May the Lamb of Mercy uplift my head,May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed,And St. Michael be steward of my soul.



O glorious Virgin, Mother of God, blessed among all nations, worthy of praise, and the greatest of praise, intercede for me with thy beloved Son.  O honoured Lady, Mother of the King of Angels, assist and deliver me from every difficulty and danger.  AmenThe above prayer used to be said by people when they were in any danger.

5008892/4964356/5078606.title: Prayers
5008892/4964356/5078606.text: Lord give me grace and strength of character to tear myself away promptly from what, if not bad, is less good, an to give myself earnestly, self-denyingly, and perserveringly to the bettter and the best.Saints Mattthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless this bed that I lie on.Four corners to my bed,Four angels round my head,One to watch, and one to pray,And two to bear my soul away.O my God, keep me safe this night,Jesus, Mary & Joseph.When people saw the new moon they used to say - 'I see the moon and the moon sees me, God bless the moon and God bless me'.

5008892/4964357/5078607.title: Prayers
5008892/4964357/5078607.text: O my God, here I lie on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,And if I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round it spread,Sts. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on.O my God, clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of charity, and grant that I may wear it pure, and undefiled before thy judgement seat.When people put out the light at night they used to say-"God grant us the light and the glory of the Kingdom of Heaven".

5008892/4964358/5078608.title: Prayers
5008892/4964358/5078608.text:
Ah!  what gift or present, Jesus, can I bring,I have nothing worthy of my God and King.Take my body, Jesus, eyes, ears and tongue,Never let them, Jesus, help to do thee wrong.Take my heart and fill it full of love for Thee,All I  have I give thee,  give Thyself to me.



Mother sweet and Mother fair,Give me Jesus now to hold,I will take the greatest care,I will keep Him from the cold.I will love Him tenderly,Please, Oh, please, do give Him me.



Long ago the people before lying down to sleep used to trace the sign of the Cross on their foreheads and say-"May Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews, preserve me from a sudden and unprepared death".

Ah!  what gift or present, Jesus, can I bring,I have nothing worthy of my God and King.Take my body, Jesus, eyes, ears and tongue,Never let them, Jesus, help to do thee wrong.Take my heart and fill it full of love for Thee,All I  have I give thee,  give Thyself to me.



Mother sweet and Mother fair,Give me Jesus now to hold,I will take the greatest care,I will keep Him from the cold.I will love Him tenderly,Please, Oh, please, do give Him me.



Long ago the people before lying down to sleep used to trace the sign of the Cross on their foreheads and say-"May Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews, preserve me from a sudden and unprepared death".

5008892/4964359/5078615.title: Prayers
5008892/4964359/5078615.text:
When the lamp was being lighted people used to say-"May this light give light to the world and to the poor souls in Purgatory"."God grant us the light of thy Kingdom to come".



Here I lay myself down to sleep,My soul to God I give to keepMy God within, my God without,My God in heaven all round about,Anything that happens me,My Sweet Saviour will save me.Crucified Jesus have pity on meMy soul and my body I give unto Thee,In honour of the five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree,Crucified Jesus have pity on me.

5008892/4964359/5078618.title: Prayers
5008892/4964359/5078618.text:
When the lamp was being lighted people used to say-"May this light give light to the world and to the poor souls in Purgatory"."God grant us the light of thy Kingdom to come".



Here I lay myself down to sleep,My soul to God I give to keepMy God within, my God without,My God in heaven all round about,Anything that happens me,My Sweet Saviour will save me.Crucified Jesus have pity on meMy soul and my body I give unto Thee,In honour of the five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree,Crucified Jesus have pity on me.

5008888/4963947/5079180.title: A Collection of Prayers
5008888/4963947/5079180.text:
This prayer to be said when you bleeds:Jesus of Nazareth baptised at the river Jordan, this water was clear this water was good. When Jesus came to it, it stood in His word and in His name I command this blood to do the same. Prayer to say at nightAs I lay down on my right side I give my soul to God to guide. If any evil troubles me my mother Mary waken me. There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels
(continues on next page)

metadata.Teacher:: R. Ní Mhaolmhochaire, E. Ní Laoi

5008889/4963972/5079205.title: An Old Prayer
5008889/4963972/5079205.text:
Through Mary's heart immaculate I offer Lord to Thee. Each action of this holy day unworthy thought be. In spirit at the Altar each night a guard I'll spend. And may each thought, each word, each breath in grateful love ascend. For am I not your chosen spouse, oh privilege most high. Then should I not reparation make even till my latest sigh.



O Lord Jesus Christ, whose unwearied eye neither slumbers nor sleeps, but continually watches in the defence of thy servants, take me and mine. I beseech Thee into thy Protection and grant that whilst our bodies are asleep our souls may be awake to Thee and that we may hereafter behold Thee in that blessed and heavenly country where Thou,
(continues on next page)

5008889/4963972/5079209.title: An Old Prayer
5008889/4963972/5079209.text:
Through Mary's heart immaculate I offer Lord to Thee. Each action of this holy day unworthy thought be. In spirit at the Altar each night a guard I'll spend. And may each thought, each word, each breath in grateful love ascend. For am I not your chosen spouse, oh privilege most high. Then should I not reparation make even till my latest sigh.



O Lord Jesus Christ, whose unwearied eye neither slumbers nor sleeps, but continually watches in the defence of thy servants, take me and mine. I beseech Thee into thy Protection and grant that whilst our bodies are asleep our souls may be awake to Thee and that we may hereafter behold Thee in that blessed and heavenly country where Thou,
(continues on next page)

5008889/4963974/5079221.title: A Bedtime Prayer
5008889/4963974/5079221.text:
(continued from previous page)
with the Father and the Holy Ghost, art Eternal Governor, and where all the angels, with the Blessed saints, are citizens for ever. Amen.



Before the closing of the day, Creator, we thee humbly prayThat for thy wanted mercy's sakeThou us into thy protection take. May nothing in our minds excite Vain dreams and phantoms of the night. Keep off our enemies that so our bodies no uncleanness know, In this most gracious fatherHear through Christ thy equal sonOur prayers who with the Holy Ghost and thee Doth live and reign eternally. Amen.

5008889/4964123/5079535.title: An Old Prayer - Our Lady's Seven Joys
5008889/4964123/5079535.text:
The very first joy Our Lady got,It was the joy of one.It was the joy of her Young Son,When He was newly born.the very next joy Our Blessed Lady got,It was the joy of two.It was the joy of her Young Son,When he began to move.The very next joy Our Blessed Lady got,It was the joy of three.It was the joy of her Young Son,When he made the bind to see.The very next joy Our Blessed Lady got,It was the joy of four.It was the joy of her Young Son,When He read the bible O,er.The very next joy Our Blessed Lady got,It was the joy of five.It was the joy of her Young SonWhen He made the dead arise
(continues on next page)

5008896/4964666/5079579.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964666/5079579.text:
Old Prayers of the LocalityO Lord my God depart not far from me. O my God have regards to help me, for diverse evil thoughts have risen up against me, and great fears are afflicting my soul.  O Lord make haste to help me.("This is to said as a prayer against evil thoughts")Collected by Nancy Courtney, Moate.
(continues on next page)

5008896/4964669/5079583.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964669/5079583.text:
(continued from previous page)
good Mother. So many fathers can no longer find work so many mothers who no longer have anything with which to feed or clothe their children.  We pray thee Lord have pity on them and on all those who are in want.  Forgive them their sins and be merciful to them.Collected byMargaret ConnellLongford



Prayer before Holy Communion.We most humbly beseech thee,Almighty God command these things to be carried by the hands of They holy Angel of Thy altar on high in the sight of Thy Divine Majesty that as many of us as by participation at this Altar shall receive the
(continues on next page)

4428337/4396631/5079585.title: Paidreacha
4428337/4396631/5079585.text:
Páidreacha1.Ag coigilt na teineadhCoiglim an teine seo mar choiglim Críost cách, Brighid ina bun, agus Muire ina lár, seacht n-aingeal fiche ag an teineadh go dtí lá is ag cúmhdach an toighe seo is na daoine go lá.2.Ag dul a luighe duit.Luighim ar an leabaidh seo mar luighfidh mé ins an uaigh, ag deánamh faoiside leat a Íosa go cruaidh, tré gníomhairí mo cholna, tré smaointeacht mo chroidhe, tré labhairt mo bhéal, tré gach ní a dubhras, is nach rabh fíor, iarraim maitheamhnas ort a righ na glóire. Amen.3.A Íosa a Mhic Dé gabh seachnuigh m'anam ar aon slighe, do mo chúmhdach, do mo shábhal ar aon teinidh agus ar uisge.4.Cum Dia agus Muire mé , Conall agus Colmcille, go sabhalaidh siad mé ar achan olc agus go gcuirfidh siad déagh-bháis chugam. Amen.
(continues on next page)

metadata.Location:: Croaghgorm or Blue Stack Mountains, Co. Donegal

5008896/4964670/5079589.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964670/5079589.text:
(continued from previous page)
Most Sacred Body and Blood of Thy Son, may be filled with all heavenly benediction and grace.Through the same Christ our Lord Amen.Collected byLena CorryMain Street



Lovely Lady dressed in blue,Teach me how to pray?God was just your little Boy,Tell me what to say.Did you lift him up, sometmesGently on your kneeDid you sing to him the wayMother does to me?Did you hold his hand at nightDid you ever tryTelling stories of the world,Oh! and did he cryDo you really think he mindsIf I tell him thingsLittle things that happen to me,Tell me, Lovely Lady.
(continues on next page)

5008896/4964671/5079594.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964671/5079594.text:
(continued from previous page)
Teach me how to pray.Collected by Lena Corry, Main St.Before the closing of the days,Our God we humbly pray theeto save us through the night.Many dreams and vain thingsmay trouble us, but by theyhelp O Lord our minds on them dwell not. Keep off our enemies that so, our bodies may no uncleaness know.Protect us under the shadow of thy wing.  Have mercy on us, O Lord have mercy on us, and that we may rest this night in peace. O, my God, I lay my weary body down to rest.  I pray, pray my God that you may save me during the night



O, my God, I lay my weary body down to rest. I pray, pray my God that you may save me during the night,
(continues on next page)

5008896/4964672/5079602.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964672/5079602.text:
(continued from previous page)
and when I waken up at morn, if it be your will to spare me, I shall praise thee endlessy.Dying may I my last Communion makeIn peace with him who dies, too for my sake,And may that Loving Lord my parting spirit take.Collected by Mary White, Larrix Street



Preserve me, O Lord from all these illusions and grant me solid piety, a true devotion which me induce me to know the source of my disorders.  Root up my vices and passions, and purify me from sin.  Let they truth set me at liberty that I may both feel and pursue the impressions of they spirit, forget creatures
(continues on next page)

5008896/4964673/5079609.title: Old Prayers of the Locality
5008896/4964673/5079609.text:
(continued from previous page)
despise the world, raise myself above the earth, hate and despise myself and sign only for what is heavenly and everlasting.  Amen.Collected byNancy Courtney, Moate



Hail and blessed be the hour and moment in which the Son of God was born of the most pure Virgin Mary at midnight in Bethleham in piercing cold.In that hour vouchsafe, O my God to hear my prayer and grant my desires through the merits of Our Saviour Jesus Christ and of his blessed mother. Amen.Oh! Sacred Heart of Jesus,
(continues on next page)

4922377/4875615/5079945.title: Paidreacha
4922377/4875615/5079945.text: Cabhair agus cáirde agus grásta ó Dhia cughann.Cabhair gach lá cughann atáimíd ghá íarradh.Sácráment na foidhne agus na h-aithrighe cughainn.Go mbeannuighedh Dia dhuit Bhrighidh naomhtha,Go mbeannuighedh Muire dhuit agus beannuighim féin dhuit.Is cúghat a tháinig mé ag gearán mo sgéil-séMar súil go bhfaighfá mo athcuinge 'ón Mhaighean Naomhtha.

5008873/4962630/5080082.title: Old Prayers
5008873/4962630/5080082.text:
Old people were very holy and religious long ago. All the work they did was in the name of God.The following prayer is said when retiring to bed at night.  "As I look up as I look down   I see the blessed heaven all    around."I see the Blessed LadyAnd the Blessed Gospel in her hand.Seven masses she did say.Seven bells she did ring.For her own dear Son.Good Friday before noonThe Jews did comeTo pierce our Saviour through heart
(continues on next page)

5008873/4962631/5080084.title: Old Prayers
5008873/4962631/5080084.text:
(continued from previous page)
and hand.The old people long ago had a very old prayer to say to anybody going on a journey." God be with you and may you have a safe journey."Another prayer is said when awakening in the morning."O my God help my work of the day and guide me from all dangers " Amen.



Long ago the old people were very holy and religious. they did all their work in the name of God. They also
(continues on next page)

5008873/4962633/5080091.title: Old Prayers
5008873/4962633/5080091.text:
The old people long ago were very holy and religious. They did all work in the name of God They made many prayers of their own. Some of these prayers still exist.When rising in the morning this prayer is said"God bless Daddy and Mam and Granny and my Sisters and Brothers. Lord have mercy on all the poor souls."This prayer should be said when going to bed."To night my Lord I place my soul and body in Thy care keep me safe till Blessed morning light."This is an other prayer said when going to bed."As I lay down my head to
(continues on next page)

5008873/4962635/5080098.title: Old Prayers
5008873/4962635/5080098.text:
Long ago the old people were very holy and religious. All their works were done in the name of God. The people made many prayers which were never put on paper. Some of these prayers still exist.The following prayer is said when rising in the morning"O My God! I give Thee thanks for having taken me over the night in the beginning of another dayGrant that I may pass the remains of my lifeIn worthy acts of praise and thanksgiving."Before starting work the following prayer is said. "In the name of God and God grant good work."Before they went on a journey the old people always blessed themselves and said,
(continues on next page)

5008873/4962637/5080101.title: Old Prayers
5008873/4962637/5080101.text:
The old people long ago were very holy and religious. They did all the work in the name of God. They also made prayers some of these prayers still exist in the district.When rising in the morning the old people said the following prayer."God bless me and save me mark me with divine graces and save me from a sudden or unprovided death".Before going to bed they would say this prayer."As now I lay down my head to sleepI give my soul to God to keepGod within God withoutThere are four corners on my bedThere are four Angels around my headMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lay onIf any evil thing come near me
(continues on next page)

4922366/4874780/5080102.title: Night Prayer
4922366/4874780/5080102.text: Now I lay me down to sleep,To God, I give my sould to keep.If I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take.If any evil spirit come to meOh Blessed Lady waken me.One to guard me, two to guide,Three to carry my soul["d" struck out] to heaven.

4922366/4874781/5080125.title: Morning Prayer
4922366/4874781/5080125.text: O Mary my Queen, and my my mother, to thee do I offer myself without any reserve, and to give thee a mark of my devotion I consecrate to thee this day my ears, my eyes, my mouth, my heart, my whole person since I belong to thee.Oh, my good mother preserve and be fond of me as thy property and thine own possession.John Gorman,Carnane,Doolin.Nora Gorman (38 years),Carnane,Doolin.

4922366/4874782/5080129.title: Night Prayer
4922366/4874782/5080129.text: There are four corners in my bed.four great angels at my head,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on.If any evil spirit come to me, my blessed lady waken me.One to guard me, one to guide me, two to carry my soul to heaven.

5008876/4962976/5080305.title: Prayers
5008876/4962976/5080305.text:
There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round my spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on, and if any thing should happen me before morning may the Blessed Virgin Mary awaken me and pray for me.Here I lay my body down to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake, I pray that God my soul may take.I must die, I know not, nor how, nor where but if I die in mortal sin, I am lost forever, O Jesus have mercy on me. Amen.These prayers are to be said before going to bedHoly Mary mother of God pick the potatoes out of the sod. Hail Mary full of grace help to pick the potatoes out of the face.These prayers are to be said while picking potatoes.On starting out on a journey people generally say. O Jesus make
(continues on next page)

4922379/4875821/5080538.title: Paidir chun na Tine a Choigilt
4922379/4875821/5080538.text: Coighlim-se an teine seo mar a choigil Bríghid an Cáisg. Bríghid agus Muire 'na lár.  Na seacht n-aingil in áirde 's na Flaitheas ag coimeád na ndaoine 'im thig seo go lá.

4922369/4874904/5080737.title: Prayer to Saint Brigid
4922369/4874904/5080737.text: Brigid Ní Dothadé a chuireas sloinncis ré ar comraic dúinn féin ós léithí féin an oidhche anocht Brigid Ní Dothad díon Inghean Aodha Ó Thúrafhinn Fiachra MhicCaisg Mhic Cormaic Mhic Chairt Mhic Chaoin - gach oidche dá gcuimhnighimíd ar shloinne Brighte gan dearmhad ní  gontar sinn ní bádhtar sinn, ní fágtar sinn ar dearmhad. Ní dhógann teine na grian soluis sinn, ní mhúcann uisce ná sáile sinn is linn féin buadh gach báire ó anocht go bliadhain ó anoch agus anocht féin. (Trí uaire Oidhche Bhrighdhe 0 gach  [?] leis An Phaidir, G ailte an Aingil, Cré na nAsbal)

4922379/4875932/5080831.title: Paidir
4922379/4875932/5080831.text: Neartuig mé a Dhía grásta an srioraid naomhtha. Ceartuig mo lochta is cuir grádh agus laradh im chroidhe. Na peacuig leit mé is coimeád mé i bhfad ó thaobh as bealach do leinbh díbirt gur bráth is a coidhche

5044788/5038168/5081712.title: Folklore - Old Cures
5044788/5038168/5081712.text:
(continued from previous page)
cake. While it is being baked, they have to sit beside it and not let anyone touch it or go between them and it. They were not supposed to break their fast until they would get the cake to eat.I cannot find the prayers because the cure was of no use if everyone knew them. A man had to leave the cure to a woman, and a woman to a man other ways it was of no use. All the cures were made on Monday and Thursday.



An Fáoisin ChaoitíceanntaAdhmúighim do Dhia Uíle-cúmhachtach, do Náomh Múire, atá 'riamh 'na h-Oigh; do Náomh Micheal Ard-áingeal; do Náomh Eoin Baiste; do ná Naoimh Apóstal, Péadhar agus Pól; do Náomh Padhráic agús do ná Náomh h-úilich  (agus dúitse, a áthair) gúr peachaigh mo go ro-tróm, lé smáoineadh, le bríathar agús lé gníomha, fridh mo chóir fhéin, fridh mo chóir fein  mhór-cóir fhéin.Ar an adhbhair sín, íagraim Náomh Múire ata  'suamh 'na h-Oigh; Naomh Mícheal Ardáingeal; Naomh Éoin  Baiste; ná Naoimh  Apstáil, Peadár agús Pól; Náomh Padhráich agús ná Náoimh h-úilich Diá a guidhe ár mó són.Cré ná n-ÁpstalCreidhim í nDía, án t-Athair Uile-cúmhactach, Crúthuighteoir Néimhe
(continues on next page)

5044788/5038171/5081757.title: Urnaithe Gaeilge
5044788/5038171/5081757.text:
Failthe  an  ÁinghilDhia dhó bheatha a Múire atá lán dhó ná ghrastha,Tá án Tighearna laeth is bheánnuigh thú tár ná mná agús is bheannuigh toradh dhó bhrónn Iósa. Á Naómh Múire Mathair Dé ghuidh orainne ná peachaighí anóis aghus  ár úair ar mbás.Amhén.Tár  eis an  AifrinnA Dhia ár ndidean aghus ár an ndaighneacht amharch anúas in dhó trochaire ár dhó pobhal atha ag sgairthigh orth aghus fridh eadhairguidhe ná Naomh maighdine glórmhair gleighil Múire Mathair Dé Naomh Seosamh a céile, na Naom Apról Peadhar agus  Pól aghús ná Naomh uiligh húilich in Dó trochaire agus  in Dhó maitheas  eisth LINN lé nár n-urnuigh (?)  ár son  gó dtionniochadh (?) ná peachaidh cugath agus ár són saoirche agus ardhuigh ár Naomh Mathair an  Eaglais Fridh Criostha ár   Tigearna. AmhenTus Paidrin PaírtheachTionnsgnaimh a rad an urnuidhe seó már d'orduigh Dia agus  ná  noamh Eaglaís  Cathloíceach  duinn Creudheadh go diongmhaltha. O a Iósa ós tú a ceannuigh sinn go mba tú geabthas sinn o a iósa éisth linn tábhair toradh ar ár nguidhe.Amen.Ná Molthago mbeannuighthear Dhia gó mbeannuighthear  a ainmh Naomhtago mbeannuightear Iósa Criostha fior Día agus fíor  Dúinego mbeannuightear Ainmh Iósa, gó mbeannuighthear Croidhe ró Naomthago mbeannuighthear Iosa Naomh Sacramhuinth ná h-Althorago mbeannuightear mór Mathair De  Múire  ro Naomthágo mbeannuightear  (?) Naomtha gan smál
(continues on next page)

5008874/4962901/5082045.title: Buying
5008874/4962901/5082045.text:
(continued from previous page)
these travellers are still seen.Sometimes goods were exchanged for hay or horsehair.other coins which are not now in use, but which were used then were, the fourpenny and tenpenny bits.People called "rag-men", bought old rags from the people, and paid fivepence per pound for them, or took them in exchange for bootlaces, spools of thread, or other useful articles, this exhange was called "bartering".



When a person hears the cuckoo for the first time he says "that we may be alive this time next year."When lying in bed before going to sleep say:-"I lay my body down to sleep
(continues on next page)

5044800/5039811/5082245.title: Prayers
5044800/5039811/5082245.text: I lay my body down to sleep.I pray to God my soul to keep.And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take. There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels overspreadMathew, Luke, Mark and JohnBless the bed that I lie on.If any evil troubles me,May The Blessed Virgin waken me. Jesus be the branch, Mary be the flowerJesus be at my dying hour.Jesus to watch and Mary to prayAnd Jesus to carry my soul away.

5044800/5039812/5082250.title: Prayer
5044800/5039812/5082250.text: Holy Mary Queen of IrelandMake thy children cling to thee.From all communistic dangerEver keep our country free. May St Patrick and St BrigidBless and guard our native shoreAnd may Mary Queen of IrelandReign o'er all for evermore. Holy Irish Saints and martyrs,For the faith who nobly diedHelp us follow in your footstepsChrist our king - The Crucified. Jesus aid us in the struggle'Gainst the wilds of Satan's band.And with Mary we will conquer.Thrusting in God's mighty hand.

5044800/5039825/5082288.title: Prayers
5044800/5039825/5082288.text: Most Sacred Heart of Jesus I place all my trust entirely in thee, above all, before all in spite of all and for ever. Night PrayerAs I go to my bed, I go to my grave.I pray to the Lord my soul to save.O Lily of Israel, branch of the flower.Jesus, Mary and Joseph be with me at my dying hour.

5044800/5039831/5082300.title: Prayers
5044800/5039831/5082300.text: God bless your hands, and bless your feet.Make them supple strong and fleet.God bless your limbs, and arms, and breastAnd the heart that I love best. God bless the beauty of your face.Told about your Heaven's graceGod bless your hair, your lips, your eyes.Keep them candid as the skiesIn everything you say or doMay you be gentle, faithful, true.Where You may walk, may God divineGuard and bless you, son of mine.

5044800/5039832/5082302.title: Night Prayer
5044800/5039832/5082302.text: May the will of God be done by usMay the death of Saint's be won by us.And the light of the Kingdom, begun by usMay Jesus the Child be beside my bed.May the Lamb of mercy lift up my head.May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed.And Blessed Michael be steward of my soul.St Patrick's Prayer.May the strength of God, guide me this dayAnd may His power preserve me.May the wisdom of God instruct me. The ear of God hear meThe word of God give sweetness in my speechThe Hand of God defend me. And may I follow. The way of God.

5044800/5039835/5082325.title: Prayers
5044800/5039835/5082325.text:
Angel of God, ever at my sideGo to the church for me.Kneel in my place at Holy MassWhere I desire to be. At the Offertory be in my steadTake all I am and ownAnd place it as a sacrificeUpon the Altar throne.When the Priest Communion takes O!Bring my Lord to me.That his sweet Heart may rest on mine.And I His temple be.Do pray for those I dearly loveAnd those that cause me griefThat Jesus' blood may cleanse all hearts.And suffering souls relieve. That this Sacrifice divineMay mankind sins effaceAnd bring my Jesus blessing homeThe pledge of every grace.
(continues on next page)

5008874/4962902/5082339.title: Local Prayers
5008874/4962902/5082339.text:
(continued from previous page)
I pray to God my soul to keep.And if I die before I wake.I pray to God my soul to take.There is four corners in my bedThere is four angles over my head.Mark, Mathew, Luke, and John.God bless the bed that I lay on."When entering a house say, "God bless the work."



People going to bed at night:-Through this day they had has led me.And I thank thee for thy careThow hast warmed, clothed, & fed me.Listen to my evening prayer.Let my sins be all forgiven.Bless the friends I love so well.Take me when I die to Heaven.Happy there with Thee to dwell.Create in me a clean heart, Oh God.
(continues on next page)

5008874/4962904/5082343.title: Local Prayers
5008874/4962904/5082343.text:
(continued from previous page)
I am a sinner, and nothing at all,And Jesus Christ is all in all.



At the close of day this prayer is heard.Another day is ended and many more to liveAlas! to many ended may God forgive forgive.When lighting a lamp this prayer is said.Light of Heaven on our souls.when a person has the toothache they say this prayer:-As Peter sat on a marble stoneOur Lord came to him and he sat alone.He said, Peter! why dost thou weep and moan?
(continues on next page)

5044800/5039854/5082420.title: Prayers
5044800/5039854/5082420.text: Here I lay my body down to sleep.Here I give my soul to God to keep.And if I die before I wake.I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners round my bed.There are four Angels over head.Matthew, Mark, Luke, and JohnBless the bed that I lie on. If any evil troubles  me.May the Blessed Virgin awaken me.Mary be the flower.Jesus be at my dying hourJesus to watch and Mary to pray. And Jesus to carry my soul away. Jesus meek and Jesus mild.Make me a good obedient child.

5044800/5039866/5082477.title: Prayers to Our Lady
5044800/5039866/5082477.text: Hail! fair Lily of effulgent and ever peaceful TrinityHail! Thou radiant Rose of Heavenly fragranceOf whom the King of Heaven will be born,And with Thy milk to be fed.Feed our souls with Divine infusions.Amen.

5044788/5038262/5082578.text:

5044788/5038307/5082747.title: Urnaithe
5044788/5038307/5082747.text: Offrail na MaidneO' a Iosa ofrailim suas duit as toct croide, Croide ro-glan na Maigdeana Muire agus mar aon lé do cróidhe naomta Fein, mó smaointhigh, focla, gnaomtaí agus buaireadh eile  ar fead an lá indiu.Failte don AingilDia do beatha, A Mhuire ata alan do na greasta. Ta an Tigearna leat is beannuighthe tu thar na mna agus beannuigh toradh do broinn Iosa. A Naom Muire, a mátar de (-) guidhe orainn na peacaide anois agus uar ar mbais. Amen.Urneen TearnaAr an athár ata ar an Neam go naomtar d'ainm go dtigidh do riogacht do thoil ar an talam mar gnidtar a Neam. Ar n-aran laetheamhail duinn ar bfiaca mar maitheamaidh don bhfiache ata(?)  agus na leigh sinn  i gcathu acsaor sinn o olc. Amen.Glory be to the FatherGloir do atar agus don Mach agus don spioriadh naomh Mar a bhí o tus mar a ta anois agus mar a beas lé saogal na saoghal. Amen.Caitlin MaolrioghanRang a sé

5044788/5038309/5082758.title: Paidreacha
5044788/5038309/5082758.text: "Ofrail na Maidne"Gach rúd ar do shonsa a Dhia, gach rúd ar do shon,Ó a Íosa beirim súas duit tré croidhe ró gheanamuidhe na Maighdine Muire agus le rún do croidhe ró naomtha fhein in'uile smaointe, mo bhríathra mo ghníomhartha agus gach abfhuil  indán dom a fhulaingt ar feadh an laé seo, Sé mó mhían cuid a fhághail de gach lóghadh is féidir gnóthughadh indiú.*   *   *Paidreaca roimh agus ina dhiaidh  BéitíBeannuigh sin a Thíghearna agus íad seó do bhronntanas ata muid dul a caitheamh tré Críost ar dTíghearna.Amen.*   *   *Bhéirimuid buideachas duit a Dhia uile cumhactach ar  son do heodlacadh go huile, tusa a mhaireas agus a riagluigheas trí saoghal na saoghail.Amen.

5044802/5039980/5082979.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044802/5039980/5082979.text: '' O my God I offer thee all the thoughts, words, deeds actions and sufferings of this day in union with those of my Saviour Jesus Christ.''Prayer to my guardian angel :- '' O angel of God who art my guardian, and through His holy care I am committed by God. Enlighten, protect, direct and govern me this day and for ever. Amen'' Sacred Heart of Jesus I place any trust in Thee for all and in spite of all.'''' Jesus make me humble of heart and make my heart like unto Thine.'''' Jesus, Mary and Joseph I give you my heart and my soul, Jesus, Mary and Joseph assist me in my last agony, Jesus, Mary and Joseph, may I breathe forth my soul in peace with you.Amen.

5008880/4963212/5082984.title: An Old Irish Prayer Said on Hearing the Bell for Mass
5008880/4963212/5082984.text: An Old Irish Prayer said on hearing the bell for MassOh God move my feet early to mass move my lips to the holy words raise up my thoughts and my mind and banish from me all bad deeds.An Old Prayer in answer to the Gloria after as it was in the beginning etc.We praise Jesus Christ we praise God always O God praise us and take us in your hands for there are no benefits at us but those of Christ's passionPrayer for going over a riverFor fear this river is deep King patience take my hand for fear the flood is strong. Oh, Mary look on me and not forsake me.
5008880/4963212/5082984.school_info: School: Mell, Mell N. School, Drogheda

5044786/5037970/5083118.title: Local Prayers
5044786/5037970/5083118.text:
This is a lot of prayersHere I lay myself down to sleep. I give my soul to god to keep. If anything comes to harm me o blessed Vergin waken me. There are four corners on my bed. There are four Angels overhead. Matt and Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on. Waken now or waken ever I give my soul to God to keep for ever. Lord Jeasus be with me at my dying hour. This prayer is said in bed at night. This prayer is also said in bed at night. While you are saying the prayer you keep your arms in the shape of a cross. I must die. I do not know when, now how, nor where. But if I die in mortal sin, I am lost for ever. Oh my Jesus have mercy on me amen. This prayer is said when going to bed at night. God by the tree, Lady by the flower. Sweet Jesus be with me at my dying hour. This prayer is also said when going to bed at night. I-N-R-I Jesus of Nazareth, king of the Jews have mercy on me and save me
(continues on next page)

5008880/4963238/5083201.title: (no title)
5008880/4963238/5083201.text:
The cuckoo tells us when spring is coming. If she sings on a tree without leaves it is a sign of the end of the world. If you hear her with your right ear you will have good luck during the year but if with the left ear you will have bad luck.If the cuckoo is heard at your back yourself or a near friend will die soon. On hearing the cuckoo you should get some money and throw it from hand to hand so that you will have money throughout the year



Oh Lord move my feet to Holy MassOpen my lips to the blessed wordsRaise up my thoughts and my mindAnd banish all bad thoughts and deeds



King of Patience take my handFor fear the river is deepHoly Mary watch over my feetFor fear the flood is strong.
5008880/4963238/5083201.school_info: School: Mell, Mell N. School, Drogheda

5044790/5038464/5083314.title: Prayers
5044790/5038464/5083314.text: When a person would be going to bed at night you would often hear him saying a little prayer like this, Now I lay me down to sleep, I pray the Lord my soul to keep, If I die before a week I pray thee Lord my soul to take. When a person would be going to eat a meal he would say, Thank God for a bit to eat and able to eat. When people get up in the mornings you would often hear them saying this little prayer, Get up little children the morning is bright and the birds are all singing to welcome the light. When people get up they often say, Thank God for another new day. You would often hear a person saying, May God prosper your work.If a person was going a long journey, people would say I wish you a safe journey or I wish you good luck. There are many other little prayers also which people use at certain times.

5044797/5039302/5083333.title: A Collection of Local Prayers
5044797/5039302/5083333.text:
There were a good many local prayers in olden times but they are nearly all forgotten now. After each decade of the Rosary some people say '' May the most holy names of Jesus, Mary and Joseph be ever praised and glorified.''If the devil is tempting this is a good prayer to say, '' Jesus help me and Joseph pray for me '', or '' My Queen and my Mother remember I am thine own, perserve and defend me thy property and possession.'' 5044808/5040498/5083764.title: Local History
5044808/5040498/5083764.text:
There was a battle fought at the Bloody pass in the year 1842 it was between Munster and Connacht. There was a history written on this battle. At the time of the battle there were treasures hidden at the Bloody Pass. At that time there was a Famine and they people had to go twelve miles for sugar and they only got one lb for each month and they had too go six miles for what tea would do them for twelve months.

5044818/5041457/5084075.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044818/5041457/5084075.text:
The prayers that the people used to say long ago before starting work was. In the name of the father and of the son and of the holy Ghost amen, or in the name of God, or all for thee o Lord o my good Jesus all for thee. These prayers should be said before staring work. I heard two prayers and the first one is. Before the close of the day. Creator to thee I humble pray. Wanting in the mercies sakeMay nothing of my mind excite.May dreams or panting of the nightKeep of my enemy of exso? My body know and clean as snow. To Jesus from a Virgin sprung. To glory give and praises sung. To God the father three and one. This prayer should be said before going to bed at night.
(continues on next page)

My old nurse, Mrs Mary Walshe, used to say her prayers in Irish. When going to bed she used to take up her scapular and say the following:-Pé díon a fuair mise ó Mháthair Criost ní fiu me é fhághail, anois tá mé ag dul  fé'd dhíon agus fe'd bhrat, slanuigheam me fhéin leat in Ainm an Athair agus an Mhic agus an Sproid Naoimh - Amen.When the lamp was lighted she used to say:-"Solus na bhFlaitheis go dtugaidh an Tighearna dár n-anamnacha an Lá Deidheannach".When the potaoes were dug she said:-Beirimid beó ar an am seo aris

5084791/5040884/5084908.text:
Old Prayers26-1-381. There are four corners on my bed, There four angel's wings are spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.2. As I lie down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep. If anything occurs, O Blessed Virgin come and waken me.3. Sweet Jesus keep me from sin, shame and scandal. Keep me from the hands of my enemies both soul and body through Christ Our LordAmen.4. God bless me and make a good child of me. God bless Daddy and Mammy and spare them over me. God bless my brothers and sisters.
