5084791/5040886/5084910.title: Prayer
5084791/5040886/5084910.text: There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels at my headSt. Matthew, Mark, and Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,As I lie on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,If any evils trouble me,I pray to God to waken me,Waken now, waken never,I give my soul to God for ever. I say this prayer when I go to bed at night. An old nurse taught it to me long ago.

5084791/5040887/5084913.title: Prayers
5084791/5040887/5084913.text: 1. Oh my Jesus: I know I have to die but I know not when or how or where, but if I die in mortal sin I shall be lost for ever.O Jesus! have mercy upon me.2. In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ crucified, I lie down to rest. Bless me O Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness through Christ Our Lord Amen. I say these prayers when I go to bed at night.Daddy taught them to me.

5044806/5040338/5084918.title: Prayer
5044806/5040338/5084918.text: PrayerOne day Saint Peter was out fishing on the sea of Galilee.  He suffered so much pain from the toothache that he had to leave from fishing.  As he sitting on a stone by the sea side Our Saviour came to him and asked him what ailed him and Saint Peter said he had the toothache.  Our Saviour cured him. By repeating the following prayer the toothache be cured.Saint Peter sat on a marble stoneOur Saviour came to him all aloneWhat ails you Peter, Our Saviour saidThe toothache was the reply Saint Peter madeArise Saint Peter and follow me and of the toothache you will be curedAll who say this prayer in rememberance of meWill never be troubled by the toothache again.

5084791/5040888/5084919.title: Prayer
5084791/5040888/5084919.text:
There are four corners on my bed;There are four angels overspread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on:Here I lay myself down to sleepWaken now or waken neverIts to God I give my soul to keep for everLord by the branch, lady by the flowerLord Jesus Christ be with me at my dying hourLord Jesus Christ be with me at my confession chairLord Jesus Christ guard me within and guard me withoutAs I am going through yon holy land,I met the Blessed Virgin standing by,Seven mass books in her hand,Seven Priests singing,Seven bells ringing,O Lamb of God" shut the gates of hell,And open the gates of Heaven,And let those poor sinners in,Who say their prayers three times by night and three times by day, That the gates of hell shall never prevail against them,
(continues on next page)

5083770/5039683/5085427.title: Prayers
5083770/5039683/5085427.text: (Irish verse on the little mothers rosary)"Theris [?] the same dear happy circle round the fires cheery blaze,with the little Irish mother telling tales of other days.""She had one sweet Holy, which I never can forget and a gentle Benediction crowns her (mother) memory for it yet"."I can see the little mother still hear her as she pleads.Not its getting on to bedtime, All you children get your beads."There were no steel bound conventions in that old slab dwelling face,Only this - she lined us up each night to say the Rosary."

5083770/5039684/5085435.title: Prayer by an Irish Woman
5083770/5039684/5085435.text: My loving Lord a thousand welcomes. O Son of Mary I love you, indeed I do.Who am I at all, that You should come next or near me. O God of Heaven make a little corner for me in your Heart and never while there is life in me let me lose my place there. Amen. Have pity on me O Blessed Mother, Talk to my God for me. Tell Him I am a poor ignorant creature full of sin and misery but that I love you His own dear Mother, that I am a poor servant and for your sweet sake to help and pity me. Amen.

5044842/5043415/5086407.title: Old Prayers
5044842/5043415/5086407.text:
As I lie down to sleep,I give my soul to God to keepIf I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take.There are four corners on my bed;There are four angels around me spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.The above prayer was recited by many of the old people in this district before going to sleep.Another prayer recited by the old people after going to bed, in this district is as follows:-In the name of Jesus crucified,I lie me down to rest.  Bless me, O Lord.  Defend and govern me, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage, bring me to everlasting happiness.  Amen.Another prayer recited by the old people in this district both in the morning and at night is as

5044836/5042810/5086590.title: Prayer
5044836/5042810/5086590.text: A prayer when you are in bedI leave my body down to sleep.  I give my soul to God to keep and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take and if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever.  O Jesus have mercy on meA prayer before going to sleepI leave my body down to sleep.  I give my soul to God to keep.  If any evil spirit troubles me the Blessed Virgin waken meThere are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels round my spread.  Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.  God bless the bed that I lie onA prayer of old Irish woman After CommunionWelcome sweet Lord JesusA hundred thousands welcomes, may the whole world adore thee

5008881/4963362/5087115.text:
The following is a prayer to be said while taking holy water. Mary Farrell learned it from her grandmother, Mrs. Farrell of Cartown, Ballymakenny:-Sprinkle us O Lord with Thy hyssop (?)Wash us O Lord and we shall be made whiter than snowMrs Farrell also taught this prayer to her grand daughter. It is a night prayerHere I lay me down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepWhether I rise now or neverI give my soul to God for everThere are four corners on my bedThere are four angels round my headMathew, Mark, Luke & John

5044828/5042372/5087609.title: Dyeing of Wool
5044828/5042372/5087609.text:
Long ago people used to dye their own wool, and manufacture it into friezes, and flannon and blankets, and all other woolen materials. The way they used to dye the wool for frieze was first to boil it in alum for one hour by keeping it turned now and again. According to so many lbs of wool then take a half lb of logwood to every two lbs of wool, and an ounce of copperous



This prayer is said going to bed at night.As I go to my bed as I go to my bedBegging of Jesus my soul shall be saved,Break not for heaven and Lord be the flower.And Jesus be with me at my dying hour.There are four corners on my bed.There are four Angels on.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on.Here I lay down my head to sleep.If any evil, wakens me, waken now, waken neverI give my soul to God to keep for ever.

5044849/5044083/5087819.title: Cure against Fever or Ague
5044849/5044083/5087819.text:
The following cure was given me by Patrick Soden Knockanork aged 80 years. He remembers the prayer being given in Irish by a man named Smith to one named Carolan. Carolan knew no Irish & Smith used to repeat in Irish & explain in English.



Prayer.As our saviour came to the place where the Veronia (This may mean Veronica) was to die He shivered & He shook and the Jews asked Him was it through mock was it fever or ague He had. He made answer and said not. Anyone carrying these words about them either in writing or memory shall never be smitten with fever or ague.



Cure of Backache. Only possessed by those born wrong. The patient lies on his back on the floor and the curer walks over the body.

5070734/5058338/5087918.title: Collection of Prayers
5070734/5058338/5087918.text:
The old people had always some special prayer getting up in the morning, going to bed, and lighting the fire. In the morning they said to the Angel of the Lord I am committed to guide me, to govern me from all sin and danger, now and for evermore. Amen.This night as I lie down to rest, I leave my head on Mary's breast.As Jesus done when He was young,Mary's dear beloved Son.This prayer is said at night before getting into bed. The following prayed is also said at night before
(continues on next page)

5044857/5044372/5091267.title: Old Prayers
5044857/5044372/5091267.text:
Long ago the people used to say many prayers which they do not say now. The following is a list of prayers. 1) This night I lie down to sleep I give my soul to God to rest and if I die before I waken I give my soul to God to keep.There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels over-head, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on2) Heart of Jesus I adore.Heart of Mary I implore,in these three hearts I put my trust Jesus, Mary and Joseph I give you my heart. Lord hear my prayer3) I see the new moon and the new moon sees me. God bless the new moon and God bless me. Grace to the kitchen and grace to the hall but God's grace is best of all. 4) As I lie down on my right side,As Jesus did on Mary's knee,
(continues on next page)

5070744/5059012/5092412.title: Prayers
5070744/5059012/5092412.text: PrayersThe following prayer is said at night"God keep the house from roof to floor. The twelve apostles guard the door. Four great Angels round my bed to my feet and to my head Matthew Mark Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on"Another prayer at night is "Here I lie for to sleep my soul I give to God to keep and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take"This prayer is said when a new moon is seen"I see the new moon and the new moon sees me. God bless she new moon and God bless me Grace in the kitchen and grace in the hall, the grace of God be with us all"

II A prayer to be said in the morning.O my God I offer this day Everything I do or say Uniting it with what was doneOn earth by Jesus Christ His Son.
(continues on next page)

Prayer to be said 15 times each day from 1st Dec. to Christmas by those who desire some special favour.Hail and blessed be thou in moment our saviour was born through the most pure Virgin Mary in Bethlehem in peirching cold in this hour O Lord Vouchsafe hear my prayers and grant me this which I desire through the same Christ our Lord. Amen.O most Holy and Immaculate Mother of God and glorious St. Joseph, Guardians and patrons of our house and Union interceed for us your devoted children now and at the hour of our death.

When Jesus was born in BethlehemBaptised at the river JordanThe water being pureThe water being goodWhen Jesus came the water stoodFor Jesus' sake and in this nameI command this blood to do the same. Amen.

5070753/5059846/5092709.title: A Collection of Prayers
5070753/5059846/5092709.text: XVIII) A prayer to be said when going to bed at night.As I went up the holy land, I met the Blessed Virgin, seven mass books in her hand, seven priests singing, seven bells ringing, rise up the lamb of God,Open the gates of Heaven, close the gates of Hell,Sweet Jesus Amen.Anyone that says this prayer seven times by night and day,shall not fear death nor danger,Nor the flags of hell shall not enter on them.XIX) A prayer to be said against diseases.When Jesus came to the cross, He shook three times,and the Jews asked Him had He the fever, ague , or palsey,Whoever has this in words or lines,Shall never have fever, ague, or palsey.

5070753/5059845/5092714.title: (no title)
5070753/5059845/5092714.text:
On Good Friday when the first Jew came in, with the sharp spear in his hand. He struck the Blessed Virgin Mary pitifull Mother standing by with a sore heart and sorrowfull moan. Thoes that say those words three times by day and three days by night shall never die in the state of mortal sin.



Prayers to be said when going to bed.O Mary my mother and my hopeI take refuge under thy mantleThere let me live and dieDeliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing.Heart of Jesus once in agony,Have pity on the dyingHeart of Jesus I adoreHeart of Mary I imploreHeart of Joseph pure and justIn those three hearts I put my trust.

5070753/5059847/5092724.title: A Collection of Prayers
5070753/5059847/5092724.text:
XXIIChrist be with me, Christ before me,Christ behind me, Christ within me,Christ beneath me, Christ above me,Christ at my right, Christ at my left,Christ in the Fort,Christ in the Chariot Seat,Christ in the Poop,Christ in the heart of every man who thinks of me,Christ in the mouth of every man who speaks of me,Christ in every eye that sees me,Christ in every ear that hears me.XXIIIO Father, O Son, O Holy Ghost, O Holy Trinity, O Jesus, O Mary, O All you Angles of God, O All you Saints of Paradise, Men and Woeman, Obtain these requests for me through the presuis Blood of Jesus Christ 1st Ever to do the Holy Will of God. 2nd Ever to live in Union with God.3rd Never to think of any one but God. 4th To love God alone. 5th To do all for God. 6th To seek alone Gods Glory. 7th To Sanctfy myself for God alone. 8th To know well my own utter nothingness. 9th Ever to know more and more the will of my own God. Mary most holy offer to the Eternal Father the most presuis Blood of Jesus Christ for my poor Soul, For the Holy Souls in Purgatory, For the conversion sinners, For the wants of the most holy Church, And for all the World. Amen.
(continues on next page)

However mort of them are overgrown with a thick undergrowth of bushes and briars. The people have an idea that ill-luck will surely
(continues on next page)

5070750/5059611/5093290.title: Old Prayers
5070750/5059611/5093290.text:
A Prayer to be said going to bedOh, Sweetest Jesus I am going to bed now. I do not know whether I shall awake or not, but if I dont, it is in you I trust. If I shall die I ask you to intercede for me. May the Blessed Virgin and all the saints and angels help me to meet my Lord and Saviour and especially my guardian angel. Amen.



Oh, my Jesus I am about to undertake a journey. As I journey, it may happen that I shall meet a sudden death or an accident. I hope if I may die on a journey away from home that I may receive Thee before I die

5094399/5061005/5093434.title: A Collection of Prayers
5094399/5061005/5093434.text:
When beginning any new work people used to say:-In the name of God.When lighting the lamp at nightGod give us the light of Heaven.God the Father bless meJesus Christ defend and keep meThe virtue of the Holy Ghost enlighten and sanctify me this nightAnd keep me from all sin and all evil. AmenSacred Heart of Jesus Mary be my refugeWhen entering a house people used to say"God save all here"People in house answer"God save you kindly"When passing people working in a fieldGod bless the work.When a person is given a drink of milk he says"God bless the cows and the giver"When people see a new moon for the first time, they make the sign of the
(continues on next page)

5070751/5059679/5093605.title: Local Prayers
5070751/5059679/5093605.text:
Local Prayers.1. A Prayer to cure a Toothache.As Christ was walking all aloneHe saw St. peter weeping over a marble stoneWhat ails thou Peter, why does thou weep?My Lord and Saviour the toothache.2. A Prayer to stop a bleeding nose.Jesus was born at BethlehemBaptised at the river Jordan.And when Jesus came the water stoppedAnd in Jesus; name and for Jesus sakeI ask this blood to stop the same.OROur Lord was born in BethlehemBaptised in the river JordanThe water was clear, the water was goof,And when Jesus came the water stood,And by His word, and in His nameI command this blood to do the same.3. Prayer when you see a New Moon.I see the moon and the moon sees me,God bless the Moon and God bless me.
(continues on next page)

5070770/5061021/5093606.title: Old Prayers
5070770/5061021/5093606.text: O Adorable Lord and Savour Jesus ChristDying on the gallows tree save meO holy Cross of Christ ward off from me all weapons of dangerO holy Cross of Christ  ward off from me all that is evilO holy Cross of Christ  protect me from my enemiesO holy Cross of Christ  ward me from all dangerous deaths and give me life always.O Crucified Jesus of Nazareth have mercy on me now and for  evermore.Blessed Mother of God intercede for us poor sinners. Amen

5070770/5061022/5093616.title: Prayers
5070770/5061022/5093616.text: I go to me bed as I go to me grave I hope in the Lord my soul to receive. My soul and my body I give unto thee. O Merciful Jesus have mercy on meAnother Prayer"I lie down on my right side I pray to God to be my guide. If any evil troubles me O Blessed Virgin Mary come and waken me. God is a branch Our Lady is a flower God and his lady to give us a good hour and a good night's rest for Jesus Christ's sake. Amen.

5070752/5059770/5094147.title: Local Prayers
5070752/5059770/5094147.text:
My father Mr. John Galligan, Corlislea, Ballinagh, Co. Cavan told me some old prayers that are said locally and have never been printed. The following are two old prayers which the old people said each night before they went to bed.Lord Jesus Christ, by the sake of Thy sufferings grant me such faith, hope, and charity, and sincere sorrow for my sins, and love of prayer, as will sanctify and save my soul.Lord Jesus Christ, we have recourse to Thee, the immortal and great God of Holiness. Have mercy on us and cleanse us from our sins, and strengthen us by Your divine blood both now and forever. Amen.The following prayer is said for stopping blood.Jesus Christ was born in Bethlehem, baptised in the river Jordan. The water was pure and the water was good and when Jesus came to the water it stood. For Jesus' sake and in Jesus' name I command this blood to do the same.The following prayer is said when a person is suffering from toothache and it is
(continues on next page)

5070768/5060941/5094465.title: A Prayer
5070768/5060941/5094465.text: Oh sweet saviour on this day or on Good Friday you may say the Jews came with their spears so sharp and pierced our saviour through the heart. From heart to hand his blood did flow his Blessed Mother standing by with the pitiful heart and the mournful cry. Not one says this prayer three times by night and three times by day shall ever enter the flames of hell.

5070774/5061725/5095215.title: Prayers
5070774/5061725/5095215.text:
The old Irish were very devout and they had prayers for every work that they started.When they lay in bed at night they said this prayer. There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels over head Mathew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on. And whether I rise now or never I give my soul to God for ever. They had also another prayer to say when going to sleep. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified. I lie down to rest. Bless me O Lord defend and keep me from sin and danger Amen. When the old people saw the new moon they would say this prayer. I see the moon and the moon sees me. God bless the moon
(continues on next page)

Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.Here I lie on my right sideAs Jesus lay on Mary's kneeGod be the branch, Blessed Lady be the flowerJesus be with me at my dying hourAs I went into the house of GodAs Jesus went into the GardenThat I may be as free from sin

It was an old tradition if ever such happened to the well it would flood the country unless stopped in the above way.The title deed of the Headford estate are supposed to be incased in a stone and buried in Lough Ramor.  The present marquis is Taylor descended from one of Cromwell followers. 5096100/5062260/5096486.title: Old Prayers
5096100/5062260/5096486.text:
When my greatgrandfather was alive R.I.P. if anybody in the house was throwing out water at night after washing the dishes or anything, he used to say there were Holy Souls outside the door and so we should repeat this prayer three or four times in Irish. "Thaíre duit, thaíre duit, uisce salaigh."When people used to go into a neighbours house long ago they would say and some people say it yet, "God save all here", and the people in the house would answer,  "God say you kindly".All the old people when they went into a house and anybody churning they would be sure to say, "God Bless the work."



Many people say that Leipreachans are good people. Some of them are and some of them are not. I heard about a very bad one. The place where this occured is in the townland of Carnin, Ballyjamesduff, Co. Cavan and is not very far from where I live and I am always afraid going past the spot.
(continues on next page)

5096100/5062296/5096603.title: Old Houses
5096100/5062296/5096603.text:
(continued from previous page)
settle-bed. There were also bed know as press-beds that could be folded up like a press in the day time and could be made into a bed at night.The floors were just made of clay, and one small pane of glass served as a window. The chimney was of wood and in real olden times the fires were in the middle of the floor with a hole in the roof to serve as a chimney.The light they used was a rush candle. They way they made the candles was interesting. A rush was got and the green was peeled off it, all to a little strip on the side of the rush, then they dipped it in gravy and let it cod as it would not burn hot



Old PrayersWhen the old people would be rising in the morning they would say:- Thanks be to God for the dangers of the night past, and may God guide use safely over the dangers of the coming day. When going on a journey:- May God bring me back safely and May God prosper me on my journey.If they were going along the road and people working in the feild:- May God bless your work, or May the blessing of God prosper your crop.When going into a house:- God save all here

5096100/5062304/5096628.title: Prayers
5096100/5062304/5096628.text:
PrayersThe old people never go into a house or leave it without some blessing When they are leaving a house they say "God remain forever in this abode." When they visit a house they say "Gof bless all here" and the people inside answer "God save you kindly." When some one passes a person milking a cow they generally say "God bless the cow and the work." If a person gets milk in a house they say "God bless the cows and the givers." If a big storm is threatening people say, "From lightening and tempest O Lord deliver."



Old BeliefsThe old people used to have strange superstitions. They believed that it was unlucky to put a first-born baby in a new cradle as it was surmised that something would happen to the child on its sixth birthday. People used to leave an oven of mashed potatoes outside on the threshold on Hallow Eve night to give the fairies a feast. They supposed that the fairies would bring luck to them through out the year. Old people used to tie red strings on the cows' tails so that they would not be overlooked.
(continues on next page)

5096100/5062318/5096666.title: Superstitions
5096100/5062318/5096666.text:
(continued from previous page)
On New Years night if you give money to anybody you will give the luck away with it. It is said that if you go out on Hallow Eve you will see a ghost and if you left a cup of water on the table it would be gone in the morning as the souls in Purgatory would drink



Old Prayers.When people are selling things to anyone they say, "May give you luck." When people are passing anybody working they say. "God bless your work." When getting up in the morning they would say. "Thanks be to God for having saved me from all the dangers of the night and may He save me from the dangers of the coming day."When a person goes into a house he says "Gd save all here," or "May God bless this house When a person is going from your house to his house say, "May God bring you home safe. When you are passing a graveyard say, "May God rest all the poor souls that are buried there." In time of war they say "May God keep away the war.

When you are dressing yourself say - Oh Lord I know I must die I know not when nor where nor why but if I die in mortal sin I am lost  forever. Oh Lord! have mercy on me. As I lie down to sleep, my soul I give to God to take. If any evil happen me Virgin mother waken me. There are four corners on my bed, There are four angels round my spread Matthew, mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I sleep on.Another prayer is - As I got to me bed I go to my grave,

This prayer is said when going to bed -Here I lay me down to sleep,I give my soul to Christ to keep,Waken now, or waken never,I give my soul to Christ for ever.Another prayer is -Thank God for having brought mesave through the dangers of the past day,I beg of God to being me save through the dangers of this night.This prayer is said both in the morning and at night. When it is said in the morning, "the past night" is used instead of, "the past day", and this day is used instead of this night.Another prayer is -O Mary, my mother, and my hope,Under thy mantle I take refuge,There will I live and die,Deliver me from sin, and grant me thy holy blessing. This prayer is usually said when going to bed. Dear Little Jesus help me to be a

"God save you kindly."When we meet people working, we say."God bless the work"When a candle or lamp is lighted, we say."God, give us the light of Heaven."or"Oh, God, show light to the poor souls in Purgatory."When speaking of the dead, we say"Lord, have mercy on him (her)"or "God rest his/her soul."

5070805/5065985/5097191.title: Old Prayers
5070805/5065985/5097191.text:
Old PrayersIn the morningO Lord God almighty who has brought us to the beginning of this day, defend us in the same by thy power, that we may not fall this day into any sin, but that all our thoughts, works and words may be directed to the fulfillment of they will.O God, who hast thought the hearts of the faithful by the light of the Holy spirit, grant that in the same spirit we may be truly wise and may ever rejoice in his consolation.To the Guardian AngelO Angel Guardian to whose care God has entrusted, I pray thee watch over me unceasingly, protect me , visit me, defend me against every attack of the devil, waking and sleeping day and night, every hour and moment be my helper, and everywhere be my companion. AmenPrayer before studyO ineffable creator who out of the treasure of thy wisdom hast ordained three hierarchies of angels and placed them in wonderful order above the
(continues on next page)

5070803/5065662/5097290.title: Old Graveyards
5070803/5065662/5097290.text:
(continued from previous page)
In fact the majority of people living in the townlands surrounding Lisnagirl No. 1 School bury in Moybologue - a graveyard entirely outside the parish and a long journey from here, but their ancestors are all buried there.The five graveyards in the parish are all in use, and contain many crosses, head-stones and tomb stones. The most of these are made of marble, granite or lime stone, but a few are made of wood and iron.One iron cross was made recently by a local blacksmith out of a crow-bar which was used in an old mud cabin in the days of landlordism. This has been erected in Gallow [?] Graveyard

(1) When going to bed at night, the old people say,"I pray to God my soul to save, I go to my bed as I go to my grave". (2) When lighting the lamp at night -"God bless the light and save us from darkness in the next world."(3) When hearing of an accident, they would say."God between us and harm."(4) When they would hear of sick-ness"God break all hard crosses before us."

5070817/5067122/5097637.text:
1 O my Jesus I know I must die. I do not know when, nor where nor how. If I die in mortal sin, I'm lost for ever. O, God be merciful to me a sinner, Grant me a most happy death and kind saint Joseph pray that full of grace and hope and faith, I, too, will pass away. 2 Here I lay me down to sleep to God I give my soul to keep. Lady of the branch, Lord of the flower merciful Jesus help me in my dying hour. 3 O Jesus, Saviour of mankind whose body was nailed to a cross nail my heart to that same cross with the three nails of faith, hope and charity. 4 O Mary my mother and my hope, I take refuge under thy mantle, here will I
(continues on next page)

5070806/5066106/5097831.title: Prayer
5070806/5066106/5097831.text: Before the closing of the day,Creator to thee we humbly pray,That for the wanted mercy sake,We to thee thy protection take,That nothing in our minds excite,Vain dreams and phantoms of the night,Our enemies repress and show,Our bodies no uncleanliness know,In this most gracious Father hear,Through Christ the son our prayers,Who with the Holy Ghost and Thee,Doth reign eternally,Visit this habitation we beseech,And drive away all the snares of our enemiesAmen

5070823/5067639/5098273.title: Prayers
5070823/5067639/5098273.text: As I go to my bed,As I go to my grave,I pray to the Lord,My soul to receive.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round my head,Matthew, mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.

5070823/5067640/5098275.title: Old Prayers
5070823/5067640/5098275.text: Jesus receive my soul,Holy Mary be a mother to me, May the Blessed Virgin Mary and all the saintsPray for me to our Lord, Amen.O my Lord Jesus, Thou  hast held me by the right hand. And by Thy Will Thou hast conducted me. And with glory Thou hast assumed me for ever in heaven, Amen.

5070823/5067641/5098276.title: Old Prayers
5070823/5067641/5098276.text: My soul is in the sight of God, and it will never leave it. I went to bed last night and I waken with the Will of God, and God stays with me night and day and never will He stray from me, As I get up this morning I pray to God to save me until tonight. May the Blessed Virgin Mary save me night and day.

5070823/5067642/5098285.title: Old Prayer
5070823/5067642/5098285.text: The Will of God be done by us,The law of God be kept by us,Our evil wits controlled by us, Repentance timely made by us,Christ's passion understood by us,All sinful deeds be shunned by us,Our last end pondered by us,And the Blessed found by us,With angels' music heard by usAnd God's high praises sung by usFor ever and ever. Amen.

5070822/5067450/5098317.title: Old Prayers
5070822/5067450/5098317.text:
Prayer said on going to bed :-"I lay my body down to sleep, I beg of God my soul to keep, And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take".Prayer while dressing in the morning,"O my God clothe my soul with a nuptial robe of charity, and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before Thy judgement Seat". Prayer for a child going to sleep :-Infant Jesus, meek and mild, Look on me a little child, Pity my simplicity Suffer me to come to Thee,Heart of Jesus I adore Thee, Heart of Mary I implore Thee, Heart of Joseph pure and just, In these three hearts I put my trust".
(continues on next page)

5070822/5067453/5098324.text:

5070826/5068003/5098365.title: Prayer by an Old Irish Woman
5070826/5068003/5098365.text: Prayer of an Old Irish Woman My loving Lord ‘ A Thousand Welcomes’  & Son of Mary. I love you indeed I do. Who am I at all that you should come next or near me. O God in Heaven make a little corner for me in your heart, and never while there is life in me let me lose my place there, and after death may I still hide there. Amen Have pity on me, O Blessed Mother. Talk to my God for me. Tell Him, I am a poor ignorant creature, full of sin and misery, but that I love you His own dear Mother, that I am a poor servant , and for your sake to help and pity me. Amen. As I lie on my bed to sleepI give my soul to God to keep. There are four corners on my bedFour angels at my head. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John. God Bless the bed that I lie on.

5070826/5068004/5098366.title: Morning Offering
5070826/5068004/5098366.text: Morning Offering O my God. I offer Thee this day.All I shall do, think or say. Uniting it with what was done, On earth, with Jesus Christ His only son.I make these offerings for those soulsWhom Lord’s own mother would releaseThat she may place them by her son,In  everlasting rest and peace. O Mary bless Thy child today And guide me on my heavenly waySt Joseph Pray for me Very Revd Luke Carroll PP Mullagh,  wrote it down for my mother about the year 1880,  when he was a curate in Shercock,  and told her to teach it to the school children.

The Lord sits on the Lady's knee,To let no spirits waken me,When I am asleep I cannot see,Sweet Jesus and the Blessed Trinity waken me, Sleep never, sleep never, To God I give my heart forever.



A night PrayerMay the will of God be done by usMay the death of the Saints be won by usAnd the light of the Kingdom begun in usMay Jesus the Child, be beside my bedMay the Lamb of Mercy uplift my headMay the Virgin Mary be brightness shedAnd Michael be steward of my soul. Amen.

5070810/5066456/5098505.title: Religious Stories
5070810/5066456/5098505.text:
There was once a woman who in order to obtain a favour vowed to hear a great number of masses in the year.  She put a small stone in a box every day to keep an account of the masses.  At the end of the year she opened the box and to her great surprise she had only one stone in the box.  She went to the priest and told.  [?] he asked her was she in the habit of talking in the church during mass and she said she was.  So he told her she only heard mass once without talking during the year.



Incline O Lord, Thine ear to our prayers in which we humbly beseech Thy mercy that Thou wouldst place the soul of Thy servant which Thou hast caused to depart from this world into the reign of peace and light and unite in the fellowship of Thy saints, through Christ Our Lord. AmenFor a woman deceasedWe beseech Thee O Lord and in Thy mercy to have pity on the soul of Thy hand
(continues on next page)

5070826/5068142/5098709.text: Prayer as Clock Strikes 'Jesus, this hour I give to thee,For all the past, oh pardon me.I know that I must soon depart, Then hide me in Thy Sacred Heart'

5070839/5069160/5098812.title: Prayers
5070839/5069160/5098812.text: Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews preserve me from a sudden and unprovided death. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ Crucified I lay myself down to rest. Bless me O Lord. Defend and govern me this night, and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to Life Everlasting Amen. This prayer is said before going to sleep. When rising I say I rise from this bed of sleep, to adore my God, and to labour for the salvation of souls. O may I rise with Thee on the Last Day to Life Everlasting Happiness Amen.

IIOne Good - Friday after noon,A Jew came in with a sharp spear in his hand,He pierced our Saviour's body throughThe blood flew from heart to hand, His Virgin Mother standing byWith a wearied heart and troubled mindWho ever shall say this prayer three times by night, three times by day,Shall never die in sinAnd the flames of Hell shall never enter them. 5070841/5069416/5099425.title: A Collection of Prayers
5070841/5069416/5099425.text:
As I lay down my head to sleep,I give my sole to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angles round this spread,One to watch and one to pray,And two to carry my soul away,St. Matt and Mark, St Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lay on.If any evil troubles me.The bells of heaven wakens meAs I go to my bed I go to my grave.I pray to the Lord my soul
(continues on next page)

5070841/5069420/5099428.title: A Collection of Prayers
5070841/5069420/5099428.text:
1  Oh my loving Jesus I give thee my heart,And I consecrate myself holy to theeOn account of the grateful love I bear theeAs a reparation for all envy I bear theeUnfaithful to grace, and, I purpose with thineNever to sin again. II Hail and blessed by the hour and momentOn which the Son of God was bornAnd of the pure Virgin Mary at BethlehemIn that cold and piercing, in that hour,Vouchafe O Almighty God to hear my prayers,And grant me my petition
(continues on next page)

5009139/4990508/5099791.title: An Old Man's Prayer
5009139/4990508/5099791.text: There was once an old man named Jimmy Hobicin he was over 80 years of age who died in 1937. He lived near Lanesboro in the townland of Clonfower. He was very religious. He used to say the rosary every night and when the rosary was finished he said this prayer after it-   "God almighty and the Blessed Virgin Mary may give me manes and ways to meet my calls- to bring Biddy and Minnie safe home from America - to save Micheal and make him a good boy to save the ass and the goats and make the hens lay and to give me favourable day to put in my little crop.

5070856/5070629/5100004.title: Prayers
5070856/5070629/5100004.text: To be said going to bed:IWhen I go to my bed I go to my grave,I give up my soul to Christ to receive,And if there be any danger to comeOh, sweet Jesus save me.IIO Lord preserve me from the greatest of all evils, a sudden or an unprovided death, and may Thou O Gracious Saviour meet with a meek and merciful Countenance at the moment of my departure out of this world.III O Holy Mary, my dear Mother, by the love you bear to Almighty God, I ask your help now and at all times especially at the hour of my death. Never leave me till you see me safe in heaven praising you and singing your mercies for ever, Amen."Taught by my mother, R.I.P."

5009143/4991166/5100316.title: Local Prayers
5009143/4991166/5100316.text: Here I lie upon my side,I hope for God to be my guide,if any evil tempts me,O blessed Virgin waken me.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels on my spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.If I should die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to takeLord by the Branch,Lady by the FlowerO sweet Jesus be with me upon  my dying hourHeart of Jesus I adore Thee, Heart of Mary I implore Thee; Heart of Joseph true and just, In those Three Hearts I put my trust.

5009149/4991895/5100349.title: Prayers
5009149/4991895/5100349.text: "The Cross of Christ about us." At this same time that these words were said, the sign of the cross was made with the back of the thumb on the forehead on the lips and on the heart.  When going on a journey the prayer is "God be with you" or God give you luck."  On donning new choihi[?] the weaver is greeted with-"God give you, your health to wear them"   Friends meeting greet each other-"God morning and good luck."   On entering a house the greeting is-"God save all here."   If one gets milk from a neighbour the thanks is a prayer."God bless the cows."

5009137/4990219/5100643.title: Old Prayers
5009137/4990219/5100643.text: On Good Friday the Jews came in and pierced our Blessed Saviour through the heart. From heart to hand his precious blood did flow. His Blessed Mother was standing by with a heavy sigh and a dismal cry. Those who say this prayer three times by day and three times by night the pains of hell shall never enter in. Heart of Jesus meek and mildLook on me a little childPity me, Pity mine and suffer me to come to thine. Heart of Jesus I adore thee, Heart of Mary I implore thee, Heart of Joseph pure and just. In these three hearts I put my trust.

5009137/4990327/5100835.title: Old Prayers
5009137/4990327/5100835.text:
When going to bed this is a prayer that is said.  Here I lay down myself to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep. If any danger troubles me Blessed Virgin waken me. There are four corners on my bed. There are four Angels over head, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on. Lord be the branch. Lady be the flower. Lord be with me at my dying hour. Heart of Jesus I adore thee. Heart of Mary I implore thee. Heart of Joseph true and just. In these three hearts I place my trust. I.N.R. I Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews save me from a sudden or unprovided death, during this night
(continues on next page)

The Blessed Lady awaken meThere are four carriers on my bed Four angels may be am them spread St Matthew, St Mark, St Luke and St John. God bless the bed that I be on. If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to takeThis prayer is to be said at myJesus be the leafMany be the flowerjesus be at my bed at my last dying houseThis prayer is to be said both morning
(continues on next page)

5100842/4991314/5101036.text:
The following prayers were told by Mrs GibbonsClonflowerLanesboro Co LongfordA prayer awaking in the morningO my God, my only good the author of my being and my last and, I give Thee my heart praise honour and glory be to Thee for ever and ever AmenRising upIn the name of the father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost. AmenI will raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore My
(continues on next page)

5070786/5063389/5101163.title: Old Graveyards
5070786/5063389/5101163.text:
(continued from previous page)
[-]



This is a prayer to be said every morning.I thank thee O Heavenly Father for keeping me safe through the night, and for all thy mercies. Bless me this day, and make me obedient, thruthful, and pure. Fill me full of love and teach me to grow like unto the Lord Jesus Christ. Bless my dear father, mother, brothers, and sister, and bring us all at last to our home in heaven. Through our Lord Jesus Christ Amen.
(continues on next page)

5009138/4990431/5101240.title: Old Prayers - On Retiring to Rest
5009138/4990431/5101240.text:
As I lie down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide;If any evil come to me,Oh Blessed Lady, waken me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels over headMathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeThrough Jesus Christ, Our Lord, Amen.



Oh my Lord Jesus, wherever I be,My heart and my soul are given to Thee,In honour of Thy five wounds,When nailed on the Tree,Oh my Lord Jesus, have mercy on me.
(continues on next page)

5009138/4990431/5101245.title: Old Prayers - On Retiring to Rest
5009138/4990431/5101245.text:
As I lie down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide;If any evil come to me,Oh Blessed Lady, waken me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels over headMathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeThrough Jesus Christ, Our Lord, Amen.



Oh my Lord Jesus, wherever I be,My heart and my soul are given to Thee,In honour of Thy five wounds,When nailed on the Tree,Oh my Lord Jesus, have mercy on me.

5009141/4990762/5101507.title: A Prayer
5009141/4990762/5101507.text: As I laid down my head to sleep,I gave my soul to God to keep,If any evil thing comes over me,Our Blessed Lady waken me,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead.Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless me on the bed that I lie on,Lord be the branch, Lady be the flower,And the Lord Jesus be with me now and at my dying hour.

5009150/4991994/5102991.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009150/4991994/5102991.text:
The prayers I know and which I have not learned in school or from a book are The Lords Prayers The Hail Mary  The Apostles Creed the the Confiteor and the Act of Contrition  A prayer when awakening in the morning is Angel of God my guardian dear to whom His love commits me here and every day be at my side to light and guard to rule and guide A prayer when dressing yourself Oh my God cloth my soul with the nuptial robe of charity that I may wear it pure and undefield before the Judgement Seat  A prayer when starting work  All for thee A
(continues on next page)

5009150/4992060/5103233.title: Collection of Prayers
5009150/4992060/5103233.text:
Collecting of prayers in this area is very rare. However there is one rather effective prayer from the Catholic stand point which to the writers own knowledge has on a few occasions proved very useful. It has to do with a hemorrhage or severe out flow of blood and can only be offered up in extreme cases or when every other method of stopping the blood has failed on another occasion a young girl of twenty years contracted a septic throat. She was attended by the local Doctor who treated her most attendively for about a week. At the end of that time she suddenly took a violent
(continues on next page)

5103353/4992678/5103756.title: Prayers - Old Prayers
5103353/4992678/5103756.text:
IAs I lie down upon my right side to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep,Wither I rise now or never,I give my soul to God for everThere are four corners upon my bedThere are four angels overhead,St. Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.Amen IIAs I went over the fields,I met the Blessed Virgin,Seven reading books in her hand, Seven chapels openSeven priests saying Mass,Seven bells ringing,I met the Lord, and asked him this:- To shut the gates of hell,and open the gates of heaven.Anyone who says this prayer lying down shall never lose the sight of heaven.
(continues on next page)

5009142/4990979/5103839.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009142/4990979/5103839.text:
Most Holy Mother of God be my safeguard in all temptations and dangers, comfort me in all my trials and afflictions, watch over my father and  Mother and all in their care. Be with me always, O Mary, my Mother, now and especially at the hour of my death(This prayer is said at Morning Prayers.)In honour of the Five Bleeding Wounds nailed to a tree, O mericful Jesus have pity on me. (Said at any time, and especially before falling to sleep.)I adore thee O Holy Cross, which has been adorned with the Tender and Loving Hands and Feet of my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ and imbued and dyed with his Most Precious Blood. I adore Thee, O Holy God, nailed to the Cross for the love of me, again I adore thee, O Holy Cross for the love of my Lord and Saviour
(continues on next page)
5009142/4990979/5103839.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Baile Mathúna

5009171/4994138/5104051.title: Prayers
5009171/4994138/5104051.text: The very first joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of one, it was the joy of her dear son when he first became a man. Blessed now is he and blessed now is she and those who sing her seven joys of the Blessed Lady.    The very next day our Blessed Lady got was the joy of two it was the joy of her dear son when he first began to do. Blessed etc.      The very next joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of three. it was the joy of her dear son when he raised the Trinity. Blessed.  The very next joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of four it was the joy of her dear son when he read the Bible o'er. Blessed etc.    The very next joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of five, it was the joy of her dear son when he raised the dead to life. Blessed etc.   The very next joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of six it was the joy of her dear son when he raised the Crucifixion. Blessed etc.   The very next joy our Blessed Lady got was the joy of seven, it was the joy of her dear son when he rang the bells of heaven.Blessed etc.

5009182/4995197/5104133.title: A Prayer
5009182/4995197/5104133.text:
I heard this old prayer from James Reilly Derrycasson, Dring, Granard. aged 77 years.It was said when going to bed. "Here I lay me head to sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf any evil spirit comes to trouble me,Blessed Virgin Mary waken me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels they bespreadMatthew, Mark, Luke, & JohnGod bless the bed that I lie  on.Lord be my branch"Lady be my flower"Jesus be with me now & at my dying hour.As I walked out on the Holy LandI met the Blessed Virgin with Three Mass-books in her handThere were seven priests singing,Seven bells ringingShut the Gates of Hill,Open the Gate of Heaven
(continues on next page)

5009175/4994506/5104143.title: Collection of Special Prayers
5009175/4994506/5104143.text:
To be said when about to sleepAs I lay down my head to sleep I give my soul to God to keep and if I die before I wake I give my soul to God to take. There are four corners on my bed there are four angels o'er my head. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lay on.Morning OfferingO' eternal Father I offer thee the most precious blood of Jesus Christ and satisfaction for my sins and for the wants of the Holy Catholic Church.Cure to stop bleedingJesus was born in Bethlehem,And baptised in the river Jordan.The water was pure and the water was goodAnd when Jesus came the water stood.Any by his word and holy name,I command this blood to do the same.
(continues on next page)

5009179/4994793/5104273.title: Local Prayers
5009179/4994793/5104273.text:
Prayer to stop Bleeding.Jesus of Nazareth was born in GalileeHe came to the Jordan baptised to beThe water was clear andthe day was goodAnd when Jesus came the water stood.And by his word andin his name I commandthis blood to do the same.This prayer is in commonuse and even a Protestantwill send for a Catholicwho has the prayer to sayit for him when needed.I lay my body down tosleep I pray to God mysoul to keep and ifI die before I wake Ipray to God my soulto take and if an evilspirit comes to me may
(continues on next page)

5009179/4994795/5104275.title: Local Prayers
5009179/4994795/5104275.text:
(continued from previous page)
never fear death, danger, or the burning pains of hell.



O Mary my Queen and my mother I give myself to thee to show my devotion to thee.  I consecrate to thee my eyes, my mouth, my heart, my whole being without reserve. Therefore good Mother as I am thine keep me, guard me, as thy property and property.Dear Angel take me to thy care beneath thy snowy wings. Defend me from the evil one and whisper Holy things.Jesus meek and Jesus mild pity me a little child,Jesus take my heart and bless it that nothing evil may possess it.

5009173/4994268/5104464.title: Local Prayers
5009173/4994268/5104464.text:
The following is a lost of the local prayers.This prayer is said when going to bed.E'er on my bed my limbs I lay.God grant me grace my prayers to say, If I die before I wake,I pray the Lord my soul to take.Another prayer said when going to bed.I lay my head upon this bed to sleep,I give to God my soul to keepIf any danger happens meI hope the almighty God will waken me.There are four corners on my bedThe are four Angels at my headMatthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on
(continues on next page)

5009158/4992912/5104720.title: Folklore - Old Prayers
5009158/4992912/5104720.text: I knew a few prayers to be said at different times When you are going to bed at night say.O my God keep me from harm this night and may I wake safe this morning. When a person looses something they say: O my God help me to find that I have lost or Saint Antony  help me to find what I have lost.When you are going to bed at night say  As I lie on my right side I pray to God to give me guideIf any evil tempts me, O Blessed  Savour wake me. There are four corners on my bed. There are four Blessed Angels over- spread. O Saints Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John. God give me rest on this I lie on. If I die before I wake I give my soul to God to take. May the Lord be the branch and may the Lady be the flower. O Sweet Jesus may you be with me at my dying hour.

5009184/4995597/5104768.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009184/4995597/5104768.text:
129A Collection of Prayers13th June, 1938.    When people are going to a fair they say the following prayer:-    "Mary Jesus Son of God bring me safe to this fair".When in temptation people say:-     "Dear Mary help me now". When going to sleep people say:-    "Mary Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews preserve me from a sudden, and an unprepared death".
(continues on next page)

5009206/4997517/5104979.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009206/4997517/5104979.text:
The prayers I learned at home are:-Thank God for loyal friends of oursWho guard us every day,When joys depart, when sorrows come, When hope seems far away. When close to every path we walkAre clouds of black despairSure all the saints of Ireland,A shining band, are there.They march with every faithful soulIn gladness and in woe,They watch above our exiled onesWhere 'er on earth they go;O, when we thread the road of deathAt ending of the day,May all the Saints of IrelandBe with us on the way. A prayer said when going on a journey.A night prayer. May the Will of God be done by us!May the death of the Saints be won by us!And the light of the Kingdom begun in us"May Jesus, the child, be beside my bed,May the Lord of Mercy uplift my head;May the Virgin her brightness shed,
(continues on next page)

5009183/4995462/5105133.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009183/4995462/5105133.text:
328A Collection of Prayers.21st June, 1938.   This prayer is said when you see the new moon    "I see the new moon and the new moon sees me. "Gold bless the new moon, God bless me. Grace in the hall. Grace in the kitchen, and the Grace of God be among us all."    This prayer is said
(continues on next page)

5009197/4996791/5105990.title: Prayers
5009197/4996791/5105990.text:
When raking the fire at night."I save this fire as our good King Christ saves all. May in each house, Brigid in the centre and all the angels in the City of Grace, protect and keep the folk in this house till morning."From the first of December to Xmas Eve the following said fifteen times each day will never fail. Hail, blessed be the hour and moment, in which the Son of God was born of the Most Pure Virgin Mary in piercing cold in a stable in Bethlehem. In this hour vouchsafe oh my God to hear my prayer and grant my petition through the merits of Christ and of His hold and Blessed Mother and through the intercession of the Glorious St Joseph. Amen. When rising out of bed in the morning.Give me eyes oh God to seeThe things kind people do for me.Give me God a heart to rejoiceTo hear a homely loving voiceSave me from hurting those I loveLet my appreciation rise aboveLet me also my God be glad for those who are so sweetTo make the spam of life complete.Waken my heart Dear Lord and let gratitude lie thereThat I may give in turn the tenderness for which those people yearn
(continues on next page)

5009213/4998493/5106200.title: Prayers
5009213/4998493/5106200.text: If you were delayed at night or coming home on a dark night and very much afraid it is right to say this prayer."A message from God before me,The court of heaven above me,The holy oil over my body,God before me and in me." A prayer to be said when going to bed" In the name of God,I will get into this bed,I will lie on my right side,And offer myself up to God,And I will sleep on my left side,And four posts under my bed,And four Angles watching over me

5009213/4998495/5106212.title: Prayers
5009213/4998495/5106212.text:
There are a few short prayers which I know: "Holy Queen of Charity pray for me that I may never die in mortal sin Amen." This is said when you you are going on a journey in case you might die suddenly in mortal sin."Gentle Jesus meek and mild look at me a little child Never know when you grow Infant Jesus meek and mild". "Holy Queen of heaven pray to God for me heart of Jesus I adore thee heart of Mary I implore thee heart of Jesus pure and Just and in those three hearts I put my trust. Thanks be to God for bringing me safe over the danger of the day and bring me safe over the danger of the nightGod bless father and Mother
(continues on next page)

5009191/4996114/5106213.title: Proverbs
5009191/4996114/5106213.text:
(continued from previous page)
516be a long time about giving it.



516A collection of prayers    The prayers I leart at home are the morning offering, the recitation of the Rosary, the prayer for the dying, the prayer for a happy death, a prayer to my Guardian Angel, and a prayer to obtain grace never to die in mortal sin.    The prayer I say when I awake in the morning is I thank God for bringing me safe over the dangers of the night and giving me the light of another day.    When getting out of bed I say my morning offering.    When going a journey I put holy water on myself and ask God to bring me home safe.    When kindling the fire I say that God may give me the light of heaven.     When going into the church I take off my cap and take
(continues on next page)

5009192/4996159/5106282.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009192/4996159/5106282.text:
557A Collection of Prayers    This is a local prayer for the stopping of blood:-    Our Lord was born at Bethlehem. Baptised in the river Jordan. The water was good and the water was pure and the water stood when Jesus came. By his word and by his name I command this blood to do the same.     The following prayer is a prayer said to protect the home from all evils :-     O blessed Virgin Mary conceived without sin. I choose thee this day to be the Lady and mistress of our home. I pray thee in the name of the most Blessed Virgin Mary to protect us from fire and lightning, tempest and thieves, consumption, cholera, influenza, diphtheria, scarlatina, and malaria. Bless, protect every
(continues on next page)

5008912/4966315/5106377.title: Old Prayers
5008912/4966315/5106377.text: Old prayersCollected from Mrs Joe Moore Harristown whose mother learned it from some religious old Irishwoman (name unknown), who composed it.After Communiion.My loving Lord, a thousand welcomes.O Son of Mary.  I love you, indeed I do.  Who am I at all that you should come next or near me.O God of Heaven make a little corner for me in Your Heart and never while there is life in me let me lose my place there and after death may I still hide there.Amen.To the Virgin Mary.Have pity on me O Blessed Mother.Talk to my God for me.  Tell Him I am a poor ignorant creature full of sin and misery but that I love you His own dear Mother, that I am a poor servant and for your sweet sake to help and pity me.Amen.

5009213/4998539/5106566.title: Prayers
5009213/4998539/5106566.text: (1) O Angle dear keep me never under your snow white wing keep me from all evil things and teach me Holy things.(2) Blessed Virgin Mary keep me under your blue choke and diliver me from all danger this day Amen.(3) My guardian Angle dear. Watch oer me this day keep me from sin and temptations of the devil.

5009181/4995066/5106725.title: Old Prayers
5009181/4995066/5106725.text:
Here I lay me down to sleepI pray to God my Soul to keepAnd if I chance to die before I wakeI pray to God my Soul to takeThere are four angels on my bedThere are four angels o're my SpreadAnd Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod blessed the bed that they lay onHeart of Jesus I adoreHeart of Mary I imploreHeart of Joseph pure and justAnd in these three Hearts I put my trust.I offer a Pater and Ave in honour of the Great God and His Blessed Mother and to all the angels and Saints to Save us from Sickness and disorder of the year from a Sudden and improvided death and from the hands of our enemies both Soul and body.Infant Jesus meek and mildLook on me a little childPity mine and pity meAnd suffer me to come to Thee.
(continues on next page)

5009198/4996910/5106762.title: Old Prayers
5009198/4996910/5106762.text:
The following prayer is taught to children at an early age and handed down from father to son:-"As I lay down my head to sleep,To God I leave my soul to keep,If any evil comes to me,God give me my eyes to see,My hands to help me,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless me on the bed the I lie on,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels o'er my head,And if I die before I 'wakeAlmighty God my soul may take."When a person dies around here they say "God be good to his soul" "God be good to him" "God rest him" "May he see the light and glory of heaven".On bidding good bye they say "God be with you" On beginning all work they say "In the name of God".The following story is told in connection with the Rosary. It happened eighty years ago. I heard it from my father Patrick Gray. A man named Garry Murtha lived in a hut on Crott Hill.
(continues on next page)

5070850/5070224/5107122.title: A Collection of Prayers
5070850/5070224/5107122.text:
A prayer said when rising in the morning - I arise from this bed of sleep to adore my God to labour for the salvation of my soul. O may I arise on the last day to live everlasting. A prayer said when dressing - Oh My God clothe my soul with the nuptial robe of Charity that I may carry it pure and undefiled before the judgement seat of Christ. A prayer said when beginning work - All for thee O lord Oh my Jesus all for thee. A prayer said when going to rest -
(continues on next page)

5008908/4965942/5107134.title: (no title)
5008908/4965942/5107134.text:
When the priest was collecting pennies at mass one day, he said to a man - "What is Matrimony? "Hell upon earth for some Me Lord", the man answered. This happened in Walterstown Chapel.



When going out in the morning you say :- "God bless all I'll meet today." When you meet anyone you say - "God spare you your health." When workmen come into dinner they say :- "God save all here." When lying down in bed you say "The Lord go between us and hell." At any time you say - "Thanks be to God we lived so long and did so little harm."



The children used to get a round piece of paper and put green ribbon on a cross-shape on it. The spaces between would be covered with bunches of ribbon. Girls wore these crosses in front and boys wore them on the shoulder. Some boys used to paint their crosses instead of putting ribbons on them.

5009208/4997618/5107153.title: Old Prayers
5009208/4997618/5107153.text: To be said in bed.Here I lay down my head to sleep to give my soul to God to keep if any evil injures me I hope the Blessed Virgin will awaken me.There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels over spread. St Mathew, St Mark, St Luke and St John God bless me on this bed I lie on. Lord by the branch. Lady be the flower Lord have mercy on me in my last hours. If I die before I awake I hope that God my soul will take.     Jesus guard me within and Jesus guard me without and the twelve apostles guard me round about.   Merciful Jesus have on me my soul and my. Who five bleeding wounds was nailed to a tree. O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.    Infant Jesus meek and mild pity me a little child pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee. Heart of Jesus I adore thee. Heart of Mary I implore thee. Heart of St Joseph pure and just. In those three hearts I place my trust.

5009208/4997619/5107157.title: Old Prayers
5009208/4997619/5107157.text: To be said going to bed.As I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,and if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.To be said going to bed.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels on them spread,One to watch and one to pray,and two to bear my soul away.

5009208/4997620/5107158.title: Old Prayers
5009208/4997620/5107158.text: St Matthew, St Mark, St Luke, and St John bless the bed I lie on, and if I chance to die before I wake I trust in God my soul to take. Lord be the branch, Lady be the flower, heavenly Jesus be with me on my dying hour. Jesus meek and mild look on me a little child pity me and pity mine and suffer me to come to thee. Most Sacred Heart of Jesus I implore the graces to love thee daily more and more. Sweet Heart of Mary be my salvation. O Mary conceived without sin pray for us who have recourse to thee. Jesus my Master my Lord and my King crown me with glory and save me from sin.

5009208/4997621/5107162.title: Old Prayers
5009208/4997621/5107162.text: Infant Jesus meek and mild look on me a little childPity mine pity me suffer me to come to theeHeart of Jesus I  adore thee heart of Mary I implore theeHeart of Joseph pure and just in those three hearts I place my  trust.After CommunionOh my loving Lord a thousand welcomes,Oh son of Mary I love you indeed I do.Who am I that you should come next or near me,Oh God of Heaven make a little corner in your heart.And never while there is life in me let me loose my place there. After my death may I still hide there.AmenHave pity on me  oh Blessed Mother, talk to my God for meTell him I am a poor ignorant creature, Full of nothing but sin and misery.But as I love you his own dear Mother, That I am a poor servant,And for your sweet sake to help and pity me.Amen

5008950/4969763/5107217.title: Prayers
5008950/4969763/5107217.text:
There are certain prayers said in the mornings, as, "I rise from this bed of sleep may I keep away from sin during the day". When a person is starting a journey,  he says, "may I arrive there safe and may Jesus be with me returning". When people are eating the new potatoes they say, "Thank God we have an abundance of potatoes this year and may we have the same next year". There are certain prayers said going to bed such as, "There are four corners on my bed there are four angels round it spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, God bless
(continues on next page)

5008950/4969764/5107220.title: Prayers
5008950/4969764/5107220.text:
(continued from previous page)
this bed that I lay on, and if I die before I wake its God I'll give my soul to take"This prayer is also said going to bed, "as I go to my bed as I go to my grave begging of Jesus to be my guide may the bright Queen of Heaven be my guide at that hour and may Jesus be with me at my last hour.



When a person goes to bed at night he can say the following prayer before he goes to sleep. "As I lay down my head to sleep I give my soul to God to
(continues on next page)

5008950/4969765/5107221.title: Prayers
5008950/4969765/5107221.text:
(continued from previous page)
keep. If any evil comes to me, O my Jesus waken me. There are four corners on my bed, there are four Angels over head., Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lay on."People say the following prayer when going to bed in case they might die during the night: "I know I must die but I do not know when, how, or where. If I die in mortal sin I am-lost for ever. O my Jesus have mercy on me."



When a person goes to bed every night he can say this prayer: "Oh my God I lay me down to rest, bless me oh Lord defend
(continues on next page)

5008921/4966724/5107374.title: Animal Calls
5008921/4966724/5107374.text:
(continued from previous page)
Animals born at whit are wicked and it is very hard to mind them.



When you are putting out the light at night you should say "God grant us the light of heaven when you awake in the morning say God grant us the light of day.



My Granny has a churn. It is tall and wide at the bottom and it is narrower at the top.The butter is made twice every week on Mondays and Thursdays. My Granny does the churning and if anyone comes in during the churning time they give help. They are supposed to be unlucky if they don't.The churning is done by hand and the churn-dash is always moved upwards and downwards. It takes a half-an-hour to churn. When it is churned the butter is taken up with a wooden platter and put into a basin and rinsed with cold water and salt put in. Then it is taken out and shaped into rolls, which is either kept
(continues on next page)

5008909/4966032/5107994.title: The Care of the Feet
5008909/4966032/5107994.text:
(continued from previous page)
foot in summer every year.  The boots are made in the cities and some are made locally.  Clogs were made locally also.  There was a tan-yard in Rathfeigh long ago for making leather.  Kid boots were worn long ago and elastic boots and moreover boots and crome boots also.  There are no shoe-makers in the parish now.  Clogs were nearly always worn long ago.  In olden times people wore canvas shoes in summer as they were light for the hot weather.  They made those shoes themselves.



The following prayer was found in the grave of our Lord Jesus Christ in the year of our Lord 1003 by Emperor Charles as he was going to battle for safety.  Whosoever shall repeat this prayer every day or hear it read or keep it about them shall never die of sudden death nor be drowned
(continues on next page)

5008909/4966034/5107995.title: Prayers
5008909/4966034/5107995.text:
(continued from previous page)
Oh Crusified Jesus of Nazarath have mercy on me now and forever more Amen.  In honour of our Lord Jesus Christ and in honour of His Sacred Passion and in honour of His glorious resurrection and God like assension to which He liked to bring me the right way to heaven.  True as Jesus Christ was born on Christmas Day.  True as Jesus Christ died to save sinners so the honour of Jesus Christ keep me from my enemies visible and invisible now and forever more. Amen.Oh Lord Jesus Christ have mercy  on me.   Mary and Joseph pray for me, through Nicodimas who took our Lord down from the cross.   Oh Lord Jesus Christ through thy suffering on the cross, this soul was flittering out of the world.  Give me peace that I may carry my cross and keep me from suffering that without complaining and keep me from all dangerous deaths now and forever more.Amen



Altughadh roimh BiadhRáth Ríogh a rinne an roinnAr ár gcuid agus ar ár bproinn
(continues on next page)

5008909/4966039/5108019.title: May Eve Customs
5008909/4966039/5108019.text:
It is thought right and proper that the threshold should be swept clean on May Eve, and then it should be sprinkled with ashes.  In the morning a foot-print is looked for and if it is found and turned inwards a marriage is sure to take place before the year is out, and if turned outwards a death will take place before the end of the year.People singe the cattles' backs with a straw and a bunch of primroses is tied to the cow's tail because no evil spirit can touch anything guarded by those flowers, if plucked before sunrise.The rowan tree is the best preservation from evil.  If it be woven into the roof, the house is supposed to be saved from the evil spirits for at least twelve months.



O God of charity without limit, and of mercy without measure it was Thy love induced Thee to come to me, I give Thee my body as a
(continues on next page)

5008924/4966938/5108474.title: A Collection of Prayers
5008924/4966938/5108474.text:
1. Going to bedI lay myself down to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,If any danger comes to me,Blessed Lady waken me,Whether I waken now or never,Lord Jesus Christ keep my soul forever.2. Going to bedThere are four corners round my bed,There are four angels overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.3. Going to bedMother of the flower,
(continues on next page)

5008959/4970971/5108805.title: Prayers
5008959/4970971/5108805.text:
1. Said when going on a journey or undertaking a work.Now in the name of God.2. Said when we hear of people die.The Lord have mercy on the dead.3. Said when we hear a person meets with an accident.May God save us from all dangers.4. Said when we pass a person who is working.God bless the work.5. When entering a house say.God save all here.6. Jesus meek, and Jesus mild,Pity me a little child.7. Said when a lamp is lit.The light of heaven to our souls when we die.



8. When lying down to sleep.Here I leave my head down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,Whether I waken, now or ever,To God I give my soul for ever.Many evils come over me,Blessed Mother waken me,
(continues on next page)

5008925/4967070/5108906.title: Old Prayers
5008925/4967070/5108906.text: Old Prayers13th June 1938The blessing of God Almighty, Father, Son & Holy Ghost descend upon us now & remain with us forever."God be with you" is said when you are leaving a house. "God save all" is said when you are entering a house."God bless the work" is said when you are passing where anybody is working.Maureen WalkerParish - CooleTownland - GallowCo. Meath God break hard fortune before every creatures rearing " (children) (very old prayer)God mark you with His Holy Grace." (A blessing)God raise a friend for you. (said to a person in trouble)

5008937/4968307/5109255.title: Old Prayers
5008937/4968307/5109255.text:
Written byPauline ReillyClondaleeHill of DownCo. Meath.Told byMrs. ReillyClondaleeHill of DownCo. MeathOld PrayersWhen you awake.O My God my only good, author of my being and my last end, I offer you my whole heart and soul.Praise honour glory be to Thee for ever and ever Amen.
(continues on next page)

5008937/4968312/5109258.title: Old Prayers
5008937/4968312/5109258.text: Additional Material Copied from the End Cover of the Notebook.Old Prayers - told by Mrs. Keoghan, Ballyadams:Down I lay my head to rest;I pray to God to be my guide;But if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners in this bedAnd four bright angels round my head;Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lay on.A prayer for a Toothache:As St. Peter sat on a marble stone,Who came up but Christ alone,Saying: "What ails thee, Peter?And what makes thee ache?""My Lord, I am bad with a toothache.""Arise then, Peter, be thou healed, Not you alone but all thoseWho say these few lines for my sakeShall never be troubled with a toothache."A Prayer said when there is lightning:The cross is my certain salvationThe cross that I always adoreThe cross and my Lord be with meNow and forever more. A Prayer said when Going to Bed:Little Jesus, meek and mild,Look on me, Thy little child.

5008964/4971445/5109414.title: Old Prayers
5008964/4971445/5109414.text:
1.Here I Iay downMyself to sleepI give my soulTo God to keepIf I dieBefore I wakeI pray to GodMy soul to take.I learned this prayer from my grand-mother Mrs. Devine of Boyerstown. It is said going to bed at night.



2.A Naomh Mhuire a mháthair dé guidh orainn ar feadh an lae, anois agus ar nair ár mbáis. Amen.This prayer is said when rising in the morning.



3.Heart of Jesus I implore theeHeart of Mary I adore theeHeart of Joseph true and justIn these three hearts I place my trust.I learned this prayer from my mother. It is said when a storm is coming.
(continues on next page)

5008964/4971446/5109435.title: Old Prayers
5008964/4971446/5109435.text:
(continued from previous page)
[-]



Oh teach me LordWhat I should beTo please God who is good to meTo please my parentsAnd to doWhats good and rightAnd what what's trueFor always God delights to seeGood little children such as weWhose hearts like angles heartsAre full of peace and full of loveLittle children should say this prayer every dayThe cross is tallAnd I so smallTo reach His handOr touch His feetBut on the sandHis footprints I have foundAnd I shall kiss them thrice
(continues on next page)

5008946/4969352/5109449.title: A Collection of Prayers
5008946/4969352/5109449.text:
O Lord Jesus I implore thee to take this cause in hands and grant us good success.



Said when getting out of bed:-I rise from this bedFor love of thee,Who did'st die on the crossFor love of me.Said when starting work:-I will do this in the name of GodSaid when going on a journeyBless yourself saying "In the name of the father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost, Amen."Said when going to bedI must die, I know not when nor where nor how but if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever.""O Sweet Jesus Have mercy on me."

5008946/4969352/5109450.title: A Collection of Prayers
5008946/4969352/5109450.text:
O Lord Jesus I implore thee to take this cause in hands and grant us good success.



Said when getting out of bed:-I rise from this bedFor love of thee,Who did'st die on the crossFor love of me.Said when starting work:-I will do this in the name of GodSaid when going on a journeyBless yourself saying "In the name of the father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost, Amen."Said when going to bedI must die, I know not when nor where nor how but if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever.""O Sweet Jesus Have mercy on me."

This prayer is to be said during Holy week.



1 Here I lay myself down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf any evil spirit touches me Oh Blessed Virgin Mary waken me. Put four corners on my bed four Angels over head. St Mathew St Mark Luke and John God bless this bed that I lie on for ever more amen.This prayer is said when going to sleep. I got it from my mother who learned it from her mother.2 Fold your arms in the form of a cross and say to yourselfI must die I do not know how nor the or where But if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever. Oh Jesus have mercy on me.This prayer is also said when

Generally people when they are lighting a lamp or a candle they say "The light of heaven to us all."Another prayer I know is -"I lay my body down to sleep,I pray to God my soul to keep,And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take."Here is another prayer I heard:-There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over spread,

Dear Mary I am but a child who kneels before thy throne. O guard my mother all the night and when  the sun dont rise. Sweet Mary keep me all the day beneath they watchful eyes.That I lay on my ned tp sleepI give my soul to God to keepIf any evil comes to meO Blessed Virgin  waken meThere are four corners on my bedEvery corner an angel spreadSaint Mathew mark, Saint Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lay onIf I die before I wakeO pray to God my soul to takeYes Lord I ask that this one day be given to thee and thineBe loveth granted every hour be reached the heart divineLet not my foolish love of prayer or work from prayers for theeO good Jesus from pride from self from sin let this one day be free

5110227/4969730/5110833.title: A Collection of Prayers
5110227/4969730/5110833.text:
There are plenty of prayers known locally which were never printed. These are some of them."There are four corners on this bed,There are four angles overhead,St Matt, St Mark, St Luke, St John,God bless this bed that I lay on.And If I die before I wake,I pray to the Lord Jesus my soul to take.""Infant Jesus meek and mild,Look on me a little child,Pity mine and pity me,Suffer me to come to thee.Heart of Jesus I adore thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,Heart of Joseph pure and just,In these three hearts I place my thrust.""O most merciful Jesus have mercy on me,My soul and my body I resign unto thee,Five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree,O most merciful Jesus have mercy on me."
(continues on next page)

5110227/4969732/5110836.title: A Collection of Prayers
5110227/4969732/5110836.text:
As I lie down this night to sleep.I give my soul to God to keep.If any evil happen me Ó blessed Mary waken men.This prayer should be said going to bed at night.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angles round my headOne at head and one at feet.And two to keep my soul a sleep.This should be going to bed,Jesus meek and Jesus mild,Pity me a little child.Take me by the heart and bless it.So that nothing evil may porsess it.This prayer should be said during the day.
(continues on next page)

5110227/4969733/5110837.title: A Collection of Prayers

(continued from previous page)
I have a loving Savour.And He is goopd and mild,He loves me very dearly.And I am His loving child,He lies above in Heaven, while I am here below,And when He calls me to HimThere I shall gladly go.



Those are prayers I was learned at homeJesus meek and Jesus mild,Pity me a little child,Jesus take my heart and bless it,That nothing evil may possess it,This prayer is said night and morning.Dear Jesus, clothe me with the
