4921941/5053545/5110845.title: Old Graveyards
4921941/5053545/5110845.text:
(continued from previous page)
Tradition claims, two or three bishops to be buried there, and that those bishops were buried there in the Penal Days. It is said that they were hunted out of their own diocese. Unbaptized chuildren were buried in the "Cillin" There is a priest buried in a fort in Turraree. This fort is in Roger O'Sullivan's land.Unbaptized children are buried in Clounlehard and in other place near Ballyhahill. The one in Clounleharde is called "Ana-gorp" and the one near Ballyhahill is called "Kileen". People get buried in other graveyards outside the parish graveyard.
(continues on next page)



Collection of PrayersThe old people had many small prayers. They said them when going to bed, when they awakened in the morning, and when going to work. This is a prayer they said when going to bed."In this bed I lay on to sleepTo God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I wake,To the Blessed Virgin I give my soul to take,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lay on,There are four corners in my bed.
(continues on next page)

5008955/4970530/5110979.title: A Child's Prayer - Lying Down to Sleep
5008955/4970530/5110979.text:
November 23rd, 1938.Here I lay myself down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide,Jesus within, and Jesus withoutTwelve apostles round about.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels overspread -Blessed Matthew Mark Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lie on.If any evil spirit comes to waken me,O Blessed Virgin Mary keep and save meHere I lay myself down to sleepI give my soul to the Almighty God to keep.And if I die before I wakeI pray that God my soul will take.Awake my soul ! aggrieved with sinRepent hard heart ! to bleed begin
(continues on next page)

5008955/4970532/5110981.title: A Child's Evening Prayer
5008955/4970532/5110981.text: April 29th, 1938Ere on my bed my limbs I layGod help me well my prayers to say O God! preserve my mother dearIn strength and health for many a year.2.And O! preserve my father, too,And may I pay him reverence dueAnd may I best thoughts employTo be my parents' hope and joy3.And O ! preserve my brothers bothFrom evil doings and from slothAnd may we always love each other bothIVAnd still O Lord to me impartAn innocent and grateful heartThat after my best sleep I mayAwake to Thy Eternal DayAmen

5008968/4971851/5111229.title: A Tree Story
5008968/4971851/5111229.text:
There is a  tree opposite Ned Stone's house and at one time a priest was hiding in it. When the Cromwellian soldiers found him they asked him "had he any temporal or spiritual powers from Rome" and he said he had. They told him to show them. He went to this tree and struck his foot in it and the mark is there ever since.



Aingeal Dé fé mo cheannDia Chríost ar mo chorpDia romhaim agus liomAgus flaitheas Dé lá déanach.
5008968/4971851/5111229.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Ceannanus Mór

At night-:Virtue we beseeth thee O Lord.For this house and family.Drive far, all snares of the enemy.Let all the holy angels dwell-herein,To preserve us in peace.



The old people had many lovely prayers and here are some of them.May Christ and His saints stand between is and harm. Mary and her son.St. Patrick with his staffMartin with his mantleBridget with her veil.Michael with his shieldAnd God over all with His strong right hand. They used to say this on the morning. O Moon! leave us well as thou has found us. They used to say this prayer when they saw the new moon first.The people used to say this prayer every evening against the plaque. O Star of Heaven" beloved of the Lord, drive away the foul constellation that has slain the people with the
(continues on next page)

Amen.A Blessing.I aged old woman of the grey locks! may eight hundred blessings twelve times over be on thee.Mayest thou be free from desolution, O woman of the aged frame! And may many tears fall on thy grave.



1. May God and the Blessed Virgin Mary be in your road. Long ago this little prayer was said when anyone was going on a journey. 2. When you are getting into bed you should say this little prayer.God bless this house from thatch to floor,The twelve Apostles guard the door, And four goo angels o'r my bed,Two at the foot and two at the head.3. Jesus, Mary and Joseph, ye three are awake, take care of me.

When the old people were going to bed they used to say.As I go to my bed,As I go to my grave,Begging of God my soul to resave. (receive).



Long ago, the old people used to say a lot of prayers of their own while they were on a journey going to bed, getting up in the morning, while lighting the fire, and other times of the day.When they were going for a walk they used to bless themselves and say "God save me from all

5008968/4971859/5111305.text:

harm this day. When they were going on a journey they used to say "God grant me a safe journey" and they used to say a little aspirations such as, Jesus, Mary and Joseph protect me from all harm. When they were lighting the fire they used to say also, "God and His Holy Mother save me from the fires of hell", and keep me always good and holy. They used to say too, that when the lamp was put out "May I see the light of Heaven."When anyone went into another person's house they used to say, "God save all here" or when they came to a field where they were men making hay, they used to say "God bless the work." There was another prayer said, too, at bed time. "May God have mercy on the sails that are gone, on those who are going now, and on those who have yet to go. Amen.

5008980/4973317/5111321.title: Old Prayers
5008980/4973317/5111321.text:
I lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepIf any evil spirit come to trouble meMay the Blessed Virgin Mary come and wake me.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over it spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.I lie on my bed as I lie on my graveBegging of Jesus my soul to receiveMay the bright star of heaven be my guardian flowerAnd may it be with me at my dying hourJesus son of the living GodHis blessed body nail to the crossNail my heart to that same crossWith these three nails Faith Hope and Charity.Amen.
(continues on next page)

5008968/4971860/5111421.title: Prayers
5008968/4971860/5111421.text:
(continued from previous page)
Good - night my Jesus, Jesus dear, the day is over, and now I leave my labour light, and before I sleep my slumber come to say sweet Good-Night, so Good-Night once more my Jesus, grant no matter where I be, all my day thoughts and night-dreams be for Thee, and only Thee. Amen.They used to say the following prayer getting up in the morning.Here is my heart, Lord, let it be.But a fountain sealed to all but Thee,What is there I would not do,My Lord and Saviour for love of You.Here is a prayer to the Holy Angel.By God appointed by him to be my Guardian, I give thee thanks for all the benefits Thou hast ever bestowed on me. Blessed be the hour in which thou wert assigned to me for my Guardian. Blessed be all thy love for me and all thy care for me. Amen.



Good night my Jesus, Jesus dear, the day is over, and now I leave my labour light, and before I sleep my slumber come to saysweet Good-Night, so Good-Night once more my Jesus, grant no matter where I be, all my day thoughts and night-dreams be for Thee, and only Thee.  Amen.They used to say the following prayer getting up in the morning.Here is my heart, Lord let it be.But a fountain sealed to all but Thee,What is there I would not do,My Lord and Saviour for love of You.Here is a prayer to the Holy Angel.By God appointed by him to be my Guardian, I give thee thanks for all the benefits Thou hast ever bestowed on me.  Blessed be the hour in which thou wert assigned to me for my Guardian.  Blessed be all thy love for me and all thy care for me.  Amen.  Christina Heary.  13 years. February 17th 1938.Prayer.I lie down with God and may God lie down with me the two hands of Mary round about me,

55The cross of the nine white angels from the top of my head to the sole of my feet.May I not lie down with evil and may evil not lie down with me.This prayer was said at night.Now I sign the blessed token,Fold my arms upon my breast,Jesus said the last word spoken,Now I gently sink to rest,This prayer was said going to bed.Mary Marmion: 13 years.February 9th 1938.Prayers.Jesus are you coming?Jesus are you there?With my little head bent low?This is my wee prayer.Jesus Lord I love you.I am listening too.For thy little voice is calling,Little Lord I love thee too.You are welcome dear Jesus?You are welcome to me?To heal my poor soul,

May God have mercy on the souls that are gone, on those who are going now, and on those who have yet to go. Amen.This prayer was said going to bed.Are you asleep Blessed Mother? Or the King of heaven? I was dreaming of your Son that your enemy was coming. That dream was true, Blessed Mother. Whoever repeats those words in memory of me shall never suffer the pains of hell.

5008968/4971863/5111431.title: Prayers
5008968/4971863/5111431.text: The old people had to learn all their prayers by heart for books were very scarce. When they would arise in the morning they would say:- O Guardian angel I thank thee for another day, and that I got safely through the night. When they would be getting out of bed they would say "I thank, Thee, Lord that I am able to rise.When they would have said the rosary, at night they would say, O my God I thank thee for all the gifts which I have received from Thee and particulary those off this day.When they would be getting into bed they would say:- O Guardian angel" keep evil away and protect me from a sudden death, this night. When they would awake in the morning they would say:- O God who has caused us to reach another day save us to day by Thy power.
5008968/4971863/5111431.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Ceannanus Mór

5008968/4971864/5111436.title: Prayers
5008968/4971864/5111436.text:
Prayer to the Blessed Virgin.Blessed Virgin, shelter me under thy blue cloak of protection from shame, blame and scandal, from the snares and powers of  the devil. If there is a cross before me may the great God cross it. Amen.When the clock strikes this prayer should be said.Jesus this hour I give to thee, For all that has passed O pardon me. I know that I may soon depart. So hide me in your Sacred Heart. Jesus by the branch.Mary by the flower. Jesus, Mary, Joseph be with me. At my last dying hour. Amen.



If the old people were passing by a place where anyone was working they would say "God bless the work and strengthen the health".
(continues on next page)
5008968/4971864/5111436.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Ceannanus Mór

An old PrayerAs I looked over the Holy Land,I saw the Blessed Virgin Mary coming,Seven Mass Books in her hand,Seven bells ringing,Seven candles lighting,Shut the gates of Hell,Open the gates of Heaven,And let my poor soul in,For evermore. Amen.On taking holy water:-Uisge na grásta is gile ná an sneachta,Go nglanaidh sé m'anam agus mo chorp.ÁmenÍosaFor a departed soul:-Ar dheis Dé go raibh a h-anam.

5008978/4972979/5111578.title: A Prayer
5008978/4972979/5111578.text: There is an old prayer for stopping blood in my district. If a person is bleeding and he says the words of this prayer the blood would stop.Christ our saviour was born in Bethlehem and Baptized in the river Jordan. The waters were wide and the waters were rude. God spoke these words and the waters stood and so shall the blood in the name of the Father and of the son and of the Holy Ghost Amen.

5008978/4972980/5111592.title: A Prayer
5008978/4972980/5111592.text: Here i lay me down to sleep. To God give my soul to keep if any evil comes to me. That god may waken me. And if I die before I wake. To god I give my soul to keep. There are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels at my head. Mathew Mark Luke and John. God bless this bed that I lie on.

5008986/4974156/5111756.title: Signs of the Weather
5008986/4974156/5111756.text:
(continued from previous page)
When hills or mountains seem near it is the sign of rain.



As soon as you wake make the sign of the cross sayingGlory be to father who had created me.Glory be to the son who had redeemed me.Glory be to the Holy Ghost who had sanctified me.Blessed be the holy and undivided Thrinity now and for ever. Amen.On rising from your bed say-In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. I arise.May he bless me preserve me, and bring me to everlasting life Amen.Getting into bed say =In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I lay down to rest may he bless, govern, and preserve me, and bring me to everlasting life.When the clock strikes, say =This hour O Lord I give to thee for all the past O pardon me for I know my sou must soon depart them hide me in thy sacred heart.
(continues on next page)

5008986/4974165/5111803.text:

When a person goes into a wake he puts his hand on the dead persons head.



You say this prayer when you are going to bed at night.As I lay my head to sleep I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake.I hope my soul the Lord will take.There are four corners on my bed, and four angels over spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on?"As I went out on the blessed land, I met the Blessed Virgin Mary with seven Mass books in her hand.Seven bells ringing, seven priests singing rise up Lamb of God and shut the gates of hell.And open the gates of heaven before any of the Jew's piece [?] Saviour from heart to hand,His Blessed Mother being standing by With a downful heart
(continues on next page)

5008986/4974168/5111811.title: Prayers
5008986/4974168/5111811.text: You say this prayer when you are going to bad at night"As I lay down my head to sleep I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake I hope my soal the Lord will take."There are four corners on my bed, and four angels over spread Matthew, Mark Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on""As I went out on the blessed land I met the Blessed Virgin Mary with seven Mass books in her hand.Seven bells ringing, seven priests singing rise up Lamb of God and shut the gates of hellAnd open the gates of heaven before any of the Jew's piece our Savior from heart to hand.His Blessed Mother being stand by with a downful heart and a mournful cry.Those that say these prayers both night and morning will never see the gates of hell or ever die in mortal sin"

5008986/4974179/5111841.title: My Home District
5008986/4974179/5111841.text:
Newtown, Newtown Moynalty Lower Meath,Eleven families and forty people.Reilly is the most common name. Most of the houses are slated. There are two people over seventy, James Mc Gillie and Maria Farrell. The houses were more numerous in former times. They dont know any Irish. They cannot tell stories. One house is in ruins it belonged to Dan Farrell. The town-land is not mentioned in any song that I know. There are no hills in Newtown. There is no boggy land in it at all. It is very good land for tillage and grazing. There is no river in it. There are no lakes in it. There are two streams in Newtown There are no stories connected with them.



O angel of God my guardian dearTo whom His love commits me hereEver this day be at my sideTo light and guard,To rule and guide. Amen.
(continues on next page)

5008986/4974194/5111879.title: Birds
5008986/4974194/5111879.text:
Birds.Seagulls on land is a sign of a storm on sea.Crows gathered in trees is a sign of good weather.If the swallows are flying low it is a sign of rain. If they fly high it is a sign of good weather.If a robin is on the low branch of a bush it is a sign that there is going to be snow.



Oh! most Sacred Heart of Jesus I place all my trust in Thee.O adore Thee O Sacred Host living banquet of the Angels.
(continues on next page)

5008986/4974213/5111933.text:
(continued from previous page)
If you break a mirror you will have seven years bad luck.



Oh holy saint Jude Apostle of mytrs. Great in virtues rich in miracles near kinsman of Jesus Christ. Faithful intercesson of all those who invoke thy special patronage to whom I have recoursed of the death of my heart we will pray."Gentle Jesus meek and mil Pity me a little child
(continues on next page)

5008988/4974444/5112090.title: Signs of the Weather
5008988/4974444/5112090.text:
If you see a rainbow its the sign of rain.If your chimney smokes it's a sign of rain.If soot falls it's a sign of rain.



Long ago the people had several ways for praying especially the old people. Here is one they used to say when there teeth pained them.1) Peter sat on a marbly stone,Jesus came and he alone.
(continues on next page)

5008988/4974447/5112091.title: Prayers
5008988/4974447/5112091.text:
1) Gentle Jesus meek and mild,Look down on me your little child.2) Oh sacred Heart of Jesus I place all my trust in thee.3) My good angel guard me,Mary, my dear Mother, watch over me.4) Jesus meek and humble of heart make my heart like into Thine.5) My Jesus, I hope in thee.Have mercy on me. I love theeforgive me my sins.6) Should Jesus bear his cross alone and let the world go free.No there is a cross for eveyone,And ther's a cross for me.
(continues on next page)

5008986/4974241/5112171.text:
(continued from previous page)
"Eye aye a-dd-o ,, etc."The bone wants to be ateNow there is in the centre the farmer and his wife and child, nurse, dog and bone. They leave the centre and another child follows in their place.



As I lay down my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep.If I ever waken now or ever.I give my soul to God for ever.Mat and Mark Luke and JohnMay bless the bed that I lay on.There are four corners on by bedThere are four angles round me spread.If I any evil thing shall disturb me in my sleep. Look down on me sweet Jesus now and the hour of my death. Amen.
(continues on next page)

5008988/4974456/5112321.title: Old Superstitions
5008988/4974456/5112321.text:
If you spill salt it is a sign you will be cryingWhen making a grave, if it slips in its unluckyIf you spill sugar its a sign you will be laughing.If a fire falls its a sign of some one coming in.



1) Father we thank thee for the night and for the pleasant morning light. For rest and food and loving care and all that makes the world so fair.
(continues on next page)

5008988/4974475/5112366.title: The Names of Fields
5008988/4974475/5112366.text:
(continued from previous page)
The Well Field.The Lawn Field.The House Field.The black water Field.The Crocan Bán Field.The padock Field.The Forth Field.The Twelve Acres Field.The Bull FieldThe Pigeon FieldThe Blastic FieldThe Crocken Field.



Eternal Father, I offer thee the most presious blood of Jesus Christ in satisfaction for my sins and for the wants of
(continues on next page)

5008988/4974525/5112593.title: Prayers
5008988/4974525/5112593.text:
Oh! most Sacred Heart of Jesus I place all my trust in thee.I adore Thee O Sacred Host living banquet of the Angels.Let us imitate them who being under the eyes of God did ever for His sake atone.Oh my God my only Good, the Author of my being and my last end I give thee my heart. Praise honor and glory be to Thee for ever and ever. AmenAngel of God, my guardian dear.To whom His love commits here.Ever this day be at my side.To light and guard to rule and guideAmen.Oh! holy mother pierce me through.In my heart each word renew,Of my Saviour crucified.
(continues on next page)

4921942/5053664/5112689.title: Collection of Prayers
4921942/5053664/5112689.text:
When people awake in the morning they say, "Thank God for another day". When a man is starting work he generally says, "It is time to start work in God's Name". When people are going on a journey the farewell they get is, "God speed you and a safe journey to you."When a person lights a lamp he say's, "The light of heaven to you".When a person quenches a lamp he say's, "May the light of heaven never leave our souls."When a person goes into a house he say's, "God bless all here."When a person sneezes he say's, "God bless us."When a person sees a bad wound he say's, "God save the mark".When a person sees a lamb or new potatoes for the first time they say, "Thank God for sparing us another year,"At wakes when snuff is
(continues on next page)

5008991/4974790/5112721.title: Local Prayers
5008991/4974790/5112721.text:
As I go to my bed as I go to my grave,I pray to the Lord my soul to save,Lady of the branch and Lord of the flower,Sweet Jesus be with me now and at my dying hour.IIAs I lay my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,If any evil Spirit comes to me,O! blessed Virgin Mary waken me.IIIAs I cut the cross of Christ upon my breast.I turn my face to Jesus Christ,O! Jesus and his Holy name,Keep me from shame, blame and scandal.IIIIAs I was walking over the Holy Land.I met the Blessed Virgin Mary coming,Seven Mass Books in her hands,Seven Priests a singing,
(continues on next page)

5008982/4973696/5112806.title: Prayers
5008982/4973696/5112806.text:
IAs I lay down my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.



IIO Jesus, dear, before I rest,I thank thee, and I pray,that thou wouldst take away my sins,Committed through the day.I believe, I hope in Thee alone,I love Thee, with my heart, Bless Thou my body, soul and friends.My Lord, my God, thou art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin dear,Saint Joseph, guardian blest.My Angel and my patron Saint.Care for me while I rest.



III Prayer for a toothacheAs Peter sat on a marble stone,Jesus came to him all alone,Peter, Peter, why dost then ache,My dearest Lord, it is a toothache.Then rise up Peter and come with me.
(continues on next page)

5008982/4973696/5112809.title: Prayers
5008982/4973696/5112809.text:
IAs I lay down my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.



IIO Jesus, dear, before I rest,I thank thee, and I pray,that thou wouldst take away my sins,Committed through the day.I believe, I hope in Thee alone,I love Thee, with my heart, Bless Thou my body, soul and friends.My Lord, my God, thou art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin dear,Saint Joseph, guardian blest.My Angel and my patron Saint.Care for me while I rest.



III Prayer for a toothacheAs Peter sat on a marble stone,Jesus came to him all alone,Peter, Peter, why dost then ache,My dearest Lord, it is a toothache.Then rise up Peter and come with me.

IAs I lay down my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.



IIO Jesus, dear, before I rest,I thank thee, and I pray,that thou wouldst take away my sins,Committed through the day.I believe, I hope in Thee alone,I love Thee, with my heart, Bless Thou my body, soul and friends.My Lord, my God, thou art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin art.O Mary, Mother, Virgin dear,Saint Joseph, guardian blest.My Angel and my patron Saint.Care for me while I rest.



III Prayer for a toothacheAs Peter sat on a marble stone,Jesus came to him all alone,Peter, Peter, why dost then ache,My dearest Lord, it is a toothache.Then rise up Peter and come with me.
(continues on next page)

5008982/4973697/5112815.title: Prayers
5008982/4973697/5112815.text:
(continued from previous page)
And you shall never be troubled by a toothache again.And whoever shall keep these words, and writings in remembrance of me, and believe in them,never shall be troubled by a toothache again.



IVSix days we toil for earthly bread,The seventh our souls with prayer are fed,Then let this day to God be given.Let's raise our souls from earth to heaven.In time from God we received our birth,All living things in this flowery earth,The spangled sky, the moon and sun,He spoke the word and all was done.Angels, Godlike, a numerous throng,From his unbounded goodness sprung.Man's body from the clay he formed,Which He with Godlike soul adornedPoor man thy vicious will control,And strive to save the precious soul.What comfort's in this present state,If heaven be not thy future seat.The God who made thee for himself,Despises all worldly pomp and pelf.The chief concern through life should be.To gain the bliss prepared for theeBe then thy duty, then thy joy.
(continues on next page)

5008982/4973698/5112819.title: Prayers
5008982/4973698/5112819.text:
(continued from previous page)
Be this on earth thy sweet employ.To love, adore, to praise and sing,All heaven and earth, Almighty King.Thrice holy Lord, and persons three,O may our glory ever be,To sing thy praise, to bless thy willAnd all thy sacred laws fulfill.Amen.



VMerciful Jesus, have mercy on me.The Five Bleeding Wounds, I give unto thee,The cross where our Saviour was nailed on the tree,O Merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.



VIInfant Jesus, meek and mild,Pity me a little child,Pity mine, and pity me,And suffer me to come to thee.Heart of Jesus, I adore thee,Heart of Mary, I implore thee,Heart of Joseph, pure and just,In these three Hearts I place my trust.My the most holy names of Jesus, Mary & Josephbe ever praised and glorified

5008982/4973698/5112821.title: Prayers

(continued from previous page)

VMerciful Jesus, have mercy on me.The Five Bleeding Wounds, I give unto thee,The cross where our Saviour was nailed on the tree,O Merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.

5009000/4975519/5113278.title: Prayers
5009000/4975519/5113278.text: Prayer to the Blessed Virgin:BLessed Virgin Mary intercede for the Souls in Purgatory at the throne of thy dear Son Jesus. Prayer to my Angel Guardian"Oh Angel of God my guardian dear.To whom God's love commits me here,Ever this {night  day) be at my sideTo light, to guard, to rule and guide. Amen

5009009/4976660/5113562.title: Prayers
5009009/4976660/5113562.text:
At twelve on Good - FridayThe Jews did come,With their spears so sharp,And they pierced the Saviouralthough the heartFrom heart to hand theblood did flow,Our Blessed Lady standing by,With a sorrowful heart and a mournful cry.Anyone who says this prayerThree times by nightThree times by dayThey never shall be cut off by a sudden death.And the gates of hell they never shall see.
(continues on next page)

5009004/4975871/5113594.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009004/4975871/5113594.text: Good Friday, before noon those wicked Jews pierced Our Lord and Saviour through the heart and hands. The blood came down on our Blessed Lady by. With heavy heart and mournful cry. Those who will say this prayer five times in the day and five times in the night will not die in mortal sin and the gates of Hell will not enter in.I go to my bed as I go to my grave begging of God my soul to save, Jesus the leaf and Mary the flower, Mary and Jesus be with me for now and ever more. To be said when going to bed.As I lay down my head to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, God within me God without me God in Heaven and all about me. There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels o'er my head saying Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed I now lie on.Jesus is my guardianMary is my flowerTell God to make my bedFor my dying hour.

5009004/4975877/5113610.title: Hidden Treasures
5009004/4975877/5113610.text:
(continued from previous page)
are supposed to sacred vessels which were buried there by a priest who was fleeing from Cromwell's solders in the Penal days. This moat is not far from a ruined chapel to which the sacred vessels were supposed to belong and the remains of the ruins are still to be seen in the field of Gernonstown near Slane Co. Meath. So that ends the story of this peculiar moat.



When going to bed at night was said."I lay me down with God,May he rest here alsoHis guarding arms about me head,His cross my limbs below.Where would'st thou lay thee down?Twixt Mary and her sonBrigid and her bright manle (?)Colomb and his (?) handle,At morning whre would thou rise?With Patrick to the skies."

5009004/4975880/5113622.title: Local Happenings
5009004/4975880/5113622.text:
(continued from previous page)
They found the poor fellow in the river Boyne with his thumb in his button hole the way he used to always walk. It was thought that the poor fellow fell asleep and walked into the river Boyne and was drowned.



Jesus meek and Jesus mildLook on me as a little child,Pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee,Heart of Jesus I adore, Heart of Mary I implore theeHeart

5008989/4974607/5113665.title: Old Prayers
5008989/4974607/5113665.text:
The old people in this district had lovely ancient prayers.Here is a prayer which my mother taught to me when I was young:Here I lie down to sleepI give my soul to God to keep.Any evil come to meBlessed Lady waken me.There are four corners around my bedThere are four angels round me spread,Mathew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.Open the gates of Heaven,Shut the gates of Hell.Let this poor soul inAnd go to rest in peace. Amen.This prayer is to be said at night. As I lie on my bed to sleepI give my soul to God to keepWaken now, or waken never
(continues on next page)

5008989/4974612/5113685.title: Local Prayers
5008989/4974612/5113685.text:
When waking in the morning I offer up this prayer:Thanks be to thee for bring me safe over the night.It is always the custom when starting work to bless yourself.When going on a journey I usally say:In the name of God I'll start out;and I say a Hail Mary that nothing will happen me on my way.When going into the church I say:Ó Jesús in the blessed scrament help me.When going into bed I sayI must die, I do not know, how, where, or whenBut if I die in mortal sinI am lost for ever,
(continues on next page)

5009010/4976782/5113804.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009010/4976782/5113804.text:
As I lay down to sleepI give my soul to God to keep.If I die before I wake,I pray to God (to take)  my soul to take,There are four corners on my bed.There are four Angel's at my head.Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed that I lay onGod within meGod without meGod in heaven around
(continues on next page)

5008995/4975120/5113867.title: Local Cures
5008995/4975120/5113867.text:
Roasted salt put in a stocking and put round your neck is a cure of a sore throat.If you chew a piece of the skin of a young ash tree, it will cure a "heart-burn."A cup full of alder-berry wine along with a little water is good for a cough.If you got a burn you can cure is by putting bread soda on the part that is burned.The sting of a wasp of bee is cured by rubbing blue on the part that is stung.



"There are four corners on my bed,Four Angels overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,Here I lie for to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,And if I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take."

5008995/4975121/5113868.title: A Collection of Prayer
5008995/4975121/5113868.text: These are some old prayers I have heard at home. This is one that is said when you go to bed at night.-There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round my head,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,Protect me 'till this night is done.Another prayer that is said when in bed is to make the letters I.N.R.I on your forehead and say Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews protect me from a sudden and unprepared death.A prayer said when getting up out of bed -O angel of God my guardian dear,To whom God love commits me here,Ever this day be at my side,To light and guard to rule and guide.A prayer said when going on a journey -There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round its head,Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,Protect me 'till this journey is done.

5008971/4971857/5114270.title: Prayers
5008971/4971857/5114270.text: 528PRAYERSO good Jesus on this day.One good Friday we will pray.The Jews are coming with their spearsWell sharpened spearsOur Savior through the heart they spearFrom hand to hand his blood it flowedHis blessed Mother standing by.With a sorrowful heart and a mournfully cry.Anyone that says this prayer either by night or by day they shall never die in mortal sin nor the gates of hell they shall never enter in.  I got this from my grand mother Mrs. Carolan Drumbaragh.  Aged 90. [born about 1848]

5008971/4971858/5114271.title: Prayers
5008971/4971858/5114271.text: Here  I lay me down to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep.I If any evil comes to meO Blessed Lady waken me.There are four corners round my bed.There are four angels round it spread.Sts Mattkew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on.May the Lord be the branch.And Mary be flower.I pray to Lord Jesus to protect me forever.

5009005/4976132/5114279.title: Old Prayers
5009005/4976132/5114279.text:
My grandmother told me some of the following prayers -: May the Divine Heart of Jeasus and the Immaculate Heart of Mary, be known, praised, blessed, loved, worshipped, glorified, always and in all places Amen.1. Show us O Lord thy ways and teach us thy paths. Direct my steps according to thy word that no injustice may rule over me. Make perfect my walking paths that my steps may not be moved into danger.2. Just one hour with thee O Lord. Just one hour with thee. I know that I shall soon depart. Hide me in they Sacret Heart. 3. Infant Jesus meek and mildTake Oh take me for Thy childAll my life oh let it bemy best joy to think
(continues on next page)

5009014/4977184/5114797.title: Prayers
5009014/4977184/5114797.text:
Payer to cure toothache.As Peter sat on a marble stone,Jesus came to Him alone,Peter, peter why do youw eepO Lord I am troubled with the toothache.To be said three times.
(continues on next page)

5009021/4978096/5114815.title: Prayers
5009021/4978096/5114815.text:
As I lay down my head to sleep.To God I give my soul to take.And if I die before I wae.To God I give my sould to keep.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels round me spread.St Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lie on.God be the branch Lady be the flowerGod be with me at my dying hour.God within, God without.Twelve apostles round about.Help of Christians upon my breastLord Jesus Christ bring my soul to Heaven arest.IIOn Good Friday the Jews came in.And pierced our Savour from heart to......His blessed Mother being standingWith a mournful heart and a pityful......Those who say these words.Three times by night.Three times by day, shall never di.....
(continues on next page)

5009006/4976328/5114949.title: Old Prayers
5009006/4976328/5114949.text:
Here is a prayer which my mother told me. It is said when going to bed.As I lie on my bed to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil thing happens me the Blessed Virgin waken me. There are four corners round my bed; there are four angels over spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on. And if I die before I wake the Lord in heaven give my soul to God to keep. O mercyful Jesus have mercy on me, my soul and my body resign unto thee. O Jesus of Madrid the king of the Jews, Save us from a sudden and an unprepared death. Amen.



This is a prayer that is said when people bless themselves with holy water:-God wash me clean and help me to keep the graces Thou hast given me through the water of Baptism.

5009006/4976328/5114951.title: Old Prayers
5009006/4976328/5114951.text:
Here is a prayer which my mother told me. It is said when going to bed.As I lie on my bed to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil thing happens me the Blessed Virgin waken me. There are four corners round my bed; there are four angels over spread. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on. And if I die before I wake the Lord in heaven give my soul to God to keep. O mercyful Jesus have mercy on me, my soul and my body resign unto thee. O Jesus of Madrid the king of the Jews, Save us from a sudden and an unprepared death. Amen.



This is a prayer that is said when people bless themselves with holy water:-God wash me clean and help me to keep the graces Thou hast given me through the water of Baptism.

5009030/4979069/5115129.title: Old Prayers
5009030/4979069/5115129.text:
Old Prayers.1. As I went into the Holy land I met the Blessed Virgin,  With seven mass books in her hand Seven bells a ringing Seven priests singingSeven candles buringShut the gates of hell open the gates of heaven and let these poor souls in.It was on a Good Friday morning the wicked Jews came in and pierced our Saviours Heart and hands. His blessed mother was standing  by with a loaded heart and a heavy mind. These that say this prayer there times by night and three times by day need never fear death or danger, mortal sin, hell's fire to enter in.2. As I lay down my head to sleep,I gave my soul to God to keep, If any evil spirit approaches
(continues on next page)

5009033/4979270/5115370.title: Festival Customs
5009033/4979270/5115370.text:
(continued from previous page)
on the chimneys of the houses. Sometimes they take the half-doors out of the houses and hang them on a tree near by. For the supper all the people have a barm brack. In this brack is a ring. The person in the family who gets the ring will be first married.



The following prayers are said when going to bed.1. I lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take.2. I must die I do not know hour or when, or whereBut if I die in mortal sinI'm lost foreverLord Jesus have mercy on me.In the name of our Lord Jesus crucifiedI lay myself down to restBless me O Lord, defend and keep meAnd after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to life everlasting.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels over head Mathew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lay on.

5009034/4979361/5115545.title: Prayers Said in Olden Times
5009034/4979361/5115545.text:
The following prayer was said at night in olden times.As I lay down my head to sleep I give my soul to God to keep and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.  There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels round my head, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on.  I go to my bed as I go to my grave begging of Jesus my soul to save.O Bright Queen of Heaven and God as my flower and Jesus be with me at my last dying hour.A prayer that was said in the morning when getting up.May Mary Christ and the saints be between us and harm.  Mary and her Son, Patrick with his staff Martin with his mantle Brigid with her hood Michael with his shield and God before them all with his strong right arm Amen.God bless and save us all may Patrick Brigid and Columkille guard each wall.  May the Queen of Heaven and the angels bright keep us in our house from harm this night.
(continues on next page)

5009034/4979366/5115559.title: Old Prayers - A Prayer Said Going to Bed at Night
5009034/4979366/5115559.text: As I lay down my head to sleep I pray to God my soul will keep.Infant Jesus meek and mild Look on me thy little child. Pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to Thee Heart of Jesus I adore.Heart of Mary I implore Heart of Joseph pure and just in those three heart I place my trust.Through Thy Sacred Virginity and Immaculate Conception O most chaste Virgin obtain for us purity andSanctity of soul and body amen.

5009019/4977839/5115572.title: Prayers
5009019/4977839/5115572.text: PrayersGiven by Mrs Edward Cullen aged 52 years Clontiduffy, Mountnugent, Co. Cavan.The Precious Blood of Jesus Christ that flowed on Calvary hill may wash away all my sins and make me chaste for the future.When going to beAs I go to my bed I shall go to my graveI beg thee Oh Jesus my soul for to saveOh bright Queen of Heaven Oh God is my powerOh Jesus be with me at my last dying hour.In bedThere are four corners on my bedAnd at each corner angels spreadSaint Matthew, Saint Mark, Saint Luke, Saint JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on

5009019/4977840/5115576.title: Prayers - When Going to Bed
5009019/4977840/5115576.text:
PrayersGiven by Mr Tomas Cumaskey aged 56 Dungimmon, Mount Nugent, Co. Cavan.When going to bedHere as I lie down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf there is any evil spirits about me that the Blessed Virgin Mary may guard and keep me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four corners on them spread Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie onBefore the closing of the dayCreator then we humbly prayThat for the wants of mercy sakeMay nothing in our minds exciteFain dreams or phantoms of this nightKeep off our enemy and that is soOur bodies white and clean as snowTo Jesus from a Virgin sprungBe Glory given and praise be sungThe light of God the Father be and Holy
(continues on next page)

5009019/4977841/5115580.title: Prayers - When Going to Bed
5009019/4977841/5115580.text:
(continued from previous page)
Ghost eternally.Save us O Lord watching and sleeping That we may watch with Christ and rest in peaceAmenMairead Ní CumasaigI must die I don't no when nor where nor how And if I die in the state of mortal sin my soul shall be damned for ever. O Sacred heart of Jesus help mePeig Balf

5009019/4977845/5115611.title: A Prayer
5009019/4977845/5115611.text: A PrayerTold by Mrs Thomas Smyth aged 40 years Crossdrum, Oldcastle, Co. Meath.O God of Charity without limit, and of mercy, without measure, it was Thy love induced Thee to come to me.I give thee my body as a temple, my will as a sacrifice, my heart as an altar, my soul as a pyx (??)O Lord merciful Redeemer of heavenO noble loving Infant keep me in Thy peace give me a dwelling in Thy heart.Dissolve me in the fragrance of Thy Charity, strengthen me in Thy love, receive me through Thy Death.O Lord make me entirely pleasing to Thee through the fruits of thy Sacred HeartAmenBrighidh Ní Ghabhann

5009019/4977846/5115614.title: Prayer - When Going to Bed
5009019/4977846/5115614.text: Prayer - when going to bedAs I lie down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep.Waken now waken neverI give my soul to God for ever.As I walked over the blessed land I met the blessed Virgin Mary Seven Mass books in her hand Seven bells ringing Seven priests singing Seven candles lighted O Lamb of God shut the gates of hell and open the gates of heaven and let my poor soul in.been on a Good Friday morning these wicked Jews came in with a long spear and pierced Our Saviour from heart to hand.  The blessed Virgin standing by with a heavy heart and a dismal cry Who ever says this prayer three times by night and three times by day never should fear hell or any other bad thing.Nainsigh Ní h-Eogasa

common story about the wren is how he got to be king of the birds.  One day when the birds assembled together they said whichever of the birds would fly the highest would be the king of the birds. The wren went in under the eagle's wing. The eagle shouted "I am the king of the birds" and immediately the wren jumped out and said "I am the king of the birds" and ever since the wren is counted the king of the birds.

5009023/4978301/5116619.text: "Long ago the people said a prayer to cure the toothache, its. As Peter sat on a marble stone, Christ our Lord came up to him alone, what ails you Peter, Jesus said. Lord and Master I am troubled with the pain of th toothache. Rise up Peter Jesus said no longer shiver or shake, but say this prayer three times a day and you will not be troubled with the pain of the toothache"A prayer for the bleeding"Jesus was born In Nazareth Baptized in the river Jordan and the water was good and the water was pure and when Jesus came the water stood  and by his word and by his name I command this blood to do the same.

There is an old story told about Lake Derravaragh, near Collinstown, Co. Westmeath. This is it. Long ago in Galway there lived a witch who owned a big lake. Another witch lived in Westmeath. The latter borrowed the lake from the Galway witch, and said she would give it back. The Galway witch gave it to her, but she wouldn't give it back. There is said to be a big hole in Galway where the lake was.

5009050/4981135/5117166.text: Here I lie down on my right side to sleep. I give my soul to our blessed Lord to keep. If any evil happens me O Blessed Mary waken me. There are four corners on my bed there are four angels round my head. St Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lay on. Waken now. Waken ever Lord have mercy on my soul for ever. Lord be the Branch and Lady be the flower and Jesus be with me at my dying hour.

5009050/4981136/5117167.text: (1) May the sweet name of Jesus. Be lovingly scribed on my heart inside. O Mother of Jesus may I with him be And Jesus with me May a binding of love that nothing can sever be between us for O Jesus for ever and ever Jesus and Mary we pray Be with us for ever on our way. (2) Praise to thee O Altar Green leafy tree of the cross Let my soul not pass you by Keep me in the state of grace. Direct us to our good. Fill us with desire for Heaven. Wet our eyes with tears of sorrow And may a share to us be given of every Mass said in Rome to-day And throught the wide world. Amen.(3) May I my life St. Joseph spotless be, beneath thy care from every peril free.

5008967/4971766/5117648.title: Praying for a Good Husband
5008967/4971766/5117648.text: In a certain church a girl came to pray day after day before a statue of the Blessed Virgin Mary for a good husband. She used to say her prayers out loud.There happened to be some painters in the church and they made it their business to find out what she was praying for. So one of them hid behind a statue one day and when the girl made her request, he imitated a child's voice and said:- "No, I won't let my Mother get you a good husband."The girl thinking it was the Holy Child that spoke said:- "Hould your whist a leanbh Íosa, and let your mother spake."
5008967/4971766/5117648.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Ceannanus Mór

Here I lie down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless this bed that I lie on.As I walked out through the Holy Land I met the Blessed Virgin Mary and seven mass books in her hands, seven priests singing seven bells ringing, seven candles lighting all at the same time saying shut the gates of Heaven and let the poor souls in.  On Good Friday the Jews came with sharp spears to spear our Blessed Saviour.  The blood leaped from heart to hand our Blessed Lady standing by with a heavy heart and a dreadful moan saying :  "Anyone that shall say this prayer three times both night and shall be free from hell, fire and danger and shall enter the kingdom of Heaven. 5009079/4984556/5119148.title: Prayer for Prevention of Fever
5009079/4984556/5119148.text: When our Lord and Savior saw the Holy Cross He shook and He trembled and the Jews asked Him had He the fever or the ague or was He afraid to die He made answer and said He had neither the Fever nor the ague nor was He afraid to die.    Any one who keeps those words in memory or in writing will never be troubled with the fever or the ague.   Blessed be the hearers.Blessed be the believers. Blessed be the Body and Blood of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ

5009080/4984602/5119272.title: Prayer - To Cure Fever
5009080/4984602/5119272.text:
Collected by Maura Cremer from Mrs CremerAustin Friar St.Mullingar"When Our Lord Saviour saw the Holy Cross.He shook, and He trembled, and the Jews asked Him had He the fever or the ague, or was He afraid to die.He made answer and said, He had neither fever nor ague nor was He afraid to die"Anyone who keeps those words in memory or writing will never be troubled by fever or the ague."Blessed be the hearersBlessed be the believers,Blessed be the Body and Bloodof Our Lord Jesus Christ."



June 9th kept    a holiday by people of Durrow - in honour of St Colmcille. A Mass-bell and cross supposed to have been erected by him can be seen. Every year a pilgrimage took place to well near Durrow Abbey. Pilgrims formed processions. Every one  drank some water and left rosary, medal, beads, strings as offerings.After visiting well stations was made to Cross. Tolers who were in possession of the Abbey locked  gates to  prevent people visiting the well. Gates said to have opened when priest came. Another well sprang up on roadside outside gate. ( Can still be seen)Tolers are supposed to have walled in this area also but as time      went on they grew less bitter and pilgrims had free access.

5009059/4982180/5119665.title: Prayers
5009059/4982180/5119665.text:
As I lie down on my right hand side.I pray to God this night to be my guide.If an evil thing comes towards me.May the blessed lady save me.There are four corners on my bed.Four angels on them spread.St. Mathew, Mark, Luke and John.Protect this bed that I lie on.If I die before I wake 2 pray to the lord.To take my soul to life everlasting.AmenO merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.My soul and my body, I resign into Thee who had five bleeding wounds and was nailed to a tree.O merciful Jesus, have mercy on me.This prayer is said when lying down to sleep.    In the name of Our Lord and Savior. Jesus Christ Crucified, I lay me down to rest. Bless me, O Lord, defend, govern and keep me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness. Amen
(continues on next page)

5009059/4982218/5119801.title: A Prayer
5009059/4982218/5119801.text: Oh my Lord Jesus Christ, thou Lamb that takest away the sins of the world, by Thy mercy which is infinite, pardon me my iniquities and by Thy Sacred Passion preserve me this day from all sin and evil.I carry about me this holy Agnus Dei in Thy honour. Preserve me against my own weakness and instil unto me the practice of that meekness humility and innocence  which thou has taught. I offer myself to thee as an entire oblation in memory of thy sacred cross and in satisfaction for my sins. Accept  oh my God this oblation I make and may it be agreeable to Thee in the odour of sweetness. Amen.Annie Cleary, Turningstown got the above prayer from her mother.It is to be said when wearing an Agnus Dei or when having an Agnus Dei in one's pocket.

5009059/4982219/5119805.title: Prayer
5009059/4982219/5119805.text:
My child, the eye of God beholds youDo naught in His presence but what is good Do as much good as possible and do it so well that God Himself on beholding it may say "it is good." Disquiet not yourself regarding what the world may say of anything but frequently consider what God may say of it.In time of calm - prayIn the tempest - prayIn discouragement - prayYou shall advance in proportion to you constancy in prayer. Always occupy your mind with something useful and serious and never entertain your imagination with foolish ideas.Let your virtue be amiable, sweet, and easily pliable to the requirements of others. Such is the counsel of the Saints.Be attentive and watchful over yourself Invoke under all circumstances the Immaculate Heart of Mary. All for Jesus through Mary. All for Mary after Jesus.This was got from her mother by
(continues on next page)

5009064/4982739/5119809.title: A Collection of Prayers

This is a prayer said before praying."Lord teach us how to pray"This is a prayer said before work"My god I do this, because it pleases you"This is a prayer said before lessons"May god the Holy Ghost, give me light to learn this"This is a prayer said before play."Dear Angel be with me, that I may be safe from haven and sin"  Some old Irish prayers are."In honour of the holy nameMay the sweet name of JesusBe lovingly inscribed,On my heart insideO Mather of JesusMay I with him be,and Jesus with me.May a binding of Love,That nothing can sever,Be between us for ever.Amen,O Jesus for ever and Ever]This is another famous old Irish prayer.O Jesus only son of the Fathers,O Lam who did'nt shed thy hearts blood to redeem us.Shelter me guard me, keep by me for ever
(continues on next page)

When the people in olden times were going to bed they would say this prayer:-Here I lay me down to sleep.Guardian Angel guard my head.And through the hours of darkness keen.May be thy watch around my bed.When they would be going on a journey they would say this prayer.O my dear Guardian to they holy care I am committed, to fend, govern, and save me this day.

Prayers19.12.38.God bless Friday and good Friday too.The day our Saviour was crucifiedThe Jews passed by with a sharp spear in their handsThey pierced so sharp, they pierced our Saviour through the heartHis precious blood began to flowHis tender Mother standing by with loath heart and despied cryNoteAny one who says this prayer three times a day or night need not fear death or danger or any deadly sin for into the gates of Hell their souls shall never enter in.Father we thank thee for the lightThe blessed morning lightFor rest and food and loving careAnd all that makes the world so fairHelp us to do the things we shouldTo be to others kind and goodAnd all we do, And all we say

To grow more loving every day.



I lay my head down to sleep.I give my Soul to God to keep.There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels on it spread.Mathew Mark Luke and John.God bless this bed that I lay on.If any evil comes to me.Our blessed Lady awaken me.God attend me God about me.God almighty round about me.Lady be the branch Lord be the flower.God be our guide no and at our dying hour.Prayer to St. Brigid.Oh glorious St Brigid, Mother of the churches of ErinPatroness of our missionary race.

My grandmother taught me this old prayer. She was taught it by her mother when she was a child. It is to be said before going to sleep."As here I lie on my bed to sleepTo God I give my soul to keep,If any evil troubles meO Blessed Virgin waken me."

5009064/4982774/5120255.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009064/4982774/5120255.text:
The prayers that I learnt at home are:Our FatherHail Mary and Glory be to the father.Our father"Our father, who art in heaven, hallowed bye they name.Thy kingdom come,Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven.Give us this day, our daily bread, and forgive us our trespass as we forgive them who trespass against us and lead us not into temptation,#but deliver us from evil.Amen"Hail Mary"Hail , Mary full of grace, the lord is with theeBlessed are thou among women,and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus"Holy Mary, mother of god pray for us sinners now, and at the hour of our death, amenGlory be to the fatherGlory be to the father, and to the son, and to the Holy Ghost as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be:World without end. Amen.The prayers which I learned at school are:The morning offering, the creed, bonfetion and Act of Contrition
(continues on next page)

5009064/4982787/5120359.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009064/4982787/5120359.text:
Into the hands of the Lord, I recommend my spirit, O Lord Jesus Christ lay me down to rest short and miserable pilgeram God the Father bless me, God the Son defend and keep me, and may the blessing of the holy Ghost Sangtify me and preserve me this night and for ever more Amen.O, Angel of God my guardine dear, to hoom Gods love commits me here ever this day be at my side to light and guard to rule and guide.Hearth of Jesus I adore thee Hearth of Mary I implore thee, Hearth of Joseph pure and just in those three hearths I place my thrust, help us o God assist us O Jesus, Mary abandon us not Mary the divine hearth of Jesus the pure hearth of Mary be every-where loved served praised glorified for ever and ever Amen.
(continues on next page)

5009083/4985042/5120421.text:

Church Island in Loch Owel and in the centre stands the ruins of an old monastery.  It was principally the burial place of the monks yet very many others were buried there.  It has not been used within living memory.Peter Hanley.



To the Angel Guardian.Angel of God my guardian dear,To whom His love commits me here.Ever this night be at my side,To light and guard to rule and guide.For Protection against Dangers.

5009083/4985044/5120422.text:
As I lie down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide.If I die before I wakeI beg the Lord my soul to take.If any evil comes over meOur blessed Lady may awaken me.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels on them spreadMatthew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless me and the bed I lie on.Lord be the branch, Lady be the flower.Sweet Jesus Christ be with me at my dying hour.Theresa Mulready.



O happy Saint whose name I bear,To Heaven convey my humble prayer.O Holy Saint Thomas pray for me.The joys of Heaven that I may see,And reign with Thee eternally.
(continues on next page)

"God speed you" is a form of prayer said to people when starting on a journey."Jesus, Meek and Mild,Pity me a little child.Take my heart and bless itThat nothing evil may possess it."This prayer may be said by children at any time.

5009083/4985046/5120428.title: A Night Prayer
5009083/4985046/5120428.text: A night prayer."May the will of God be done by us.May the death of the Saints be won by us,And the light of the Kingdom begun in us.May Jesus the Child, be beside my bed,May the Lamb of Mercy uplift my head,May the Virgin Mary her brightness shed,And Michael be steward of my soul."

5009064/4982842/5120526.text:
This is a Prayer said before praying :"Lord teach us How to pray"This is a Prayer said before work :"My good it do thisbecause it pleases you"This is a Prayer said before lessons :"May God the holy ghostgive me light to learn this"This is a Prayer said before Play :"Dear angel be with meThat I may be safe from harm and sin"This is a Prayer said before Church :"My god I love youI know you are there"In time of trouble:O sweet Jesus, thou art my protection, and my strength in time of strife. Thou art my joy in time of prosperity. O vouchsafe relief to me in this difficulty. Amen

5009065/4982983/5120995.title: Old Friday Prayers
5009065/4982983/5120995.text: On good Friday the old people said this prayer.It was on good Friday morning the Jews come in to pierce our Saviour through the heart. From heart and hand his blood began to flow. His tender hearted mother standing by with aching heart and dismal cry.      Anyone who says this prayer three times by day three times by night shall never die in mortal sin and the flames of hell shall never enter in.

5009065/4982984/5121002.title: A Prayer for a Happy Death
5009065/4982984/5121002.text:
O St Joseph Foster father of Jesus Christ and true spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary pray for all those who are in the agony this might.This is a prayer that small children say.God bless me and keep me safe till night again.This prayer is said at nightHere I lay me down to sleepI give my soul to god to keepand if a, I die before I wake I trust in god my soul to take    There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels on my spread, Martha, Mark & Luke and Jhon God

5009085/4985174/5121052.title: Prayers
5009085/4985174/5121052.text:
Going to bed or in bed.1.  Here I lie on my right side I pray to God to be my guide and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.  There are four corners on my bed there are four Angels over head.  Saint Mathew Mark Saint Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on.  Lord of the branch.  Lady of the flower.  Lord Jesus assist me at my last hour.2.  On Good Friday before noon it rained a heavy dew fierce and sharp towards us.  Our sweet Saviour's flowing blood his Blessed Mother standing by with a heavy sob and dismal moan.  Any one that says this prayer five times by day or by night never shall die in mortal sin nor the Flames of hell they shall never enter in.  Amen.3.  O Mary, my Mother and my hope, I take refuge under thy mantle, there let me live and die, deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing.
(continues on next page)

ointments such as the burst ointment, blast ointment and ulcer ointment.  A man, named Corcoran who lives in this district, has the cure for burst.  The ointment is made in this manner.  Nine herbs a got and fried with butter on a pan.  The substance of herbs (is) goes through the grease and when it cools, it is put aside and many are freed from cruel sufferings by it.  There is also a drawing out ointment made of sugar and cold tar soap, boiled which is applied before the other ointment.

5009088/4985497/5121215.title: Prayers
5009088/4985497/5121215.text: Mrs Slevin, Mt Murray sent this prayer to school.  She says it is a cure for toothache.St Peter sat on a marble stoneThe Lord appeared to him alone"What ails you Peter or where do you ache.""Oh Lord"says Peter "I have the toothache."Jesus said to him "Rise up Peter and behold from your toothache not you alone but all others who keep those words in memory or in writing and say a pater and ave and creed never shall be troubled with a toothache again."

Mrs Slevin Mount Murray told meThe seven joys if [of] Our LadyThe first fine joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of oneIt was the joy of Her Only SonWhen He became a manThe second fine joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of twoIt was the joy of her Only SonWhen He began to doThe third fine joy Our Lady gotIt was the joy of threeIt was the joy of her Only SonWhen He made the blind to seeThe fourth fine joy Our Lady got
(continues on next page)

5009098/4986378/5121556.title: Prayers - In the Morning
5009098/4986378/5121556.text: In the morningLord be the branch, Lady be the flower,Sweet Jesus be with me at my dying hour.All for Thee O Lord, O my Jesus all for thee.At nightI lay my body down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God, my soul to take.There are four corners on my bedThere are four angels round it spreadSt. Matthew, Mark, St Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.

5009127/4989219/5121661.title: Folk Prayers or Verses
5009127/4989219/5121661.text: I heard the following folk prayers.Good FridayGood Friday our Saviour was crucified,The bloody Jews came and pierced him through the side.His blessed Mother was standing byWith a heavy heart and dismal sigh.Whoever shall say this prayer three times by night and three times by day shall never die in mortal sin or enter the gates of hell. Amen.St Peter sat on a marble stoneChrist came to him when alone."What ailest thou Peter?""A toothache.""God bless the hour God bless the day.For at this hour on this dateNo one shall ever suffer from toothache again."Charms1. If a person buries a sheaf of corn in the ground, having the intention of bringing about the death of an enemy, people say that as the sheaf decays, the

5009124/4988869/5122437.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009124/4988869/5122437.text: (1) When going to bed the following prayer is recited -:As I lie down on my right side, I pray to God to be my guide ;If I die before I awake I give my soul to God to keep;There are four corners on my bed; there are four angels overhead ;Mathew, Mark, Luke and John bless the bed that I lie on.Lord be thy branch; and Lady be thy flower;Sweet Jesus have mercy on me at my last dying hour.(2) The following prayer is also said on retiring-:O most mercifull Jesus, have mercy on me,My soul, my body I resign unto thee;Thy five bleeding wounds were nailed to a cross;O, Most merciful Jesus have mercy on me.

5009124/4988877/5122454.title: A Collection of Prayers

When our Lord and Savour saw the holy cross. He shook and trembled and the Jews asked him had he ever the fever or the ague or was he afraid to die. He made answer and said "He had neither the fever or ague or neither was he afraid to die. Anyone who keeps these words shall never be troubled either with the fever or the ague.

AmenInfant Jesus meek and mild Look on me a little child.Pity me and suffer me to come to thee.Heart of Jesus I adore thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,Heart of Joseph pure and just,In those three hearts I place my trust.AmenGod I thank thee for having brought me safely through the day.God give me the grace to bring me safely through the night.My God this night I give to theeFor the past oh pardon me.I know that I must soon depart

God Bless Good Friday the Friday of the day when the Jew was passing by with a sharp spear in his hand. He pierced Our Saviour thro the Heart from hand to hand His Blessed mother being standing by with a heavy heart and dismal cry who ever one who says this prayer three times by night three times by day neither death nor danger nor deadly sin not the flame of hell his soul shall never enter in.When lighting a lamp say "The light to our souls", when going on a journey they say "I'll go now in the name of God" and the people in the house say "God be would you."In times of danger they bless themselves and say"The cross of Christ shelter us."
