5009222/4999519/5124084.title: Local Prayers
5009222/4999519/5124084.text:
To be said before getting up in the morningJesus guard my tonguePut a lock on my handsPut a veil on my eyes against all sin and dangerTo be said before getting up in the morningAs I went out one Sunday morningTo view the holy lands.I met the Blessed Virgin Mary,With seven mass books in her handsSeven bells ringing,Seven priests singing,Open the gates of heaven and let the poor soul inShut the gates of hell fore ever more. Amen.To be said going to bed at nightAs I lie down on my right side,I pray to God to be my guide,Die now die never.God forgive my soul for ever.To be said before getting up in the morningIt was on a good Friday morningAfter twelve o'clockThe Jews came down and speared
(continues on next page)

5009222/4999521/5124087.title: Local Prayers
5009222/4999521/5124087.text: This prayer to be said every eveningOh my lord Jesus Christ true Lamb who takest away the sins of the world.By thy mercy which is infinite pardon my iniquities and by Thy Sacred PassionPreserve me this day from sin and evilI carry about me this holy Agnus and in Thy honour as a preservative against my own weakness and as an incentive to thy practice of meekness humility and innocence by which Though has taught me I offer myself up to Thee as an entire oblation and in memory of the Sacrifice of love which Thou did'st offer for me on the cross and in satisfaction for my sinsAccept my God the oblationsI make and may it be agreeble to Thee in adour of sweetness Amen

5009109/4987562/5124098.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009109/4987562/5124098.text:
When people are starting to work, they start in the name of God. If people  were  passing where other people were  working  they say God bless the work or God speed the labour.The names of the prayers  I learned  at home  are a prayer to the infant Jesus, Infant  Jesus  meek and mild  look on me a little child.A prayer  to the Imaculate Conception. O Mary through her spotless purity obtain for us purity  and chastity  of soul and body.A prayer to my Angel  guardian, O Angel  of God my guardian dear to whom  his love commits me hear ever this day  be at my side to light  and guard to rule and guide.A prayer to St. Philomena, We beseech thee O Lord to grant us the pardon  of our sins, by the intercession  of St Philomena, Virgin  and Martyr, who was always pleasing to Thy sight be her eminent chasity and
(continues on next page)

5009248/5001360/5124454.title: Collection of Prayers
5009248/5001360/5124454.text:
When children are going to bed they say this prayer."There are four corners on my bed.There are four angels overspread.St Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.God bless the bed that I lie on."Other prayers people say going to bed are."If any bad Spirit offend me,,Jesus Christ may defend me,,"If I die before I wake,,The angels of heaven my soul may take.""Branches of heaven flowers of Mary meet me at my last hour.  Amen"Another prayer is -"God grant me the light and glory of heaven,"And a happy nights rest  Amen."People say this when blowing out the candle at nightWhen people sneeze they say this prayer."God bless us."When a person comes to a door he says,"God save all here."The person inside answers"God save you kindly."
(continues on next page)

5009241/5001013/5130479.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009241/5001013/5130479.text: Little child Jesus come to meLittle child Jesus come stay with meMy heart is so small will thee allTheres no room for no one only thee.Angel guardian keep me near beneath thy snow white wing defend me from the evil one and teach me holy things.Jesus give the weary sweet and calm response guard the sailors tossing on the deep blue sea comfort every sufferer watching late and pain those who plant some evil from their sinful strainFour corners on my bed four angels over spreadSt Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on.When in my bed and in my sleep toGod I give my soul to keep.

5009241/5001025/5130541.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009241/5001025/5130541.text:
To be said at any time of the day.I must die but I know not when where or how but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever.This prayer is to be said when going to bed at night.Here I lie down on my bed of God I give my soul to God to keep any evil come to me, blessed Mother waken me.There are four corners on my bed,there are four angels over spreadMatt, Mark, Luke, and John,  God bless the bed that I lay on.As I go to my bed as I go to my grave, I give Mary the bough and Joseph the branch.  Jesus, Mary and Joseph may be with me in my dying hour.Prayer to be said when in bed.Come sweet Jesus come to mecome to the heart that is longing for Thee.  Into thy hands O Lord I commend my spirit.  Lord let me not be confounded.Prayer to be said for the success of anything.Our Lady, our Queen and my Mother the name of Jesus and the love of Jesus we implore the Sacred Heart of Jesus to grant us good
(continues on next page)

5009112/4987945/5130571.title: Old Prayers
5009112/4987945/5130571.text: Long ago prayers of every kind were heard throughout the country when a visitor would enter a house he would say "God save all here" to which the people from within would answer "God save all those who are entering."When going on a journey they would say "May God and save all those who are entering."When going on a journey they would say "May God guide and direct me in this journey."Young people had respect for their elders, and would always have a very nice salutation to greet them with starting work they said "I will now start work in the name of God."When rising in the morning they said "I will now rise from this bed of sleep, to labour for the Lord this day."

5009112/4987946/5130573.title: Old Prayers
5009112/4987946/5130573.text: Long ago there  were many beautiful prayers but unfortunately few of them are heard now. It is believed that their whole life consisted of prayers and hard work. They had a prayer for every act they did during the day.In the morning when getting up they said:-"Christ be with me, be after me, be before me, and be at my right and left hand, and may every thing I do, be for Christ"There is another to Saint Michael, it is:-"Blessed Saint Michael save us in the day of battle that we may not be lost on the day of judgement"They also said a prayer when kindling the fire:-"Oh my Jesus warm my heart with the fire that (is) in Thy Sacred Heart."This is another aspiration  said when dressing:-"Lord! Clothe me with the role of innocence."When the men were going to the fair their wives would say:-"God be with them now, and bring them home safe with their share of stock or money."During  thunder and lightening they said:-"O! Lord be between us and harm and protect us from the harms of the world."(Told to me by my mother)

5009112/4987947/5130575.title: Old Prayers
5009112/4987947/5130575.text: Long ago the Irish people said different prayers to those said nowadays. When a visitor came into a house he said. "God save all here". When getting up in the mornings they said "That God may be with me through the day". When starting work they said "I will begin now in the name of God". When going to bed they said a beautiful prayer. "Here I lay down my head to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, if any evil happen me blessed Mary waken me. There are four corners on my bed there are four angles overhead. Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John, God bless this bed that I lie on. Lord be the branch, Lady be the flower, Lord Jesus be with me at my dying hour. In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ crucified bless me O Lord and after this short a miserable pilgrim bring me to life everlasting. Amen.

5009112/4987948/5130580.title: Old Prayers
5009112/4987948/5130580.text: There were many nice prayers said by the old people. When the old people woke in the morning they would say : thanks be to the great God I have seen the morning. When starting work they said : I'll begin this in the name of God. Or when going on a jorney the would say : I'll go now in the great God and his blessed Mother. When putting down the fire they say : Thanks be to God I have what I'll put down a fire with. When entering the church they would say : We adore thee O Lord. After geting up some say this prayer before the picture of the Holy Family. O Mary, most sweet Mother, we enplore thy protection, trusting with confidence that thy divine Son will hear thy request. And thou also most glorious Patriarch, Saint Josept, come to our assistence which thy mighty protection, place our vows in the hands of Mary, that she may preseant them to Jesus Christ

5009256/5002063/5130788.title: Prayers and Holy Stories
5009256/5002063/5130788.text:
The Fishermen's Night - Prayer."O Mother!  look on us to-night, and guide us safely home,For we fear the storm is going to break,that has threatened us so longThe Moon is dark, the sky is black,Thunder crashes, lightning flashes.Our fear is quickly departing for we know,That Mary our Mother is praying for us.The Fisherman's Prayer for a Good Season.Father, fill my nets to - night,With fish so plentifulAs you did fill poor Peter's netsOn that night so long ago.My children lie at home in bed,Their hearts in me are set,My wife is waiting to sell my catch,
(continues on next page)

5009256/5002070/5130799.title: Old Prayers
5009256/5002070/5130799.text: Going to bed long ago, the old people used say many prayers.Some were as follows :-i.  First they used make the sign I.N.R.I. on their foreheads with holy-water, saying : "Jesus of Nazerath, King of the Jews, preserve me from a sudden + private death."ii.  In time of an epidemic :-St. Roch preserve us from all contagouus diseases"iii  "God bless the work"  +"God save all here" of course were common salutations on entering a house where work was going on.

5009276/5003826/5131766.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009276/5003826/5131766.text: 231A Collection of PrayersO Jesus Sweet Jesus  have mercy on me,My heart and my soul I give unto thee,The five bleeding Wounds have been nailed to a tree,O Crucified Jesus have mercy on me._____Prayer on setting out on a journeyIn the name of the Father for success,And of the Son who suffered pain,May Mary meet me at the the shore,Let not my soul go by Thee,In the Communion of Saints may we be,Listening to the voices of angels.And praising the Son of God world, without end.   Amen.Let us prayMay the Almighty and merciful Lord direct us on our journey may he make it prosper, maintain us in peace may the Archangel Raphael accompany us along the way and may we return to our home in peace and joy and health.Jesus Mary we pray,Be with us ever on our way,Sadie Walsh,Kereight,  Kyle,Co. Wexford.

5009259/5002382/5131806.title: Old Prayers
5009259/5002382/5131806.text:
Morning PrayerMary most holy and all the saints intercede for us with the Lord, that we may merit to receive help and salvation from him who liveth and reigneth for ever and ever. Amen. Prayer to our Angel Guardian.O Angel of God, to whose care I am committed by thy supreme clemency, illuminate, defend and govern me this day, in all my thoughts, words and actions. Amen.
(continues on next page)

5009259/5002389/5131811.title: Old Prayers
5009259/5002389/5131811.text:
These following prayers were told to me by Mammy, they were told to her by her Mother. The first is said going to bed at night it is said in the following way,As I lay down on my right side,I pray to God to give me guideAnd if I die before I wake to GodI give my soul to take,O Blessed Lady awaken meThere are four corners on my bedThere are four Angles over spreadSaint Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lay onGod Bless "Good Friday" Friday day the Day of Our Lord "Jesus Christ"Crucified, Crown of shell thorns On his head the heavy heartAnd a dismal cry.
(continues on next page)

5009259/5002404/5131841.title: A Morning Prayer
5009259/5002404/5131841.text:
O my God, I love and adore theeI give Thee thanks with my wholeheart for all thy blessingsEspecially for having protected me somercifully during the night.O Jesus keep me in Thy hands thisday. Mary, Holy, Virgin Mary I take shelterunder thy protecting mantle and do thou! Heavenly Father help me for the sake of Jesus and Mary my guardian Angel help me by thy Holy prayer.O my Lord I will strive is to avoid this sin (name it) above all others and to be on my guard against this dangerous occasion (name it),To thee, my God I offer all that I may and suffer during the day which
(continues on next page)

5009277/5003889/5131932.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009277/5003889/5131932.text:
As I looked up as I looked downI saw the Blessed Virgin MarySeven Mass Books in her handSeven priests carrying 7 candles lighting.Open the Gates of Heaven, and shut the Gates of HellLet all the Suffering Souls, enter in for Evermore  Amen.I lay my body down to sleepTo God I give my Soul to keepTo sleep now, to sleep everTo God I give my Soul for ever.If death comes tonight to me.Lord Jesus waken me.Good-night, my good AngelYou watched over me during the dayWatch over me during the nightAnd grant that I may be always good and wise
(continues on next page)

5009260/5002536/5132049.title: Prayers
5009260/5002536/5132049.text: There are four corners on my bedThere are four Angels on them spread,Matthew, James, Luke and John.Bless the bed that I lie on.Here I lie upon my side.I pray to God to be my guide.And if I die before I wake.I pray to God my soul to take.Waken now or waken neverTo God I give my Soul forever.God bless me.Four corners on my beadFour Angels over-spread.One to sing  One to pray.And two to carry my Soul away.

5009260/5002539/5132058.title: Prayers
5009260/5002539/5132058.text:
My Aunt taught me to say these prayers before going to bed.Jesus heavenly shepherd hear me.Bless thy child tonight.  Through the darkness be Thee near me keep me safe until morning light.  All this dayThy hand has lead me and I thank Thee for Thy care.  Let my sins be all forgiven  bless the friends I love so well.  When I die take me to heavenhappy there with thee to dwell.Four corners around my bed.  Four angels around my head toMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.



Long ago there lived an old minister whose wife had died a couple of months and a certain priest was after being ordained a couple of weeks.  So the old minister asked the priest to come for dinner.  He went the following day.  After he had taken his dinner the old minister went
(continues on next page)

5009278/5004020/5132139.title: Food in Olden Times
5009278/5004020/5132139.text:
(continued from previous page)
Then when satisfied in that position he swang round on the other hip saying he may as well now eat his breakfast as he was to be on the road early.



The following old prayer was taught to Miss O'Connor when a child, by her nurse Julia Bolger:As I looked up as I looked downI saw the B.V.M. and seven Mass Books in her handSeven priests singing and seven candles lightingOpen the gates of Heaven and shut the gates of HellLet all the suffering souls enter inFor evermore. AmenAnd another;I lay my body down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepTo sleep now sleep neverTo God I give my soul foreverIf death come to-night to meLord Jesus waken me

5009249/5001441/5132421.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009249/5001441/5132421.text:
People putting out the light when going to bed say :"May God grant us the light of Heaven."This seems to be a very old prayer and is still said in many houses."May God bless the man and his work" is the usual salutation given to a person who is working by a passerby.When the people are lying down to rest they say :"Under the protection of the Holy Family I lay down to rest this blessed and holy night."A very old prayer said also at night is "Bless O Lord the repose I am going to take that by renewing my bodily strength I may better and able to serve thee.All ye Saints and Angels but especially thou O Mother of God intercede for me.  Not only now during this night, but especially at the hour of my death.  Pour down thy blessings on my parents, benefactors, friends : on my enemies if I have any.Protect my superiors both spiritual and temporal.Help the poor and sick, and those in their last agony.  Convert all heretics and unbelievers
(continues on next page)

5009249/5001442/5132425.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009249/5001442/5132425.text:
(continued from previous page)
O God of mercy and goodness put an endto the suffering of the souls of the faithful departed,and grant to all those for whom I am particulary bound to pray for,eternal light, rest, happiness,  Amen."



At waking in the morning I say -"O my God my only good the author of my being and my last end. I give thee my heart, praise, honour and glory be to thee over and ever Amen."On rising up I say -"In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy GhostI will raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore my God, and to labour for salvation of my soul
(continues on next page)

5009249/5001444/5132427.title: Prayers
5009249/5001444/5132427.text:
After the rosary at night we say."Oh Most Blessed Virgin more than martyred, yet the suffering, such as afflicted, by the unspeakable joy where the soul was lost in finding the beloved son in the temple, amidst the doctors, disputing with them, obtain for us to seek him and find him that we may never be separated from him again."On rising in the morning I say."I kiss the wounds of thy sacredhand with sorrow deep and true,May every move of my hand tobe a million acts of love for youDear Lord.""I kiss the wounds of thy sacred feetwith sorrow deep and true,May every step I take to daybe a million acts of love for youDear Lord."
(continues on next page)

5009249/5001445/5132432.title: Prayers
5009249/5001445/5132432.text:
(continued from previous page)
"I kiss the wounds of thy sacred heartwith sorrow deep and true,May every move of my heart to daybe a milion acts of love for youDear Lord."



There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed that I lie on.This prayer is said at night

5009249/5001446/5132435.title: Prayers
5009249/5001446/5132435.text:
"My God I offer thee this day,All I may do, or think, or say.Uniting it with what was done, onearth by Jesus Christ thy son"



"Oh Holy Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, dying on the Cross for our lives,Oh Holy Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ ward off from us all evils,Oh Holy Cross of Christ protect me from my enemies,Oh Holy Cross of Christ direct me in the way of happiness,Oh Holy Cross of Christ protect me from a sudden and unprovided death."

5009249/5001446/5132436.title: Prayers
5009249/5001446/5132436.text:
"My God I offer thee this day,All I may do, or think, or say.Uniting it with what was done, onearth by Jesus Christ thy son"



"Oh Holy Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, dying on the Cross for our lives,Oh Holy Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ ward off from us all evils,Oh Holy Cross of Christ protect me from my enemies,Oh Holy Cross of Christ direct me in the way of happiness,Oh Holy Cross of Christ protect me from a sudden and unprovided death."

5009284/5004625/5132488.title: Collection of Local Prayers
5009284/5004625/5132488.text:
A prayer said when going to bed at nightNow I lay me down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.Sleep now, Sleep never,To God I give my soul forever.There are four corners on my bedFour holy angels round it spread,St. Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on.Oh my Jesus, I know that I have to die,But I know not where, when or howBut if I die in mortal sin,I am lost foreverSacred Heart of Jesus have mercy on me and forgiveme all my sins.  Amen.The following prayer is said when passing a Crucifix.Oh Lord my God by sufferings rent,Nailed to a cross my love to gain,Grant through my cross when life is spentIn death Thy Mercy I obtain.Daily PrayersMay all the words that I speak be so many arrows dipped in the Blood of Thy
(continues on next page)

5009284/5004626/5132493.title: Collection of Local Prayers
5009284/5004626/5132493.text:
(continued from previous page)
Sacred Heart,  O Jesus to pierce the hearts of allwho hear them with love for Thee.Infant Jesus meek and mildLook on me Thy little childPity me, pity mineSuffer us to come to TheeHeart of Jesus I adore Thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,Heart of Joseph true and justIn those three hearts I place my trust.Oh, Holy Mary Queen of charity pray for methat I may never die in mortal sin.



A prayer to be said in the morning when rising :-O God I rise from this bed of sleepto adore thee my God and to labourfor the salvation of my soul.  Oh mayI rise on the last day to love andenjoy thee for ever and ever.  AmenA prayer to be said every morning and night :-It was on a Good Friday day afternoon, and day afternoon and day
(continues on next page)

5009284/5004627/5132498.title: A Collection of Local Prayers
5009284/5004627/5132498.text:
(continued from previous page)
after study.  The Jews came with spears so sharp and pierced our Saviour's tender heart.  From heart to hand O God  O Blessed Mother stand, with a sorrowful heart and pitiful eye.  Whoever says this prayer five times both day and night, shall never die in a deadly sin nor the gates of hell they shall never enter in.  This is a prayer from all and about us now and at the hour of our death amen



A prayer to be said going to bed.In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ crucified lay me down to rest.  Bless me O Lord defend me and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness.  Amen.Prayer to obtain Christian MastersO Lord who seest the efforts of wicked men to deprive Thee of the souls of children.  Have pity on the people and deign to multiply the number of christian masters send labourers
(continues on next page)

5009284/5004628/5132500.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009284/5004628/5132500.text:
(continued from previous page)
into the vineyard fill them with the spirit and increase their fruits. We ask this in the name of the Sacred Heart of Christ Jesus Amen.Jesus Mary and Joseph may guide us and guard us protect us and save us from a sudden and unprovided death from the hands and mouths of our enemies from all evils both of soul and body and grant us all to be alive and well this time twelve months better in health wealth and prosperity and if we are no better God and the Blessed Virgin Mary grant us to be no worse.



I lay my body down to sleepI give my soul to God to keep,If I die before I wakeI give my soul to God to take



Here I now lay down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepTo keep now To keep foreverTo God I give my soul foreverGood night God and all His saintsHis Blessed Mother and His SonPrayers said when awakening in the
(continues on next page)

5009284/5004628/5132506.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009284/5004628/5132506.text:
(continued from previous page)
into the vineyard fill them with the spirit and increase their fruits. We ask this in the name of the Sacred Heart of Christ Jesus Amen.Jesus Mary and Joseph may guide us and guard us protect us and save us from a sudden and unprovided death from the hands and mouths of our enemies from all evils both of soul and body and grant us all to be alive and well this time twelve months better in health wealth and prosperity and if we are no better God and the Blessed Virgin Mary grant us to be no worse.



I lay my body down to sleepI give my soul to God to keep,If I die before I wakeI give my soul to God to take



Here I now lay down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepTo keep now To keep foreverTo God I give my soul foreverGood night God and all His saintsHis Blessed Mother and His SonPrayers said when awakening in the

5009294/5005204/5132690.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009294/5005204/5132690.text: A Collection of Prayers. April 13th, 1938.A Prayer to the Infant JesusDear Jesus teach me to be generous with thee.Teach me to serve thee as thou deserves,To give and not to count the cost,To fight and not to heed the wounds,To toil and not to seek for rest,To labour and not to seek for any rewards,Save that of knowing that I do thy will.A PrayerCrucified Jesus have mercy on me,My soul and body I give to thee,The five bleeding wounds nailed to the tree,Merciful Jesus have mercy on me.Jesus the branch and Mary the flower,Jesus and Mary be with me in my dying hour.Infant Jesus meek and mild, look on me a little child,Pity mine and pity me, and suffer me to come to thee.Heart of Jesus I adore, Heart of Mary I implore,Heart of Joseph, pure and just and in these three hearts I put my trust.John Dempsey, Wells, Gorey.

metadata.Teacher:: Criostóir Ó Cuanáin, Liam de Noraidh

5009294/5005205/5132693.title: Local Prayers
5009294/5005205/5132693.text: Local Prayers. April 13th, 1938.Jesus and Mary help me and bring me over my troubles because I am troubled very much now.Jesus and Mary help me and keep me out of temptation.Jesus and Mary help me and bring me safe over the night and God bless all the corners of my bed in which I sleep tonight. Amen.Jesus help me to pray and keep me from the wrong and to love thee for ever and bring me to thy heavenly kingdom.Michael Byrne, Ballyedmond, Monamolin, Gorey.

metadata.Teacher:: Criostóir Ó Cuanáin, Liam de Noraidh

5009294/5005206/5132697.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009294/5005206/5132697.text: A Collection of Prayers. April 13th, 1938.When the men are going out in the morning the others that are in the house say to them "God keep you through the day and God bring you home safely."When one person gets something from another person, he says, "God increase it for you."When they hear that there is a certain mark on some person, they say "God bless the mark."When somebody is going away from their house, they say "God speed you on your journey."When they sneeze, they say "God bless us."When they are going to bed, they say "Matthew, Mark, Luke and John bless the bed that I lie on. There are four corners round my bed, there are four angels round my head, one to watch, one to pray, and two to carry my soul away."If they were going along the road and they saw someone working in the fields, they say "God bless the work."When a traveller comes in, he says "God bless all here."Mollie Lacey, Court, Monamolin, Gorey.

metadata.Teacher:: Criostóir Ó Cuanáin, Liam de Noraidh

5009294/5005207/5132699.title: Local Prayers
5009294/5005207/5132699.text: Local Prayers. April 13th, 1938.Good morning day, Jesus send me the rightJesus keep me from sins and shame.I'll get up in Jesus' name.IIIt was on a good Friday morning before first moon,The Jews came up with their spears so sharp,Pinned our Saviour's tender heart,The blessed mother standing byWith a heavy heartAnd an achiful cryWhoever will say this prayer, Five times by night,And five times by day,No death or danger shall be nigh,Nor neither shall they enter in.IIIPeter sat on a marble stone,Our Lord came to him all alone,What makes you shiver?What makes you shake?Lord, I am troubled with a toothache.IIIIHere I lay to restThere are four corners on my bedThere are four angels over headMatthew, Marl, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.Peter Lacey, Gariydaniel, Monamolin, Gorey.

metadata.Teacher:: Criostóir Ó Cuanáin, Liam de Noraidh

5009286/5004720/5132945.title: Folklore - Prayers

The following prayer was taught to me by my motherMy soul and body were resigned to TheeFive bleeding wounds were nailed to a treeO Crucified Jesus have mercy on meWritten by.Nancy Murray   5th StandardTinnock,  GoreyCo Wexford

5009286/5004720/5132947.title: Folklore - Prayers
5009286/5004720/5132947.text:

5009286/5004721/5132960.title: Folklore - Holy Prayers
5009286/5004721/5132960.text: 146The following are holy prayers taught to James Carroll 6th Standard.He lives inCoolinteggart,  HollyfortCo. WexfordJames Carroll told them to the 6th Standard and they were taught to him by his mother.  She learned the prayers from her grandmother.Here I lay myself down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepBut if I die before I wakeTo God I pray my soul to takeThis I ask for Jesus'  sake"Think of death"I shall die, I know not when, where, or how,But if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever.O Jesus !  Have mercy on me.O, Jesus who for love of me,Didst bear Thy Cross to CalvaryIn thy sweet mercy grant to meTo suffer and die with thee

5009295/5005251/5133047.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009295/5005251/5133047.text:
105A Collection of PrayersIn the morning before I get up I say the following prayer :-"I will rise from this bed of sleep to adore Thee, God, and to labour for the salvation of my soul. O! may I rise on the last day to life everlasting.  I clothe my soul with a nuptial robe so that I may wear it pure & undefiled before Thy Judgment Seat."When I am going to bed I say the following prayer :-"Here I am lying down to sleep, to God I give my soul to keep; waken now or waken never, to God I give my soul forever."I say the following prayer night and morning :-"O gentle & loving Saint Anthony whose heart was ever full of human sympathy, whisper my prayers into the ears of the Infant Jesus, Who loved to linger in your arms one word from you and my prayer- book will be granted ; speak that word and the gratitude of my heart will ever be yours."Briget Lacy,Monamolin, Gorey, CoWexford.



This is to be said while in the bed :-"Here I lay down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep, if any evil spirit come to waken me, O Blessed Virgin waken me.""There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels overhead, Saint Matthew, Mark, Luke & John.  God bless the bed that I lie on."When putting out a lamp you say :-"God give us the light of Heaven."When the clock strikes say :-"Another hour of my life now gone, Sweet Jesus come and take me at my last."
(continues on next page)

5009295/5005252/5133058.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009295/5005252/5133058.text:
(continued from previous page)
106Mary Breen,Kilcoulshea, Boolavogue, Ferns,Co. Wexford.



A prayer to be said when in bed :-"Now I sign The Blessed Token, fold my arms upon my breast, Jesus Lord, the last word spoken ere I sink to rest."Norah Breen,Ballycarrigeen,  Ferns,  Co. Wexford.



Holly is put in windows & behind pictures & on the dresser a few days before Christmas Day & is not taken down till after Twelfth Day.  Blessed Palm is put behind holy pictures.  Holy water is kept in the bedroom & you bless yourself with it every morning and night.  When stall-feeders are put in the house to be fattened they are sprinkled with holy water.  Blessed salt is used in drinks for all kinds of animals.  When any animals are sick people put blessed salt in their food.  Blessed salt is put in a mash for a cow after calving.Mary Breen.Kilcoulshea,  Boolavogue, Ferns,Co. Wexford.



It was an old custom to put palm up in the house with cattle. The blessed salt is given to cattle when they are being let out after they have been in for the winter.John Coleman,Legnalough, Monamolin, Gorey, Co. Wexford.Told me by my motherMrs A. Coleman  (41)[Same address]

Prayers said when going to sleepHere I lay me down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep.If I die before I wakeJesus and Mary my soul may keep.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lie on,Four corners to my bed four angels there to spreadTwo at my head and two at my feet,One at my heart my soul to keepWhen putting out the lightGod grant us the light of heavenI.N.R.I on the foreheadJesus of Nazareth king of the JewsSave us from a sudden and unprovided death this night

74Virgin Mary Pray for us and those in their last Agony and who are to die tonight.  Heart of Jesus once in Agony have pity on the dying.To be said in bedSeven priests singing.  Seven bells ringing.  Shut the gates of hell and open the gates of heaven and let my poor soul pass in.  I dont know when or how or where I may die but if I die in Mortal sin I am lost forever                                    Tom Franey.



Here I lay me down to sleep I give my soul to God to keep.  Waken now or waken never, I give my soul to God for everWhen the Clock strikes sayJesus protect me and keep me from sin.Teresa Jordan

5009306/5006080/5133485.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009306/5006080/5133485.text: 75Infant Jesus meek and mild pity me a little Child (suffer)  Sweet Jesus I implore Thee  Heart of Mary I adore Thee Heart of Joseph pure and just in these Three Hearts I put my Trust                       Mary O'Leary

4758497/4748753/5133979.title: A Prayer for a Happy Death
4758497/4748753/5133979.text:
A prayer for a happy death."May God grant that we may never meet with a sudden nor unproved death."



A prayer during thunder and lightning."From thunder and lightning St Anthany deliver us."

5009317/5006794/5133982.title: Prayers
5009317/5006794/5133982.text:
1PrayersGod Bless the mark - when referring to a blemish on a person.God bless the hearers - when listening to a story.God leave you the use of your arm - when a person strikes a bully or some one deserving punishment.When entering a house - God bless all here save the dog and the cat.When hearing bad news of another - God break all hard fortune before everyone.When we see a person churning we say "God bless the work".  We also take a part as it is and old custom.  This was supposed to keep people from taking the butter by magic or witchcraft.There are fields near Ferns called "The Butter Fields" as people of the neighbourhood remember them covered with lumps of matter like butter but which the people say was butter.  John Nolan Askinamoe  Ferns told the teacher that he saw it and that it remained on the fields for a couple of days.Some people put hot coals under the churn also to prevent people from taking the butter.  Stories are told of people having only one or two cows selling the butter to be got from seven or eight.
(continues on next page)

5009327/5007402/5134040.title: Prayers
5009327/5007402/5134040.text:
Here I lay myself down to slep. To God I give my soul to keep. Sleep now and sleep for [?] to God I give my soul forever. Matthew Mark Luke and Jogn God bless the bed that I lay on. There are four corners on this bed there are four angels over head and I may sleep and I cannot see sweet Jesus look down and comfort me. Jesus within me and Jesus without me. I see Jesus on Mary knee begging the great God of [?] Trinity let no real spirit betray me Amen.In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I lay myself down to rest. Bless me Oh Lord defend and govern me and after the short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness Amen.Oh ANgel of God to thy Holy care I am committed. Enlighten and direct me defend and govern me this day from all sin and danger.Infant Jesus meek
(continues on next page)

5009318/5006815/5134042.title: Old Prayers
5009318/5006815/5134042.text:
The following prayers may be said at any time _O Jesus Christ, my God andmy Redeemer,  I trust in Thee, in ThyHeart, in all, for all, in spite of all and forever,Amen.__________O, Mary, my Mother and my hope,Under Thy Mantle I take  refuge,There will I live and die,Deliver me from sin and grant meThy Holy Blessing.I know that I must die,but I do not know how, where norwhen, but if I die in mortal sin,I am lost forever.  Sacred Heart of Jesus have mercy on me a sinner.__________The following prayer is said to invoke Our Lady's help in any under taking -Our Lady, our Queen and my Mother, in the name of Jesus, for
(continues on next page)

5009312/5006529/5134442.title: A Collection of Prayers
5009312/5006529/5134442.text:
The following prayers are said when going to bed.Here I lie down on my bed to sleep,That God may take my soul to keep,If any evil come to harm me,Blessed Lady, Queen of Heaven, awaken me.Christ's Cross upon my breastI turn myself to Jesus Christ,Jesus Christ and His Holy name,May keep me out of sin and shame.As I lay my head on this bed to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,When I rise, now or never,I give my soul to God forever.There are four corners of this bed.Four bright angels over-spread.Mark and Matt, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,If any evil comes to me,O, Blessed Virgin, awaken me.God almighty and the Blessed Virgin Mary,And Her only Son Jesus,Guard me and bring me safe over the night.
(continues on next page)

5009325/5007245/5134714.title: A Prayer of Olden Days
5009325/5007245/5134714.text: An old beggar woman used to go from house to house looking for lodgings.  She often spent a night in his father's house in Templesheelin, where she slept on a couch beside the fire.  She was a very pious old woman, and prayed fervently for those who gave her alms.Every morning, on getting up, she used to say this prayer."Good morning, day,Jesus guide me the right way,That God may keep me fromsin and shame,I'll arise to-day God's name."
5009325/5007245/5134714.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Ros Mhic Treóin

5044728/5034975/5135132.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044728/5034975/5135132.text:
Little King,Little King so fair and sweet,See us gathered at thy feet,Be the monarch of our school;It shall flourish 'neath thy rule,We will be they subjects true;Brave to suffer, brave to do,All our hearts to thee we bringTake thorn, keep them, Little KingHere is another prayer when starting workMorning Offering,O Jesus, through the most pure heart,Of Mary, I offer thee, all the prayers,Works and sufferings, of this day,For all the intentions,Of thy-divine heart,And Holy MassHere is a prayer to be said when lying down in bed.As I lie down upon my side,I pray thee, O God to be my guide,There is four corners on this bed,Four holy angels around it spread
(continues on next page)

5044728/5034984/5135152.title: (no title)
5044728/5034984/5135152.text: There are not very many prayers known now as they are nearly all in books.This is a prayer to be said when entering a church.Sprinkle me Lord with hysopWash me and I will be made whiter then snow.This prayer should be said before going to bed.O Angel of GodMy Guardian dearTo whom His love commits me hereEver this night be at my sideTo light and guardTo rule and guide.  Amen.Most people say the Rosary at night before retiring.That is a lovely prayer, it is an old Irish tradition and one of the loveliest of prayers to be said

5044729/5035006/5135232.title: Prayers
5044729/5035006/5135232.text: Four corners on my bed, four Angels on my spread, Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John God bless the bed that I lie on, if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take, any evil troubles me, our blessed Lady waken me, and when I go to bed I hope to sleep for God knows will I rise.  May the Lord defend and protect me and from me not take his eyes.Five bleeding wounds are nailed to a treeO merciful Jesus have mercy on me.God grant the light of heaven on all the poor souls on the last day.When people are working during the day people say;  Jesus Mary and Joseph make me stronger every day.  Before they get in to bed at night they say "Lord give me a good night's rest."This prayer is said in the morning." O my Jesus meek and mild,Let me be your little child.Let me till the day is done,Every sinful danger shun."

5009339/5008536/5135257.title: Old Sayings
5009339/5008536/5135257.text:
(continued from previous page)
A tousled head was "like a bewitched barley stack".Anything lopsided as "all to one side like the handle of a can".The fox never sent a better messenger than himself.Story & Proverb:- She used to tell of an old man who lived alone called Brian Quigley.  Discovering traces of a rat in his kitchen he decided he'd live & let live, so instead of setting a trap for it, he often left scraps of food for it.  It became as tame that it often ran around the kitchen unmolested.  One night he left his freshly greased "brogues" at the fire to "soften" - to find in the morning that one had been chewed by the rat.  That night he set a trap and killed it.  A person who presumed too much was warned by Granny to remember Brian Quigley's rat.PrayersOn seeing new potatoes:- Thank God for the new food.On putting out the light:- The light of heaven to usWhen I found a needle on the floor:- God leave you your eyesight.On hearing the clock strike:- another hour of my life has passed Lord Jesus! receive my last.On hearing ill news (Crossing herself) The sign of the Holy Cross between us and all hurt and harm!On hearing the loss of an animal:- All the hurt and harm of the year go with it!We had to offer up all our good works "For the poor suffering souls, especially for our own nearest and dearest".Her observance of the Sabbath was very strict - one doesn't cut one's

5044732/5035130/5135445.title: Collection of Prayers
5044732/5035130/5135445.text: Oh, holy mother pierce me throughIn my soul each wound renewof my Saviour Crucified.God bless the work. Said to people working.Old people whether there was sorrow or joy  on them always said."Thanks be to God for everything he sends.A person on going into a house always said God bless all here.No person went out on the morning without blessing himself with holy water

5044712/5033636/5135956.title: Old Prayer to Our Blessed Lady
5044712/5033636/5135956.text: My Queen and my Mother, to day I offer thee myself without any reserve, and give to thee, my love, and devotion. I consecrate to thee this day, my eyes, my ears, my heart, and my whole person. Since I belong to thee, O, my good Mother. Since I prefer thee above all persons. O' Holy, Saint Joseph, chaste Spouse of Mary, obtain for me a pure humble mind, and give me grace to die in the arms of Jesus. Oh; most Clement Jesus lover of Saints, I beseech Thee by the minister of the most Sacred Heart, and the door of the Immaculate Mother, cleanse in thy Son's pure blood, Sinners of the world in their agony, and all to die this day, Oh; agonising Heart of Jesus, pity on dying.Amen.Morning Offering.Direct we beseech Thee O' Lord, our actions by Thy holy inspirations, and carry them on with the greatest affections, that every prayer, and good work of ours, may begin always from Thee, and by Thee be happily ended, through the same Christ Our Lord.Amen.

5044712/5033638/5135961.title: Old Irish Prayer
5044712/5033638/5135961.text: Open to me Thy Sacred Heart, O Jesus. Show me its charms and unite me with It for ever. May every breath and pulsation of my heart, whether sleeping or waking, be a testimony of my love for Thee, and May I say to Thee unceasingly. "Yes Lord I love Thee. Accept the little good I do. Give me grace to amend my evil ways, so that I may live with You eternally in Heaven.

5044714/5033738/5136058.title: Ancient Prayers
5044714/5033738/5136058.text:
There were many prayers which the ancient people of Ireland used to recite at certain times, such as in the morning and at night. These prayers are still recited in many old Catholic homesteads throughout the country. There are also many stories about priests in religion in former times which I heard told by the old people in my district. This is one of them.There was once a priest who was going on horseback to visit a sick person in his parish. He used to go across a field and through a Protestant man's yard for a short cutOne evening the man who owned the field met the priest at the yard gate and said, "get out of my yard as quick as possible and do not let me see you
(continues on next page)

5009128/4989486/5136384.title: Collection of Prayers
5009128/4989486/5136384.text:
Starting to plough people say, "God bless this land. When in trouble people say, "O Heart of Jesus bruised for our offences, on Thee we call." When starting on a long journey people say, "Fair home of everlasting love."



This prayer is said when getting into bed, "O God I give thee thanks for having a bed to lie down on." After meals the following prayer is said, "Thanks be to God for having that bit to eat." When a cow calves people say, "God bless the caff."



This is a prayer that is generally said before going to bed, "As I walked out on the Holy Land I met  the blessed Virgin Mary. Seven mass books in her hand, seven candles lit, seven priests singing, seven bells ringing. The Lamb of God shut the gates of hell and open the gates of heaven and let this poor soul in for this one night and for ever more "Amen". When people are passing those that are working they say, "God Bless the work." and the workers answer "And you too". Going into a house at night people say, "God save all here." The people inside[?] say, "God save you kindly". A person getting milk from his neighbour says, "God bless the cow." People says, "God bless us when in danger

metadata.Teacher:: Ml Mc Garry, Alice Mc Garry

5009128/4989487/5136388.title: Collection of Prayers
5009128/4989487/5136388.text:
IVIf a person was getting milk from his neighbour he would say "God bless the cow." On entering into a house people say "God save all here." When a person is going away on a journey, another person will say "God be with you" When a person is passing where there is work going on he says "God bless the work. "If a person got anything new the people would say "When you may wear". In the morning when people arise they say. "That God may bring me safe through the dangers of the day."



Before going to sleep at night the following prayers said, "Hail I lay me down to sleep. I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil spirit come near me O blessed Virgin Mary waken me and save me. There are four corners on my bed there are four angels over head.Mathew Mark Luke and John, God bless this bed I lie upon as I go to my bed as I go to my grave. Beginning of thee my soul for thee to save. Bright queen of heaven to be my flowers. O Jesus Mary and Joseph may I breath forth my soul in peace with you. Amen"

metadata.Teacher:: Ml Mc Garry, Alice Mc Garry

5009128/4989488/5136392.title: Collection of Prayers
5009128/4989488/5136392.text:
IILong ago it was the custom after mass in the chapels for about fifteen men to come in and chant and these were called Office Men. Each man had a book called an Office Book and they used chant the Office out of it. It was carried on in the same way as the high masses are carried on now-a-days. Every chanter had to get the office chanted in his house every year. They used to put a table on the middle of the floor and put four candles and a crucifix on it. Then they used kneel around the table and read the office in turn. At the end of the office they used read the Litany in Latin. When a person would
(continues on next page)

metadata.Teacher:: Ml Mc Garry, Alice Mc Garry

5009128/4989489/5136394.title: Collection of Prayers
5009128/4989489/5136394.text:
(continued from previous page)
die in a house the chanters would go to that house and go back in four weeks and chant again. The names of the office men were Michael Lynam, John Carty, William Sheil, Michael Moran, Patrick Moran, Michael Cullen, John Cunningham, Patrick Tracey, William Tracey, John Henson, Patrick Feeney, William Carty, Joseph Farrell, Peter Elliot, Thomas Moran, Anthony Duncan.



When anybody spills milk he says, "God bless us somebody wants it." Before plowing people say, "Ge up in the name of God and His Blessed Mother."

metadata.Teacher:: Ml Mc Garry, Alice Mc Garry

5044746/5035945/5137329.title: Old Prayers
5044746/5035945/5137329.text: For the toothache - St. Peter sat on a marble stoneOur Saviour came to him alone"Peter" said He, "what troubles thee?""The toothache my Lord" said he."Now rise up Peter and come with meAnd the toothache shall not trouble thee".A prayer in bed - God bless Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that i lie onThere are four corners on my bedThere are four angels o'er me spreadTwo at my head, two at my feetAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to keepWaken now or waken neverI pray to God my to keep forever.

5044750/5036261/5137703.title: Local Ruins
5044750/5036261/5137703.text:
In Cill Scadh Urlsír is still to be seen the ruin of the church-yard



Here I lay down my head to sleep.To Almighty God I give my  soul to keep. There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels over me spread.One to guard me, one to guide me, Two to carry my soul to Heaven.Mathew Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.

5044753/5036400/5138165.title: Prayers
5044753/5036400/5138165.text:
When our Saviour went to be crucified he trembled and shook. The Jews asked him was he afraid he answered and said I am not afraid of Fever, Eager or the Fits.His Angel Mother standing by with a heavy heart and a weeping eye.Saying those who repeat those words five times either by night or by day shall never die in mortal sin or hells fire to enter in Amen.A Prayer to be said after the Angelus.We offer up this Holy Angelus in honour of the blessed and Holy Incarnation of You my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ and for the suffering Souls in Purgatory especially the ones that were most devoted to the Angelus while on earth. Amen.I got these Prayers from an old Woman.
(continues on next page)

5044578/5023675/5138756.title: Prayers
5044578/5023675/5138756.text:
As I laid myself down to rest I gave my soul to God to keep, There are four corners on my bed there are four angels overspread, Matthew, mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on,As I go to my bed as I go to my grave the lord that knows that I shall wake,And if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul may he take.Into thy hands Oh! Lord; lord Jesus receive my soul,Lord by thy branch, lady by the flower,Sweet Jesus, Mary and Joseph be with me at my dying hour,(Said when going to bed at night).
(continues on next page)

5044579/5023704/5138804.title: Night Prayer
5044579/5023704/5138804.text:
Here  on my bed my limbs I lay,God give me strength my prayers to sayO God! preserve my mother dear,In health and strength for many a year,And O! preserve my father tooThere are four corners on my bed,
(continues on next page)



St Peter sat on a marble stone,Christ came to him and he all alone,"What ails thee Peter? said He,"The Toothache!"Rise Peter: and I shall cure thy acheWhoever says this prayer in right and in mind an for My sake Shall never be troubled with the toothache

5044774/5037253/5139207.title: Prayers
5044774/5037253/5139207.text:
I rise from this bed of sleep to adore one God and to adore but him alone may I rise on the Last Day to life ever lasting.When clothing sayO my Jesus clothe my soul with the robe of Charity and may I wear it pure and undefiled before the Judgement Seat. When in bed sayI fold my arms in the shape of a cross and say I must die, I do not know where when or how but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever. My Jesus have mercy on me. If any evil happens me may the Blessed Virgin come and waken me. O lord be the Branch O Lady be the FlowerO Sweet Jesus be at my dying hour.There are four corners on my bed there are four angels at my head. Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John, God bless this bed that I lie on, and if I die before I wake to God I give my soul to keep. In our district when lighting a lamp we say God give us the light of Heaven.
(continues on next page)
5044774/5037253/5139207.school_info: School: Holy Faith Convent, Newtownmount Kennedy

5044774/5037254/5139208.title: Prayers
5044774/5037254/5139208.text:
(continued from previous page)
When preparing foodGod give us a love for Holy Communion.The above prayers are said by the people of Newtownmountkennedy district



In our home when the clock strikes we say the following prayer:-This hour I give to thee O Lord, and for the past O pardon me I know my soul must soon depart so hide me in thy Sacred Heart.:-
5044774/5037254/5139208.school_info: School: Holy Faith Convent, Newtownmount Kennedy

5044598/5024821/5139338.title: Prayers
5044598/5024821/5139338.text:
34Prayersthe following prayer is said before going to bedGod be the branchJesus the flowerJesus be with me my dying hour.If bad evil tempt me,O Sweet Saviour waken meOn my right hand God bless meMatthew, Mark Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.There are four corners in my bedThere are four angels overspreadAnd if I die before I wakeI got myself to God to take.The following prayer is said before going to bed:-O Angel of God, my guardian dearTo whom God's love commits me hereEver this night be at my sideTo light and guard to rule and guide.The following prayer is said in the morning:-
(continues on next page)

5044596/5024670/5139979.title: Prayer to Be Said When in Bed at Night
5044596/5024670/5139979.text: There are four corners on my bed. On the same four angels spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on. And if I die before I awake. I pray to God my soul to take.

5044613/5025879/5140621.title: Prayers
5044613/5025879/5140621.text:
As I knew down to you my darling Saviour and to the Blessed Mother of Jesus, I put myself under thy holy care and protection.  I offer myself and my prayers to thee my losses and crosses to thee my griefs on my troubles to thee and although I am born to go through in this life and I beseech thee to accept them through the hands of thy divine son Jesus. Amen.



O spotless Virgin pray for me that your son Jesus I may see and all my trial that you may be O spotless Virgin pray for me.  O Mary my mother and Jesus my King crown me with glory and free me from sin. God bless me in this day's work I am going to begin. O holy Mary Queen of Charity pray for me that I may never die in mortal sin. Amen.

metadata.Address: Cor More and Cor Beg, Co. Offaly

5044613/5025879/5140622.text:

I offer myself and my prayers to thee my losses and crosses to thee my griefs on my troubles to thee and although I am born to go through in this life and I beseech thee to accept them through the hands of thy divine son Jesus. O Mary my mother and Jesus my King crown me with glory and free me from sin. God bless me in this day's work I am going to begin. metadata.Address: Cor More and Cor Beg, Co. Offaly

5044613/5025880/5140623.title: Prayers
5044613/5025880/5140623.text:
Infant Jesus meek and mild. Look on me a little child Pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee  Heart of Jesus I adore. Heart of Mary I implore thee Heart of Joseph pure and just. in these three hearts I placed my trust.



Oh King of the Fridays whose limbs were stretched on the cross. Oh Lord thou didst suffer the bruises the wounds and the loss. We stretch ourselves beneath the shield of thy might May some fruit of the tree of Thy passion fall on us this night. Here I lie down upon my right side. I pray to God to be my guide. If I die before I wake I prayed to God my soul to take. There are four corners on my bed I hope there are four blessed Angels around me spread Sts Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. God bless me on this bed I lie on. Lady be the branch, Lord be the Flower, Jesus, Mary and Joseph assist me in my last dying hour. Amen.

metadata.Address: Cor More and Cor Beg, Co. Offaly

5044613/5025880/5140624.title: Prayers
5044613/5025880/5140624.text:
Infant Jesus meek and mild. Look on me a little child Pity mine and pity me and suffer me to come to thee  Heart of Jesus I adore. Heart of Mary I implore thee Heart of Joseph pure and just. in these three hearts I placed my trust.



Oh King of the Fridays whose limbs were stretched on the cross. Oh Lord thou didst suffer the bruises the wounds and the loss. We stretch ourselves beneath the shield of thy might May some fruit of the tree of Thy passion fall on us this night. Here I lie down upon my right side. I pray to God to be my guide. If I die before I wake I prayed to God my soul to take. There are four corners on my bed I hope there are four blessed Angels around me spread Sts Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. God bless me on this bed I lie on. Lady be the branch, Lord be the Flower, Jesus, Mary and Joseph assist me in my last dying hour. Amen.

metadata.Address: Cor More and Cor Beg, Co. Offaly

5044614/5025973/5140965.title: Prayers
5044614/5025973/5140965.text:
In the morning:I thank thee sacred heart of JesusFor rising me safely from my bed,and guard me from all danger for the day Lighting the fire:O Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews, Preserve me from a sudden and a unprepared death.At Midday:Infinite Jesus meek and mildLook on me a little child,Put thy gracious hand on me and Make me what I ought to be Going to Bed:Here I lie down to sleepI give my soul to god to keepand if I die before I wakeI pray to god my soul to keep.There are four corners to my bedFour angels here to spreadSt. Matthew, Mark Luke and JohnGod Bless this bed that I lie onIf any danger some near meO Blessed Virgin pray for me.
(continues on next page)

5044617/5026326/5141278.title: Prayers
5044617/5026326/5141278.text:
O Eternal Father I offer thee the Precious Blood of Jesus in every consecrated Host all over the world in thanksgiving for all the blessings conferred on St Peter of Alcantara to obtain the intention of this Novena.  (This prayer when recited ten times daily has never been known to fail).Bridget Egan, Told to her by her father Francis Egan, 65 yrs Aughinacabe



Oh Angel of God, my guardian dear, to whom Gods love commits me here, ever this night be at my side,To light, to guard, to rule and guide.God of the branch, Lady of the flower, O Sweet Jesus be with me at my dying hour.Katie FlanneryTold by her father, Cearan Flannery.Creevagh 60 yrs.



God of the branch, Lady of the flower, O Sweet Jesus be with me at my dying hour.

As I lie down on my bed to sleep I pray to God my soul to keep,If any evil happens me I pray to God to waken me,There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels over head.Mathew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on,and if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take



I arise myself this morning from bed of sleep to adore my God and labour for the salvation of my soul. O may I rise on the last day to life everlasting.Oh my God clothe my soul with the mupitalroles of charity.Grant that I may wear them pure and undefiled before the judgment sea of God



Jesus my God to you I pray, Direct and Guard me every day,Be my protector I implore,
(continues on next page)

"My God, I am on your side,Keep me there,My face is turned towards you,Nearer let me turn awayMy heart and hands are stretched towards you,Sraw me daily more and more.I give Thee of my seed to sow,Bringest Thou to me a hundred-fold?Can I look up, with face aglow,And answer, "Father, here is gold".

5044617/5026349/5141294.title: Riddles
5044617/5026349/5141294.text:
(continued from previous page)
What is that which occurs once in every minute, twice in every moment but not once in a year? (Answer): The letter M.What goes round the house, and round the house and never touches the house? (Answer): A lazy womanWhy is a policeman like an aeroplane? (Answer): They both take people upWhat nation does a criminal dread most? (Answer): Condemnation.Why is milk like dancing? (Answer): Because it strengthens the calves



What is that which occurs once in every minute, twice in every moment but not once in a year? (Answer): The letter M.What goes round the house, and round the house and never touches the house? (Answer): A lazy womanWhy is a policeman like an aeroplane? (Answer): They both take people upWhat nation does a criminal dread most? (Answer): Condemnation. Why is milk like dancing? (Answer): Because it strengthens the calvesA Prayer.I throw myself into the arms of Jesus, and into the arms of the three highest angels in Heaven, to guard, guide, protect me at home and abroad, asleep and awake, ghostly and bodily, visible and invisible, from the denial the world and the flesh.

5044664/5030198/5141418.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044664/5030198/5141418.text:
No. 1 "God bless the work"This prayer is used when people pass by a field where there are men working.No. 2 "Jesus Mary and Joseph be with you on your way"This prayer is said when people are going on a journeyNo. 3 "May your Guardian Angel be with you"That is also used when people go on a journeyNo. 4. "God bless the mark"This prayer is said when people talk about a disease that another person has.No. 5. "God bless the hand"This prayer is said by a poor man  going around begging alms.No. 6. "God bless the family all together"This prayer is said also by a poor man going around begging alms.No 7. "Good night and a good nights rest."This prayer is said when a person is going to bedNo 8. "Much good may it do you"This is said by a person when he goes into a house where the people are eating.No. 9. "God Rest his soul"This prayer is said for the deadNo. 10 "Lord have mercy on him"This is another prayer for the dead
(continues on next page)

5044660/5029621/5141467.title: Prayer
5044660/5029621/5141467.text: There are four corners on my bed, four Angels over my head, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless this bed that I lie on, and if I should die and nee'r awake, I give my soul for God to take.Amen.

5044618/5026545/5141641.title: Local Prayers
5044618/5026545/5141641.text:
1. Blessed Mary meek and mild,Guide me as you did your child,Fill my heart full with grace,That I may meet  your blessed face.2. Here I lie myself to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,If any evil crosses me,The Blessed Virgin waken me,If I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to (keep) take,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels round it spread,Saint Matthew, Mark, Saint Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on.3. Jesus of Nazareth King of the JewsPreserve me from a sudden and unprovided death,In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ  crucified.I lie down to rest,Bless me O Lord defend and govern me.
(continues on next page)

5044627/5027215/5141832.title: Old Prayers
5044627/5027215/5141832.text:
There are only a few old prayers known in this district  My grandmother learned some of them in her early days and she taught them to my mother. This is one that can be said in the morning: -"God and His Blessed Mother may guide me,God may save my sisters and brothers,God may save myself.Heart of Jesus I imploreTo love Thee daily more and more,Great God I adore and honour Thee,I acknowledge Thee to be my Creator and Sovereign Lord,
(continues on next page)

5044627/5027219/5141835.title: Old Prayers
5044627/5027219/5141835.text:
There are a few old prayers known round this district at the present time. But my grandfather knew some old prayers which he learnt when he was young, and my father learnt them from him. The following prayer was said when getting up in the morning: - "Good morning, good Jesus,Good morning, bright day, Jesus direct me on the right way.May soul to serve,My body from shame,Arise and get up in God's holy name."This prayer could be said any part of the day: -
(continues on next page)

5044627/5027221/5141836.title: Old Prayers
5044627/5027221/5141836.text:
There are very few of the old prayers in use or known at the present time. This is one to be said when going to bed at night: - "As I lie down my right hand side,I pray to God to be my guide,And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take,If any evil comes to me,Blessed Lady waken me,There are four corners on this bed, There are four Angels on its spread,Matthew, Mark Luke and John,God bless me on this bed that I lie on."
(continues on next page)

5044620/5026709/5142238.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044620/5026709/5142238.text:
There is a prayer which the old people say.  When they get into bed at night while waiting to go to sleep:-"As I lie on my right hand sideI pray to God to be my guideIf any evil touches meO blessed Mother awaken me,If I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeThere are four corners on my bed And there four Angels round me spreadMathew, Martin, Luke and JohnGod bless me on this bed that I lie on".Amen.This is a prayer which used be said on awakening in the morning:-When the eastern sky is redI must raise my little headWhen the lark sings loud and gayI must rise with him and pray.Jesus when I first arise
(continues on next page)

5044629/5027530/5142407.title: Old Prayers
5044629/5027530/5142407.text:
The old people long ago had a lot of nice prayers. The following are some of them.1. It was on Good Friday our beautiful Saviour was crucified He died and he was buried He died nailed to a Cross with a crown of thorns pressed to his head. The Jews came with a sharp spear and speared our Blessed Saviour through his
(continues on next page)

5044622/5026775/5142511.title: Folklore - Prayers
5044622/5026775/5142511.text: Mary my mother and my hope, I take refuge under thy mantle there I live and die deliver me from sin and grant me thy holy blessing. (at night)      As I lie down to sleep my soul.      There are four corners on my bed.       There are four angels overspread.       Matthew, Mark, Luke @ John        Bless the bed I lie on.        If I die before I wake         I pray to God my soul to take.(on Sighting the lamp.)       The light of Heaven may shine on my soul.(On kindling the fire)          Kindle my soul in sanctifying grace "O Lord"(If were getting milk from a person)             "God bless the cow"(When finishing work in the evening)              "So much done for Gods sake."

5044567/5023051/5143033.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044567/5023051/5143033.text: A collection of prayers.When going to sleep at night this prayer is generally said;Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels lying spread.If I die before I awake,I pray to God my soul to take.If any evil comes to me,The Lord my God shall waken me. Before Holy Communion;Dearest Jesus come to me,Oh, how much I long for Thee,Come to my poor soul to-day,Teach me how to love and pray,Jesus, Jesus, come to me,A thousand times I welcome Thee.

5044567/5023053/5143041.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044567/5023053/5143041.text: 108A collection of prayers\When gong to bed at night:-Here I lay down upon my bed to sleep,To God I give my should to keep,There are four corners of my bed,There are four angels to light and spread,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on,If any evil comes to me,I pray Blessed Lady waken me,And if I die before I wake,I pray to God my sold to take.Some people say the end of the prayer different they say:If any evil spirit comes to me,I pray to God my woes to see,And my right hand to bless myself. Amen.When a person would be going a journey he would say:- "God grant me a safe journey" and on the rest used say, God grant or Amen. When going past the graveyard they used say, "God grant eternal rest to them".Kathleen Carey,Clonsast,Rathangan,Co. OffalyGor fromMrs. Thomas Carey,Clonsast,Rathangan,Co. Offaly.

5044637/5028214/5143530.title: Old Prayers
5044637/5028214/5143530.text:
These are some of the prayers I say when I lie down in bed.As I lie down on my right side I pray to God to be my guide and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take. I lay my body down to rest I pray to god to be my Guide if any evil come to me O sweet Jesus comfort me. There is four corners on my bed there
(continues on next page)

5044640/5028354/5143939.title: Local Prayers
5044640/5028354/5143939.text: P prayers to be said before going to bed.  Here I lay me down to sleep I pray to God my soul to keep and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to takeThere are four corners on this bed there are four angels on its spread. Mathew Mark Luke and John God bless the bed that I lie on. Jesus the branch and Mary the flower Jesus sweet Jesus be with me this first and last hour where ever I go and where ever I be my heart and my soul I give up to the five bleeding wounds nailed to a tree. Merciful Jesus have mercy on me. I throw myself into the hands of Jesus, and the twelve most powerful angels in heaven to save me and guard me at home and abroad within and without visible and invisible. Three the worst enemies the devil the world and the flesh.

When candle lamp etc was lightedThe light of Heaven to our souls!Entering a house: God save all here!Answer: God save you kindlyWhen a person telling of another or of a family stricken with fever (after the famine) he always added:God bless the hearer!God almighty save us from all harm, accidents & dangers, from sin, shame & scandal & from a sudden or unprovided death!A morning prayer which Mrs. Hynes, Courtnellan taught to her daughter Kathleen:Father, we thank Thee for the night,

5044668/5030595/5144010.title: Prayers Heard Locally
5044668/5030595/5144010.text:
O Jesus, dear Holy Child, my only treasure, I abandon myself to thy every wish.  I seek no other joy than that of calling forth thy sweet smile.  Vouchsafe to give me the graces and virtues of thy holy childhood so that on the day of my birth into Heaven the Angels and Saints may recognise thy Child.O Most holy Heart of Jesus, Fountain of all good.  I adore thee, I love thee and being deeply sorry for my sins, I offer thee this my poor heart.  Make it humble, patient, pure, and in all things conformed to thy desires.  Grant O God, that I may live in thee and for thee Protect me in dangers console me in affliction, give me health of body, assistance in my temporal needs, thy blessing in all my undertakings and the grace of a holy death.
(continues on next page)

5044668/5030598/5144011.title: Prayers Heard Locally
5044668/5030598/5144011.text:
Prayer before returningOpen to me Thy sacred Heart, O Jesus, Show me its charms and unite with it for ever.  May every breath and every pulsation of my heart be to Thee a testimony of my love and say to Thee unceasingly.  "Yes Lord I love thee".  Accept the little good I do.  Grant me grace to repair my evil ways that I may praise Thee in time and bless Thee for all eternity.Prayer for the dying.Amonising Heart of Jesus have mercy on the dying.Prayer said every morning and night.O mother of Jesus, I give you my eyes, my ears, my mind, and my heart.Prayer before lessons.Our Lady, our Queen, and our Mother. The old people have many beautiful prayers which have never appeared in print.  Some these prayers are.Prayers when going to bed.There are four corners on my bed.  There are four angels overspread.  Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.  If God take my soul before I sleep.  I pray to God my soul to keep.  And if God take my soul before I wake.  I pray to God my soul to take.  Oh Lord bless this bed I am going to be on and bless this sleep I am going to take.  Sweet Mary my mother be Thou at my head. 5044671/5030886/5144942.title: Old Traditional Prayers
5044671/5030886/5144942.text:
1 Prayer of ConsolationWhen you are weighed down with care,Seek the peace of God with Prayer,Your duty do, show your sincere,And he will help you never fear.So when by trouble you are oppressed,Trust all in him for he knows best,Be of good heart and lilt a song,What need you care if you do no wrong.2Suffer me to taste of Thee,In my life's last agony,O King, O loving One.O Sweetest Jesus, Mary's Son.3When the Great Master calls and you rise to answer your name,You will not not be asked whether you won or lost,But how you played the Game.
(continues on next page)

5044677/5031141/5145095.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044677/5031141/5145095.text:
A Collection of Prayers 15-12- '37Every nation on the earth has special prayers peculiar to its people but Ireland surpasses all in its collection of prayers. The following are some prayers which I collected from my mother and some neighbours.Morning Prayers -(1) O' my God my only good the author of my being in my last end I give Thee my Heart. Praise honour and glory be to Thee for ever and ever Amen.(2) I arise from this bed of sleep. To adore my God and to labour for the Salvation of my own soul. Oh, may I arise on the Last Day to live ever-lasting Amen.
(continues on next page)



When turning out the light at night this prayer is said:-(3)  "Sight and light of the heavens be to us"When going on a journey people say "God speed you"When eating the Christmas dinner people say may I be alive and well this time twelve months" Night Prayers. In my little bed I lie looking upwards to the sky Jesus Christ is
(continues on next page)

5044685/5031853/5145380.title: A Collection of Prayers
5044685/5031853/5145380.text:
1. My God I thank you for your love & every good gift you give me. Make me kind & good so that some day I can be with you. 2. Jesus tender Shepherd hear me. Bless Thy little child. This night through the darkness be Thou near me. Keep me safe till morning light. All this day Thy hand has led me & I thank Thee for Thy care. Thou hast warmed clothed & fed me,Listen to my evening prayer.Let my sins be all forgiven,Bless the friends I love so well
(continues on next page)

5044690/5032430/5145441.title: Prayers Collected by Children from Old People in Locality
5044690/5032430/5145441.text:
Prayers Collected by Children from Old People in Locality23How long, O' Lord we spend our days in vice and evil ways. Truly now we must repent through the blessings of Lent."May the Almighty God save us from sudden or unprovided death". May the Almighty God and His Blessed Mother save us from the tongues of our enemies in both soul + body.Here I lay me down to sleep, I give my soul to God to keep. If any evil comes on me, Christ Jesus comfort me.There are four corners on my bed. There are four Angels on them spread. Mathew, Mark, Luke + John come bless the bed that I lay on."The light of Heaven to us when we die" on quenching light."When I lie down on my right side. That Jesus Christ may be my Guide If I die before I wake, I pray to God my soul to take.In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ Crucified I lay myself down to rest. Bless O' Lord protect + govern us this night + forever and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring us to eternal life. Amen.Oh! Divine Jesus. Lonely to-night in so many tabernacles without a visitor or a worshipper. I offer Thee my lowly heart may its every beat be an act of praise towards Thee. in thy love, Thou never sleepest and Thou art never weary of Thy vigil for sinners. Oh! Lonely Jesus. Oh! Loving Jesus! may my heart be a lamp, the light of which shall beam and beam for Thee alone for time and eternity. Watch Sacramental Sentinel. Watch for the wearly world, the erring soul and Thy poor lonely child. Amen.
(continues on next page)

5044690/5032439/5145589.title: Prayer to Our Lady for a Happy Death
5044690/5032439/5145589.text: Oh! Holy Virgin I know I shall one day die and perhaps that day may soon arrive. If ever I wanted your assistance it will be in these last moments, when the enemies of my salvation will re-double their efforts for my ruin.  All through life you have honoured me with your protection, loaded me with your favours. You have been my mother and after God my all. Surely you will not abandon me in that dreadful hour.  With all the earnestness of my Soul I beseech you to come to my aid to defend me in that last combat (when the enemies of my sal)  The remainder is forgotten.

5009263/5002751/5146959.title: Prayers
5009263/5002751/5146959.text: The following are some prayers never printed in paper.When getting up in the morning say,Blessed by the hour that Jesus was born,Peace to the living and rest to the deadMerciful Jesus have mercy on me,My soul and my body I give unto thee.Though the five Sacred Wounds that hung on a tree,O merciful Jesus have mercy on me.The old people usually when the clock strikes, Bless themselves and say,Another hour of my life has passed Sweet Jesus be with me at the last.When starting to churn they say,Here we go in the name of God.Another prayer isThere are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over head.Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.If any evil come to me, Holy Mother waken me.

5009263/5002752/5146960.title: Prayers
5009263/5002752/5146960.text: When passing by a crucifix -"Oh Lord my God by suffering rent,Nailed on the Cross my love to gain,Grant through Thy Cross, when life is spentIn Death, Thy Mercy may I obtain."When taking Holy Water -"By the sprinkling of Thy Precious BloodO Lord Jesus, by the Merits of ThySacred Passion wash me from every stain and cleanse my soul from all sin.When genuflecting -"We adore Thee oh Lord Jesus Christ andwe bless Thee here and at all the world,because by Thy Holy Cross and PassionThou hast redeemed the world."

5009263/5002753/5146962.title: Prayers
5009263/5002753/5146962.text: ' Pity me and Pity mine,Suffer me to come to Thine,Heart of Mary,  I adore theeHeart of Jesus,  I implore Thee,Heart of Joseph,  pure and just,In these three Hearts I place my trust".-------Before retiring -" I lay my body down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,And if I die, before I wakeI pray to God, my soul to take."-------Now I sign the Blessed token,Fold my arms upon my breast,May Jesus' name be the last word spoken,Ere I gently sink to rest.-------

5009263/5002754/5146966.title: Prayers
5009263/5002754/5146966.text: "The night before the glorious Tidings,The Blessed Virgin on her guideA long time in the townSeeking up and down,The Chamber couldn't be found,Twas in an asse's mangerThe Queen of Heaven lay.It was on Good Friday before noon the Jewscame up with their spears so sharp,And pierced our Saviour through the heartOur Blessed lady standing by,With a heavy heart and a doleful sigh.Saying good Christmas sayThis five times by night or day,And you shall never enter hell's fire.

4921578/4881377/5147146.text: Ceithre cúinne ar mo leabaigCeithre haspoil ortha sanMarcuis agus Lúcas, Seamus, agus SeánGabhaim Dia mar athairIs Muire mar MháthairFlaitheas Dé mar dhúthaig Is diúlthuighum don áirseóirTar a Mhichíl agus glac mo lámhDein mo siothcháin le Mac DéIs má tá Liúicifar ar mo thíDo sgiath a Mhichíl idir mé is éA Mhic a chuaidh sa chrannAgus do dort orainne fuil Do bhallSin é chúghainn an tamA thíghearna ná leig ár nanama i ngeallNár thughaidh Dia dhuit an bháis, ná gearra bháis, ná bás oban, ná báis in aon pheaca de's na seacht bpeacaí marbhthacha acht deagh bháis, deagh lá agus an ola coisrighthe i ngrádh Dé agus na gcómharsan.

This prayer is said to have been found in the 102 on a stone where our Lord was buried and is locally known by the name:Sceul LuarachO Adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ,Who died on the Cross to save us,O holy Cross of Christ, see us safe through,O holy Cross of Christ, ward off all weapons of danger.O holy Cross of Christ, ward off from all sharp repeated words.O holy Cross of Christ, ward off from us all things that are evil,O holy Cross of Christ, protect us from our enemiesO holy Cross of Christ, guide us the right way to happinessO holy Cross of Christ, ward off from use all dangerous deaths,And give us life always.O crucified Jesus of Nazareth, have mercy on us now, and for evermore.O Blessed Mother of God, intercede for us poor sinnersIn honour of our Lord Jesus Christ.
(continues on next page)

Céad moladh mór leat a rí na ngrást bás naomhtha agus saor bhrietheamhantais trí thrócaire Dé go bhfaighid ár n-anam.Fuascailt ar na h-anama atá folug na bpianta bpurgadóireacht agus anam mhairb Caitilicidhe an domhain mar órdúigear Dia agus an eaglais dúinn guidhe leo agus ár nanam fhéin ar uair a bháis.
