Paidir ba TromluidheÍosa, Aon Mhic Athair Mhic a thuain, bí im thimpal im' choinleach, im aire ins gach uain, im luidhe dhom, im shuidhe dhom, im chodhladh is im shuain, i ndíbirt gach smaointe mallaighthe uaim.                             2Anna, máthair Mhuire, Muire máthair Chríost, Eibhlis ó Máire mathair Naomh Eoin Baiste, Cuirim a dtriúr ar cholbha mo leabthan, Am saoradh ar gach ann-sprid tá ar mo thí. Cuirim mo aithchuinghe chughat a Chros na Meann, Cuirim mo ghuidhe chughat ó chrann go crann, do céasadh Críost im shaoradh ar aicídí na leapthan agus an tromluidhe.Bhailigh Seosamh ó drisceoil, Cnocán na mbairneach, Inis Cléire.Fuaireas ó Cáit Ní Conghealaigh, Lios a Móna , Oileán Cléire.



Triúr Mac Feirmeóra a chuaidh ag foghluim BéurlaBhí triúr mac ag feirmeóir agus ní raibh aon fhocal Béurla aca.  Dubhradar le na chéile gur mhór an náire dóibh é ag dul ar aonach agus margadh ag ceannach agus ag díol a gcoda gan aon fhocal Béurla na bpus. 4921606/4884283/5150066.title: A Prayer
4921606/4884283/5150066.text: Who does God's work will get God's payHowever long may seem the day,However weary be the way.Though powers may thunder "Nay"!No human hand God's hand may stay,Who does God's work will get His payGod hurries not nor makes delay,Who works for Him will get His pay,Some certain hour, some certain day.He does not pay as others payIn gold or land or raiment gay,In goods that perish and decay.But God's high wisdom knows the wayAnd this is sure, let come what may,Who does God's work will get God's pay.

Do suibhalís sa Cléire, Laoidhe agus ManinisGort na Móna agus Áird Mhana,Ní fheaca sa mhéid sin aon bhall ba farsingeNá Cnocán na mBáirneach agus a láimh leis an bfairrge



Do bhí cailín ag deunamh imirtis fé bhuachaill  aon lá  amháin agus  sé dubhairt an bhuachaill léi ná:-"A óig bhean gil na mbailí sul ná tagair liom  sa an sórd san.Mar tá sé agat cómh maith anois dul i mbun do gnótha,Mar leat bréitre clis, ní mheallair me, mar taoin tú cruinn is dóich liom."Bhailig: Cáit Ní Drisceóil, CumolánFuaireas ó: Ciarán Ó Drisceóil, Cumolán



Brí Dia go ndeunamh mé,Beatha na Naomh go dtuile i mé,Ceól na bFlathas go gclais-i-méAgus radharc na bFlathas go bhfeic-i-mé.



Do bhí ministir ann fadó agus ní raibh aige ach aon leanbh amháin. Do buaileadh an leanbh sin bróidhthe agus do fuair  sé bás agus do  chuir an ministir iarraidh ar seana bhean  chun a leanbh a  chaoineadh. Seo mar a chaoin an sean bhean an leanbh:-"Mo thruagh mo mhinistir, a thug dhá pingin dom,  i dtaobh a leinbh a caoineadh."
(continues on next page)

4798749/4795543/5150652.text: Aon Míc   Iosa agus  Atair Mic an tSuainBhí im coinleacht, im timceall dom im codladh is im  shuanAgus díbir na smuinte maluighthe seo uaim.Im luíge lé Dia agus Dia ag luige liom, Muire ag luighe liom. Brigidh ag eirige liom, am luige is im aodaire lé Mach DéGabhaim (?) Dé    m-atair liom, Muire mar mathair agam, Flatais De mar dúthaigh agam is díbir an t-aithibhteóirTá ceithre cuinne aighe ar mó leabaidh, ceitre asbal im thímcheall Miceal is Peadar agus na h-Aingil ag deanamh dinn dúinn(Friteadh ó Mhaire Bean Uí Lionan, Baile Iartach, Oilean Cleire. Tá sí 68 bliain anois.Bailig Tomás Ó Séoghda, Baile Iartach, Inis Cléire é seo)

4798749/4795545/5150663.title: Urnaí Roimh agus Tar éis Bia
4798749/4795545/5150663.text: Tá oileán beag ar an taobh tiar teas de Co Corcaige ar a dtugtar Oileán Cléire agus tá sé de nós ag na sean daoine paidir  rád roimh is tar-éis biadh a itthe.Seo éCéad molad leis an Rí nác gannCéad moladh gach om (?) lé DiaCéád moladh lé hIosa CriostI dtaobh ar iteomair is a idfomair (?) den biadhAn té a tug an biadh seo duinnIs an ciall cun a caittheGo dtugad sé an trócaire is an beátha siorruide dár n-anamIs d'anamnaca na marbh go léir  tré Iosa Criost ár dTigearnaAmen.Friteadh Ó Dómhnaill O Lionáin, Baile IartachBailig Tomás O Séoghdha Baile Iartach é

4921608/4884621/5150839.title: A Prayer
4921608/4884621/5150839.text:
Here I lay me down to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep.There are four corners on my bed,There are four angels over my head.-Saint Matthew, Mark, Saint Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lay on,And if evil come to me,Sweet Jesus comfort me,If I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take.



Some years ago , there lived in Sough Schull a man named John Burke, who was locally known as  "Jack Tricks." One fair morning he was in Schull, and he got drunk. He was causing a great disturbance to the public, when a sergeant with foxy hair arrested him. This sergeant was known as
(continues on next page)

ahaon, an bhó; a dó, an bainne; a trí, an barra; a ceathair, an tímh; a cúig, an bláthach.



An diabhal nuair a bhíonn na 'luighe go cráidhte fonn, Is diadhtha a bhíonn ina chroidhe ná bráthair cheallAn diabhal nuair a bhíonn go láidir teann,Do'n diabhal  ig tigheann gníomartha an bhráthair ann.Bhailig:   Cait Ní Drisceóil, Cumolán, Inis CleireFuaireas ó:   Mhícheál Ó Drisceóil   (65 bl.)



Má tá píanta Purgadhóireact, smút nú smál ó'n saoghal seo, fíol faoísdine, baoís óige, briseadh laé shaoire ná Domhnaigh: Dia agus Muire agus Mícheal, agus a dhá aspal deug, agus a Chúirc Aingeal  glórmhar go  raibh tróchaire lé na namam. Tabhair  fuascailt, fúrant(?) anúr agus solus-síoraidhe, saoghal  broidinis dá nanam.Bhailig:   Cáit Ní Drisceóil, Cumolán, Inis Cléire Fuaireas ó:   Ciarán Ó Drisceóil  (56bl.)Fuair sé sin ó na sheana mháthair é, agus d'fholmuig sí sin é ó'n tAth. Labhrás Ó Maghthamhna



Do dheineadh na daoine san áit seo fadó shoin na coínnle iad féin. Do dheinead an tincéir múnla stáin dóibh agus do dheinidís geir a leachadh istheach ins an múnla agus do fágtí isthig sa mhúnla é chun go gcruadh sé. Do geibhidís snaithín cotúin annsan agus do chuiridís istheach ins an gheir é. Do bhíodh

4798779/4798053/5151182.title: Old Irish Prayers
4798779/4798053/5151182.text:
The following prayer was said by our ancestors at any part of the day:-Do cuid feola, tarta, ealuis agus éite do cróin, do crois céasta agus do cuid céasta déanamh dian dúinn i faire láe agus oidhche.The following prayer was said three times by our ancestors when lying in bed:-Dia dhuit-se a Mháthair go mbeannuigthe, Dia dhuit-se is Pádraig, ionnat coladh tré Mháthair, ní thag grád liom acht an aisling atáim-se. Fear caol dubh is shearrach caol donn tré dhealaibh na lámhaibh cun í sháth tré taobh ár dTigearna, cun í lútsail ár duit-se is fíor é sin a Mháthair, tré o ... an aisling sin trí uaire 'na luighe ar an leabaidh ionndas geoghadh-sé feadsa Dia mar suimhneas agus a bheith ar mo guailinn sin go haoibhinn. The following prayer was said by our ancestors when lying in bed:- Anam Mháthair Muire, Muire Máthair Críost, Naomh
(continues on next page)

4798781/4798137/5151515.title: Prayer
4798781/4798137/5151515.text: I lay dwn on my bed to sleetTo God, I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.I saw Holy Mary comingWith seven man books in her handSeven bells ringing seven Priests singingClose the gates of hell, and open the gates of heaven.Tis time for my poor soul to go to heaven. There are four corners on my bedThere are four Angels around my headMatthew, Martk Luke and JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on

4798781/4798159/5151543.title: St Patrick's Prayer
4798781/4798159/5151543.text: I arise this dayThe power of God to guide meThe might of God to uphold meThe wisdom of God to teach me.The eye of God to watch over meThe shield of God to  shelter meThe host of God to defend meAgainst temptations and vicesAgainst the snares of the devil.Against every man who meditates injury to me.

4921656/4888017/5152849.title: Old Ruins
4921656/4888017/5152849.text:
(continued from previous page)
used by the fishermen, we find the ruins of the fishermen’s houses. There is one to be seen at Dirk and Beal a Chuain, but the local men will tell you that there were rows of houses there when the fishing was good about 50 years ago. These men and their families emigrated when the fishing failed, or else the took cottages and worked as casual labourers.



Prayers.Got from Mrs. O Hea (65) Gahhanive, who learnt them in her youth.Before the old people of long ago retired for the night they recited a prayer to put them under God's protection. This
(continues on next page)

4921655/4887929/5152875.title: Old Prayers
4921655/4887929/5152875.text:
Old PrayersSaid in the morningI will rise from this bed of sleep to adore my God and for the salvation of my soul that I may rise on the last day to life ever-lastingA prayer said going to bedI lay my body down to sleep to God I give my heart to keep and if I die before I wake, to God I give my soul to take. A prayer said when the clock strikesThe hours are passing death is approaching O Sweet Jesus have mercy on me. A prayer said when going to bedThere are four corners in my bed there are four angels in the spread. One to guide me one to guard me and two to carry my soul to God. St Michael Martin Luke, and John God bless the bed where I lay on.O Lord I must dont know where, when, or how, or if I die in mortal sin my soul
(continues on next page)
4921655/4887929/5152875.school_info: School: Caisleán na Leacht, Droichead Banndan

4921642/4887317/5153063.title: Old Prayers
4921642/4887317/5153063.text:
" I lay down on my bed to sleep,To God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take.There are four corners on my bed,And four angles round me spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.God bless the bed that I lay on""Jesus meek and Jesus mild,Pity me a little childJesus take my heart and bless itThat nothing eil may posess it.""Heart of Jesus I adore Thee,Heart of Mary I implore Thee,Heart of Joseph pure and just,In those true hearts,I place my trust.""Good morning Jesus my SaviourGood morning Mary my mother,Keep me from sin this day,Keep me from sin forever."
(continues on next page)

4921639/4887190/5162677.title: Food in Olden Times
4921639/4887190/5162677.text:
(continued from previous page)
such as Christmas and Easter that they used tea. There were tables there and at meal time they would let down and when not in use it was fixed back against the wall.



O Jesus dear before I sleep. I pray and thank thee that thou hast carried me safe through this day. I believe in thee I hope in thee I love thee with all my heart my lord my God thou art. Oh mary mother virgin dear Saint Joseph Gaurdin blest my angel and my patron Saint care for me while I rest.
4921639/4887190/5162677.school_info: School: Baile na Daibhche, Droichead Banndan

4921639/4887191/5162679.title: Intention before Sleep
4921639/4887191/5162679.text:
Taught to St Gertrude by our lord.Lord Jesus Christ I acept this sleep in the spirit of love with which thou didst santify it when you didst design to sleep in thy most sacred humanity, to the glory of God the father, and for the salvation of mankind beseeching that, in union with thee it may tend to the increase in grace and glory of all thine elect on heaven on earth and in purgatory amen



Oh Jesus I cast myself and all my concerns into your Sacred heart overflowing with all sweetness. I commit to you with perfect confidence all my spiritual and temporal interest. I beg of you in the hours of my weakness and excitement when I forget to call upon you for help to be still my protector and guide. Give me light to see your will, strength to do it and grace
(continues on next page)
4921639/4887191/5162679.school_info: School: Baile na Daibhche, Droichead Banndan

5162691/5159662/5162722.title: A Collection of Prayers
5162691/5159662/5162722.text:
In the morning when I awake I say O my God, my only good, the Author of my being, and my last end, I give Thee my heart, praise, honour and glory be to Thee for ever and ever, Amen or, Glory be to the son who had redeemed me, Glory be to the Holy Ghost who had sanctified me.  Blessed be the holy and undivided Trinity now and for ever.  When rising up I say:- I will rise from this bed for the love of Thee who died on the cross for the love of me.  When starting work say-  In the "Name of God", and when working say:- O my Jesus all for Thee. When passing a church say:- My God I know
(continues on next page)

5162166/5160230/5162781.title: Paidreacha, Abairteacha, srl
5162166/5160230/5162781.text: (I)Tá ceithre coirneal ar mo leabaidhTá ceithre ainglí ortha scapthaIs a Íosa ma fhaghaim-se bás roimh mhaidinGo Flaiteas Dé go rabh m'anam.(II)Lá an BhreitheamhnuisBéidh droichead deanta  de ghloinneIs cómh caol le ribe do chinnBéidh an Fathach na sheasamh a craos le teinidhAg feitheamh orainn go dtuitfidh sinnBéidh na h-aingli beaga cliste anonn 's anallAgus an té a bhéas saor ó pheacadhRachaidh Sé ar eiteóig go cuan na ngeall(III)'Sé adubhairt Com Cille, "Go h-Ifrann go bráth nach dtéidh fial; lucht an t-saidhbhris go gcaillidh siad a bpáirt le Dia, is nach mór an  tubaiste de dhuine ar bith  da dearnfadh ?  ariamh oiread ar do cruinniú as a  'chuinneochas  as Parais iad.

Guidhim go daingean tú a Árd Mhic Dé na n-iúlGuidhim do bhanarthla beannuighthe taobh Ríogh dlútGuidhim na n-Aingil na n-Aspol na naoi geal núirdSlíghe tabhair dom eadraibh féin sa Cúirt



" Go mbeannuightar dhuit a Gobnait Naomhtha.Go mbeannuighidh Muire dhuit agus beannuighim féin duit,Cughat-sa tánag ag gearáin mo sgéal leat.Is d'iarruig mo leighis air, ar san Dé ort.".

4811654/4809303/5164550.title: Prayers
4811654/4809303/5164550.text:
1."On this bed, I lie down to sleep, To God, I give my soul to keep,For if I die before I wake,To God I give my soul to take."The proper time to say this prayer is when retiring to bed.2."There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels to guard my head.St Matthew, Mark, Luke and St John.God bless the bed that I lie on"This prayer is to be said when in bed at night. 3. "Caithfih me troid cun m'anama do shábháil. Ó a Tírearna Íosa dein trócaire orainn"This is to be said before rising in the morning.
(continues on next page)

4921921/4900454/5164657.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921921/4900454/5164657.text:
The following prayers are said when in bed at night:-As I lay down this night to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep.If I shall die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to take.There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels over head,St. Mark, St Luke, St. James, St John,God bless the bed that I lay on.Morning PrayerDear Jesus, Dear Jesus, have mercy on me,Thy five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a treeO Merciful Jesus have mercy on me this dayAnd keep me from harm and danger, Dear Jesus When my days work is done, I will thank you for your goodness in preserving me from all dangers. Amen.Night Prayer.Prayer to St BridgetOh Holy St Bridget, pray to the Sacred heart for me, a poor sinner low and miserable in this world. I cannot do anything for myself. I place all my confidence in the the Sacred heart. So
(continues on next page)

4921915/4910789/5165376.title: Prayers
4921915/4910789/5165376.text:
I give myself up to Almighty God and his blessed mother to guard and guide me. As he brought me safe from the harms and troubles of the day may he bring me safe from the harms and troubles of the night through his blessed mother Amen.When I lay my body down to sleepI give my soul to God to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAmen.



There are four corners to my bedThere are six angels at my headTwo to watch and two to prayAnd two to take my soul awayIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAmen.I lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAmen.
(continues on next page)

There are four corners to my bedThere are six angels at my headTwo to watch and two to prayAnd two to take my soul awayIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAmen.I lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAmen.

4811662/4809960/5165387.title: Old Prayers
4811662/4809960/5165387.text: The following prayer is said by the old people at night:-An trúir is sine,An trúir is óige,An Trúir is truise í bFleitheas na gláire'An' shábháil is am gárdáil ó anochtGo dtí bliadhain is anocht míIn ainin an áthair is an mhich is an spioradh naomh. Amen.The following prayer is also said by old people to prevent themselves of a tromluighe:-An - mháthair Muire, Muire Máthair Criost Naomh Cibhlís máthair Naomh Coin baiste An cros gur úasadh Crióst aann 'am' sháoradh an aucí na h-oidhcheagus ar an dtromluighe, Amen.

4921755/4903801/5166559.title: Prayers
4921755/4903801/5166559.text:
If a person sneezes, the person listening says "God bless us" If a person tells another one of some fearful happening he says "God bless the hearers" When a few people have finished any work they say "May we be all alive this time twelve months" When some people are working and a person passes by he says "God bless the work and the workers"In the morning "O my God my only good, the author of my being and my last end. I give thee my heart. Praise, honour and glory be to thee for ever and ever. Amen" Getting up out of bed "I will raise myself up from this bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for thee of my soul. O may I rise on the last day to live everlastingly."When a person takes a pinch of snuff he says "Lord have mercy on the dead." When one person does some job for another, he says "The Lord spare you the health." When a person is going on a journey we say "God speed you" When we enter a house we say "God Bles all here." If you give alms to a person,
(continues on next page)

4921628/4886232/5166602.title: A Local Prayer
4921628/4886232/5166602.text: The following prayer is to be said fifteen times each night from the first of Dec to Christmas night and it is said that any three favours you will ask for will be granted if you do so."Hail and blessed be the hour and moment,In which the Son of God was born,At midnight in Bethalem, in the piercing cold,At that hour for our sake,O my God hear my prayers and grant my petitionsThrough the merits of our Lord and SavourJesus Christ and of his blessed Mother"
4921628/4886232/5166602.school_info: School: Béal na Carraige, Béal Átha Fhinghín

4921628/4886233/5166612.title: A Prayer
4921628/4886233/5166612.text: This prayer was told to me by my mother and it was told to her by my grandmother. It is said on going to bed every night.------------------------------------------------------O Lord bless the bed that I am about to lie on, and the sleep that I am going to take. O Mary my mother be thou at my head, Blessed John the apostle be thou at my feet. Dear angel of God at my side. May Christs messengers with the holy oils be in time at the hour of my death to put the seal upon my soul in the name of Christ crucified.
4921628/4886233/5166612.school_info: School: Béal na Carraige, Béal Átha Fhinghín

The old Irish people had many beautiful prayers and ejaculations, for instance when a person is intering a house he says " Día’s Muire dhuit" which means "God and Mary be with you", also when a person come for alms he says "go mbeannuighid  Día annso isteach which means "May the blessing of God be with all here", and if they receive any alms they say a little prayer like "May God keep sickness and trouble and death away from all here and may God increase your store". When people are going on a long journey they sprinkle Holy Water on themselves and say, "May God protect me on the way" or "May God bring me safely back".When people are kindling a fire they say "May God grant that
(continues on next page)

4811672/4811110/5167919.title: A Collection of Prayers
4811672/4811110/5167919.text:
A prayer said when going to bed.If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take. There are four corners in my bed there are four angels around my head one of them to guard me one of them to guide me two of them to carry my soul to heaven. Saint Mick, Saint Matt, Saint Luke, and Saint John, God bless the bed I die on.



Lord Jesus Christ, I accept this sleep in the spirit of love with which Thou didst sanctify it when Thou didst deign to sleep in Thy most sacred humanity to the Glory of God the Father. Amen.



Sprinkle "Holy Water" on your room and bed saying - by the sprinkling of Thy most precious blood, Lord Jesus, and by the merits of Thy bitter passion, wash me from every stain, and cleanse me from every sin. In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost, Amen

4811672/4811111/5167923.title: At the Sight of a Priest You Ought to Say
4811672/4811111/5167923.text:
At the sight of a priest you ought to say.This is he who made me a Child of God, and opened Heaven to me, who purified me from sin and gives my soul nourishment, Amen.At the sight of a church sayThe body of Our Lord is there. How come it there. A priest has been there and has said Holy Mass. Amen.



O Adorable Lord, and Saviour Jesus Christ, dying on the gallows tree. O Holy Cross of Christ see me safe true. O Holy Cross of Christ ward off from us all dangers deaths. Give us life always. O Crucified Jesus of Nazereth dying on the gallows tree save us. O holy Cross of Christ protect us from our enemies. O holy Cross of Christ guide us the right way to happiness. In honour of Our Lord Jesus Christ in honour of his Glorious resurection in Gods like ascension to which he ascended into heaven through as Jesus was born on Christmas Day in a Stable at Bethlehem. Through as Jesus died to save sinners. Through as Nicodemus and
(continues on next page)

4811672/4811112/5167924.title: A Prayer to Be Said Every Night
4811672/4811112/5167924.text:
(continued from previous page)
St Joseph took Our Lord down from the cross and buried him. O Lord Jesus Christ through Thy sufferings and death on the cross thy soul was fighting out of this world. Give us grace that we may carry our cross patiently save us from all dangerous death now and forever. Amen.



Most merciful God have mercy on me my soul and my body I give up to thee. To thy five bleeding wounds that were nailed to a tree most merciful God have mercy on me forgive me my sins and bring me to life everlasting Amen.



When the gentle virgin Mary was sleeping in her bed there appeared to her a vison of her son passing and re-passing before her observing this he speaks to her Mother what is it thou dreamest. My son I see men coming. to arrest thee carrying a bright lantern. They spit in Thy sacred face. They will spurn thee under foot. They will scourge thee with whips. They will crown thy sacred head
(continues on next page)

"O Mary conceived without sin pray for us who fly to thee. Refuge of Sinners, Mother of those who are in sorrow, leave us not in the hour of Death, but obtain for us perfect sorow, sincere contrition, remission of sins, a worthy reception of the most "Holy Viaticum" and the strength of the Sacrament of Extreme Unction so that we may be able to stand with safety before the throne of the just and merciful Judge "God". Amen.

4811673/4811260/5168250.text:
Cabhair agus grastá agus cáird[?] ó Dhia cugainn. Cabhair gach lá is táim d'iarraidh. Sacraimint [?] agus neartuigh Dia sinn Agus tugaim suas m'anam do Dhia agus o Mhaoidean Mhuire cun a shaobhail Tugaim suas m'anam do Mhiceal agus do Conchubhar gleigeal cun go saorofaí mé ó bás obann, ó teine, ó uisge, agus ó comdrach. Mhaoidhean Mhuire liom i luighe. Brigidh liom ag eirighe agus Padruig liom i ngach aith a gabaimh. Gobnaith geal do brathnuigh Báíle Mhuirne Seachain mé ar mheileos, Deirtear an Paidir seo nuair a bhíthear ag dul a codlad
(continues on next page)

4811666/4810763/5170528.title: Prayers
4811666/4810763/5170528.text: Prayerin connection with the putting out on St. Brigid’s day of theBrat BríghdeBrighid agus a brat!An Maigdean Muire agus a Mac!Míchéal, agus a sgéith!Aon {le báin no Aoinne amháin} le Dia → (Aon le bháin nó Aoinne amháin + Ri ?)Castar orainn aniar anochtAgus blian ó anochtAgus anocht amháin le Dia.

4921753/4903607/5170609.title: Prayers at Night
4921753/4903607/5170609.text: There are four corners in my bedAnd four angels round me spreadMatthew, Mark, St. Luke and JohnGod bless this bed I lay upon. If I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified, Lay me down to rest. Bless me O'Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness amen. When in bed I lay to sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to takeHeart of Jesus I adore you,Heart of Mary I emplore youHeart of Joseph true and blessedAnd in these three hearts I place all my trust.

4921753/4903608/5170617.title: Prayers at Night
4921753/4903608/5170617.text: When you wake in the morning say:-O my God I thank thee for having preserved me through the dangers of the past night. Do thou O infinite Goodness and adorable mercy preserve me through the dangers of the coming day. Free at least from the guilt of mortal sin and free from falling victim to Satan and my own corrupt inclinations. O My God I adore love praise and magnify thy Holy and adorable name now and forever more. When you are dressing yourself say:-O my God clothe my soul with the Nuptial Robe of Charity and grant that I may wear it pure and undefiled before thy judgement seat. Prayer to your guardian angelO Angel of God my guardian dear,To whom his care commits me here,Ever this day be at my sideTo rule and guard to read and guide.

4921753/4903609/5170619.title: Prayer to the Sacred Heart
4921753/4903609/5170619.text: Remember Our Lady of the Sacred Heart the ineffable power which thy divine Son has imparted thee over His adorable Heart. Entirely trusting in thy merits we come begging thy protection O' Heavenly Treasurer of the Sacred Heart of that Heart inexhaustible fountain of all graces which thou mayest open when thou pleasest in order to distribute amoungst men.All the treasures of love and mercy of light and salvation which it contains grant us we beseech thee the favours we solicit no we cannot be refused and since thou art Our Mother Our Lady of the Sacred Heart.Propitiously hear and grant our prayers. Our Lady of the Sacred Heart, pray for us.

4921711/4892907/5170653.title: Dripsey Woollen-Mills
4921711/4892907/5170653.text:
(continued from previous page)
is carried on on the premises.Their productions include woolen and worsted suitings costumes and mantle cloths, overcoats, blankets and rugs. In prewar days a considerable trade was done with Great Britain, Canada, China & Japan & S. Africa.The Chairman of the Company is Mr Andrew O'Shaughnessy. The Managing Director is John A O'Shaughnessy - his son. The Director is Mr Wm Cronin and Secretary is John M. Twomey. The Dublin show rooms are at 21 Abbey Buildings, Middle Abbey Street.



O most loving Jesus, who by thy ineffable virtues and by the example of thy domestic life, didst consecrate the family which Thou didst chose on earth, in thy clemency look down upon this household humbly prostrate before thee and imploring Thy mercy. Remember that this family belongs to Thee, for to Thee we have in a special way consecrated and devoted ourselves. Look upon us in Thy loving kindness, preserve us from every danger and grant us the grace to perserve to the end in of the Holy Family that having revered Thee and loved Thee

4921711/4892908/5170656.title: A Night Prayer
4921711/4892908/5170656.text:
faithfully on earth we may bless and praise eternally in heaven. O Mary most Sweet Mother to Thy intercession we have recourse knowing that Thy divine Son will hear our prayers.And do thou O Glorious Patriach St. Joseph assist us by thy powerful mediation and offer by the hand of Mary our prayers to Jesus.A Night Prayer.Lord Jesus Christ, who with unwearied eye, neither slumbers nor sleeps, but continually watches in defence of thy servant. Take me and mine I beseech thee into Thy protection and grant while my body is asleep my soul may be awake and that I may hereafter behold thee in that blessed and heavenly country, where with the Father and the Holy Ghost they are eternally governed and where all the Angels with the blessed Saints are citizens for ever. Amen.



I must die I do not know when or where or how. But if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever.Oh! Jesus have mercy on me.

4921711/4892909/5170670.title: Prayer to the Adorable Name of Jesus
4921711/4892909/5170670.text:
May the adorable name of Jesus be the sweet and daily music of my soul and the zeal of my heart; and in the agony and cold sweat of death, I give thee the last look for mercy may the parting sigh of my soul be Jesus Amen, sweet Jesus Amen.



Crosses and bye roads usually derive their names from the nearest village or station and in cases from the gentleman who resides nearest to the cross. About half ways between Coachford and Peake there is a cross known as "John's Cross". This is called after a well known gentleman - Mr John Murphy commonly as "John the Bog". He was the late owner of the residence known as Rocklodge. This farm comprises between three and four hundred acres, about 150 of this is bog. In olden time people came from far and near cutting turf in these bogs. The family are buried in a tomb in the Coachford Chapel ground.

4921772/4905618/5170933.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921772/4905618/5170933.text: This is a prayer for stopping blood:-Faleris, ainm an fir do sháidh an sleagh tré chroidhe Fosa. Phainig ag, Fuil, fíon, agus fíor uisge. A'Fosa, Máire scop an fhuil.

4921744/4902648/5170976.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921744/4902648/5170976.text: Prayer when leaving the Church. Jesus dear I now must leave you for a little while. How I wish that I could linger in thy loving smile. Lest there should thou be lonely Jesus while I am away, my poor heart to thee I offer through the long long day. There before the Tabernacle as the lamp will burn with my love. It will be glowing until I return. Jesus put thine arms around me, keep me undefiled, watch, and in the shades of evening welcome back Thy child.

metadata.Teacher:: An tSr. Seosamh; An tSr. Berchmans

4921744/4902649/5170977.title: A Prayer when Going to Bed
4921744/4902649/5170977.text:
There are four corners in my bed, there are four angels round my head. One to guard me, one to guide me, one to carry my soul to heaven.    Saint Luke, St. Mark, St. James, St. John, God bless this bed that I lay on, Jesus has the branch, Mary has the flower, Jesus and Mary be with me now, And at the hour of my death. Sweet Jesus.Amen.



In the name of Our Lord Jesus I lay me down to rest, bless me o'Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable Pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness. Amen.
(continues on next page)

When Our Lord was taking the cross he was shivering and shaking, the Jews asked him was it either fever or ague He had. Our Lord said he had neigther fever or ague but anyone who would keep those words in their mind or written about them would neigther get fever or ague.     Amen.



As I lay on my bed to-night, I give my soul to God to mind and if I die before I wake I give my soul to God to take. There are four corners to my bed, there are four angels over my head. Mattew, Mark, Luke, St. John. God bless this bed that I lay on. Amen.

4921744/4902652/5170982.title: Prayer
4921744/4902652/5170982.text: The following prayer was found in the tomb of our Lord Jesus Christ in the year 803 sent from the Pope to the emperor Charles on his going to battle for safety. They who shall repeat it or hear it repeated or keep it about them shall never die a sudden death, or be drowned in water, nor shall poison have an effect on them. They who laugh at it shall suffer.Oh adorable Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ dying on the Cross for our sins, Oh holy Cross of Christ see me safe through life, Oh holy Cross of Christ ward off from me all sharp repeating words, Oh holy Cross ward off from me all things that are evil, Oh holy Cross of Christ protect me from my enemies, oh holy Cross of Christ ward off from me all dangerous deaths and give me life always, oh Crucified Jesus of Nazareth have mercy on me now and for-ever in honour of our Lord Jesus ChristAmen.

metadata.Teacher:: An tSr. Seosamh; An tSr. Berchmans

O God, who through the Resurrection of thy son, Our Lord Jesus Christ hast vouchsafed to give joy to the whole world, grant as we beseech thee that through the intercession of the Virgin Mary his mother we may obtain the joy of eternal life, through Christ Our Lord. Amen.O man forgive thy mortal foe.Nor ever strike him blow for blow.For all the souls on earth that live.To be forgiven must forgive.Forgive him seventy times and seven.For all the blessed souls in heaven.Are both forgivers and forgiven.

An old belief is that sunshine on a wedding day means happiness and rain unhappiness.



Some girls pray to certain Saints for good husbands, especially to Saint Antony. The following story is said to be true.A girl had been praying to Saint Antony for a husband for a long time and nobody had turned up. One day she got into a temper and threw the statue of the saint out the window. A man was passing at the time and the statue hit him on the head. He got a very severe wound and was taken into the house. The doctor was sent for and ordered that he could not be moved for a time. He was kept on at the house. The girl helped to nurse him. He fell in love with her and they got married. So Saint Antony did find a husband for her.

4921797/4908062/5180585.title: Old Prayers
4921797/4908062/5180585.text: OLD PRAYERS 	This a prayer said by old women before going to sleep:“There are four corners in my bed There are four angels o’er my head. Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless the bed that I lay on.”When a person is going on a journey, say to him “God speed you”, “God be with you” or “God guard you”When a person goes into a house or a field where people are working say “God bless the work”When a person gets anything from another he says “God increase you” or “God spare you your health.”When a person hears of somebody having a great illness he says “God between us and all harm”.At Christmas people say “May we be all together again this time twelve months with God’s help.

4921882/4898597/5180860.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921882/4898597/5180860.text:
Old people have many beautiful prayers which have never appeared in print. Among them may be prayers said when when awakening in the morning, when getting out of bed, when going to bed and when beginning work.   When awakening in the morning this prayer, is said. "My God what I do this day I will do it for the honour and glory of thee." When getting out of bed we say "O Mary Mother me defend and bring me to a happy end." When passing a church we say "O Jesus, My God, I adore thee here present in the Sacrament of thy love."   When going to bed we say "Mathew Mark, Luke and John, guard the bed that I lay on, Four corners to my bed, four angels at my head, one to watch, one to pray and one to bear my soul away." When going to sleep
(continues on next page)

The prayer said at night before retiring. "There are four corners in my bed, there are four angels over head, two within and two abroad, Jesus Christ around about. When I lie in this bed to sleep I give my soul to God to keep, and if I die before I wake I hope to God my soul is safe. God to be my father, the Blessed Virgin to be my mother, Heaven to be my bed, I renounced the devil therefore." This is a prayer said on every Good Friday. "God bless Good Friday He was crucified, the Jews they pierced him with their big long spears, pierced Our Saviour's Heart, Hand and Feet. His Blessed Blood began to flow. I do not know when, nor how, nor where, but if I die in mortal sin I'm lost forever,   When passing by a Crucifix:- O Lord my God by suffering rent, Nailed to the Cross my love to gain, grant thro' Thy Cross my when life is spent, in death Thy mercy I obtain   When starting work:- Gach nídh ar do shon, a Íosa.   When awaking in the morning they make the sign of the Cross and say Jesus, Mary and Joseph I give you my heart and my soul.

4921812/4894833/5181231.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921812/4894833/5181231.text: The prayers said when starting on a journey are "God speed you", "God be with you" and "Good luck to you.   When leaving a place the prayers are "Safe home" and "God direct you".   When entering a house the prayer said is "God save all here".    The prayer said when passing workers is "God bless the work and the workers too.   When lighting the light the prayer said is "the light of Heaven to us.

Muire máthair Críost Eiblis gabrail máthair Eóin baiste cuirim an trúir fan idir mé is gabas na leaba cuirain an crann gur crochodh Íosa Críosd idir mé agus an trom laighe.In Ainm An Athar agus an Mhic, agus an Sperod NaomhAmen.



In olden days when the Catholics were molested by the Protestants there was a man named Lord Hyde who lived at Castle Hyde said he would build a house which no one could compete with.He built it up on a mountain and while it was being built people came from all parts to view it but no Catholics would be allowed in, he made a lovely avenue up to it and on one of the piers of the gate he erected a stone and wrote on it
(continues on next page)

4811630/4804277/5182731.title: Paidir le linn Dul a Chodladh
4811630/4804277/5182731.text: Luighimís le Dia is éirighimís le Muire, gabhaimís Diar mar athair agus Muire mar mháthair, flathais Dé mar dhúthaigh is ní umhluíghimíd do'n áirseóir. Go mbeannuighidh Dia dhuit a mháthair go mbeannuighidh Muire dhuit is Pádruig. Cad na thaobh ná codlann tú a mháthair mar ná féadaim é a ghrádh ghil. Cad na thaobh san duit a mháthair. Aisling a deineadh tríom shuan dom ar marcach caol cíor dhubh ar each caol ruadh. A shleadh dhearg na dheas láimh chun é sháthadh trí chroidhe an rí ghlórmhair. Fuil cómhachta atá le dortadh amáireach. Is fíor é d'aisling a mháthair. An té mhachtnóchadh ar seo trí n-uaire taréis luighe ar leabaidh shuain do gheobhadh sé flaithis Dé gan duadh agus bheith ag mo ghualainn-se go bráth.

4811630/4804279/5182733.title: Paidir le linn na Tine a Choigilt
4811630/4804279/5182733.text: Coiglím an teine seo leis na fearta thug Pádruidh dúinn. Na h-aingil dá gcúnlacht agus nár múchaidh ar naímhde í. Cros Chríost ar an ndoras go dtagaidh solus an lae amáirigh.Ní deireann aoinne an phaidir sin anois nuair a bhíd ag coigilt na teine acht nuair a bhíodh na daoine ag coigilt na teine sa t-seana shaoghal ní theaghaidís a chodhladh gan é rádh.

4811630/4804285/5182746.title: Paidir chun Naomh Gobnait
4811630/4804285/5182746.text: Beannuighimh duit a Ghobnait naomhthaBeannuigheann Muire dhuitIs beannuighimh féin duitAg ínnsint mo ghearán do thánag féin chughat,Is ag iarraidh mo leigheas igcúntas Dé ort.Máire Ní DuinnínNa MilíníFuaras an cúntas seo thuas óm' sheana mháthair Síle Bean Uí Loinghsigh atá na cómhnuidhe ar na Milíní i mBarúntacht Músgraí Uí Fhloinn Thiar.Aos:-  65

4921821/4909254/5182750.title: Local Prayers
4921821/4909254/5182750.text: When the new moon appears in the sky the old people sayCíonn na h-iasc í an céad oidhcheCíonn na h-ean í an dara oidhcheCíonn gach aoinne í an tríomhadhoidhcheWhen the people see her they say God bless the moon.The old people used these words frequently when they saw anything for the first time such as a young baby they would say God Bless her.If a person was talking about diseases they would say May God keep it away from us.If they were in trouble they would say God between us and all harm or May God protect us.I heard my mother saying these.

4921702/4891478/5182775.title: Maighréad Ní Néill
4921702/4891478/5182775.text:
Maighréad Ní NéillBhí sí ‘na chómhnuidhe i mbothán na bfrocs ar feadh tamaill. Bhíodh sí ag díol tobac. Thugadh sí cromadh de thobac caol ar phingin agus bhi sé d’ainm uirthe go raibhsí ana ghann sa tomhas. Do dhein file gurbh ainim do Diarmuid Ó Duinnín an bhéarsa so mar gheall uirthe“Óig bhean ghlic de chine Dhordain Uí NéillMo cómhairle dein anois is ná tóg orm é Do chómharsa cuir fé chion mar d’órduig Mac De [?]I dtómas na smut neamh-mion leig orlach ded’ mhéar.D’fhreagair fear eile:-Níor cóir í chur de cine Dhórdán Uí NéillAn rógaire do sgrios na cómharsain go léirGo mbíodh a próca aice ar a muin i dtómas mban mbaothI dtreo go gcuireadh luibh na seómraí go léir.



Dia dhuit a mháthairDia duit a’s PádraigCad na thaobh ná codhlann tú a Mháthair?Ní fhéadfainn é a ghrádh ghilCad ‘na thaobh san a Mháthair?Aisling a deineadh trím’ suan dom
(continues on next page)

4811630/4804287/5182787.title: Paidir ag Dul Isteach sa tSéipéal
4811630/4804287/5182787.text: Leigim mé féin anuas in imeall do ghrásta i lár do thíghe ag úmhalúghadh dod theampall beannuighthe ag admháil m'fhaoistine ós cómhair d'ainm naomhtha. Do bhrígh gur pheacuígheas go mór is go ró-mhór le clos mo chluas le smaointe mo chroidhe le labhartha mo bhéil le radharc mo shúl agus le siúbhal mo chos. Ó a thíghearna laraim míle mathúnachus agus párdún ort.

4811630/4804288/5182788.title: Paidir ag Éirí ar Maidin
4811630/4804288/5182788.text: Sgreadaim go cruaidh ar mo thíghearna m'anam do thabhairt chun glóire Dé chun bheith rann-pháirteach i ngach iodhbhairt bheannuighthe dá bhfuil is dá mbeidh ar feag an domhain uile agus ar feag na Críostuígheachta insan ló indhiu.

4811630/4804289/5182790.title: Paidir le linn Dul a Chodladh
4811630/4804289/5182790.text:
Luíghimse síos fé do comairce a Mhaighdean Mhuire, go raibh do bhrat glórmhar ag déanamh dín dom anam. A thighearna Iosa féach anuas le truagh anocht ar do sheachránaídhe bocht sínte anso ar leabaidh gan fhios agan an eirigeóchadh aiste ar maidin, ná ar osgailt mo shúl dom cá mbeidh m'anam, Ó a Iosa do cheannuig mé beannuig mé saor mé. Na glaoidh as mo chodla orm coidhche as an saoghal so. Moladh leat a úir mhic is ná luadhaig púicíní do chur ar do shúile acht clúdaigh m'anam le róbaí na bhflaitheas. A Íosa a Mhuire agus a naoimh Iósep. Go réidhtíghidh sibh an bóthar dom nár ghabhas fós ann Amen.Guídhim na naoimh le soíllse rómham-sa.Guídhim na h-aingil is na naoimh

4811630/4804294/5182801.title: Seanphaidreacha
4811630/4804294/5182801.text:
Nuair a bhíonn duine nó beirt as lín-tíghe istigh ón Aifreann Dé Domhnaig deireann siad paidir roimis an Choróinn Mhuire. 'Sé seo an phaidir.Ófrálaimíd suas an Choróinn Mhuire naomhtha so do Dhia is don Mhaighdin Ghlórmhar chumhachtaigh indhiu, chun toradh an Aifrinn do thabhairt dúinn chómh maith agus dá mbeimís 'na láthair. Deir furmhór na ndaoine paidreacha dos na mairbh nuair a bhíonn an Choróinn Mhuire ráidhte aca. Ag seo an phaidir a derimíd-ne.Éist leó a Dhia thrócaireach le h-úrnaighthe do sheirbhíseach, sinn a theanghmhais le chéile i gcómhluadar na Coróinneach Muire, ró-naomhtha na Maighdine beannuighthe máthair Dé. When starting work - All for thee O Lord, all for thee.In bed(a) On this bed to-night I sleepTo God I give my soul to keep,But if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.(b) There are four corners on my bedThere are four angles o'er is spread,Matthew Michael Luke and John,God bless this bed that I lie on.(c) Heart of Jesus I adore theeHeart of Mary I implore thee,Heart of Jesus meek and justIn these three hearts I place my trust.(d) I must die. I do not know when nor how nor where, but if I die in mortal sin I am lost for ever. Jesus have mercy on me.(e) Merciful Jesus have mercy on me.(f) My soul and my body I resign unto thee,Whose five bleeding wounds were nailed to a tree.O crucified Jesus have mercy on meWhen getting up:I will arise O Lord from this bed of sleep, to adore my God, and to labour for the salvation of my sould. Oh may I arise on the last day to life everlasting. Amen.

PrayersOne little prayer that I was taught at my home, in the parish of Kanturk, barony of Duhallow, County Cork, is as follow:"Oh! my God I know I must die sometime, I do not know when, or how, or where; but, if I die in mortal sin I am lost forever.  Oh, Jesus help me".Another prayer is:"God bless my father, and my mother; and my brothers, and sisters; and God bless our home".Another prayer is:"Most Holy Virgin offer to the Eternal Father the most precious Blood of Jesus for

4921808/4894519/5184075.title: Old Prayers
4921808/4894519/5184075.text: Jesus tender shepherd hear me. Bless thy little lamb to night. Through the darkness be thou near me.Keep me safe till morning light.All this day thy hand has led me.And I thank thee for thy care.Thou has warmed me, clothed and fed me.Listen to my to my evening prayer.Let my sins be all forgiven.Bless the friends I love so well.Take us all at last to heaven.Happy there with thee to dwell.There are four corners in my bed.There are four Angels at my head.Matthew, Mark, James and John.God bless the bed that I lie on.One to watch.One to pray.Two to carry my soul away.

4921808/4894520/5184076.title: Old Prayers
4921808/4894520/5184076.text: Come O Come my Jesus comeMake my poor little heart Thy homeCome but ere thou comestPrepare for thyself a dwelling there.Come no longer Lord delayCome dear Jesus come and stayPut thy kind arms round meFeeble as I am.Thou are my Good ShepherdI thy little lambSince thou comest now to be my GuestI can trust thee always Lord for all the rest

4921808/4894521/5184079.title: Old Prayers
4921808/4894521/5184079.text: I saw the blessed lamb coming and seven Mass books in his hand seven priests singing seven bells ringing Close the gates of hell open the gates of Heaven for my poor soul now and for ever Amen

4921824/4909532/5184388.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921824/4909532/5184388.text: Here I lay myself to sleepTo God I give my soul to keepIf I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeThere are four corners in my bedThere are four angels in them spreadOne to guard me, one to guide me,Two to carry my soul to HeavenMy soul and my body I resign unto TheeOh merciful Jesus, have mercy on meThy five bleeding wounds that were nailed to the TreeOh merciful Jesus have mercy on me.I also saw my grandmother make the sign of the Cross three times on the bed before she lay down to sleep.While signing on her forehead with her thumb the letters I.N.R.I. she used to say Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews, preserve me from a sudden and unprovided death.

4921826/4909642/5185562.title: Prayers
4921826/4909642/5185562.text: There are four corners on my bed. There are four Angles round my head. One to guide me, one to protect me, one to save me, and one to take me to heaven------------------------------------------------------   O my God, I believe Thou art here present. I adore Thee with my whole heart. I thank thee for all the blessing Thou hast bestowed on me. I offer Thee all my thoughts, words, actions, of this day - I intend to gain all the Indulgences I can - and I place them in the hands of the Blessed Virgin Mary ------------------------------------------------------

4921826/4909644/5185564.title: Prayers
4921826/4909644/5185564.text: O Mary my Mother and my hope,I take refuge under thy mantle,There will I live and die, deliver me from sin,And grant me thy holy blessing.Amen.------------------------------------------------------There are four corners in my room,There are four Angels round my head,One, to guide, One to protect me, One to help me, and one to take me to Heaven. Amen.------------------------------------------------------Infant Jesus meek and mild,Look on me a little child,Make me humble as thou art,And with Thy love inflame my heart. Amen.------------------------------------------------------Heart of Jesus I adore Thee,Heart of Mary I implore thee,Heart of Joseph pure and just,In these three Hearts I place my trust. Amen.

4921728/4894130/5187745.title: Prayers
4921728/4894130/5187745.text:
I found it impossible to find any prayer that was not in a prayer-book, but the following are some 'sayings' of the people.'God bless all here'. 'God bless ye all'. 'God bless all here except the cat and the dog'. I have heard those expressions said by persons on entering a house. The usual reply to them is 'And you too'.When the woman of the house lights the lamp at night she says. 'The light of heaven  to us all' also 'The light of heaven on sinners'If a person borrows a jug or cup of milk or a piece of butter he says 'God increase your dairy', or 'May the Lord never see you in want'. 'The Lord increase your store'. The reply is 'The same to you'.When the fire is raked at night people often make the Sign of the Cross on the ashes with the tongs, and the prayer 'My Jesus I adore Thee before me' is said.



When people wash their feet at night they are always careful 'not to leave the feet-water inside'. When throwing it out they usually say - God be with all travellers'.
(continues on next page)

4921728/4894130/5187746.title: Prayers

The usual reply to them is 'And you too'.When the woman of the house lights the lamp at night she says. 5177632/5174579/5188122.title: A Collection of Prayers
5177632/5174579/5188122.text:
When a person gets any present, or if he is treated to refreshment in any house, he usually says "God increase your store" or when he gets a new suit of clothes, anyone he meets says "Well wear" or "That you may live to wear it."When a person sneezes "Dia linn" or "God bless us" is said by all who hear the sneeze. When a man enters a house he say's "God save all here" and the people inside answer: "God save you kindly". Some years ago the people always said those salutations in Irish.When a person wakes in the morning he says the well known aspiration "Jesus, Mary and Joseph I give you my heart and my soul" As he is arising he says "Sacred Heart of Jesus I arise with thee."During the day the aspiration "Sacred Heart of Jesus, I place my trust in Thee" is repeated frequently. When a person is inclined to anger he says "My Jesus give me patience, Mother Mary, curb my tongue."
(continues on next page)

4921850/4910418/5188633.title: Prayers
4921850/4910418/5188633.text: Prayer said on awakening - "Thank God for the day again."Grace after meals - Thank God for a good dinner (&c). God spare father, God spare mother, God spare (each brothers & sisters name and any other occupant of the house - aunt, uncle, workman &c), God mark us to grace and make good children of us. Amen.Thank God for a good dinner and thank God for the health to eat it.That we may never want for a good dinner and for the health to eat it.When starting work - Let us make a start in the name of God.Salutation to a workman - God bless the work and the workman too. Reply - And you too.

4921850/4910419/5188636.title: Prayers
4921850/4910419/5188636.text: When going on a journey - May God direct us on the right road and bring us home safe.When going to bed -This night as I lay down to sleepTo God I give my soul to keep.If I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.Four corners to my bedFour angels round my headOne to watch and one to prayAnd two to bear my soul away.When relating news of sickness or death - God bless the listeners.   orGod save the hearers.   orMay God look on us with an eye of pity orGod between us and all harm.When speaking of someone dead"May the Lord have mercy on his soul.""God be merciful to him.""That heaven may be his bed."

4921850/4910420/5188637.title: Prayers
4921850/4910420/5188637.text: When sneezing. God bless us; Dia linn.Other prayers and salutations.God protect usMay God increase your store.May God reward you.God save all here - and you too

4921870/4897456/5190513.text:

There is a disused graveyard in Mr. Lynch's field in Barryscourt, Carrigtwohill, Co. Cork. There were a lot of people buried in it but when Templecurraheen graveyard was used the other graveyard was abandoned.



O most merciful Jesus have mercy on me,My heart and my soul I resign into thee,Those five bleeding wounds got when knelt to a tree.O most merciful Jesus have mercy on me
(continues on next page)

5190451/4895231/5190718.title: An Old Prayer
5190451/4895231/5190718.text: As I lay down and sleepI pray to God my soul to keepAnd if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeThere are four corners in my bedAnd in these four corners four angels spreadSt. Matthew St Mark St. Luke and St. JohnGod bless the bed that I lay onAnd if any evil come to meI pray to God to deliver meOne to guard me, one to guide meAnd two to carry my soul to heavenThe Blessed Virgin standing by me With a naked heart and a dismal cry.Whosoever shall say this prayer three times each night will see the Blessed Virgin three times before their soul will be judged.
5190451/4895231/5190718.school_info: School: Claonar agus Carraig, Cill an Mhuilinn

5177653/5177175/5190736.title: Prayers
5177653/5177175/5190736.text:
There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels overhead.Matthew, Mark. Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on.May the spatters of your carriage, blind your enemies.Good so nuachair to you.God spare you your health (the County Clare payment).That you may never know what it is to be in want.That you may always have enough.God's blessing down on you every hour and minute of the day.The grace of God is nearer than the door.This old saying was said to a poor woman who was in sore distress. "I wont be long finding out" said she. She stood up and made her way to the door. As she did so she broke her leg.Kate Markham (R.I.P.) told me this story.
(continues on next page)

5190451/4895245/5190751.title: Old Prayer
5190451/4895245/5190751.text: O Son of Mary I love you, indeed I do.Who am I that you should come next or near meO God of Heaven make a little corner for me in your heartAnd never while there is life in me let me lose my place there,And after death may I still hide there.  AmenHave pity on me O Blessed Mother talk to my God for meTell Him I'm a poor ignorant creature full of nothing but sin and misfortune,But that I love His own dear Mother, that I am a poor servantAnd for your sake, to help and pity me.

5162185/5162011/5191504.title: Prayers
5162185/5162011/5191504.text: 1. Before going to bed I say this prayer:- There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels at my head, Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on. Before starting out on a journey this prayer is said:- May the Almighty and Merciful Lord direct me on this journey. May He make it prosper and maintain me in peace. May the Archangle accompany me along the way and may I return to my home in peace, joy and health. Jesus and Mary be with me on my journey, On starting work this short prayer is said:- Oh dear Jesus may I do all my actions for the love of Thee. This prayer is said when getting out of bed:- I rise from my bed of sleep to adore God and to labour for the salvation of my soul. O may I rise on the last day to Life Everlasting.

5162185/5162012/5191514.title: Prayers
5162185/5162012/5191514.text: 2. In my home every night before going to bed I recite this prayer:-There are four corners on my bed, there are four angels at me head. Mattew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on. On setting out on a journey this prayer is said:- May the Almighty and merciful Lord direct me on my journey. May He make it prosper and maintain me in peace. May the Archangle accompany me along the way and may I return to my home in peace, joy and health. On starting work this short prayer is said:- O dear Jesus may I do all my actions for the love of Thee. This prayer is said when getting out of bed:- I rise from my bed of sleep to adore my God and to labour for the salvation of my soul.

5162185/5162013/5191521.title: Prayers
5162185/5162013/5191521.text: 3. There are certain prayers the old Irish said at different times. For example when going to bed this prayer was said:- There are four corners on my bed. There are four angels at my head  Mattew, Mark, Luke and John. God bless the bed that I lie on. when they saw the new moon they recited this prayer:-I see the new moon, And the new moon sees me,God bless the new moon,And God bless me.There's light in the cottage,There's light in the hall.And the glory of God,Is over us all.

5162185/5162014/5191525.title: Prayers
5162185/5162014/5191525.text:
Mr F Murray aged 60Bridge St CootehillThis prayer is said when going to sleep I lay my body down to restI pray to God my soul to keep And if I die before i wakeI pray to God my soul to takeWhen entering a house God bless the work or God bless all hereWhen the new moon appears God bless the new moonGod bless me God bless as far as I can seeFrom Maura O' Doherty Bridge St Cootehill Co Cavan



Other prayers Jesus , Mary and Joseph guide me on this journey as God guided you on your journey to Egypt. This prayer is said when going on a journey
(continues on next page)

4921731/4894476/5191776.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921731/4894476/5191776.text:
A Collection of prayers.As I lay down my head to sleepTo God I give my soul to keep,And if I die before I wakeTo God I give my soul to take.There are four corners in my bed,There are four angels overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke ana  JohnGod bless the bed that I lie. on.And if any evil spirit comes to me before I wakeMay God direct me.This prayer is said going to bed.Another prayer that is said going to bed is Jesus dear the day is over,Softly falls the evening dew. Before I close my eyes in slumber let me say good night to you.Through this lovely day you've kept me free free from trouble, free from care. Kneeling here before the Altar let me say my evening prayer.Jesus dear, protect my father, Bless my  loving Mother too. Keep my brothers free from harm Keep my sisters pure and true. Jesus dear I am growing weary, keep me safe all through the night. Send the angels bright to guard me
(continues on next page)

Cuirim an Chrois  ar ar ceásadh Chríost idir mé agus an Trom-luighe.Chuala so ag máthair, i glarraig an lme, Magh Chromrha, Co. Matthew, Mark, Luke & John.God bless the bed that I lie on(On Good Friday the Jews stuck Our Saviour through the heart & side & everyone that says this little prayer, at night, will never see the burning fires of Hell.) Amen.). This prayer is said after going to bed.



"God bless Friday & Good Friday too - the Friday Our Saviour was crucified by the wicked Jews. His Blessed Mother who was standing by had a sorrowful heart & a mournful cry. 4921774/4905833/5192455.title: Seanphaidreacha
4921774/4905833/5192455.text:
There are four corners in my bedThere are flour angels above my headSt Matthew, St Mark, St Luke and St JohnGod bless the bed that I lie on.And if I die before I sleepI pray to God my soul to keep.And if I die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to take.     To be said when lying in bed.II In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ CrucifiedI lay me down to restBless me O Lord, defend and protect meAnd after this short and miserable pilgrimageBring me to ever lasting happiness. AmenIIIA Íosa bheannuightheSábhail ar m'anam bochtSaor ó'n bpeachadh sinn'S ó smaointhe malluightheÓ bás obannÓ bhreith damanthaÓ's Tú a ceannuigh sinnGura tú glacfidh sinnSuas go Parraghas. Amen.
(continues on next page)

4921774/4905835/5192491.title: Old Prayers
4921774/4905835/5192491.text:
The people long ago had different prayers to the people at the present day. They were far holier than the people at the present day.Any spare time the old people used have, it was on prayer they spent it. They had certain times of the day for praying.The prayer they used say in the morning was called a short morning prayer. This was the prayerIO my God I believe that thou are here present.I adore Thee, I love Thee with my whole heart.I thank thee for all Thy favours Thou hast bestowed upon me.I offer Thee all my thought, words, and works of this day.In union with that most pure intention which Jesus and Mary and all the Saints had in life.IIAfter dinner they used say one Our Father and three Hail Mary's in honour of the purity of the Blessed Virgin,
(continues on next page)

4921774/4905836/5192507.title: Old Prayers
4921774/4905836/5192507.text:
(continued from previous page)
After every Hail Mary they used say this prayer.Though thy Virginity and Immaculate Conception, O most chaste virgin, obtain for me purity of soul and body.At evening they used say:IIIO my God, I believe that thou art here present.I adore, I love Thee with my whole heart.I return Thee thanks for all thy benefits, particularly those I have received this day. Give me light, "O my God" to know the sins I have committed this day and grant me grace to be truly sorry for them.



[cont. from p. 135]me to do.Lord teach me WisdomMy God! I love Thee with my whole heart.

4921774/4905837/5192589.title: Old Prayers
4921774/4905837/5192589.text: When quenching the fire at night. People used to say. "God save us." "May God have mercy on the souls in Purgatory." Before work, "May God give me light to do what is right, to please you." Before play; "Dear Angel keep with me that I may not fall into sin!" Passing a church, "May God have mercy on the souls of the souls Faithful Departed. Before going to bed people used to say this prayer.There are four corners in my bed.There are four angels o'er my head.If any evil spirit come to me.O Blessed Saviour awaken me.Till I look up to see the Blessed Lamb.To see the Blessed Virgin coming on.Seven Mass books in her hand.Seven Priests singing.Seven bells ringing. People used to say this prayer getting up in the morning.Bless us. Mary Maiden mild.Bless us Jesus Mary's Child.May He to whom His Mother prays grant us blessing all our days.

4921774/4905838/5192597.title: Old Prayers
4921774/4905838/5192597.text:
A Night Prayer."May the Will of God be done by us,"May the death of the Saints be won by us,May Jesus the Child be beside my bed,May the Lamb of Mercy uplift my headMay the Virgin Mary her brightness shedAnd St Joseph be steward to my soul.Amen. When any person died they used say"Lord have Mercy on the dead."When any trouble came on them they said "God's Will be done." When passing a Church where the Blessed Sacrament was, they said "My Lord I know you are there." , le linn dul a chodhlad duit abair:- A Íosa, a Mhuire, a Sheosaimh tugam suas dhíob mo chroide agus agus m'anam.A Íosa, a Mhuire a Seosamh bíd ag cabhrú liom le linn mo bháis.A Íosa a Mhuire a Sheosaimh go dtugaidh suas m'anam dióbh, i Siothcháin Dé.Isteach i do láimh féin go n-glacair úaim mo sprid a Thigearna go nglacair uaim A Thigearna Íosa.
(continues on next page)

4921774/4905840/5192604.title: Seanphaidreacha
4921774/4905840/5192604.text: VIII Anamh mháthair Mhuire agus Muire máthair CriostNaomh Éíbhlis máthair Eoin BaistheCuirim an triur so idir mé agus galar na leabranTeighim ar do comhact a Críost na mbeannAgus gach aon sprid dá bfuil ar mo thíAg deanamh disdamh agus mé a shábhail.IX Coiglim an teine seo mar a coigleann Críos cáchMuire ag cheann an tighe agus Brigidh ina lárDá bfuil d'Easpalaibh agus Ainglile i bhFlaitheas geal na grástA shabail an tighe seo agus go bfuil na daoine ann go lá.A Íosa Criosth a croidé na truagh mhoileDein trocraidh orainn anois agus ar uair ár mbáis.

5162131/5156795/5192663.title: An Paidir Geal
5162131/5156795/5192663.text:
Here is a Prayer I got from a person who is now dead; he said he got it from an old man:An Paidir GealGo mbeannuighthear dhuit féin:Cár chodail tú aréir?I bhfocair Mhic Dé.Cá codlochaidh tú anocht?I bhfocair na mbocht.Cá codlochaidh tú amáireach?I bhfochair Pádraig.Cad é sin romhat amach?Dhá chéad aingeal.Cad é sin ar do dhiadh aniar?Da chéad aspol.Cad é sin ar do dheis - láimh?Coineal trócaire a chuir Muire chugam agDéanamh eolais ó dhorus go dorus go dorus fairsing.Druid suas an ghaoth ruadh.leig isteach an anam trócaireach,leig amach an Maighdean Ghlórmhar.Brighid fé'n a brat,Micheal fé'n a sciath,Dhá láimh Dé shoir is thiar.An té a bheadh an phaidir seo aige is í a rádh gach lá ní sheasochadh a anam ar lic na bpian go deo.
(continues on next page)

5162131/5156796/5192666.title: An Paidir Geal
5162131/5156796/5192666.text:
(continued from previous page)
I have set it down as I heard it.



This is a Custom I saw done with the old people: Every Christmas morning they used to get a cup of cold water and while fasting they used to take three sips of the water and say after each sip:Fuil is fíon is Fíor-uisce:trí níd a tháinig tré thaoibh Críost AmachI remember seeing this done when I was a young lad



This is a Prayer I often heard my Grandmother (R.I.P.) say at night time before going to sleep: I heard it so often that I remember the words:Anna, máthair Mhuire,Muire, Máthair Chríost,Cuirimíd an triúr sin 'dir sinn agus galarna leabhthan ár seachaint ó'n dtrom-luighe. Amen.Anocht gabliadhain ó anocht agus anocht féin.This was a Prayer against Night-mare. (trom lenghe)

5170142/5169299/5192826.title: Prayers
5170142/5169299/5192826.text:
As Peter sat on a marble stone Jesus came to him alone. Oh Peter dear why dosi'st thou ache? Oh Lord save me from the tooth ache.Jesus of Nazareth king of the Jews save me from a sudden and unprepared death. A men.



"Bog-moat in my eye. Hail Mary take it out". Some old people used to say this when they had a moat in their eye. Oh Jesus may the skies be blue for ever and may the grounds bring forth crops.
(continues on next page)

5162131/5156797/5193239.title: Prayer
5162131/5156797/5193239.text: Here is another Prayer she taught me when I was young. I am putting it down as well as I remember it:'Chodladh thá tú amháthair?'Seadh cheana mhuise, a grádh gheal. (shil)Cad is aisling duit a mháthair?Is aisling dom go bhfaca chugham anoir fear caol dubh ar each caol donn, trilní 'na láimh aige gur sháith sé tré chliathán mhic dé gur sgaoil sé a chuid fola 'na [?] anuas leirs.Is fíor sin a mháthair agus an té go mbeidh a "Aisling" seo aige is a rádh trí h-uaire ar [?] agus leabaidh shuain dó geobhaidh mar luach saothair [?] gan díoghgháil, [?] dia sin dár n an-amáil.(I do not know the meaning of last word, probably it means 'souls', but that is how I learned it).

5177640/5175478/5194098.title: The Patron Saint of the Locality
5177640/5175478/5194098.text:
St Fenian is the Patron Saint of Quin. He built a church in the village of Quin, which is now a protestant church. There is a well in a tree at the back of the church dedicated to to his honour. The well was at opposite side of the river Rhine, but the soldiers of Cromwell disturbed it and it re-appeared in the opposite side of the river.



O great St Fenian: sainted teacher of the Saints of Ireland!. bless our Irish Bishops, prists, religious, and faithful, so that, illumed by faith, and beaming with charity, in the future, as in the past they may continue to follow, in thy footsteps, and so come to share in thy enternal recompense, with all the Saints of Holy Ireland. Amen.

5177640/5175560/5194571.title: Old Prayers
5177640/5175560/5194571.text:
"Going to Bed.""Here I lay my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,And if I die before I wake,I give my soul to God to take.There are four corners on my bed.There are four Angels on them spread.Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that I lie on."Going to Bed."Anne mother of Mary, Mary Mother of Christ, Elizabeth mother of John the Baptist be between us and all nightmares.At the time when thunder is on.O Lord, Jesus Christ I call upon thee for mercy. O Holy Great and Immortal God have mercy on me, and on the whole world. By the blood of Jesus Christ intercede for us and preserve us for all the wickedness of time and Eternity. Amen.
(continues on next page)

In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ crucified I lay down to rest. Bless me Lord, defend and govern me, and after this miserable pilgrimage bring me to everlasting happiness. Amen.In this bed I lie to sleep,I give to God my soul to keepIf I die before I wake,I pray to God my soul to keep.There are four corners on this bed,There are four Angels on them spreadOne to sing and one to pray,And two to carry my soul away,Matthew, Mark, Luke and John,Bless the bed that I lay on.
(continues on next page)

5170144/5169454/5195539.title: Old Prayers
5170144/5169454/5195539.text:
Long ago the people had a lot of old prayers, some of them were.As I lay my head to sleep,I give my soul to God to keep,And if I die before I wake,I hope that God my soul will take,There are four corners on my bed,Four angels there are o'er my head,Its Mattew, mark, Luke and John,God bless the bed that  I lie on.No 2. As I lay down my head to rest, I ask thee O Lord to defend and govern me for a short and miserable pilgrimage and bring me to life everlastingAMEN.No. 3. O Angel of God,My guardien dear,To whom Gods love,Commits me here,Ever this day,be at my side,To light, to guard,To rule and guide.No. 4. A short prayer for little children isAngel guardien, meek and mild,Watch o'er me a little child.
(continues on next page)

4921806/4908936/5196391.title: A Collection of Prayers
4921806/4908936/5196391.text:
1. The B.V.M was walking one day.She met holy Simeon coming from Rome.A well reared man was he.This is the Habit of the three Golden Crosses.This is the Habit of the three bright Saints.This is the Habit which Christ was christened in.This is the Habit which Christ was born in.This is the Habit which Christ was reared in."God Bless the owner of the Habit" said he."God Bless you most Kindly." said she."Who ever will wear my Habit in my name.I'll have a list of his name is Heaven among the Angels and Saints."
(continues on next page)

5162119/5155762/5196559.title: Prayer
5162119/5155762/5196559.text:
Oh, God our refuge and strength, fountain of all goodness, mercifully hear the fervent prayers of the church and grant that what we ask with Faith we may effectually obtain through the intercession of the Blessed Virgin Mary through her Son Jesus.  Oh Almighty God who despises not the people who call upon Thee in their afflications but for the glory of Thy name Jesus, forgive us our sins and deliver us from all dangers.   O that Jesus Mary and Joseph may save and guard us from all sickness and danger, from the hands and powers of our enemies visible and invisible and may guide and direct us.   And that all our thoughts words and acts may be guided by the Holy Name of Jesus.    That the Blessed Virgin Mary and Holy Saint Joseph may pray and intercede for us, and all the Angels and Saints in Heaven and for all the intentions we offer up a Pater and Ave in honour of the purity of the Blessed Virgin Mary for the intercession of her Son Jesus  for all our requests.
(continues on next page)

5162119/5155763/5196560.title: Prayer
5162119/5155763/5196560.text:
(continued from previous page)

O Mary, My Mother and my hope,I take refuge under Thy Mantle,there will I live and dieDeliver me from sin and grant me They Holy Blessing.



In my little bed I lie,looking, upward to the skyJesus Christ is there above,looking down on me with love.In hid heart so good and mildWell he loves His little child
(continues on next page)

5162119/5155765/5196566.title: Prayer
5162119/5155765/5196566.text: Open to me Thy Sacred Heart O Jesus and unite me with it forever. May every breath and pulsation of my heart be to Thee a testimony of my love accept the little good I do grant me grace to repair my evil ways that I may praise Thee and bless Thee in time for all Eternity. Amen.Prayer when asking for a favour:-Though I have asked for a long time still I ask Thee O Sacred Heart of Jesus for this great favour.   I place it in the presence of they Broken Bleeding Heart.  When covered with the most crimson robes of Thy most Prescioius Blood, The Elternal Father cannot refuse to hear not my prayer but Thine.

5008880/4963238/5197784.title: (no title)
5008880/4963238/5197784.text:
The cuckoo tells us when spring is coming. If she sings on a tree without leaves it is a sign of the end of the world. If you hear her with your right ear you will have good luck during the year but if with the left ear you will have bad luck.If the cuckoo is heard at your back yourself or a near friend will die soon. On hearing the cuckoo you should get some money and throw it from hand to hand so that you will have money throughout the year



Oh Lord move my feet to Holy MassOpen my lips to the blessed wordsRaise up my thoughts and my mindAnd banish all bad thoughts and deeds



King of Patience take my handFor fear the river is deepHoly Mary watch over my feetFor fear the flood is strong.

At last they came to the graveyard and they took the coffin out of the cart and told David to go home. David didn’t know where he was, but sauntered along until daybreak when he found himself on the Bridge of Clonea. He lived in a house which is now occupied by my father.

A prayer to be said when going to bed.Now I lie down to sleep.I give my soul to the Lord to keepRise now or rise never.I give my soul to the Lord forever.There are four corner on my bed.There are four angels in a spreadMatt, and Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless me in the bed I am on.
(continues on next page)

5162140/5157969/5199839.title: Great Men
5162140/5157969/5199839.text:
(continued from previous page)
as Jack Liston was in bed a man called to the door. This man had a ton of sea-weed in a car and the wheel came out. The man went down the road for the link spin and after a while he returned. Jack Liston rose up the car and the ton of sea weed and the man put in the wheel. Long ago there was a stone above the Market in Ennis and all the strong men used try to lift it.



This is one of the old prayers the people used to say Long ago. "As I was going up a blessed mountain I met the blessed Virgin with four mass books in her hand; with four bells ringing; four priests singing — open the gates of heaven; shut the gates of Hell and let all the poor suffering souls into heaven.

5177646/5176199/5200300.title: Prayers
5177646/5176199/5200300.text:
The people of Cratloe long ago would say prayers that they did not learn at school.When they would going to bed at night they would say “There are four corners in my bed there are four angels on it spread Mathew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lay on.When they would hear bad news “The lord between us and all harm”When a person would be going away from a house the person inside would say “God speed you”When a person would give something to another person he would say “ God reward you”
(continues on next page)

5177646/5176201/5200305.title: General Collection of Prayers
5177646/5176201/5200305.text:
"Mary, Mary quite contrary bless me to night and keep out of the dairy" May God speed you and bring you safely back or bring luck to you" God bless you store and put it in your heart to give me more.When a person would see a new beast he or she would say "Oh what a fine beast it is God bless it and save it amen.Five bleeding wounds knelt to a tree Merciful Jesus have mercy on me My soul and my body I resign unto you.God bless me and mind me for the day and my sisters, brothers, father, and mother and we place ourselves in the care of the Blessed Virgin MaryThere is a prayer said when awakening in the morning "In the name of our Lord Jesus crucified I arise bless me O Lord defend and govern me and after this short and miserable pilgrimage and bring me to everlasting rest and happiness Amen.In the night going to bed some people say "Blessed be the holy and undivided Trinity now
(continues on next page)

5198905/5158823/5200392.text: Umhluigim duit, a athair mhic De  "          " a mhaighdean bhean bheannuighthe  "          "     a theampull na dtri naomh  "          "      reilig an aifrinnBeirim m'anam suas duit, a Dhia Ni duil ina dhiaidh ort, a shean Criost (aithrana) na go brath (go breogh)Dha athchuingi ort gach AifreannDo leigfear induiDo leigheadh coidhche agus do leighfear go brath.Mo chuid agam ' anam anoisAgus ar uair mo bhais. 5198905/5158824/5200393.title: Paidreacha - Sa Leabaidh
5198905/5158824/5200393.text: Slan agat, a crann ar a ceasadh ChriostSlan agat, a chrann dhilis 'an Duilleabhair glaisBeirim ort, m'anam ar do choimiri (coimirce)Iosa Criost,Iarraim ar Dhia agus ar mo aingeal deas.Mo leas Athchuingim ort, an sprid chle.-De, a leigint dom.

5177648/5176550/5202172.title: Seaniarsmaí
5177648/5176550/5202172.text:
There are no old crosses in this parish but there are some in the next parish Parteen. There is one of them in a graveyard called the "Paupers' Hole" up on the top of a hill at the left hand side of the road as you go into Parteen. There is another one across the road from it in a graveyard.We have a trough for cooling the horse's shoes. It was  a holy water font in the penal days when the priests used to say Mass by the ditches in the mountains. it was a big rock and a man cut a hole in it with a chisel and hammer. The trough holds about six gallons of water. Jerry Liston got it down from Glan na gCroc. It is about three hundred years old It was found on a hedge.



A night prayer: When I lie on my bed to sleep To God I give my soul to keep. And if I die before I wake, I hope that God my soul will take.There are four corners in my bed, There are four angels at my head, Mathew, Mark, Luke
(continues on next page)

There are four corners in my bed,And four angels overheard,Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,God bless the bed I lay on,And if I die before I rise,I leave my soul to Almighty God.

Seo phaidir adeirtear roimh an Choróin Mhuire:-"Tosnuighimíd an abairt seo chun glóire a thabhairt do Dhia chun leas ár n-anam a Thighearna agus anamnacha na marbh."Seo phaidir a deirtear oidhche Nodhlag:-"Molaim le Dia is go moladh Dia liom más fearr atháimíd anocht go seacht fearr abheithimís bliadhan ó anocht fé chuid, fé chabhair, fé ghrástaibh ag Dia is ag daoinibh. An Té thug ár bheatha seo dhuinn go dtabhairfaidh sé bheatha shíoruidhe maitheamhnachas d'ár bpeacaí ar an saoghal so beannacht guidhe is Dia le h-anama na marbh."Seo phaidir a deirtear ag dul a chodhladh:-
(continues on next page)

Aonmhic do céasaidh Dia h-Aoine ar an gcrannLéigfead do deagad leat síos go fonnRí réaltann do shaorthaig an tír agus an domhan.Céad fáilte an t-saoghail rómhat a Dhia gléigeal dom croidheagus tar ann.Athair mhic do shealbhuig an tír agus muirGo bhfuil an peaca seo ceangailte orainn ríamh agus indiuSgreadaim ort a mhaitheamh duinn ríamh gach cor agus glacaim-se go taithneamhnac mo Thigearna indui.
