4921760/4904267/5218444.title: Altú tar éis Bia
4921760/4904267/5218444.text:
Moladh leat a Rí nach gann.Agus moladh gach am leat a Rí.Cead glóire mar gheall ar an'itheamhar.Agus a n'íosfann de'n bhiadh.An té tug an maitheas dúinn.Agus ciall chun a caichte.Go dtugadh Sé Trocáire agus GlóireShiorruidhe d'ár n'anaim.



Cabhair agus grásta agus cáirde ó Dhia chughainnCabhair gach lá agus táimíd ghá iarraidhSácramímt na h-aithrighe is go neartidhidh Dia linnComaruighim m'anam ort a Mhuire Meighdean Tigearna

4921760/4904268/5218445.title: Seanphaidir
4921760/4904268/5218445.text:
Do gaibh Muire is a mac amach go moch sa lá. Do tháinig ortha fear beannuighthe ón Róimh. Do bhronn sí uirthe brat ar a raibh tairringthe trí brainnse óir.   "Go mbeanniugthear dhíbh a lucht na mbrat ná ithidh feóil Dia Céadaoin - ná deinídh gearáin ar bhúr dtuirse. Deinidh bhúr síothcháin le mac Dé agus beidh sibh cómh n-aos leis na leinbh. Sé mo bhrat-sa brat na dtrí mbeann gur rugadh Críost is gur baisteadh Críost ann. Níl aoinne a dearfaidh mo marbhna gach maidin Dé Luain ná geoghaidh sé Flaitheas Dé gan duadh gan atuirse agus radharc ar Muire trí uaire roimh bás."Ag dul isteach i Séipéal abair:-Beannuighim duit a Crois, a crann de'n duilleabhar glais. An crann gur céasaidh Críost agus beannuighim duit airís a Chrois. Beannuighim duit seipéal na h-eaglaise. Beannuighim duit a theampaill na tríonóide. Cuirim m'athcuigní súas chun an Árd rí glórmhar ar urlár a thíghe féin - Is nár théigim méag go brách Air.
(continues on next page)

4921760/4904270/5218447.title: Paidreacha
4921760/4904270/5218447.text:
Radharc ar Dhia go bhfeicimíd - Réir Dé go ndeimíd. Beatha na Naomh go dtuillimid - Ceol na n'aingeal go gcloisimíd agus glóire na Flaitheas go sroisimíd. Cara is cáil is grast ó Dhia cughainn. Cabhair gach lá fé mar a táimid gá iarraidh. Sacramint na h-aithrighe fé mar a táimid dhá iarraidh agus teigmíd fé do chomirce a Mhuire Maighdin Tigearna. Coimirighim m'anam ort a rí na glóire Íosa Críost agus an Maighdin Glórmhar - don na trí ainglib - Aingil is órdha is sine agus is fearrdha athá ar cataoir na glóire. Gabhaim Dia mar athair agus Muire mar mháthair i bhflaitheas Dé mar tataigh agus d'fillimid dón t-áirseoir (ar eagla go ngéillimid don táirseóir)1Téigheadh saor slán sabhálta go lá sinn Go dtugadh Dia agus an Mhaighdean Muire fé mhaise ón oidhche sinn. Luighim le Dia agus go luigheadh Dia liom. Eirighim le Dia is go n-eirigid Dia liom. Cros beannuighthe sa leaba ag
(continues on next page)

4921760/4904273/5218459.title: (no title)
4921760/4904273/5218459.text: Denis OLeary of Lyreaoune who died in 1931 aged 80 had a prayer to guard against night-mare. As far as I believe it runs as follows: "St Ann mother of the B.V.M., B.V.M. mother of God, St Elizabeth mother of John the Baptist. I put the B.V.M. those two Saints and my Guardian Angel with the Cross of Jesus Christ between me and all troubles of the night."He found this very effective in case of night-mare.

Is maith an baisteadh rinne sé. Bhaist sé Coin agus bhaist Coin é.Ba eisean a bhí le cách an áit a chrochadh is a chéasadh é. 5215779/5207999/5219329.title: A Prayer After a Death
5215779/5207999/5219329.text:
For we must toil this autumn dayA Prayer after a deathII am home in heaven dear ones. O so happy & so bright. There is joy and beauty. In this everlasting lightIIAll the pain & grief is over. Every restless tossing passed. I am now in piece forever. Safely home in heaven at lastIIIDid you wonder I so calmly. Trod the valley of the shade. O but jesus love illumined. Every dark a fearful glade.IV
(continues on next page)

5215756/5207593/5219371.title: A Prayer
5215756/5207593/5219371.text: As I lay down my right hand sideI pray to God to be my guideIf any evil comes to meMay the Blessed Virgin Mary come and waken meThere are four corners on my bedAnd four bright angels on them spreadTwo at my head and two at my feetAnd four to carry me when I am deadMatthew, Mark, Luke and John,God bless me and God bless the bed that I lay on.If I chance to die before I wakeI pray to God my soul to takeAnyone (that) who says this prayer three times a night they will never enter the gates of hell.who = who = who = who = who

5215782/5209464/5219677.title: Paidir
5215782/5209464/5219677.text:
An gcluinn tú libh mé lucht na scapaill ná leigheadh fallach Dia í n-ár gcás.Is truaigh liom fear na carraig agus é in a luigheadh ar leabhadh a bhás.A Dhuine bocht gan ceille ná théigir le, do theinneas. Ná ithe feol Ceadon agus na déin breag le Muire.Ultaigh síos dó'n C;eirig, is na cúíg féile Muire Déan faoistean le Mach Dé is beidh tú ar feastan le na linn.
(continues on next page)

5215782/5209569/5219821.title: Paidir
5215782/5209569/5219821.text:
An gcluinn tú libh me lucht na sgabhail na leigheadh fallaí Dia í n-ár gcás.Is truaigh liom fear na carraig agus e in-a luighead ar leabhaidh a bháis.A dhuine bhocht gan céille ná théigir le do theinneas Na ithe feól  Ceidhaon agus ná dein breag le MuireUltigh sios dó'n Cleirig is n cúig feile Muire. Dhéan  faoistean le Mach Dé is beidh tú ar feastain le na linn.
(continues on next page)

5215782/5209573/5219825.title: Paidir
5215782/5209573/5219825.text:
Paidirín pairteach í ngairdín parras moladh na mnaoí a bhí riamh gan locht. Athair Siorraidhe agus rí na ngráste na leig dom fail ar m'anamh bovht.Is maith an sagart mac De is maith an báisteadh a rinne sé baist se Eoin agus báist Eoin é go bá eisean a bhí le các an áit í n-a crochaidh is a chéasadh é. Níl aoinne a deirfidh an pháirteach a creidhfidh a cruaidh naoí a  n-uaire chuile maidin luan nach dtógfadh sé naoí
(continues on next page)

5215756/5207785/5219873.title: Bird-Lore
5215756/5207785/5219873.text:
(continued from previous page)
of blood fell on his breast and from that day out all robins have red breasts.CorrectionsSeagull = Seagull = Plover = Plovera = a = a = a = a = a = a = a



As I lay down my right hand side I pray to God to be my guide. If any evil spirits comes to me may the Blessed Virgin Mary come and waken me. There are four corners on my bed and four bright Angels on them spread, two at my head and two at my feet and four to carry me when I am dead - Matthew, Mark, Luke and John God bless
(continues on next page)

5215805/5213544/5235264.title: Paidreacha - Prayers
5215805/5213544/5235264.text:
When they awake in the morning the old people say "O my God I rise from this bed of sleep to adore my God to labour for the salvation of my soul. O may I rise on the last day to life everlasting. O God who hast throughout the night watched me with a fathers care I praise thee with the morning light, protect me still throughout the day from sin from evil and distress and what I think
(continues on next page)

5235086/5233914/5235456.title: Local Prayers
5235086/5233914/5235456.text:
(i) Prayer said at night:Here I lay me down to sleepAnd on my bed four angels keepMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless this bed that I lie on.The Lord be the breathThe Lady be the flowerGod will be my friend At my dying hour.Another version isThere are four corners on my bedThere are four angels at my headMatthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod bless me on the bed I lie on.And if I die before I wake To God I give my soul to take.PetitonO Sacred Heart of Jesus I have asked Thee for many favours but I plead for this one.  Take it.  Place it in your open Broken Heart and when the Eternal Father sees it covered with a mantle of His Most Precious Blood He will not refuse it.
(continues on next page)

5235087/5234011/5235733.title: Prayers
5235087/5234011/5235733.text:
IO my good Jesus I have asked Thee for many favours but I plead for this one.  Take it and place it in Thy open broken Heart.  And when Thy Eternal Father sees it covered with the mantle of Thy most precious blood, He will not refuse Thee.  It is not my prayer but Yours.  O my good Jesus I place all my trust in Thee let me think only of Thee Amen.Our Lady of good success pray for us.  Our Lady our Queen and our Mother in the name of Jesus and for the love of Jesus we implore thee take this cause in thy hands and grant us a good success Amen.IIAs I lie down on my right sideI pray to God to be my guide
(continues on next page)

5215779/5208652/5235933.title: For We Must Toil this Autumn Day - Prayers
5215779/5208652/5235933.text:
These are prayers the people used to say long ago. This is a prayer to be said before going to sleep. Lord of the branch, Lady of the flower,Jesus Mary and JosephBe with me at my dying hour. Dear angel be with me That I may be safe from harm and sin. In the name of Our Lord Jesus Christ. I lay down to rest. Bless O'Lord, defend and govern me,
(continues on next page)

5008904/4965557/5239027.title: Prayers
5008904/4965557/5239027.text:
I see the moonAnd the moon sees meGod bless the moonAnd the moon bless meGrace in the kitchenGrace in the hallAnd the Grave of GodBe about us all.O Angel of God my guardian dearTo whom God's love commits me hereEver this day be at my sideTo light and guard to rule and guard. O Sacrament most holyO Sacrament divineAll praise and all thanksgivingBe every moment Thine.
(continues on next page)

5008906/4965721/5239219.title: Old Prayers
5008906/4965721/5239219.text:
On rising. I rise from this bed of sleep to labour for the salvation of my soul. Oh may I rise at the last day to life everlastingWhile dressing.O my God clothe my soul with nuptial robe of charity that I may wear it pure and undefiled before thy judgement seat. A thousand thanks to God for all His blessings and benefits to me a poor sinner.
(continues on next page)

5236078/5218099/5240460.title: Prayers
5236078/5218099/5240460.text:
O most loving Jesus who by thy ineffable virtues and by the example of domestic life didst consecrate the family which thou didst choose on earth, in thy mercy look down upon this household humbly prostrate before thee and imploring thy mercy. Remember that this family belongs to thee, for to thee we have in a special way dedicated and devoted ourselves. Look upon us with a loving kindness, preserve us from every danger give us help in the time of need and grant us the grace to persevere to the end, in the imitatation of thy holy family that having revered thee and loved thee faithfully on earth we may bless and praise the eternally in Heaven. O Mary, most sweet Mother to thy intercession we have recoursed knowing that thy Divine Son will hear thy prayer.
(continues on next page)

5236078/5218312/5240846.title: Prayers
5236078/5218312/5240846.text:
O most loving Jesus who by thy ineffable virtues and by the example of thy domestic life didst consecrate the family which thou didst choose on earth, in thy mercy look down upon this household humbly prostrate before thee and implore thy mercy. Remember that this family belongs to thee, for to thee we have a special way dedicated and devoted ourselves. Look upon us with the loving kindness preserve us from every danger give us help in the of need and grant us the grace to preserve us from every danger
(continues on next page)

4811621/4802893/5241088.title: Paidir
4811621/4802893/5241088.text:

Nuair a bhionns muid ag a codladh

5235182/5227503/5243751.title: Seanphaidreacha
5235182/5227503/5243751.text:
Sean-Phaidreacha 24adh Samhain 1937(1 ) Beannacht dé le h-anam na marbh agus fhlaitheas Dé an lá deiridh. (2) Bás Aoine agus chiallagad an t-Shatharn agus guidhe Rí an Domhnaigh. (3) A Dhia Ghrásta go dtugaidh tú Dia bhás dhúinn agus Dia lá ag dul chun na cille. (4) Go luighidh mé leat a Athair Shioraigh agus go n-éirigh muid leat a Maighdean Beannuighe ghlórmhar. (5) Dia idir sinn agus an anachan. (6) “Go mbeannuighidh Dia Dhuit. “Go mbeannuighidh Dia agus Muire dhuit. (7) Go dtugaidh Dia cuid de ghlór na flaitheas dá anam bocht.
(continues on next page)

5235182/5227625/5243895.title: Seanphaidreacha
5235182/5227625/5243895.text:
I ngarraidhe Phárrthais tá an paidrín párrtach molad na mná nár pheacaidh ariamh Íostar Muire agus Righ na nGrása nár leigidh an fán ar mo anam féin.Is maith an sagart mac Dé is maith an bhaisthighe rinné sé. Bhaist sé Eoghan is bhaist Eoghan é. D'eirigh an Maighdean Muire trí uaire aon lá chuaidh sí chun an tumba ag dúil leis na Grása. Tháinig Aingeal as Flaitheas cros geall na slán leis. Sé do bheatha
(continues on next page)

5235182/5227626/5243896.title: Seanphaidreacha
5235182/5227626/5243896.text:
(continued from previous page)
Mhuire ar Righ geall na nGrása. Sé deireas mo bhuaidh sa trí uaire aon luain, tiocfaidh an Maighdean Muire ar cuairt thuige trí uaire an lá.



Ceithre coirnéal ar mo leabaidh ceithre hAingeal déag d'mo aire ma fhághamse bás sul go dtí maidin i Flaitheas Dé béas mo anam. Brighid agus a brath Micheál is a stír. Dia is a lámh deas.

5235182/5227662/5243924.title: Seanphaidreacha
5235182/5227662/5243924.text:
(1) Go luighidh muid leac a Dhia is go luighidh On liom Dá lámh di liom. An muighdin Górmhar Bheanauighe Brighid's a drac. Michéal's a Sgiach, Dio is a lámg Deas, Cathre cóirneáil ar mo leabaidh is Ceithre Anglaí bi dá  faire má fhagham bás sal a dtí maidin, í bhFlaitheas dé go raibh, mo anam bocht. (Ag dul chodladh abruigtear é)(2) Ar n-Athair atá ar Neamh is in Mic idir an phian, An i Athair Sagiridh go mo Bheanná agus an Mhaighdin Bheinnuighthe go mo thriall.*Ag dul chodhladh)(3) Bhí ghrástas leac a Dhia is an sé a thug an bheatha sin go dtugaidh Sé na Flatheas dodhbhtha

(1) A Dhia na ngrásta déan trócaire orm(2) A Mhic Dé dean trócaire orm.(3) A Mhathaur De sábháilibh mhuid.(4) A Íosa déan trócaire orrainn(5) Dia in aghaidh sin is an anachain(6) Í ngarrdha Parrthais tá an paidrín páirteach moladh na mná már pheacadh ariamh Íostar Muire agus Rígh na nGrása nar leigidh an fán ar mo anam féin is maith an sagart Mac Dé, is maith

5236093/5230880/5243999.title: A Prayer
5236093/5230880/5243999.text: Oh Mother are You sleeping? No Son but I am dreaming. What are you dreaming of? I am dreaming that You are tearing, wearing and wailing nailed to a Cross and a Crown of Thorns on Your Head. That is a very good dream Mother and whoever says it three times when going to bed shall never see the Gates of Hell but shall be sure that the Gates of Heaven will be open to him.

5236093/5230894/5244016.title: Paidir a' Tobac
5236093/5230894/5244016.text:
Paidir a’ TobacNá raibh liachta gainnimhe ar an tráigh, ná seammair ar an bhféar ag fás, ná braonaí drúcht ar a’ bhárr, an méid sin beannachtaí dílis Dé go raibh le h-anam na marbh agus ár n-anam féin an uair ár mbáis.Deirtear gur i dtigh mo mháthar móire a dubhradh an paidir sin i dtosach. Nuair a fuair a h-athair súid bás thainic bean isteach le breacadh lae agus thairg muinntir an tighe píopa tobac dhí. Chaith sí é agus thug sí arais aris é. D’imtigh sí annsin agus ní fhaca aon duine í beo nó marbh, istig nó amuigh ina dhiaidh sin



Paidir (le radh nuair a bheithfeá ag coigilt na teineadh)Coiglighmuid an teine seo, mar coigligheas
(continues on next page)

Creidimíd a Dhia go bhfuil tú anseo i lathair, go bhfuil tú féachaint orainn agus ag éisteacht linn, go bhfuil fhios agat ar ár n-uile smaointe. Iarrfamuid thú agus onórfamuid thú. 5236093/5230902/5244029.title: Paidir
5236093/5230902/5244029.text: PaidirLuighimse ar an leabaidh seo mar a sinighthear mé ins an uaigh. Faoisdín chruaidh o gníom leat a mhic Dé aspolóid atá mé ag iarraidh ort Íosa Críosta fé droch-cráidhte mo bhéil, fe droch smaointe mo chroidhe, fé droch-gníomartaí mo cholna, fé gach a ndubhras nach raibh fíor, fé gach rud smaoinigheas nach raibh liom. Tá mé ag iarraidh maitheannas ort Íosa Críosta. A Muire Mhór tabhair dom amharc ar do mhór-theaghlach, ar do mhór-throcaire, grásta na fiogaidne in aghaidh na n-éagcora agus má fhághaimse bás is luat gí maidin gur i bFlaitheas Dé a bhéas m’ainm, a Thigearna. Amén

That is a very good dream mother and whoever says it three times going to bed shall never see the gates of hell, but are sure that the gates of heaven shall be open to him.

5236093/5231256/5261537.title: A Prayer
5236093/5231256/5261537.text: Ah mother are you sleeping. No son, but I am dreaming. What are you dreaming of. You are tearing, wearing, wailing, nailed to a cross and a crown of thorns on your head. That is a very good dream. Mother and whoever says it three times going to bed shall never see the gates of hell put are sure that the gates of heaven shall be open to him.

5260470/5255886/5262652.title: Sayings and Prayers
5260470/5255886/5262652.text:
"God bless the work."Said when a person is milking a cow."God save all here."Said when going into a house."God be with you."Said when anyone is leaving a house."God spare your health".Saif when anything is sick."Good luck."
(continues on next page)

5260470/5255950/5262864.title: Sayings and Prayers
5260470/5255950/5262864.text: "God bless your work."Said when anyone is working."God spare your health."If you do a person a good turn."Good luck."Said when taking a drink."God save you."Said when a person is ill.

5260470/5256009/5262909.title: Sayings and Prayers
5260470/5256009/5262909.text:
"God save all here except the cat"Said when a person is going into a house.  The people in the house answer"God save you kindly.""God give you good luck,"Said when a man buys a cow."God bless both of you,"Said when a pair gets married."Here's luck,""Good health where its going,""May we all be alive and in as good health this time next year,"All those are said when a man
(continues on next page)

5260470/5256036/5262918.title: Sayings and Prayers
5260470/5256036/5262918.text:
"God bless you"Said when anything is done for you or given to you"God save all here and let who likes save the rest"Said when going into the house"God be with you"Said when going out off a house"Welcome be the will of God"Said after a death has occurred
(continues on next page)

5260470/5256169/5263083.title: Sayings and Prayers
5260470/5256169/5263083.text: "Heres good luck to you".Said when a man is about to take a drink of liquor."God bless all here except the cat".Said when a person enters a house."Welcome be the will of God".Said at a death."God spare you good health".Said when a person is sick.

5260488/5259596/5263452.text:
Páidir.Tá an codladh sin ort A Mhathair “Ni headh a mhic” acht osnaigh”. “Caidé an osnaigh é sin a mháthair” “Tá go bfhuil Tusa le do stróca agus le strialladh ar bharr na Mín árd udaidh chall. Cuig ropa caoile cruaidhe crabha ag dul thar do corp coróin spiónach ar do cionn agus do chuid fola fíor uaisle ag
(continues on next page)

5260488/5259598/5263454.title: Seanphaidir
5260488/5259598/5263454.text:
Sean Paidir.Is mé an creatur lag lag faoi ualach throm ar mhead mo pheacaidh agus aidighim liom.Aidighim creidim Dé go síorraidhe. Le gradh mo chroidhe le dóchas faoi cos na croiche. Guidhimshe ar dTighearna Íosa Criost ar glúin anuas.
(continues on next page)

5260445/5253122/5265932.title: Prayers
5260445/5253122/5265932.text:
O Lord Jesus Christ was born in a stable in Bethleham.Baptised in the river Jordan by John as the water stood still so shall the blood stand still.This is a prayer for stopping blood. To say three Hail Maries and five Our Fathers would cure a pain.
(continues on next page)

5274069/5270906/5274125.title: Folklore - Prayer
5274069/5270906/5274125.text: Hear I lay me down to sleep. To God I give my soul to keep. There are four cornes on my bed: There are four angles ["in" struck out] around them spread, Mathew, Mark, Luke + John God bless me on this bed that I lay on. If any evils threation me may the almighty God be between them + me. Infant Jesus meek + mild look on me a little child, pety me + pety mine + suffer thee to come to me.

5260471/5256364/5275394.title: Graveyards
5260471/5256364/5275394.text:
(continued from previous page)
child dies without Baptism it is buried in the outskirts of the graveyard. My mother told me.



Here I lay me down to sleep my soul I give to God to keep, and if I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, God bless the bed that I lie on. There are four corners round my bed there are four angles round it spread, God within me God without me the Holy Ghost all round about me. I saw the Blessed Mother with seven Mass books in her hand seven bells ringing seven priests open the gates of
(continues on next page)

5260471/5256471/5275528.title: Old Prayers
5260471/5256471/5275528.text:
When people were getting up they would say "I arise this day in the Name of God to do the work I am bound to do." They would also say: "Here"Here dawns another day as I lie still So I will rise in the Name of GodTo do His Holy Will"Amen.In going to bed;The darkness is fallingThe angels are callingSo I go to bed at the Will of my God
(continues on next page)

5260471/5256525/5275609.title: Old Prayers and Expressions
5260471/5256525/5275609.text:
Most Irish people when speaking use blessings as - If you bought a new coat they would say "Go mairid is go cairfar é". Also when a man sees another working he says "God bless the work"Some people when going to bed say "Matthew, Mark, Luke & John bless the bed that I lie on. Four corners at my bed four angels round my head. One to sing & one to pray  & two to carry my soul away.Another said when going to bed is "Sacred Heart of Jesus I put my trust in thee."When walking into a house " God save all here" is often said. When a person gets a
(continues on next page)

5260471/5256641/5275889.title: Prayers
5260471/5256641/5275889.text:
Here is an old but nice prayer,There are four corners on my bed,There are four angles overhead,Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnGod, bless this bed that I lie on.One to sing and one to pray, two to take my soul away,And if I die before I wake,I will give my soul for God to take.The above prayer is varied very much and is said when going to bed
(continues on next page)

5215784/5209817/5277806.title: Prayers
5215784/5209817/5277806.text:
When I lie down upon my right sideI pray to God to be my guide.If I die before I wake I pray to God my soul to take.Four corners on my bed, four angelsOn them spread.Lady be the branch, Lord be the FlowerAt my last hour.
(continues on next page)



There are four corners on my bedAnd on them lie four angels spread.One to sing, one to pray and two to carry my soul away.If I die before morning, May the heavens be my bed.

5215784/5209818/5277808.title: Prayers
5215784/5209818/5277808.text:
(continued from previous page)
Matthew, Mark, Luke and JohnBless the bed that I lie on.Our Lord with a branch, Our LadyWith a flower meet my soul at my last hour.



I lay my body down to sleepI pray to God my soul to keep.The Blessed Virgin waken meIf any evil spirit comes to me.

5215784/5210513/5279072.title: Old Prayers
5215784/5210513/5279072.text: As I lie down upon my bed this night to rest I pray to God to be my guide.There are four corners on my bed may four angels be on them spread. Mathew, Mark, Luke, and John God bless me on this bed I lie on. One to save me, one to guard me one to carry my soul to heaven. Amen

5215784/5210514/5279075.title: Old Prayers
5215784/5210514/5279075.text: Jesus meek and Jesus mild pity me a little child. Jesus suffer me to come to Thee. Jesus take my heart and soul and bless them that nothing evil may ever possess them. Amen

5286174/5286155/5286185.title: Paidir
5286174/5286155/5286185.text:
PaidirA Mháthair an chodladh sin ort? Ní h-eadh acht aisling. Caide an aisling sin a mháthair? Ag amarch ortsa da stialladh as da strochadh agus do ceangal le trí rópa caola cnaibe ar mallaidh na mbeann arda udaí thall sleagh nimhe ag gabhail fríd do chroidhe, do chuid fola ag sgeardadh in airde agus ag tuitim ar leacacha na sráide udaí thall O! a mháthair is maith an aisling sin. Níl an dhuine a dearfas ceithre h-uaire ficheadh e no bhfuil seilbh agamsa ar a anam sa glóir.



Comhartaí AimsireNuair a bhíos an ghrían ag gabhail síos agus an spear uilig dearg thart fa dtaobh duithe sin comhartha go mbéidh aimsear mhaith ann.Nuair a bhíos an ghrían ag gabhail síos comh h-an ghéar sin comhartha go mbéidh aimsear olc ann. Nuair a bhíos an dusta ag éirghe ó’n bhealach mhór sin comhartha go mbéidh gaoth mhór ann.Nuair a bhíos an ghaoth ag feadalaigh ins na dorsaí agus na fuinneógaí sin comhartha go mbéidh gaoth mhór ann. Nuair a bhíonn sé ag cur agus an coileach a fheicheal ag gabhail suas ar chlaide agus é ag sgairtigh sin comhartha go mbéidh aimsear mhaith ann.

5286174/5285709/5286230.title: Cluiche
5286174/5285709/5286230.text:
(continued from previous page)
go teach aitithe a dh-airnéal agus bhíodh na paisdí leobhtha. Bhíodh na seandaoine istuigh ag cainnt agus ag comhrádh. Théigheadh na paisdí amach agus dhéanad siad na folacháin thart ar na cruacha. Crag na sleise; Chuirthí bata na sheasamh ins an talamh agus chuirthí cnag na luighe ag a bhun. Annsin bhuailthí bata beag eile ina éadan, agus d’eireochad an cnag agus bhuailthí an cnag go gasta leis an bhata eile a bhiodh i lamh an duine a bhíodh ag immirt.



Ramhas.Eamonn go bhfeicfidh-me i dToraigh tú,Eamonn go bhfeicfidh-mé i n-Uaighe thú,Eamonn go bhfeicfidh-mé ar shuipín an Iolair tú,A’s máinte drugaid ar do uachtar.



Tháinig rón isteach am amháin go caslaigh bheag i n-Ath na  gCoire. Chruinnigh cuid fear na h-aite agus mharbuigh siad é. Sula bhfuair sé bás dubhairt sé, "Mharbuigh Pádruig óg mé, d'feann Doim nic hudaí mé agus phioc Nuala Ainne mo chnamha.



Sean Urnaighthe.Luigim ins an leabaidh seo mar shintear mé san uaigh le faoiside chruaidh craidhthe a dhéanamh leat-sa Mhic Dé fá ocaracha mo codaltha agus olcas mo croidhe. Ó Dhia nach mé tá loctach ní gheallaim nach ndéanamh é. Mháthair Íosa in eideadh Íosa go rabh tú ag mo cheann Eoghan Baiste Naomh Easbuig go rabh tú ag mo bhonn. Theachtaire
(continues on next page)
